0.30958837.10644726.html.plaintext.txt	321	Copyright   2000 by The American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology, Inc.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	0	Stat 5b and the Orphan Nuclear Receptors Regulate Expression of the 2-Macroglobulin (2M) Gene in Rat Ovarian Granulosa Cells Maya Dajee, Georg H.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	1	) Baylor College of Medicine Houston, Texas 77030 Department of Genetics (G.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	2	) Institute for Microbiology, Biochemistry and Genetics Friedrich-Alexander University D91058 Erlanger-Nurenberg, Germany.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	3	   ABSTRACT TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION RESULTS DISCUSSION MATERIALS AND METHODS REFERENCES   2-Macroglobulin (2M) is a serine protease inhibitor and cytokine inactivator associated with inflammation and tissue remodeling.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	4	 The gene encoding this protein is selectively induced in the rat corpus luteum by the luteotropic hormone and cytokine, PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	5	 The promoter of the 2M gene contains two regulatory regions that bind a diverse set of transcription factors and confer functional activity in ovarian granulosa-luteal cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	6	 The PRL response element (PRLRE) binds PRL-activated (tyrosine-phosphorylated) signal transducers and activators of transcription (Stat 5b and Stat 5a).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	7	 5'-Deletion of the Stat-binding sites or mutation of either one or both of these sites within the context of the intact promoter abolished PRL inducibility of 2M promoter-reporter constructs in granulosa-luteal cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	8	 Cotransfection with a vector expressing a dominant negative, truncated form of Stat 5b abolished PRL-induced activation of 2M transgenes.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	9	 5'-Deletion of the Stat-binding sites abolished all promoter-reporter activity in response to PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	10	 Internal deletion of a second functional domain 3' of the PRLRE also abolished PRL inducibility and markedly reduced basal activity, indicating that functional interactions between these two regions might occur.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	11	 The 3'-region was shown to bind orphan members of the nuclear receptor superfamily, steroidogenic factor 1 (SF-1) and chicken ovalbumin upstream promoter-transcription factor (COUP-TF) and has been called the orphan receptor response element (ORRE).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	12	 When site-specific mutations were made in either the SF-1-binding site or the two COUP-TF direct repeat (DR1 and DR2) binding sites in the context of the intact promoter, specific changes in the functional activity of this novel region of the 2M promoter were observed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	13	 Mutation of the SF-1 site drastically reduced basal activity of the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	14	 Mutation of the COUP-TF sites caused the basal activity of the 2M promoter to increase markedly.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	15	 Neither mutation altered the PRL inducibility of these constructs.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	16	 Lastly, differentiation of cultured granulosa cells was required for functional activity of both the PRLRE and the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	17	 Collectively, these results document for the first time that Stat 5b, SF-1, and COUP-TF each exert specific effects on the function of the 2M promoter: basal activity is controlled by the balance of SF-1 (positive) and COUP-TF (negative) activities and PRL inducibility is mediated by activation of Stat 5b.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	18	 These results add 2M to the list of nonsteroidal genes regulated by SF-1 in the gonads and provide the first evidence that COUP-TF has a specific role in regulating ovarian gene activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	19	 In addition, the ORRE and PRLRE act independently of, rather than synergistically with, each other to regulate basal and PRL-induced expression of 2M in ovarian luteal cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	20	   INTRODUCTION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION RESULTS DISCUSSION MATERIALS AND METHODS REFERENCES   Tissue-specific expression of genes is dependent on the cellular set of transcription factors as well as the selective activation of these factors by hormones, growth factors, and cytokines.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	21	 One transcription factor that dictates ovarian (gonadal) development is steroidogenic factor 1 (SF-1), an orphan member of the nuclear receptor superfamily (1).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	22	 SF-1 binds as a monomer to (CA)AGGTCA-like motifs and interacts with other factors to regulate the expression of most steroid hydroxylase genes (2, 3, 4, 5).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	23	 During the development of preovulatory follicles and in granulosa cells in culture, FSH induces expression of two steroid hydroxylase genes encoding aromatase (CYP19; Ref.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	24	 SF-1 also regulates the expression of genes encoding peptides, including Mullerian Inhibiting Substance (8) and oxytocin (9).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	25	 Thus, SF-1 appears to play a critical role in regulating genes expressed in differentiated granulosa cells in response to FSH (6).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	26	When granulosa cells luteinize, they respond to a different set of extracellular signals, one of which is the cytokine PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	27	 In the ovary (10, 11, 12), as in other target tissues (13, 14, 15), PRL activates the JAK (Janus kinase)/STAT (signal transducers and activators of transcription) pathway.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	28	 One gene that is selectively regulated by PRL in luteal cells encodes 2-macroglobulin (2M), a large tetrameric protein that traps and inactivates proteases and cytokines.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	29	 The inducibility of this gene by interleukin-6 (IL-6) in rat liver (16) and by PRL in rat luteal cells (11) has provided a unique opportunity to delineate the cellular signaling mechanisms used by each cytokine to control the tissue-specific expression of this gene.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	30	 In previous analyses, we have shown that Stat 5 is activated by PRL and binds to specific -activating sequences (GAS) sites present in the promoter of the 2M gene and originally referred to as the IL-6 response element (IL6-RE) based on the activation of this gene by IL-6 in rat liver (16).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	31	 Because a luciferase reporter construct containing 1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	32	2 kb of the 2M promoter showed high basal activity when transfected into differentiated granulosa cells in the absence of PRL, we sought to identify additional factors involved in regulating the promoter of this gene and the extent to which the high basal as well as PRL inducibility were dependent on hormone-induced differentiation of granulosa cells in culture (10).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	33	As a result of additional analyses of the 2M promoter, we observed that when a 109-bp region directly 3' of the Stat 5-binding sites was deleted, the 2M promoter-reporter construct lost both its high basal activity and PRL-regulated induction.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	34	 When the sequence of this region was examined, we noted that it contained putative binding sites for SF-1 and chicken ovalbumin upstream promoter-transcription factor (COUP-TF).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	35	 Like SF-1, COUP-TF is a member of the orphan nuclear receptor superfamily (17, 18).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	36	 However, unlike SF-1, it is presumed to be expressed ubiquitously and has been shown to exhibit complex interactions by binding, as a heterodimer, other members of the nuclear receptor superfamily (19).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	37	 COUP-TF homodimers bind to a wide spectrum of response elements containing, as a core half-site, the A/GGGTCA motif, the spacing and orientation of which determine the relative binding affinity of COUP-TF (19).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	38	 Recent evidence indicates that Stat proteins may interact functionally with other transcription factors and coregulatory molecules, including members of the nuclear receptor superfamily (20, 21, 22, 23, 24).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	39	 Based on the close juxtaposition and functional activities of the PRL response element (PRLRE) and the putative orphan receptor-binding sites, it seemed reasonable to predict that factors binding to these regions might interact to control maximal expression of the 2M gene in granulosa-luteal cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	40	Based on these considerations and the tissue- specific expression of this gene in the rat ovary, the following studies were undertaken to determine which Stat 5 proteins were present and functional in differentiated granulosa cells, if either SF-1 or COUP-TF bound to the intact 2M promoter, and if either SF-1 or COUP-TF interacted functionally with Stat 5 proteins to confer maximal expression of this gene in response to PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	41	 The functional activities of the Stat-binding sites and the orphan receptor-binding sites were analyzed by generating site-specific mutations in the context of the intact promoter and transfecting differentiated granulosa cells with specific intact and mutant promoter-luciferase reporter constructs.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	42	 Activities were related to the binding of specific nuclear factors and the stage of differentiation of the granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	43	   RESULTS TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION RESULTS DISCUSSION MATERIALS AND METHODS REFERENCES   Two Regions in the Proximal Promoter of the 2M Gene Are Required for Functional Activity in Granulosa Cells To identify and characterize the functional regions in the 2M promoter conferring both PRL and high basal activity in granulosa cells, specific deletion constructs were generated to remove sequences either 5' (-371 bp and -209 bp) or 3' (-209) of the Stat-binding sites or which deleted the PRLRE (-159 bp) (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	44	2-kb 2M-luciferase construct, as well as the deletion constructs, were transiently transfected into differentiated granulosa cells that had been cultured with FSH and testosterone for 48 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	45	 After 4 h, granulosa cells were treated with or without PRL for 6 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	46	 Luciferase activity was measured, normalized to the amount of protein present in the sample, and then expressed as activity/ microg protein.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	47	 Constructs with 5'-deletions to -371 and -209 bp retained both PRL inducibility and high basal activity (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	48	 Deletion of the Stat-binding sites reduced basal activity and abolished PRL- inducible activity (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	49	 Deletion of a 109-bp region 3' of the PRLRE (-209) reduced basal activity to that seen with the minimal -48-bp 2M promoter and abolished PRL inducibility.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	50	 These results indicated that the PRLRE as well as the 109-bp region immediately downstream of the PRLRE might interact functionally to confer maximal promoter activity in granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	51	View larger version (20K):    Figure 1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	52	 Two Regions of the 2M Promoter Are Required for Functional Activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	53	Each of the indicated vectors was transfected in triplicate in differentiated granulosa cells that had been cultured in the presence of FSH (50 ng/ml) and testosterone (10 ng/ml) for 48 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	54	 After 4 h of incubation, PRL(1  microg/ml)was added for 6 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	55	 Luciferase activity (light units) was measured in 20  microl cell lysate and normalized to the amount of protein.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	56	 The relative luciferase activity is represented as the mean (light units/ microg)  plus or minus  SEM.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	57	  Stat Binding Sites Are Critical for PRL Induction of the 2M Promoter To specifically determine the function of the Stat- binding sites in the context of the intact 1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	58	2-kb 2M promoter, each of the Stat-binding sites was mutated or both of the sites were deleted.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	59	2-kb 2M construct and the mutant promoter-luciferase pSV constructs (16) were transfected into differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	60	 2, PRL induced a 2- to 3-fold increase in luciferase activity from the intact promoter-reporter construct.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	61	 Although the level of luciferase activity of the promoter in the pSV promoter-reporter constructs was low (as compared with the pGL3 constructs, Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	62	 1), the inducibility by PRL was similar.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	63	 Deletion of both Stat-binding sites or mutation of either site abolished inducibility by PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	64	 Basal activity was not markedly altered except for the reduced activity in the proximal Stat 5 mutant construct.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	65	 These results clearly show that both Stat- binding sites are required for PRL inducibility of promoter activity in granulosa cells but not for the high basal activity of the constructs.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	66	View larger version (21K):    Figure 2.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	67	 Both the Stat Factor-Binding Sites Are Required for the 2M Promoter Activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	68	To determine the function of the Stat binding sites in the context of the endogenous intact promoter, either one of the Stat-binding sites was mutated or both were deleted.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	69	 These constructs were then transfected into differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	70	 Luciferase activity was measured in 20  microl cell lysate, normalized to the amount of protein.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	71	  PRL-Induced DNA-Binding Activity Contains Stat 5a and Stat 5b To determine the specific factors binding to the PRLRE, we used electrophoretic mobility shift assays (EMSAs) in which the labeled oligonucleotide probe consisted of two copies of the proximal Stat-binding site of the 2M promoter (2MGAS2) (16).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	72	 Because activated (phosphorylated) Stat proteins bind DNA whereas the nonphosphorylated Stats do not, the activated factors are readily detected in EMSAs.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	73	 Accordingly, whole cell extracts (WCEs) were prepared from differentiated granulosa cells before or 15 min after PRL treatment, incubated with labeled 2M GAS2 probe, and resolved by electrophoresis.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	74	 One slow migrating protein/DNA complex was formed with the WCE from PRL-treated cells but was not observed in WCE prepared from untreated cells (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	75	 To identify the Stat factor(s) present in the slow migrating complex, WCEs were preincubated with antibodies to either Stat 5a or Stat 5b.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	76	 The PRL-induced complex was partially supershifted by the Stat 5a antibody, as shown previously (10).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	77	 A specific Stat 5b antibody resulted in retardation of the entire PRL-induced protein/DNA complex (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	78	 3A, asterisk) as was observed in extracts isolated from PRL-stimulated corpora lutea (11).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	79	 These data indicate that in differentiated granulosa-luteal cells, as in luteal tissue from pregnant rats (11, 12), PRL activates Stat 5b as well as Stat 5a and that Stat 5b is the predominant isoform in these cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	80	View larger version (54K):    Figure 3.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	81	 Activation and Phosphorylation of Stat5b in Differentiated Granulosa Cells by PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	82	A, PRL-induced DNA-binding activity present in granulosa cells contains Stat 5a and Stat 5b.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	83	 WCEs isolated from untreated and PRL-treated (15 min) granulosa cells were incubated with labeled oligonucleotide 2MGAS2 (5'- GATCATCC TTCTGGGAATTCTGATATCCTTCTGGGAATTCTG- 3') and analyzed on EMSA.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	84	 The arrow indicates the specific PRL-induced DNA protein complex formed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	85	 WCEs from PRL-treated granulosa cells were preincubated with antisera to Stat 5a and Stat 5b antibodies (30 min/4 C) before the addition of radiolabeled double-stranded oligonucleotide 2MGAS2.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	86	 The PRL-induced DNA-protein complex is super-shifted partially by the Stat 5a antibody and completely by Stat 5b antibody (*).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	87	 B and C, PRL induces tyrosine phosphorylation of Stat 5b.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	88	 For immunoprecipitations, 30  microl immobilized Protein A on tryacryl beads were incubated with 200  microg WCEs, for 1 h at 4 C with shaking.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	89	 After a brief spin, the supernatant was incubated with 1  microl Stat 5b antibody and 20  microl beads for 24 h at 4 C with shaking.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	90	 Each of the samples was then washed three times with WCE buffer to remove unbound proteins.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	91	 Bound proteins were eluted from the beads by addition of equal volume of SDS-loading buffer and boiled at 100 C for 10 min.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	92	 Samples were electrophoresed on a 10% SDS-polyacylamide gel, transferred to an immobilion membrane, and blotted with antiphosphotyrosine antibody (B).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	93	 The same blot was stripped and immunoblotted with anti-Stat 5b antibody (C).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	94	  PRL Induces Tyrosine Phosphorylation of Stat 5b To demonstrate that the activated Stat 5b in granulosa cells was phosphorylated as a consequence of PRL stimulation, immunoprecipitation experiments were performed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	95	 WCEs were prepared from granulosa cells before and at selected time points after PRL treatment.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	96	 WCEs were incubated with a specific Stat 5b antibody.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	97	 The immunoprecipitate was resolved by SDS-PAGE, and tyrosine-phosphorylated Stat 5b was identified by an antiphosphotyrosine antibody (PY20) used in the Western blotting procedure.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	98	 3B, WCEs from untreated cells do not contain detectable amounts of tyrosine-phosphorylated Stat 5b, whereas WCEs prepared within 15 min of PRL treatment contained significant levels of phospho-Stat 5b.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	99	 Phosphorylated Stat 5b remained present but at lower levels at 6 h and 20 h after PRL treatment (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	100	To ensure that relatively equal amounts of Stat 5b were present in each immunoprecipitate, the same blot was reprobed with an anti-Stat 5b antibody.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	101	 3C, similar amounts of Stat 5b were immunoprecipitated from each of the samples.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	102	 These data show that PRL rapidly stimulates tyrosine phosphorylation of Stat 5b in granulosa-luteal cells but that, even in the presence of continuous exposure to PRL, the amount of phospho-Stat 5b decreases progressively with time, coincident with reduced DNA-binding activity (data not shown and Ref.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	103	Stat 5b Is a Key Regulator of 2M Gene Expression in the Ovary Having established that Stat 5b, rather than Stat 5a, is the major Stat 5 protein activated in these granulosa-luteal cells and knowing that Stat 3 fails to bind the 2M PRLRE (10, 11), we sought to determine whether disruption of Stat 5b binding to the promoter would abolish promoter activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	104	 For this we cotransfected into differentiated granulosa cells vectors expressing either wild-type Stat 5b or a truncated, splice variant form of Stat 5b (Stat 5b-40C) that has been shown to act in a dominant negative fashion to suppress Stat 5b function in other cells (25, 26).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	105	 A reporter construct containing four copies of the proximal Stat-binding site ligated to the minimal 2M promoter-luciferase gene (4XGAS 2M) was chosen as the reporter construct since in previous studies (10, 16) it has been shown to exhibit a greater response to PRL treatment than the intact 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	106	 When wild-type Stat 5b expression vectors were cotransfected with the 4XGAS 2M luciferase construct, the PRL-induced response was similar to cells cotransfected with the empty vector (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	107	 4), indicating that endogenous amounts of Stat 5b were already in excess.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	108	 In contrast, PRL-induced activation of the promoter-reporter construct was significantly repressed by cotransfection of the vector expressing the truncated variant of Stat 5b (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	109	 These data indicate that PRL induction of 2M in differentiated granulosa cells is dependent on activation of Stat 5b and that the truncated splice-variant of Stat 5b can act as a dominant negative factor in granulosa cells as it does in other cells (25, 26).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	110	View larger version (18K):    Figure 4.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	111	 Truncated Stat 5b Acts as a Dominant Negative Factor in Differentiated Granulosa Cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	112	Expression vectors of the long (Stat 5b) and truncated form (Stat 5b-40C) of Stat 5b were cotransfected as above with 4xGAS-2M promoter-reporter construct, containing four copies of the proximal Stat-binding site.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	113	 Luciferase activity is presented as the mean  plus or minus  SEM of activity obtained for each construct done in triplicate.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	114	  SF-1 and COUP-TF Are Present in Granulosa Cells and Bind the Proximal Promoter of the 2M Gene The 109-bp fragment (-153/-43 bp) which, when deleted, totally abolished functional activity of promoter-reporter constructs (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	115	 1; -209 2M) was analyzed for potential transcription factor- binding sites.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	116	 Putative binding sites for orphan members of the nuclear transcription factor family, SF-1, and COUP-TF (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	117	 5A) were present in the 45-bp region of this fragment.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	118	 The sites for COUP-TF included an imperfect direct repeat (DR) separated by one nucleotide (designated DR1) and another direct repeat that contains a variant repeat of A/GGGTCA separated by two nucleotides, designated DR2.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	119	 On the opposite strand between DR1 and DR2, a putative SF-1 site was identified that contains one nucleotide mismatch from the consensus hexameric sequence (CA)AGGTCA (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	120	 Based on sequence identity and the binding studies described below, we have referred to this region as the orphan receptor response element (ORRE).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	121	View larger version (52K):    Figure 5.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	122	 Sequence and Functional Binding Sites for COUP-TF and SF-1 in the 2M ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	123	A, Sequence comparison of the ORRE to consensus binding sites for members of the nuclear orphan receptor family.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	124	 The ORRE contains two potential COUP-TF binding sites designated direct repeats (DR), DR1 and DR2.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	125	 The SF-1 binding site is present on the opposite strand between DR1 and DR2.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	126	 Consensus sequences are represented in bold.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	127	 Identical nucleotides are indicated with lines.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	128	 B, SF-1 and COUP-TF bind the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	129	 WCEs obtained from differentiated granulosa cells were incubated with labeled oligonuleotide ORRE various cold competitors, as indicated, and analyzed by EMSA.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	130	 The sequence of each oligonucleotide is described in Materials and Methods.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	131	 Arrows indicate the specific DNA protein complexes formed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	132	 WCEs from differentiated granulosa cells were preincubated with antisera to COUP-TF or SF-1 (30 min/4 C) before the addition of radiolabeled ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	133	 Antisera against COUP-TF reacts with Complex A and antisera against SF-1 reacts with complex B.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	134	 Supershifts are indicated by (*).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	135	  To determine whether these factors were present in the differentiated granulosa cells and could bind to the ORRE, EMSAs were performed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	136	 A 50 mer oligonucleotide spanning the ORRE was used as a labeled probe and incubated with WCE obtained from untreated and PRL-treated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	137	 Since identical complexes were observed with either WCE (data not shown), only the results obtained with WCE not exposed to PRL are presented (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	138	 As shown, two major protein/DNA complexes were formed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	139	 The slower migrating complex, designated complex A, consists of two bands (thin arrow); the faster migrating complex is designated complex B (thick arrow).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	140	 Formation of both these complexes was inhibited by the addition of 100-fold molar excess of unlabeled ORRE oligonucleotide, indicating that each of these complexes contains a protein(s) capable of binding to the probe.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	141	 When a 20-bp oligonucleotide encompassing a consensus COUP-TF-binding site (Materials and Methods) was added to the reaction, the formation of complex A but not complex B was abolished (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	142	 When oligonucleotides spanning either the putative COUP-TF-binding DR1 or DR2 regions (Materials and Methods) of the 2M promoter were added, neither altered the formation of complex A or complex B at the 100-fold molar excess.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	143	 However, when oligonucleotides containing both DR1 and SF-1 (DR1SF-1) or DR2 and SF-1 (DR2SF-1) (Materials and Methods) were added, each reduced the formation of complex A as well as complex B.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	144	To confirm the identification of proteins present in granulosa cell extracts, the WCEs were incubated with specific antisera to either COUP-TF or SF-1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	145	 Antisera to COUP-TF specifically supershifed both the bands of complex A (*).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	146	 Previous data show that this antiserum recognizes both COUP-TFI and COUP-TF-II (27).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	147	 This COUP-TF antiserum also diminished the binding of in vitro translated COUP-TF to ORRE (data not shown).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	148	 The SF-1- specific antiserum retarded complex B (*) but not complex A, indicating a specific interaction of the antibody to this major protein-DNA complex.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	149	 Collectively, these data indicate that the SF-1 (complex B) and COUP-TF (complex A) bind the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	150	 Furthermore, the functional binding sites appear to be overlapping rather than distinct.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	151	Mutation of the SF-1 Binding Site Alters COUP-TF Binding to the ORRE To determine whether the nucleotides required for the binding of SF-1 and COUP-TF to the 2M promoter were overlapping, mutations within the ORRE were generated (Materials and Methods).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	152	 Mutations in both DR1 and DR2 (Mutant 1; M1) were made to selectively eliminate the putative binding sites of COUP-TF; mutations in the SF-1-binding site were generated to block the binding of SF-1 (M2) (Materials and Methods).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	153	 When EMSAs were performed with M1 as the labeled probe (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	154	 6A, left panel), one major complex was formed (arrow).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	155	 This complex was competed with 50-fold and 100-fold molar excess of unlabeled M1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	156	 The antibody to COUP-TF failed to affect the mobility of the major complex binding to M1, whereas the antibody to SF-1 supershifted the major complex (*).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	157	 These results indicate that mutations within DR1 and DR2 inhibited COUP-TF binding without altering the binding of SF-1 to the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	158	View larger version (60K):    Figure 6.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	159	 Binding Characteristics of Mutant SF-1 and COUP-TF-Binding Regions.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	160	A, Analysis of mutant SF-1- and COUP-TF-binding sites.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	161	 WCEs obtained from differentiated granulosa cells were incubated with labeled oligonuleotide containing either mutation in both DR1 and DR2 (M1) or mutation in the SF-1 site (M2) and analyzed by EMSA.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	162	 The sequences of both M1 and M2 are described in Materials and Methods.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	163	 Arrow indicates the specific DNA protein complex formed with M1.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	164	 WCEs from differentiated granulosa cells were preincubated with antisera to COUP-TF/SF-1 (30 min/4 C) before the addition of radiolabeled M1/M2.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	165	 Supershift of the specific complex with antisera against SF-1 is indicated by (*).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	166	 B, Mutation of the SF-1 site alters the affinity of COUP-TF to ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	167	 WCEs obtained from differentiated granulosa cells were incubated with labeled oligonuleotide ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	168	 The oligonuleotide containing mutation in the SF-1 site (M2) was used as a cold competitor at various concentrations.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	169	 The arrow indicates the specific DNA protein complex formed with ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	170	 WCEs from differentiated granulosa cells were preincubated with antisera to COUP-TF (30 min/4 C) before the addition of radiolabeled ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	171	 Supershift of the specific complex with antisera against COUP-TF is indicated by (*).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	172	  When the SF-1 mutant (M2) oligonucleotide was used as the labeled probe in EMSAs, no specific protein-DNA complexes containing SF-1 or COUP-TF were observed (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	173	 The absence of SF-1 binding was expected.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	174	 However the absence of COUP-TF was unexpected because both DR1 and DR2 sites were intact.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	175	 Thus mutation of the SF-1 site altered not only the binding of SF-1 but also that of COUP-TF.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	176	 When labeled M2 was incubated with in vitro translated COUP-TF, the binding of COUP-TF was markedly diminished compared with the intact ORRE (data not shown).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	177	 Based on these observations, we concluded that the SF-1 site of the 2M promoter appeared to enhance, stabilize, or directly bind COUP-TF.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	178	To determine if the mutation of the SF-1 site within the 2M promoter altered the binding affinity of COUP-TF to the ORRE, additional EMSAs were run in which the intact 50-mer ORRE was used as the labeled probe.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	179	 As previously, unlabeled ORRE reduced the formation of complexes A and B whereas the COUP-TF antibody supershifted complex A but not complex B (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	180	 When the SF-1 mutant M2 oligonucleotide was used at 100-, 500-, and 1000-fold molar excess, no reduction in the binding of SF-1 was observed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	181	 However, M2 did compete for the binding of COUP-TF (thin arrow), albeit less effectively than unlabeled ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	182	 A 1000-fold molar excess of M2 was required to achieve the same inhibition as a 100-fold molar excess of the intact ORRE (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	183	 These results indicate that mutation of the SF-1 site reduces the affinity or stability but does not completely prevent the binding of COUP-TF to the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	184	SF-1 and COUP-TF Exert Opposing Effects on the Functional Activity of the 2M Promoter SF-1 is known to be a positive regulator of many genes (2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9), whereas the effects of COUP-TF are more complex and can be either positive or negative (17, 28).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	185	 In addition, both exhibit tissue-specific effects as indicated by the phenotypes of mutant mice lacking SF-1 (1) or COUP-TFI/II (Refs.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	186	 To analyze the functional roles of SF-1 and COUP-TF in regulating activation of the 2M promoter, specific mutations that abolished the binding of SF-1 or COUP-TF (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	187	 6) were generated within the -3712M promoter-reporter construct using PCR- directed mutagenesis techniques (Materials and Methods).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	188	 These constructs were then transfected into differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	189	 After 4 h, cells were treated with/without PRL for 6 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	190	 Luciferase activity was measured, normalized to the amount of protein present in the sample, and then expressed as activity/ microg protein.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	191	 As expected, PRL induced a 2- to 3-fold increase in luciferase activity from the intact -371 2M promoter-reporter construct (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	192	 Mutation of the SF-1 site (mSF-1) that prevents SF-1 binding and reduces the affinity of COUP-TF binding (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	193	 6A/B) markedly decreased basal activity of the reporter gene but did not prevent the 3-fold increase in response to PRL (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	194	 In contrast, the COUP-TF mutant (mCOUPTF) construct that retains an intact SF-1 binding site but fails to bind COUP-TF showed a 5-fold increase in basal promoter activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	195	 Although the fold increase by PRL was somewhat reduced, an effect of PRL was observed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	196	 When both the SF-1 and the COUP-TF sites (mSF-mCOUPTF) were mutated, basal and PRL-stimulated luciferase activities were similar to that of the intact promoter-reporter construct.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	197	 Collectively, these data document that within the ORRE of the 2M promoter, SF-1 acts as a positive regulator whereas COUP-TF acts as a repressor of transcriptional activation.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	198	 Combined with the data from the EMSAs, these results indicate that although mutation of the SF-1 site decreases the affinity of COUP-TF binding to the 2M promoter, COUP-TF binds this region (albeit with reduced affinity) and retains potent repressor activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	199	 Thus, both of these nuclear receptors appear to control the basal activity of the 2M promoter in granulosa-luteal cells but do not markedly alter the response to PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	200	View larger version (18K):    Figure 7.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	201	 SF-1 and COUP-TF Are Required for 2M Promoter Activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	202	Mutations of specific bases within the SF-1- and/or COUP-TF-binding sites were generated using PCR mutagenesis technique.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	203	 Each of the indicated vectors was transfected in triplicate in differentiated granulosa cells as above.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	204	 Luciferase activity (lights units/ microg) is presented as the mean  plus or minus  SEM of activity obtained for each construct done in triplicate.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	205	  Molecular Mechanisms by which FSH and T Control Expression of 2M in Granulosa Cells The identification of SF-1 and COUP-TF as factors binding to and regulating the functional activity of the ORRE of the 2M promoter prompted us to determine whether these factors regulated the basal activity of this promoter at different stages of granulosa cell differentiation.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	206	 Specifically, FSH has been shown to regulate the expression of numerous genes in granulosa cells that contain SF-1 binding sites.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	207	 The list of genes includes aromatase (6), P450scc (7), MIS (8), and, more recently, the receptor for PRL (31).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	208	 This latter observation indicated that not only the basal activity of 2M promoter, but also the PRL inducibility of 2M gene might be dependent on several aspects of FSH-mediated differentiation of granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	209	 Therefore, we analyzed and compared both basal and PRL- induced expression of 2M in immature granulosa cells and in cells differentiated in the presence of FSH and T.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	210	 The expression of the endogenous 2M gene has been compared with the activity of 2M promoter-luciferase-reported constructs transfected into similar immature and differentiated cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	211	 Furthermore, the expression of the endogenous gene and the transgene has been related to the expression of PRL receptors (PRLRs), activation of Stat 5, and the relative levels of SF-1 and COUP-TF.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	212	To analyze the expression of the endogenous gene, granulosa cells were isolated from estradiol-primed immature rats.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	213	 The cells were either cultured in serum-free medium without hormones for 24 h or were cultured with FSH/T for 48 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	214	 PRL was added to the hormone-free (undifferentiated) and hormone-induced (differentiated) cell cultures for 24 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	215	 Total RNA was isolated, and 2M transcripts were analyzed by Northern blots.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	216	 8A, 2M mRNA was not present in the undifferentiated cells in the absence or presence of PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	217	 In contrast, PRL did induce 2M mRNA in the differentiated cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	218	 Thus, in the absence of FSH/T, PRL is unable to stimulate transcription of the endogenous 2M gene, confirming previous studies in vivo (11) and in vitro (32, 33).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	219	View larger version (23K):    Figure 8.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	220	 FSH/T-Induced Differentiation of Granulosa Cells Is Required for Expression of 2M mRNA and Promoter Activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	221	A, PRL fails to induce 2M transcripts in undifferentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	222	 Undifferentiated (-FSH/T, 24 h) and differentiated (+FSH/T, 48 h) granulosa cells were placed in culture, followed by addition of PRL (1  microg/ml, 24 h).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	223	 Total RNA (20  microg) was used for Northern blot analysis.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	224	 B, Functional activity of the 2M promoter is dependent on granulosa cell differentiation.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	225	 The -3712M construct was transfected in triplicate into granulosa cells that had been cultured in the presence or absence of FSH and T.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	226	 After 4 h of incubation, PRL (1  microg/ml) was added for 6 h.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	227	 Luciferase activity (lights units/ microg) is presented as the mean  plus or minus  SEM of activity obtained for each construct done in triplicate.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	228	  Similar cultures were then set up and transfected with the -3712M promoter-reporter construct to analyze the activity of these chimeric genes in the absence and presence of PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	229	 8B, basal luciferase activity of the -371 2M promoter-reporter construct was low in undifferentiated granulosa cells and was not increased by the addition of PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	230	 In contrast, basal luciferase activity was 10-fold higher in the differentiated cells, and PRL induced a further 2- to 3-fold increase in activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	231	 The marked differences in the activity of the transgene in these two stages of granulosa cell differentiation were not related to transfection efficiency since an SV40 enhancer-promoter construct gave similar activity (20,000 mean light units  plus or minus  SEM per  microg protein) when transfected into each culture.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	232	 Based on these observations that FSH- and T-induced differentiation altered both basal and PRL-regulated activities, we sought to determine what changes in the PRL-response system or in the ratio of SF-1 and COUP-TF might account for these marked differences.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	233	To determine whether PRL could stimulate activation of Stat 5b/5a in undifferentiated granulosa cells, WCEs were isolated from FSH/T-treated (48 h) or untreated (24 h) granulosa cells before and after PRL treatment (15 to 30 min).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	234	 Several protein/DNA complexes were formed when WCE prepared from immature granulosa cells before and after their exposure to PRL were added to the labeled 2MGAS2 probe.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	235	 However, only extracts prepared within 15 min after PRL addition to FSH/T-treated cells (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	236	 9A) formed a specific slow migrating complex, which is composed primarily of Stat 5b with lesser amounts of Stat 5a (Figs.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	237	 Immunoblot analysis using WCEs prepared from FSH/T treated (48 h) or untreated (24 h) granulosa cells before and after PRL treatment (15/30 min), and Stat 5b antibody shows similar levels of protein in both the immature and the FSH/T-stimulated cells (data not shown).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	238	 Thus, although Stat 5b protein is present in undifferentiated granulosa cells, PRL is unable to activate it in these cells (i.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	239	View larger version (43K):    Figure 9.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	240	 PRL Receptor Activity and mRNA Content in Undifferentiated and Differentiated Granulosa Cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	241	A, PRL fails to activate Stat 5b in undifferentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	242	 WCEs were isolated from cultured granulosa cells before and after PRL treatment (15 min) from undifferentiated (-FSH/T, 24 h) or differentiated (+FSH/T, 48 h) cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	243	 WCEs were incubated with a radiolabeled, double-stranded oligonucleotide 2MGAS2 as above.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	244	 The protein/DNA complexes were analyzed by EMSA.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	245	 B, Expression of PRLR mRNAs in undifferentiated and differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	246	 RNA was isolated from uncultured, undifferentiated (-FSH/T, 24 h) and differentiated (+FSH/T, 48 h) granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	247	 Specific primers to the long and the short form of the PRLRs were used in a RT-PCR assay using 350 ng RNA.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	248	 PCR amplification was performed for 20 cycles as described in Materials and Methods.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	249	 PCR products were resolved on a nondenaturing gel and quantified using Storm860 PhosphoImager.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	250	  One explanation for the transactivation of 2M in differentiated cells, but not in immature cells, is the level of PRLRs in these cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	251	 Three forms of the PRLRs have been identified in the rat.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	252	 The short receptor is an alternatively spliced product of the long form (L-PRLR).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	253	 The Nb2 form expressed in T cells is identical to L-PRLR but lacks 198 aa in the cytoplasmic domain.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	254	 Studies have shown the long form to be functional in the ovary.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	255	 Specific primers to the long and the short form of the PRLRs were used in an RT-PCR assay using RNA isolated from uncultured cells, undifferentiated granulosa cells (-FSH/T, 24 h), and differentiated cells (+FSH/T, 48 h).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	256	 The amplified receptor mRNA products were normalized to the endogenous ribosomal L19-amplified band (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	257	 The long form of the PRLR was detected at significant levels in immature granulosa cells before culture.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	258	 However, in the absence of hormone, the levels of PRLR decreased progressively at 24 and 48 h of culture (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	259	 In contrast, cells cultured with FSH/T for 48 h expressed 5-fold more message for the long PRLR and exhibited detectable amounts of the short form of the receptor (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	260	 These data indicate that the ability of PRL to induce 2M in these differentiated cells is related, in part, to the induction-maintenance of PRLR in these cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	261	 However, since PRL does not induce 2M in immature cells that also express the long form of the PRLR, additional factors regulating either the PRL-signaling cascade or the A-kinase system must be regulated by FSH/T as the granulosa cells differentiate.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	262	Based on the opposing actions of SF-1 and COUP-TF in regulating the basal activity (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	263	 7), we sought to determine whether changes in the relative amounts of these factors might be related to increase of 2M mRNA expression in differentiated cells compared with immature cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	264	 EMSAs were performed using labeled ORRE and extracts prepared from either immature/undifferentiated granulosa cells (in which 2M is not induced) or from FSH/T- treated/differentiated granulosa cell extracts (Fig.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	265	 Quantification of the specific complexes was performed to determine the relative amounts of the SF-1 and COUP-TF binding to the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	266	 10B), a relative increase in SF-1 binding (6-fold) compared with COUP-TF was detected in the FSH/T-treated granulosa-lutein cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	267	 These results indicated that a relative increase in the positive regulator SF-1 may enhance the basal promoter activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	268	View larger version (28K):    Figure 10.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	269	 Levels of SF-1 and COUP-TF-Binding Activity in Undifferentiated and Differentiated Granulosa Cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	270	A, Relative increase in SF-1 and COUP-TF binding to the ORRE in differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	271	 WCEs obtained from immature and differentiated (FSH/T, 48 h) granulosa cells were incubated with labeled ORRE oligonuleotide.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	272	 The protein/DNA complexes were analyzed by EMSA.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	273	 B, Quantitative representation of SF-1 and COUP-TF binding to the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	274	 The SF-1 and COUP-TF protein/DNA complexes were quantified with Storm860 PhosphoImager.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	275	 FSH-dependent differentiation of granulosa cells increases the relative amount of SF-1 binding to the ORRE compared with COUP-TF.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	276	 Ratios (relative units) of SF-1 to COUP-TF binding are indicated in parentheses.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	277	     DISCUSSION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION RESULTS DISCUSSION MATERIALS AND METHODS REFERENCES   The expression of 2M in the rat ovary is dependent on the differentiation of granulosa cells to luteal cells (10, 11) as well as the presence, activation, and binding of a diverse set of transcription factors to the promoter of the 2M gene.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	278	 In this study we have identified and functionally characterized the interactions of two regions of the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	279	 One region contains a PRLRE that is comprised of two Stat factor-binding sites and binds both Stat 5a and Stat 5b (Refs.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	280	 The other region contains an ORRE that binds the orphan nuclear receptors SF-1 (2, 3, 4) and COUP-TF (17, 18).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	281	 We show herein that maximal functional activity of the 2M promoter depends on the independent activation of each region by the binding and interactions of these specific transcription factors, hormonal stimulation, and a differentiated granulosa-luteal cell phenotype.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	282	When the studies described herein were originally initiated, we had shown that Stat 5a was expressed in rat granulosa cells, activated by PRL, and bound to the PRLRE of the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	283	 We have extended these observations by showing that both Stat-binding sites are critical for PRL-induced activity of the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	284	 Neither site alone in the context of the intact promoter exhibits significant functional activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	285	 These results indicate that the two sites may interact to stabilize or increase the binding of coregulatory molecules that interact with the transcriptional machinery.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	286	 As new information about the complexity of the Stat 5 family of transcription factors was reported (34, 35), reagents to these new family members allowed us to extend our initial observations.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	287	 Using antibodies specific for Stat 5b, we show that not only is it present in the rat granulosa cells, it is expressed at higher levels than Stat 5a, is activated by PRL, and binds to the PRLRE of the 2M gene.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	288	 These results obtained in granulosa-luteal cells in culture support those observed in luteal cells in vivo (10, 11).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	289	 Antibodies to Stat 5b have allowed us to document that in differentiated granulosa cells Stat 5b is tyrosine phosphorylated and translocated to the nucleus in response to PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	290	 In addition, truncated, splice-variant forms of Stat proteins have been cloned.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	291	 For the Stats in which truncated forms have been identified, Stat 1 (36, 37) Stat 3 (38), and Stat 5 (25, 26), the mutants lacking the transactivation domain have been shown to exert dominant-negative functions in transcription assays (25, 26, 36, 37, 38).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	292	 When we coexpressed the truncated Stat 5b variant with the 2M promoter-luciferase reporter construct, PRL-induced activity was markedly impaired, supporting the hypothesis that Stat 5 is the major PRL-regulated activator of 2M promoter activity in the differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	293	 Taken together, our results provide evidence that PRL-mediated signaling events that transactivate the 2M gene in the granulosa-luteal cells occur by mechanisms similar to those that regulate cytokine signal transduction of target gene activity in other tissues, such as mammary gland (13, 39, 40) and liver (35, 41).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	294	 That Stat 5, especially Stat 5b, plays a major role in transducing PRL action in ovarian cells has been supported recently by the generation of mutant mice.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	295	 Although female mice null for Stat 5a do not exhibit an overt ovarian phenotype (42), mice null for Stat 5b alone (43) are infertile and exhibit abnormal ovarian functions.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	296	 Based on the luteal cell-specific expression of 2M in vivo as well as its regulation by PRL and Stat 5b in cultured cells, we predict that corpora lutea of the infertile mice either fail to express 2M or express it at a markedly reduced level.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	297	Our results have also provided new evidence to indicate that other regions, in addition to the PRLRE, regulate the expression of 2M in granulosa-luteal cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	298	 The region directly 3' of the PRLRE binds both SF-1 and COUP-TF and has been designated herein as the ORRE of the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	299	 When this region of the 2M promoter was deleted, leaving the PRLRE intact, transgene activity was reduced to baseline and PRL inducibility was abolished.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	300	 Based on these initial observations, we predicted that Stat 5 binding to the PRLRE interacted synergistically with the orphan receptors binding to the 3'- regulatory region to confer maximal promoter activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	301	 This initial hypothesis was supported by observations of others who have shown that Stats synergistically interact with a variety of other transcription factors and coregulatory molecules.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	302	 In mammary epithelial cells, Stat 5 interacts with the glucocorticoid receptor for activation of the ss-casein gene by PRL (23, 44).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	303	 In liver cells, Stat 3 synergizes (interacts) with glucocorticoid receptor for activation of the 2M gene by IL-6 (24).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	304	 Stat 1 and Sp1 interact to activate ICAM-I promoter in human tracheobronchial epithelial cells (21).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	305	 In addition, Stat 2 has been shown to bind CBP/p300 and enhance gene activation by interferon- (20).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	306	 When site-specific mutations were generated in either the Stat 5, SF-1, or COUP-TF binding sites within the context of the intact 2M promoter, a different set of functional interactions was observed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	307	Mutation of either one or both Stat 5-binding sites markedly reduced PRL inducibility.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	308	 As mentioned above, these results indicate that the functional activity of the PRLRE is dependent on the binding of Stat 5 to each site and that these two sites interact to confer maximal PRL inducibility.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	309	 However, mutation of the Stat sites did not alter the high basal activity observed with the intact 2M promoter-reporter constructs compared with the -48 2M minimal promoter construct.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	310	 Contrary to our initial hypothesis, these results indicated that the Stat sites acted independently of the factors binding to the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	311	 However, when site-specific mutations of the SF-1 site or the two COUP-TF binding sites were generated, marked changes in the basal activities of the mutant constructs were observed.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	312	 The mutant SF-1 construct that failed to bind SF-1 exhibited markedly reduced basal activity, whereas the COUP-TF mutant construct that failed to bind COUP-TF, but did bind SF-1, exhibited elevated basal activity.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	313	 These results indicated that SF-1 is a transcriptional activator and enhances 2M promoter activity, whereas COUP-TF acted as a corepressor to antagonize the activity of SF-1 and thereby reduce the functional activity of the intact 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	314	 Thus, the 2M gene can be added to a growing list of genes that are regulated by SF-1 in ovarian cells and highlights the importance of SF-1 in many diverse functions within the gonads and adrenals as suggested by the phenotype of mice null for SF-1 (1).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	315	 Furthermore, these observations provide the first evidence that COUP-TF is present and functional in ovarian granulosa cells and can regulate the expression of an ovarian gene.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	316	 Although the actions of COUP-TF are complex and have been shown to be both stimulatory and inhibitory (17), our data indicate that COUP-TF acts as a corepressor of SF-1 action in the intact promoter of the 2M gene.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	317	 This observation supports results obtained by one other study in which the effects of SF-1 were blunted by COUP-TF (5).
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	318	Although the mechanism by which COUP-TF blocks the actions of SF-1 on the 2M promoter have not been entirely defined, our data show an interesting juxtaposition and interaction of SF-1- and COUP-TF-binding sites.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	319	 Of note, mutation of the SF-1 site reduced by 10-fold the binding affinity of COUP-TF for the DR1 and DR2 regions of the 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	320	 From this, we conclude that the binding of COUP-TF to DR1 and DR2 overlaps the SF-1 site or adjacent sites.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	321	 However, despite the dramatic reduction in the binding affinity of COUP-TF to the SF-1 mutant region, COUP-TF retained potent repressor activity as revealed by the markedly reduced basal activity of the SF-1 mutant construct.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	322	 These interactions of SF-1 and COUP-TF indicate that any change in the relative levels or activity of these factors could markedly alter the basal activity of the 2M gene and thus its expression.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	323	Both PRLRE and ORRE are dependent on the differentiation of granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	324	 In the case of the PRLRE, granulosa cell differentiation is obligatory, in part, because of the increased expression of PRLRs on the cell surface.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	325	 Increased PRLR number enhances the activation of Stat 5b, which is constituitively expressed in the same amount in immature as well as differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	326	 In the case of the ORRE, the molecular basis for the enhanced activity of this region in differentiated cells, as opposed to immature cells, remains to be determined but likely involves altered functional activity and complex interactions of SF-1 or COUP-TF on the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	327	 As shown herein, the amounts and relative ratios of these two factors binding to the 2M ORRE are different in immature and differentiated granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	328	 There is a relative 6-fold increase in SF-1 binding in differentiated granulosa cells compared with the immature granulosa cells.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	329	 Therefore, increased basal activity of the 2M promoter may depend on the increased binding of this transcriptional activator.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	330	 In addition, functional changes are likely to involve the selective phosphorylation of either factor or a coregulatory molecule.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	331	 Phosphorylation of SF-1 would be predicted to increase activity of the ORRE, whereas phosphorylation of COUP-TF might decrease its repressor activity on the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	332	 The phosphorylation of either factor might alter the recruitment of other coregulatory molecules.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	333	 Phosphorylation of SF-1 has been shown to occur in differentiated granulosa cells (45) and, therefore, may be a critical event in increasing both basal activity of 2M as well as increasing the expression of PRLR.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	334	 In combination, these two events promote enhanced transcription of 2M by PRL.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	335	 As mentioned above, most cells do not express SF-1 but do express COUP-TF.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	336	 Therefore, it is possible that in these cells the repressor activity of COUP-TF is unopposed by any other transcription factor, thereby reducing expression of the gene.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	337	In summary, we have shown that expression of the 2M gene in ovarian granulosa-luteal cells involves not only PRL-induced activation of Stat 5b/a but also the opposing interactions of SF-1 and COUP-TF on an ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	338	 The close juxtaposition of these regions initially indicated that there might be a functional synergism between the factors binding to the PRLRE and the ORRE.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	339	 However, using site-specific mutations, rather that deletion analyses, we have been able to show that these regions act independently of each other in the context of the intact 2M promoter.
0.35218814.9731707.html.plaintext.txt	340	   MATERIALS AND METHODS TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION RESULTS DISCUSSION MATERIALS AND METHODS REFERENCES   Materials 17ss-Estradiol was purchased from Sigma Chemical Co.
