0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	62	 B, Transient transfection assay as described in Materials and Methods into Saos2 cells with 2.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	63	0  microg reporter construct ApoB.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	64	1  microg of the indicated HNF4 expression vector (see Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	65	 Shown is the mean luciferase activity in relative light units (RLU)  plus or minus SD of triplicates from one representative experiment of three.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	66	wt also stimulated HNF4-mediated transcription in the absence of added ligand in 293T and CV-1 cells (data not shown).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	67	 Stimulation was also observed when normalized to a ss-galactosidase control, although it was not as great because DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	68	wt also enhanced the expression from the ss-galactosidase vector (data not shown).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	69	  Polyamines Enhance the Interaction between HNF4 LBD and DRIP205 in Vitro To determine whether DRIP205 interacts directly with the LBD of HNF4, as it does with other nuclear receptors (17, 19, 20, 21, 22), GST pull-down assays were performed using in vitro-translated DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	70	wt interacted only modestly with the HNF4 LBD construct (2.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	71	2%) just as it did with the VDR LBD in the absence of ligand (1.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	72	 In contrast, addition of 1,25-(OH)2D3 significantly enhanced binding to the VDR LBD (21.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	73	5%; lane 5) and served as a positive control.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	74	View larger version (42K):    Figure 3.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	75	 The Polyamine Spermine Enhances Binding of DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	76	A, Pull-down assay as described in Materials and Methods with in vitro-synthesized 35S-labeled DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	77	wt and immobilized GST fusion proteins of the HNF4 and VDR LBD (see Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	78	 1) in the absence and presence of 4  microM 1,25-(OH)2D3 (+D3) dissolved in ethanol (EtOH) as indicated.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	79	 Shown is an autoradiograph of SDS-PAGE quantified by phosphor imaging.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	80	 10% input, 10% of amount of lysate used in the reaction; % bound, percentage of total input bound normalized to binding to the GST control (GST).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	81	 B, Pull-down assay as in A with 35S-labeled DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	82	 Brackets, Partial translation products of DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	83	 10% input, 10% of amount of lysate used in the reaction; % bound, percentage of input of full-length DRIP205 bound, normalized to GST control (GST).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	84	  To resolve the apparent discrepancy between the ability of the HNF4 LBD to bring down the DRIP complex from cell extracts and the relative inability of the LBD to interact with in vitro-translated DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	85	wt, we incubated the 35S-labeled DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	86	wt with cell extracts and repeated the pull-down assay.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	87	 We found that under these conditions the DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	88	wt could indeed interact with the HNF4 LBD but that the addition of the cell extracts was not required for the effect, only the addition of the extract buffer (data not shown).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	89	 Because the most unusual components of the nuclear extraction buffer were the positively charged polyamines spermine and spermidine, we tested them in the pull-down assay.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	90	 We found that physiological concentrations of spermine (1 mM) markedly enhanced the interaction between 35S-labeled DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	91	5% to 22%, but had only a negligible affect on background binding to the GST control (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	92	 3B, compare arrow in lane 5 with lane 3, and lane 4 with lane 2).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	93	1 mM) resulted in less binding (3.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	94	5%), indicating a dose effect (lane 7).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	95	 Interestingly, truncated 35S-labeled DRIP205 products present in the lysate bound relatively well to the HNF4 LBD, irrespective of the addition of spermine (lanes 3, 5, 7, 9, bracket).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	96	 Similar effects were observed with spermidine although to a lesser degree (data not shown).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	97	In investigating the nature of the effect of spermine on the HNF4-DRIP205 interaction, we found several properties that suggest that the effect is a specific one.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	98	 For example, spermine did not enhance binding of DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	99	wt to a GST HNF4 fusion construct lacking the AF-2 (C360), indicating that the AF-2 is required (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	100	 4A, top panel, compare lane 6 with lane 3).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	101	 Spermine also only marginally affected the ability of the HNF4 LBD to interact with another protein, namely 35S-labeled HNF41 (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	102	 4A, bottom panel, compare lane 7 with lane 4; 1.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	103	3-fold effect on binding DRIP205), and this effect did not require the presence of the AF-2 (compare lane 6 with lane 3).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	104	 The effect of spermine also required the presence of the NR boxes of DRIP205 as pull-downs with the full-length DRIP205 containing mutations in the two NR boxes (DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	105	mut) were not affected by the addition of spermine (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	106	 4B, middle panel, compare lane 7 with lane 4).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	107	 Likewise, interaction with a small region of DRIP205, which encompasses just the NR boxes (DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	108	box), was not greatly affected by the addition of spermine (compare lane 7 with lane 4, bottom panel).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	109	 These results indicate that whereas the effect of spermine was dependent on the presence of the AF-2 and the NR boxes, it was not due to an increased interaction between just these two regions.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	110	 This is not surprising in that spermine is a charged molecule and the AF-2-NR box interaction is primarily a hydrophobic one.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	111	View larger version (34K):    Figure 4.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	112	 Spermine Enhances Binding of DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	113	wt to NR LBDs in an AF-2- and NR Box-Dependent Manner.

0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	122	LBD) in the absence and presence of 1 mM spermine and 1,25-(OH)2D3 (+D3) or ethanol control (EtOH) as indicated.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	123	 10% input, 10% of amount of lysate used in the reaction; % bound, percentage of total input bound normalized to binding to the GST control (GST).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	124	  Additional studies support the notion that the effect of the spermine may be due to more than simply an enhancement of the AF-2-NR box interaction and may in fact involve the entire DRIP205 molecule.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	125	 Because other coactivators have been found to interact with the DNA binding domain (DBD) of nuclear receptors (23, 24), we sought to determine whether DRIP205 might also interact with the HNF4 DBD and whether that interaction was affected by the addition of spermine.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	126	 Whereas the HNF4 DBD bound remarkably well to both the wt DRIP205 (67%) and the DRIP205 containing the mutated NR boxes (54.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	127	 4B, top and middle panels, lane 3), spermine greatly decreased both of those interactions (lane 6).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	128	 In contrast, the isolated DRIP205 NR box did not bind well to the HNF4 DBD either in the absence or presence of spermine (bottom panel, lanes 3 and 6).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	129	 Whereas it is possible that the decrease in binding of the full-length DRIP205 to the HNF4 DBD is not related to the increased in binding to the LBD, it is equally possible that the two effects are related.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	130	 For example, spermine could induce a conformational change in DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	131	wt that causes a decrease in the interaction with the HNF4 DBD and an increase in the interaction with the LBD, perhaps as a result of increased access to the NR boxes.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	132	 Such a conformational change could also explain why the HNF4 LBD binds the truncated DRIP205 products better than the full-length DRIP205 and why that binding is not affected by spermine to in the truncated products, the NR boxes may already be fully accessible (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	133	If spermine is primarily affecting DRIP205 and not HNF4, then one might expect to see a similar affect on the interaction with other nuclear receptors.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	134	 This is exactly what we found with the VDR LBD: the presence of spermine enhanced the interaction with DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	135	4% binding in the presence of 1,25-(OH)2D3 (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	136	 4C, top panel, compare lane 7 with lane 4).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	137	 It also enhanced binding to the unliganded VDR, although that binding was still considerably less than in the presence of ligand (Fig, 4C, top panel, lane 6 vs.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	138	 Once again, the affect of spermine was evident only on the full-length DRIP205, as there was no appreciable effect on the isolated NR boxes (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	139	GRIP1: Decreased Binding in the Presence of Polyamines and Synergy with DRIP205 To determine whether polyamines could increase the interaction between nuclear receptors and any NR box containing protein, we examined the effect of spermine on binding to p160 family member GRIP1.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	140	 Much to our surprise, addition of spermine to the pull-down reaction reproducibly decreased the interaction of 35S-labeled GRIP1 with both the HNF4 and the VDR LBD (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	141	 5A, top and bottom panels, compare lane 7 with lane 4).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	142	View larger version (28K):    Figure 5.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	143	 Spermine as a Switch between the p160 Family and the DRIP Complex: Spermine Decreases Binding of GRIP to NR LBDs and GRIP1 Synergizes with DRIP205 to Activate HNF4-Mediated Transcription.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	144	 3 but with in vitro-translated 35S-labeled GRIP1 and GST.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	145	 HNF4 (DBD or LBD; top panel) and GST.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	146	LBD (bottom panel) in the absence and presence of 1 mM spermine as indicated.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	147	 +D3, Reaction performed in the presence of 4  microM 1,25-(OH)2D3 dissolved in ethanol (lanes 4 and 7).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	148	 An equivalent amount of ethanol was added to the reactions in lanes 3 and 6.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	149	 B, Transient transfection assay into 293T cells as described in Materials and Methods with 2  microg of a Gal4 luciferase reporter construct (pFR-luc, Stratagene, La Jolla, CA) and 0.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	150	1  microg of expression plasmids containing a Gal4.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	151	DBD fusion to the HNF4 LBD (Gal4.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	152	LBD) in the absence or presence of 5  microg pSG5.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	153	 Shown is the mean luciferase activity in relative light units (RLU)  plus or minus SD of triplicates from one representative experiment of three.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	154	  Because spermine decreased the interaction with GRIP1 but increased the interaction with DRIP205, this suggested that the two coactivator complexes could act together in a single pathway with spermine acting as a switch between the two complexes.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	155	 If this is the case, then one might expect to see a synergistic effect between the two coactivators.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	156	 In contrast, if GRIP1 and DRIP205 act independently in two parallel pathways, then one would expect to see only an additive effect.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	157	 Transient cotransfection analysis showed that DRIP205 activated a Gal4 fusion construct containing the HNF4 LBD approximately 2.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	158	 5B, compare lane 6 with lane 5) and that GRIP1 activated it 2.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	159	6-fold (compare lane 7 with lane 5).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	160	 In contrast, when both GRIP1 and DRIP205 were present, the activation was more than additive (8.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	161	LBD alone; compare lane 8 with lane 5), indicating a synergistic effect of these coactivators and supporting the notion that they act on the same pathway.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	162	In Vivo Evidence of a Role for Polyamines in Activated Transcription To determine whether the effects of spermine seen in vitro also played a role in vivo, the transient transfection assay was performed in the presence of a specific inhibitor of polyamine biosynthesis, -difluoromethylornithine (DFMO), which is known to decrease the levels of intracellular polyamines such as spermidine and spermine by blocking the activity of ornithine decarboxylase (Ref.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	163	 A 24-h treatment with DFMO reduced the intracellular levels of both spermidine and spermine in the 293T cells (to 37% and 77%, respectively; Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	164	 6B), and decreased the HNF41-mediated transcription by nearly 50% (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	165	 6C, top, compare lane 3 with lane 1 and lane 4 with lane 2).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	166	 The effect on the HNF41-mediated transcription appeared to be specific in that DFMO slightly increased the level of background transcription from the reporter construct but did not decrease the HNF41 protein levels as evidenced by immunoblot analysis (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	167	 6C, bottom, compare lane 3 with lane 2).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	168	 Because the addition of polyamines to a gel shift reaction decreased the ability of HNF41 to bind DNA in vitro (Seidel, S.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	169	 Sladek, unpublished data), it is unlikely that the decrease in HNF4-mediated transcription in the DFMO-treated cells is due to a decrease in DNA binding.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	170	 Rather, the results suggest that blocking synthesis of polyamines such as spermine specifically decreased the ability of HNF41 to activate transcription.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	171	View larger version (19K):    Figure 6.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	172	 Polyamines Modulate Transcriptional Activation in Vivo.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	173	A, Pathway of polyamine biosynthesis in mammalian cells.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	174	 ODC, Ornithine decarboxylase (25 ).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	175	 B, Intracellular polyamine concentrations in duplicate samples of 293T cells in the absence (control 1 and 2, DMEM alone) and presence of 1 mM DFMO in DMEM (DFMO 1 and 2) were measured as described in Materials and Methods.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	176	 Results are given in nanomoles of polyamine per milligram of total protein.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	177	 Intracellular putrescine levels were less than 0.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	178	 The effect of the DFMO was comparable to that observed by others in another cell line (38 ), although the starting levels of spermine were somewhat higher for the 293T cells.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	179	 C, Transient transfection into 293T cells performed as described in Materials and Methods with 2  microg of the reporter construct (ApoB.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	180	HNF41 (HNF4) in the absence or presence of 1 mM DFMO added 24 h before harvesting as indicated and as in B.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	181	 Fold Induction, Luciferase activity normalized to ss-gal activity.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	182	 The experiment was repeated twice with similar results.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	183	 The data are presented as the mean  plus or minus  SD of the triplicate.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	184	 Bottom, Immunoblot analysis of the transfected 293T cells to detect the HNF41 protein using the 445 antibody (39 ) and goat antirabbit antisera conjugated to alkaline phosphatase.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	185	     DISCUSSION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION RESULTS DISCUSSION MATERIALS AND METHODS REFERENCES   In the current study, we show for the first time that the orphan receptor HNF4 interacts with a complex containing DRIP proteins in vitro and responds to DRIP205 in vivo in the absence of exogenously added ligand (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	186	 We also show that full-length in vitro-translated DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	187	wt does not interact well with the HNF4 LBD unless the polyamine spermine is added to the reaction (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	188	 The enhancement by spermine appears to be specific in that it was dependent on the presence of the AF-2 of HNF4 and the NR boxes of DRIP205 (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	189	 Spermine also enhanced the interaction of DRIP205 with the VDR LBD but decreased the interaction with the HNF4 DBD (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	190	 An in vivo role for spermine in activated transcription was observed when the specific inhibitor of polyamine biosynthesis, DFMO, decreased HNF41-mediated transcription but not basal transcription (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	191	 Finally, spermine decreased the interaction of both HNF4 and VDR with coactivator GRIP1, and GRIP1 synergized with DRIP205 in vivo to activate HNF4-mediated transcription (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	192	 We and others (5, 6, 7, 26, 27) have proposed previously that the p160 and p300 coactivators and the DRIP complex act in a sequential fashion.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	193	 Our current work supports that model and allows us to propose a mechanism by which this might occur to namely, that polyamines may play a role in switching from one coactivator complex to the other (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	194	View larger version (21K):    Figure 7.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	195	 Proposed Model for a Role of Polyamines in Transcriptional Activation.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	196	Polyamines such as spermine may decrease the binding of activators such as HNF4 and VDR to coactivators such as GRIP1 (a p160 family member) but increase the binding to DRIP205 (shaded molecules).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	197	 This would allow for a switch between the p160/p300 complex and the DRIP complex, both of which interact with nuclear receptors via a common docking surface, the AF-2 (black dot).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	198	 As described in the text, one potential source of the polyamines could be the chromatin.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	199	  Polyamines are small, ubiquitous, organic polycations found at relatively high concentrations in the cell, approximately 1 to 2 mM.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	200	 They have been implicated in a wide variety of physiological functions and have been found to bind proteins as well as nucleic acids (reviewed in Refs.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	201	 Perhaps one of the most intriguing, if elusive, roles of polyamines is in the regulation of gene expression.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	202	 Polyamines are implicated in the formation of higher order chromosomal fibers, facilitating condensation of chromatin fragments and interacting specifically with nucleosome core particles and DNA (31).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	203	 Whereas this would suggest that an increase in polyamine levels would globally repress transcription, in fact it results in an increase in expression of many genes (32), suggesting that polyamines regulate gene expression by additional mechanisms.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	204	 One such mechanism could be via affecting the interaction of transcriptional activators, such as HNF4, with coactivators, such as the DRIP complex.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	205	The data presented in this study indicate that p160 family member GRIP1 and DRIP205 can synergistically activate transcription (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	206	 5B), suggesting that they act in a single pathway but raising the question of how the switch is made from one coactivator to the other.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	207	 Our data also show that the polyamine spermine can decrease the binding of at least two different nuclear receptors to GRIP1 (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	208	 5A) and can increase the binding to DRIP205 (Figs.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	209	 3 and 4), suggesting that polyamines may play a role in that switch.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	210	 Support for that role in vivo is observed when blocking the biosynthesis of polyamines resulted in a decrease in HNF4-mediated transcription (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	211	 If polyamines were acting at the level of chromatin only, and not at the level of coactivators, then one would expect a decrease in polyamine levels to decondense the chromatin and result in an increase, not a decrease, in transcription.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	212	 Therefore, the in vivo as well as the in vitro results suggest that polyamines may play a role in transcription activation other than altering the state of the chromatin.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	213	 However, it must be noted that other interpretations of the in vivo data are possible and that additional experiments are required to definitively prove that polyamines modulate the synergy between GRIP1 and DRIP205 in vivo.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	214	The model of polyamines playing a role in the switch between different coactivator complexes is intriguing but provocative, and raises several important questions.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	215	 One is how do polyamines affect binding of coactivators to activators? Whereas the mechanism is not known, our results suggest that it is not due to a simple enhancement of the interaction between the AF-2 of the nuclear receptors and the NR boxes of DRIP205 (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	216	 Rather, because truncated DRIP205 products bound the HNF4 LBD equally well in the presence and absence of spermine (Fig.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	217	 3), we favor a model in which polyamines induce a conformational change in DRIP205 that exposes otherwise buried NR boxes.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	218	 There is at least one example already of a conformational change in a coactivator that is important for its function (33).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	219	 Another important question is where do the polyamines come from? Most of the polyamines in the cell are not free but are bound to negatively charged molecules such as chromatin (28, 29, 30).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	220	 Because others have shown that the hyperacetylation of histones inhibits the ability of polyamines to condense the chromatin (31), it is possible that acetylation of histones by coactivators such as p300 or p300/CBP-associated factor may also cause a release of polyamines from the chromatin.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	221	 If this were the case, then upon activator binding DNA and recruiting a HAT-containing coactivator complex, there would be an increase in the local polyamine concentration that could then mediate the switch from the HAT-containing complex to the DRIP complex.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	222	 Some evidence already exists that polyamine levels can affect histone acetylation by influencing the action of histone acetyltransferases and deacetylases (32).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	223	 Finally, an attractive feature of the model is that it could apply not only to nuclear receptors but to any transcriptional activator that recruits both HAT-containing coactivators and the DRIP/TRAP/ARC/mediator complex, of which there are several examples (4, 7).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	224	   MATERIALS AND METHODS TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION RESULTS DISCUSSION MATERIALS AND METHODS REFERENCES   Materials 1,25-(OH)2D3 was a generous gift from A.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	225	 Norman (University of California, Riverside, CA).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	226	 Spermine was purchased from Sigma (St.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	227	 Louis, MO) and DFMO was provided by Ilex Oncology (San Antonio, TX).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	228	Plasmids and Transient Transfection Assays The following constructs have been previously described: pMT7 expression vectors containing full-length rat HNF41 (pMT7.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	229	HNF41) and amino acids (aa) 1 to 374 (HNF4.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	230	1 vector containing aa 1 to 360 of HNF41 (HNF4.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	231	N1C360) (12); HNF4 GST fusion constructs containing aa 127 to 374 (GST.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	232	DBD); the reporter construct ApoB.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	233	Luc; a Gal4 DBD fusion construct containing the HNF4 LBD (Gal4.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	234	LBD) (34); the GST fusion construct containing aa 110 to 427 of the human VDR (GST.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	235	1 expression vectors containing the full-length wt human DRIP205 cDNA (DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	236	wt), a small region spanning the two NR boxes of DRIP205 (aa 527 to 714) (DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	237	box), and a full-length DRIP205 with two mutated NR boxes (LXXLL to LXXAA; DRIP205.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	238	GRIP1 containing full-length mouse GRIP1 kindly provided by M.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	239	 Stallcup (University of Southern California) (Ref.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	240	 Human embryonic kidney 293T and Saos-2 cells were maintained and transfected with Lipofectin (Life Technologies, Inc.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	241	, Gaithersburg, MD) as previously described (34).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	242	 DNA mixtures typically contained 2  microg luciferase reporter; 0.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	243	0  microg of the DRIP expression vectors, pSG5.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	244	GRIP1, or appropriate empty vector; and 2  microg RSV.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	245	GST Pull-Down Assay In vitro protein-protein interaction assays were performed using GST fusion proteins as previously described (34).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	246	 In general, 20  microl of beads containing 10 to 20  microg protein were incubated at 4 C with 2 to 5  microl in vitro-translated [35S] methionine-labeled protein in rabbit reticulocyte lysate (TNT, Promega Corp.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	247	, Madison, WI) for 1 h with gentle agitation before extensive washing and elution with SDS buffer and analysis by 10% SDS-PAGE followed by autoradiography and phosphor imaging.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	248	DBD beads were prewashed in buffer containing 1 M NaCl to remove contaminating DNA.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	249	 Pull-downs with Namalwa B cell nuclear extracts were performed as previously described (17).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	250	 For pull-downs with ligand or polyamines, 1,25-(OH)2D3 or spermine was added to 1 to 4  microM or 1 mM, respectively, to the GST beads at the same time as the lysate or extract.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	251	 The concentration of Tris-HCl was increased from 20 mM to 50 mM for experiments with polyamines to maintain the pH at 8.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	252	Measurement of Intracellular Polyamine Levels Intracellular polyamine levels were measured by ion-exchange chromatography followed by reverse-phase HPLC as previously described (36).
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	253	 Briefly, 3 x 106 293T cells plated in a 100-mm plate 1 d in advance were treated with 1 mM DFMO in DMEM when the cells were approximately70% confluent.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	254	 Twenty-four hours later, the cells were washed extensively with PBS and lysed in 400  microl 0.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	255	2 N perchloric acid followed by sonication.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	256	 The extracted material was then subjected to chromatography.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	257	   ACKNOWLEDGMENTS   We thank E.
