0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	305	 J Biol Chem 275:10719 to 10722[Abstract/Free Full Text] Thomas T, Shah N, Klinge CM, Faaland CA, Adihkarakunnathu S, Gallo MA, Thomas TJ 1999 Polyamine biosynthesis inhibitors alter protein-protein interactions involving estrogen receptor in MCF-7 breast cancer cells.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	306	 J Mol Endocrinol 22:131 to 139[Abstract/Free Full Text] Sladek FM, Zhong W, Lai E, Darnell JE 1990 Liver-enriched transcription factor HNF-4 is a novel member of the steroid hormone receptor superfamily.
0.2994644.12089346.html.plaintext.txt	307	 Genes Dev 4:2353 to 2365[Abstract].
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	0	The Mouse Fetoprotein Transcription Factor (FTF) Gene Promoter Is Regulated by Three GATA Elements with Tandem E Box and Nkx Motifs, and FTF in Turn Activates the Hnf3, Hnf4, and Hnf1 Gene Promoters* Jean-Francois Pare, Sylvie Roy, Luc Galarneau, and Luc Belanger .
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	1	From Le Centre de Recherche en Cancerologie de l'Universite Laval, L'Hotel-Dieu de Quebec, Departement de Biologie Medicale, Faculte de Medecine, Quebec G1R 2J6, Canada.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	2	Received for publication, November 28, 2000.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	3	    ABSTRACT TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	4	Fetoprotein transcription factor (FTF) is an orphan nuclear receptor that activates the 1-fetoprotein gene during early liver developmental growth.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	5	 Here we sought to define better the position of FTF in transcriptional cascades leading to hepatic differentiation.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	6	 The mouse FTF gene was isolated and assigned to chromosome 1 band E4 (one mFTF pseudogene was also found).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	7	 Exon/intron mapping shows an mFTF gene structure similar to that of its close homologue SF1, with two more N-terminal exons in the mFTF gene; exon mapping also delimits several FTF mRNA 5'- and 3'-splice variants.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	8	 The mFTF transcription initiation site was located in adult liver at 238 nucleotides from the first translation initiator codon, with six canonical GATA, E box, and Nkx motifs clustered between 50/140 base pairs (bp) from the cap site; DNA/protein binding assays also pinpointed an HNF4-binding element at +36 bp and an FTF-binding element at 257 bp.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	9	 Transfection assays and point mutations showed that the mFTF promoter is activated by GATA, HNF4, FTF, Nkx, and basic helix-loop-helix factors, with marked cooperativity between GATA and HNF4.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	10	 A tandem GATA/E box activatory motif in the proximal mFTF promoter is strikingly similar to a composite motif coactivated by differentiation inducers in the hematopoietic lineage; a tandem GATA-Nkx motif in the distal mFTF promoter is also similar to a composite motif transducing differentiation signals from transforming growth factor--like receptors in the cardiogenic lineage.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	11	 Three genes encoding transcription factors critical to early hepatic differentiation, Hnf3, Hnf4, and Hnf1, each contain dual FTF-binding elements in their proximal promoters, and all three promoters are activated by FTF in transfection assays.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	12	 Direct DNA binding action and cooperativity was demonstrated between FTF and HNF3 on the Hnf3 promoter and between FTF and HNF4 on the Hnf1 promoter.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	13	 These combined results suggest that FTF is an early intermediary between endodermal specification signals and downstream genes that establish and amplify the hepatic phenotype.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	14	     INTRODUCTION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	15	5 days of mouse embryogenesis, endodermal cells of the ventral foregut interact with the cardiac mesoderm and become committed to the hepatic differentiation program; these newly specified cells then migrate and proliferate in the mesenchyme of the septum transversum where liver morphogenesis becomes apparent at E10.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	16	 Initial induction of hepatic functions is driven in part by growth factors of the FGF1 family, secreted by cardiac mesodermal cells and acting via transmembrane receptor kinases at the endodermal cell surface (3).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	17	 The process also involves potentiating transcription factors among which GATA factors appear essential to endodermal determination across vertebrates as well as invertebrates (Ref.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	18	 Following liver specification, transcriptional activation cascades further develop among early hepatic transcription factors creating interactive regulatory networks that amplify the induction signals and imprint the liver phenotype; the HNF4 gene product, for example, activates the Hnf1 gene whose product further enhances the Hnf4 gene promoter, and both HNF1 and HNF4 activate a broad spectrum of liver functions (5, 6).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	19	One of the earliest events marking endodermal specification to liver function is the activation of the 1-fetoprotein (AFP) locus, one of four albumin-related genes tandemly organized in the genome but differentially expressed during development (7).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	20	 The AFP gene is the first to be activated in the foregut endoderm (8), and therefore transcription factors that transduce early cell specification signals to unfold AFP chromatin are likely to exert high ranking liver differentiation functions.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	21	 One prime candidate in that regard is an orphan nuclear receptor originally pinpointed as a potent, highly specific and mandatory activator of the proximal AFP gene promoter (9-11).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	22	 The fetoprotein transcription factor (FTF) (NR5A2) (FTF designation as per Genome Data Base Nomenclature Committee (accession number 9837397); NR5A2 as per Nuclear Receptor Nomenclature Committee (12)) belongs to a subgroup of nuclear receptors related to the archetypal Drosophila segmentation gene Ftz-F1 (13) and that bind as monomers to the DNA motif PyCAAGGPyCPu (where Py is C or T and Pu is A or G)(11).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	23	 FTF is widespread and tightly conserved among vertebrates (14-17); its closest mammalian relative is SF1 (18) that is mainly expressed in steroidogenic cell lineages, whereas FTF is mainly expressed in gut derivatives.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	24	Early developmental patterns of FTF expression in several species (14, 17, 19) and its activation of the AFP locus in hepatocyte progenitors suggested an important role for FTF in endodermal differentiation pathways.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	25	 To gain better insight into FTF functions and its position in liver induction pathways, we isolated and functionally characterized the mouse FTF gene promoter in search for upstream FTF gene regulators, and we also searched for new FTF downstream gene targets.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	26	 The combined results make a compelling case for FTF as a key intermediary between initial signals of liver specification and cascade activations of other transcription factors that enhance hepatic differentiation.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	27	 cis-activating elements pin-pointed in the mFTF promoter may lead to new important effectors of endodermal differentiation pathways.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	28	     EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	29	Isolation and Mapping of the Mouse FTF Gene-- A mouse 129 SV genomic DNA library in bacteriophage DASH II (Stratagene) was screened by plaque hybridization using rat FTF cDNA (11) as a probe.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	30	 The PCR method was used to screen a mouse 129 SV P1 bacteriophage library (Genome Systems) with the following primers from mouse FTF gene introns: 5'-AGTTGAATCTCTGCTGCCCGTGTCC-3' (intron 2) and 5'- TAGCCCGAGAGTGTAAAACCAGGAA-3' (intron 3).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	31	 DASH II DNA from the FTF-positive clones was prepared by the plate lysate method, and the P1 clone DNA was prepared by the alkaline lysis procedure.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	32	 DNA was digested with various restriction enzymes, and DNA fragments were ligated into pBluescript SK+ (Stratagene) and used to transform Escherichia coli DH5; plasmid DNA was isolated, and positive subclones were identified by Southern analysis using mouse FTF/LRH-1 (11) cDNA fragments.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	33	 DNA was sequenced on both strands by the dideoxynucleotide method, and exon/intron boundaries were mapped against the mFTF/LRH1 cDNA sequence (11); mFTF genomic sequences were deposited in GenBankTM under accession number AF239709 (BankIt 322861).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	34	The mFTF gene transcription start site was mapped by primer extension of mouse liver RNA using a 25-mer oligonucleotide (FTF-PE1) spanning mouse FTF gene sequence +37 to +61 (underlined in Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	35	 FTF-PE1 was radiolabeled (106 cpm/ng) with [-32P]ATP and T4 polynucleotide kinase (Life Technologies, Inc.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	36	) and purified by gel electrophoresis and electroelution; 5  x  105 cpm of the FTF-PE1 primer was annealed to 200  microg of total RNA from adult mouse liver overnight at 50  degrees C in 32  microl of Superscript II reverse transcriptase buffer (Life Technologies, Inc.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	37	); the reaction was cooled to 42  degrees C and pursued for 2 h in the presence of 10 mM dithiothreitol, 1 mM dNTPs, and 100 units of Superscript II reverse transcriptase.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	38	 Reverse transcription products were subjected to RNase A digestion, phenol/chloroform extraction, and ethanol/sodium acetate precipitation and analyzed by electrophoresis on denaturing 6% polyacrylamide gels; reference DNA sequences used the FTF-PE1 primer with DNA from FTF gene plasmid 4F-CAT (below).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	39	Chromosomal localization of the mouse FTF gene was carried out by fluorescence in situ hybridization (Genome Systems).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	40	 Mouse FTF genomic DNA (P1 clone) was labeled with digoxigenin dUTP by nick translation, mixed with sheared mouse DNA, and hybridized to metaphase chromosomes from normal mouse embryo fibroblasts in 50% formamide, 10% dextran sulfate, and 2 x  SSC.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	41	 Hybridization signals were revealed with fluoresceinated anti-digoxigenin antibodies followed by counterstaining with 4,6-diamidino-2-phenylindole.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	42	 Of 80 metaphases analyzed, 72 exhibited specific labeling; FTF gene assignment was further confirmed by cohybridization with a telomeric probe specific to chromosome 1.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	43	FTF Gene Constructs-- FTF gene promoter activity was analyzed with FTF/CAT reporter constructs spanning 4 kb or 280 bp of contiguous DNA 5'-adjacent to the mouse FTF transcription start site.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	44	 A HindIII-BamHI fragment from pSV0-CAT (9) was cloned into HindIII-BamHI-digested pBluescript SK+ to generate vector SK-CAT; the EcoRI FTF gene fragment 3.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	45	9 kb to +79 bp (leftmost fragment in Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	46	 1A) was isolated, blunted, and inserted in HindIII-blunted SK-CAT to generate construct 4F-CAT.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	47	 To obtain pF-CAT, the 4F-CAT vector was digested with PstI to leave only FTF gene segment 184/+79 upstream from CAT, and a PstI 280/185 FTF segment was inserted at 184 in the correct orientation.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	48	 Mutations in the FTF gene promoter were derived by PCRs using plasmid 4F-CAT and oligonucleotides listed in Table I; two complementary oligonucleotides (125 ng of each) overlapping the targeted region were mixed with 50 ng of 4F-CAT DNA and amplified with Pfu DNA polymerase (Stratagene) for 30 s at 95  degrees C, 1 min at 55  degrees C, and 2 min/kb of DNA template at 68  degrees C (18 cycles), followed by 1 h at 37  degrees C with 10 units of DpnI (Stratagene).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	49	 The PCR products were transformed into E.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	50	 coli DH5, and mutations were confirmed by sequencing.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	51	 Mutant 4FmG123 was derived from 4FmG3.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	52	Hnf1, Hnf3, and Hnf4 Promoter Vectors-- Reporter vector pH1-CAT driven by the Hnf1 promoter was obtained by PCR amplification of mouse Hnf1 gene region 174/+10 using mouse genomic DNA and the following primers: 5'-GGCTCGAGTGCTCACTCCCAATTGCAGGCCATGACTCC-3' and 5'-CCAAGCTTGGCCAGTGAATCAGGGCCCCTGCCTGCTC-3'.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	53	 The PCR product was digested with XhoI-HindIII and cloned in SK-CAT to generate pH1-CAT.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	54	 Mutations were introduced in pH1-CAT by PCRs as described above for the FTF constructs, using oligonucleotides H1mF1 and H1mF2 (Table I) with pH1-CAT plasmid DNA or its derivative pH1mF1-CAT.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	55	 HNF3-CAT reporters pH3-CAT and H3mF1 are constructs HNF3 184/+69 and its UF2-H3 mutant, described elsewhere (20); vector H3mF12 was derived from H3mF1 using PCR with a pTZ18U internal primer and oligonucleotide H3mF2 (Table I).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	56	 The PCR product was digested with ScaI and SacI and used to replace the ScaI/SacI segment of H3mF1.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	57	 HNF4 reporter vector pH4-luc is a luciferase expression vector carrying a 363/+182-bp mouse Hnf4 gene segment (6).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	58	                              View this table:    Table I Oligonucleotides used for mutagenesis.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	59	Electrophoretic Mobility Shift Assays and Transient Cell Transfections-- Bandshift assays were conducted as described before (10, 11) with total nuclear proteins from adult rat liver and oligonucleotides listed in Table II, using 0.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	60	2 ng of 32P-labeled probe, 3  microg of nuclear proteins, and 5-500-fold molar excess of cold competitor oligonucleotides.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	61	 For FTF binding assays, probe and competitors were coincubated with the nuclear extract for 30 min at 4  degrees C; for HNF4 supershift assays, 1  microl of anti-HNF4 serum (Santa Cruz Biotechnology) was preincubated with the nuclear extract 1 h at room temperature, and then the probe and competitors were added for an additional 30 min.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	62	                              View this table:    Table II Oligonucleotides used in electrophoretic mobility shift assay.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	63	Transfection assays were carried out by the calcium phosphate procedure detailed previously (9, 10), using HepG2, Hep3B, HeLa, and F9 cells maintained in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium (Life Technologies, Inc.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	64	) containing 10% fetal bovine serum (Wisent) and 1% penicillin/streptomycin (F9 cultures used gelatin-coated dishes).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	65	5  x  106 cells in 6-cm Petri dishes or 75-cm2 flasks and transfected 24 h later with 2-5  microg of CAT reporter plasmid, 2-10  microg of transcription factor expression vector, and 1.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	66	5  microg of RSV-lacZ to standardize for transfection efficiency.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	67	 Cells were washed after 16 h and harvested 48 h after transfection.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	68	 CAT activity was measured by thin layer chromatography and phosphorimaging.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	69	 Luciferase activity was measured with a EG  and  G Berthold Lumat LB9507 luminometer.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	70	 Expression vectors for transcription factors used viral enhancer-promoter elements from cytomegalovirus (FTF, HNF4, C/EBP, HNF1, HNF3, HNF3, HNF6, SP1, and Nkx2.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	71	5), Rous sarcoma virus (GATA1, GATA2, GATA4, GATA5, and GATA6), and simian virus 40 (COUP-TFII); the FTF vector carried full-length human FTF cDNA (16, 21).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	72	     RESULTS TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	73	Genetic Mapping of the Mouse FTF Locus-- We retrieved three independent clones (ZF2, ZF6, and ZF25) from the mouse genomic library screened with a rat FTF cDNA probe; clones ZF2 and ZF25 gave stronger signals on Southern blots and were further characterized.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	74	 Clone ZF2 contained a contiguous sequence closely matching the mouse FTF/LRH-1 cDNA sequence (11) but with many base changes, deletions, insertions, and no introns, all indicative of a retro-pseudogene.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	75	 Clone ZF25 contained FTF coding and interspersed DNA sequences corresponding to the exon 3-6 domain in Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	76	 Intronic oligonucleotides were used for further screening of a mouse P1 library, which yielded an insert extending 35 kb upstream from ZF25.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	77	 The P1 insert revealed additional exons and a cluster of transcription factor recognition sites 5'-flanking exon 1 and suggestive of a promoter domain (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	78	 Intron/exon boundaries mapped from  or P1 clones all conformed to the GT/AG splicing rule.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	79	 Mouse FTF exons 3-6 correspond to SF1 exons 1-4 (18), and two additional 5' FTF exons encode the longer FTF N-terminal (A/B) domain (11); the conserved exon/intron junctions of SF1 and FTF predict that the FTF 3'-gene domain contains three more exons (7-9 in the mouse) encoding C terminus amino acids 390-560 (11).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	80	 mFTF exons 1 and 4-6 are similar in size to zebrafish ff1 exons 1 and 3-5 (17).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	81	View larger version (45K):    Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	82	   Genetic mapping of the mouse FTF locus.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	83	 A, restriction sites (E, EcoRI and S, StuI) and mapping of mFTF gene exons I-VI (superscript numbers, encoded amino acids; ZF1 and ZF2, DNA-binding zinc finger 1 and 2 domains; arrow, translation initiation).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	84	 The dashed line is a gene segment measured by PCR and unmapped with restriction enzymes.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	85	 B, transcription initiation site and promoter sequence.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	86	 Left, the mFTF mRNA start site was located by primer extension of mouse liver RNA with FTF antisense primer +37/+61 (sequencing ladders used the same primer with 4F-CAT plasmid DNA); the major reverse transcription product is marked by the arrow.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	87	 Right, mFTF promoter sequence compared with the corresponding zebrafish FTF gene sequence (zff1) (17); dots indicate conserved nucleotides; transcription factor recognition elements are marked in bold; arrows +1, mRNA initiation sites; underlined sequence: oligonucleotide used for primer extension.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	88	 C, chromosomal mapping of the mFTF gene by fluorescence in situ hybridization using a mouse P1 FTF probe (middle panel, cohybridization with a chromosome 1 telomeric probe); arrows point specific signals that assign the mFTF gene to chromosome 1 band E4.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	89	The mFTF gene transcription initiation site was identified by primer extension of adult mouse liver RNA using antisense primer +61/+37 (underlined in Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	90	 1B); a predominant transcription start site was mapped (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	91	 1B) at a G residue 79 nt upstream from the previously reported 5'-end of mouse FTF cDNA and 238 nt upstream from the first translation initiation codon (11) (other extension primers downstream of +79 bp yielded smears of reverse transcription products terminating around +79; some mRNA structure perhaps blocked polymerase extension but alternative start sites around +79 cannot be excluded).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	92	Chromosomal assignment of the mFTF gene was carried out by fluorescence in situ hybridization with a P1-FTF genomic probe minimizing cross-hybridization with the mouse FTF pseudogene.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	93	 Out of 80 metaphases analyzed, 72 showed single specific labeling of the middle portion of chromosome 1 (identified by 4,6-diamidino-2-phenylindole staining and cohybridization with a specific telomeric probe); measurements of chromosomal distances on 10 fluorescence in situ hybridization metaphases located the mouse FTF gene at chromosome 1 band E4 (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	94	Functional Analysis of the mFTF Gene Promoter-- Functional analyses were initiated with mFTF gene construct 4F-CAT carrying FTF gene segment 4 kb/+79 bp.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	95	 Transfection assays showed strong reporter gene activity in HepG2 and Hep3B hepatoma cells (which express endogenous FTF) (21) and no detectable activity in (FTF-negative) HeLa or F9 cells (inset, Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	96	 Reporter CAT activity was also higher in Hep3B than HepG2 cells, correlating with higher expression of endogenous FTF in Hep3B cells (21).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	97	 These results thus indicated that mFTF gene segment 4 kb/+79 bp correctly reproduced hepatic specificity and relative activities of endogenous FTF gene promoter functions.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	98	 Electromobility shift assays were then conducted with presumptive HNF4 and FTF recognition sequences located at +36 and 257 (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	99	 1B), slightly divergent from consensus binding sites.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	100	 Radiolabeled DNA probe +36/+50 (oligonucleotide FH4, Table II) yielded a single retarded liver complex that was competed by cold oligo FH4 and more efficiently by an optimized HNF4-binding site (oligo DR1) (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	101	 2A, lanes 1-7) but not at all by 100-fold excess of a mutated FH4 sequence (oligo mFH4 in Table II) (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	102	 Furthermore, the retarded complex was completely supershifted by anti-HNF4 antibodies (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	103	 These results showed that FTF promoter segment +36/+50 is a highly specific HNF4 recognition site, of lower affinity than a canonical HNF4 DR1 element.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	104	 Similar assays using as a probe the strong FTF-binding element of the AFP gene promoter (10, 11) (oligonucleotide FTF in Table II) indicated that mFTF gene segment 254/268 (oligo FF, Table II) can also efficiently bind FTF, with lower affinity than the FTF site (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	105	View larger version (53K):    Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	106	   A, bandshift reactions showing the interaction of liver transcription factor HNF4 with mFTF gene sequence +36/+50 (oligo FH4, Table II) (mFH4, mutated FH4 sequence; DR1, optimized HNF4-binding site), and the binding of FTF to promoter sequence 254/268 (oligo FF, Table II) (FTF and mFTF are the wild-type and mutated FTF-binding sequence from the AFP promoter).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	107	 Reactions used 3  microg of rat liver nuclear proteins (arrows point the four rat FTF isoforms) (10, 11) and 5-100-fold excess (numbers above lanes) of cold competitors (C, no competitor; lane 11 shows a supershift reaction by preincubation of the extract with anti-HNF4 antiserum; all bandshift is removed indicating that the FH4 element is highly restricted to HNF4).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	108	 B, transient transfection assays conducted in HepG2 and Hep3B hepatoma cells with mFTF gene reporter constructs 4F-CAT and pF-CAT cotransfected with transcription factor expression vectors (C, control cotransfections with void vector pCI).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	109	 Results are averages  plus or minus  1 S.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	110	 from three sets of duplicate or triplicate transfections using two plasmid preparations and referred to pCI controls given an independent value of 1 for HepG2 or Hep3B transfections.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	111	 Inset, autoradiograms are CAT assays using FTF gene construct 4F-CAT transiently transfected in the four cell lines indicated (arrows, chloramphenicol-acetylated products;  < 0.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	112	mFTF gene activation by HNF4 or FTF was tested by transient transfection in Hep3B and HepG2 cells.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	113	 Cotransfection of construct 4F-CAT with an HNF4 expression vector resulted in 5-6-fold enhancement of reporter gene activity in both cell lines (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	114	 2B, lane 3); cotransfection with an FTF expression vector also resulted in significant increase of CAT activity in Hep3B cells (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	115	 2B, lane 4) but not in HepG2 cells (perhaps because HepG2 cells express abundant SF1, which binds and activates the same DNA motif as FTF) (11, 21).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	116	 Three consensus GATA-binding sites (WGATAR) were conspicuous in the proximal mFTF gene domain 80/138 (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	117	 1B), and we tested activatory effects of GATA expression vectors including the GATA6 and GATA4 variants expressed in the foregut endoderm and liver primordium (22, 23).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	118	 Cotransfection of GATA6 or GATA4 (and GATA1, GATA2, or GATA5 as well) raised 4F-CAT activity 2-3-fold in HepG2 or Hep3B cells (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	119	 2B, lane 2); coexpression of GATA6 or GATA4 with HNF4 showed additive or cooperative effects enhancing FTF promoter activity as much as 12-fold in Hep3B cells (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	120	 We also found significant activation of the 4F-CAT construct with the Nkx2.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	121	 2B, lane 5), which is consistent with the recognition of a cognate high affinity (24) Nkx2.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	122	5-binding element at 99/105 bp (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	123	 1B); coexpression of GATA4 and Nkx2.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	124	5 enhanced 4F-CAT activity only slightly more than each factor alone (not shown).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	125	 No stimulation of mFTF promoter activity was detected with expression vectors encoding SP1, HNF1, HNF3, HNF3, HNF6, or C/EBP (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	126	 2B, lanes 7-12) (no binding sequences for these factors were apparent in the mFTF promoter sequence), nor with c-Myc, USF1, or USF2 expression vectors (not shown).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	127	 Generally similar results were obtained in cotransfections using the shorter FTF gene construct pF-CAT carrying only 280 bp of 5'-flanking DNA (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	128	 2B, lanes 13-17); this suggested a direct action of the activating factors on their cognate DNA motifs clustered around the cap site.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	129	 Basal activity of pF-CAT was similar to that of 4F-CAT and provided no indication for regulatory components operating between 280 bp and 4 kb.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	130	To prove their role in mFTF promoter activity, point mutations were introduced in the HNF4, GATA, and Nkx elements in the natural 4-kb context of construct 4F-CAT; mutations were also introduced in tandem E box motifs at 66 and 58 bp.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	131	 Mutation of the HNF4 sequence (FmH4 in Table I) reduced basal mFTF promoter activity in HepG2 or Hep3B cells (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	132	 3B, lane 2), and in cotransfection assays it abolished mFTF promoter activation by HNF4 (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	133	 Mutations targeting the three GATA elements (mutant mG123) or only the proximal GATA site (mG3) also reduced basal FTF promoter activity (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	134	 3B, lanes 3 and 5), and mG3 attenuated the response to cotransfected GATA4 (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	135	 3C, lanes 2 versus 7), whereas mutation of the distal GATA sites (mG12) abolished all induction by GATA4 (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	136	 Mutation of the Nkx element also eliminated promoter activation by Nkx2.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	137	 These combined data showed that mFTF promoter activation in cotransfection assays using HNF4, GATA, and Nkx2.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	138	5 vectors resulted from a direct action of these factors on their cognate DNA-binding elements surrounding the FTF cap site.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	139	 Notably, in contrast to the proximal GATA and HNF4 mutants (mG3, mH4), the distal GATA and Nkx mutants (mG12, mNk) showed significant increase of basal promoter activity in both HepG2 and Hep3B cells (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	140	 3B, lanes 2 and 3 versus 4 and 6).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	141	 Also, when the two E box motifs were mutated (mE12), strong reduction of basal FTF promoter activity was observed (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	142	 3B, lane 9), whereas a single mutation of either the distal or the proximal E box had opposite effects on basal promoter activity (mE1 versus mE2 in Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	143	 Double mutant mE12 maintained similar relative responses to exogenous GATA4 or HNF4 (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	144	 3C, lanes 1 versus 9 and 2 versus 10), like GATA mutants to HNF4 and vice versa (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	145	 3C, lanes 1 versus 6 and 2 versus 5, and data not shown), suggesting that each factor can activate the mFTF gene promoter independently.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	146	View larger version (27K):    Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	147	   Mutational analysis of the mFTF gene promoter.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	148	 A, diagram of 4F-CAT mutations (using PCR primers shown in Table I) introduced in the GATA (G1, G2, and G3), E box (E1 and E2), Nkx, and HNF4 promoter sites (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	149	 B, mutation effects on basal mFTF promoter activity in transient transfection assays; results are averages  plus or minus  1 S.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	150	 from three sets of transfections with three plasmid preparations, referred to wild-type 4F-CAT activity given an independent value of 1 for HepG2 or Hep3B cells.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	151	 C, mutation effects on the 4F-CAT response to cotransfected expression vectors; results are averages  plus or minus  1 S.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	152	 from three transfections with two preparations of plasmids, referred to void vector pCi transfected in parallel and given an independent value of 1 for HepG2 or Hep3B cells.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	153	FTF Binds and Activates the Hnf3, Hnf4, and Hnf1 Promoters-- Among liver-enriched transcription factors, HNF3, HNF4, and HNF1 exert preponderant functions in the establishment and maintenance of the hepatic phenotype (4, 5, 25).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	154	 We observed that the promoter sequence of the Hnf3, Hnf4, and Hnf1 genes all contained putative FTF-binding sites; the proximal Hnf1 promoter had potential FTF recognition elements at 47 and 99 bp, on each side of the HNF4-binding element (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	155	 5); the Hnf3 promoter also had two proximal FTF-like sequences organized in tandem at 35 and 58 downstream from the HNF3 autoregulatory element (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	156	 20); and the Hnf4 promoter had two FTF-like sequences at 224 and 290, upstream from the HNF1 recognition element (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	157	 Electromobility shift assays confirmed that all FTF motifs identified in the Hnf1, Hnf3, and Hnf4 promoters were efficient competitors in bandshift reactions using the high affinity AFP/FTF-binding sequence as a probe (Figs.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	158	 Furthermore, in transfection assays, Hnf1, Hnf3, and Hnf4 promoter constructs were all activated by cotransfection of the FTF expression vector (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	159	 5B, lane 3) to a similar extent as by other known direct activators, i.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	160	 the Hnf1 promoter by HNF4 (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	161	 4B, lane 3), the Hnf4 promoter by HNF1 (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	162	 5B, lane 2), or the Hnf3 promoter by HNF3 (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	163	 In addition, mutation of the two FTF-binding sites in the Hnf1 or Hnf3 promoters eliminated all promoter response to exogenous FTF (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	164	 5A, lane 8) and not to HNF4 or HNF3 (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	165	 Transfection assays confirmed coactivatory effects of HNF4 and COUP on the Hnf1 promoter (27) (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	166	 4B, lanes 3 and 5) and showed cooperativity between FTF and HNF3 in activating the Hnf3 promoter (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	167	 5A, lane 4) and between FTF, HNF4, and COUP in activating the Hnf1 promoter (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	168	 Notably, the Hnf4 promoter responded strongly to GATA6 in HepG2 cells (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	169	 5B), and it contains no apparent GATA-binding sites; this may indicate activatory protein-protein interaction between GATA6 and SF1 (28).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	170	 SF1 is highly expressed in HepG2 cells (21) and presumably occupies FTF-binding sites on the Hnf4 promoter.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	171	View larger version (40K):    Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	172	   Activation of the Hnf1 promoter by FTF.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	173	 A, left, bandshift reactions conducted (like in Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	174	 2) with rat liver nuclear extract and oligonucleotides shown in Table II (H1FTF-1 and H1FTF-2 correspond to FTF sites 1 and 2 in the Hnf1 promoter).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	175	 Right, diagram of FTF site mutations introduced in Hnf1 promoter construct pH1-CAT (mutated sequences H1mF1 and/or H1mF2 are shown in Table I).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	176	 B, transfection assays in Hep3B or HepG2 cells showing the response of pH1-CAT or its FTF site mutants to coexpressed transcription factors; results are averages  plus or minus  1 S.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	177	 from three transfections using two plasmid preparations, referred to parallel transfection with void vector pCI (column C) given an independent value of 1 for HepG2 or Hep3B cells (basal activities of pH1-CAT, H1mF1, H1mF2, or H1mF12 did not vary significantly).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	178	View larger version (37K):    Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	179	   Activation of the Hnf3 and Hnf4 promoters by FTF.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	180	 A, diagram, regulatory elements of the Hnf3 promoter (26) and FTF site mutations (cf.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	181	 sequences in Table I) introduced in reporter construct pH3-CAT.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	182	 Autoradiogram, FTF binding to Hnf3 promoter sites H3FTF-1 and H3FTF-2, shown by bandshift reactions using a radiolabeled AFP/FTF probe (FTF) incubated with 3  microg of rat liver nuclear proteins and 20-fold molar excess of unlabeled oligonucleotides (sequences are given in Table II) (C, no competitor).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	183	 Histograms, transfection assays in HepG2 cells showing the effect of FTF site mutations on basal pH3-CAT activity (lanes C) and on HNF3 promoter inducibility by cotransfected FTF and/or HNF3; results are averages  plus or minus  1 S.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	184	 from four sets of transfections using two plasmid preparations referred to pH3-CAT/pCI cotransfection (lane 1) given a value of 1.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	185	 B, autoradiogram, bandshift reactions showing FTF binding to Hnf4 promoter element FTF-2 (oligo H4FTF-2 in Table II) (results were similar with oligo H4FTF-1); reactions were conducted as in A with 20-500-fold molar excess of cold competitors.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	186	 Histogram, transfection assays in HepG2 cells showing enhancement of pH4-luc activity by coexpressed FTF, HNF1, or GATA6 (no additive effects were found between these three factors); results are averages  plus or minus  1 S.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	187	 from three transfections using two plasmid preparations, referred to void vector pCI (C) given a value of 1.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	188	     DISCUSSION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	189	FTF Gene Structure and Splice Products-- This is the first molecular cloning of a mammalian FTF genomic locus.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	190	 The partial mFTF gene structure established here indicates an intron/exon organization similar to that of the Sf1 gene, which was duplicated from the same ancestral gene (14).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	191	 Like in man, the mouse Sf1 and FTF genes reside on different chromosomes (16, 29, 30).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	192	 The mouse FTF gene structure is largely conserved in zebrafish (17) but with an apparent evolutionary remodeling in the exon 2-3 domain, as discussed below.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	193	The mouse exon mapping indicates 5'-exon heterogeneity between FTF cDNAs cloned from different species.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	194	 Clones of human FTF cDNAs uniformly lack a sequence corresponding to mouse exon 2 (the hFTF cDNA clone we initially reported in Ref.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	195	 16 corresponds to human FTF cDNA variant hB1F2 in Ref.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	196	 31; we reviewed our original sequence data and found one compressed C missing at position 344 in Ref.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	197	 16, disrupting the hFTF N-terminal reading frame).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	198	 One human FTF variant (hB1F) (29) (CPF) (31) lacks both exons 2 and 3.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	199	 Rat FTF (rFTZ-F1) (32) also exists as two 5'-transcripts, one 21 amino acids shorter than the other and probably skipping exon 2.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	200	 In zebrafish, one FTF transcript (ff1-I) (17) contains a 17-amino acid exon 1 corresponding to mouse exon 1 and spliced to an exon corresponding to mouse exon 4, i.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	201	 also skipping the mouse homologue 2-3 domain.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	202	 Thus, some FTF transcripts are 5'-splicing variants that lack most of the N-terminal protein (A/B) domain flanking the FTF DNA-binding domain.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	203	 FTF splice variant 1:4 (hB1F, CPF) is more abundant than variant 1:3 (hFTF, hB1F2, CPF-1) in human liver (29), and the shorter rat FTF variant (presumably 1:3) (rFTZ-F12) is also more abundant than the longer transcript (rFTZ-F11) (32).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	204	 These observations may indicate that the FTF N-terminal (A/B) domain fulfills no particular activatory functions, which would fit transfection data showing comparable transactivations by full-length FTF cDNA versus FTF devoid of the first 3 exons (pf1 versus pf4 in Ref.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	205	FTF also exists as C-terminal splice variants; human and Xenopus "short" variants (hFTFs and xFF1rAs) diverge to noncoding sequences at the 3'-splice junction of exon 6 (16, 33).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	206	 Other FTF cloning products include human FTF clone CPF-2 (31) truncated in exon 6 to restart with exon 7, and zebrafish ff1 clones "B" which also interrupt a C-terminal exon (17).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	207	 Such transcripts devoid of the AF2 activatory domain could in principle exert dominant negative functions (11, 21, 33); however, no significant amounts of such products have been detected in vivo (17, 33).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	208	 The FTF exons 2-3 domain is further considered below.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	209	Regulation of the mFTF Gene Promoter-- This report is also the first functional characterization of an FTF gene promoter.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	210	 Many cis-acting elements pinpointed here are stringently conserved in zebrafish (17); such evolutionary conservation suggests that these elements fulfill important regulatory functions.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	211	 Given the broad phylogenetic role of GATA factors in endodermal specification (4), a triple GATA-binding domain also suggests tight connections of the GATA-FTF pathway with endodermal differentiation, which conceivably could extend to invertebrate FTF/Ftz-F1 homologues (to the best of our knowledge, FTF is the first liver-enriched transcription factor gene directly activated by GATA).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	212	In cotransfection assays, GATA and HNF4 were highly efficient partners in coactivating the mFTF promoter, consistent with abundant coexpression of GATA4, HNF4, and FTF in mammalian liver.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	213	 However, FTF is also abundant in other tissues such as the adult exocrine pancreas in which HNF4 is not significantly expressed.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	214	 Furthermore, during development FTF gene expression precedes that of HNF4 (FTF can be unambiguously detected by in situ hybridization at E7.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	215	0 in the foregut endoderm,2 which is consistent with AFP gene transcription beginning at least from E8.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	216	0 (8)), and HNF4 knockout experiments also indicate that the FTF (and AFP) genes are efficiently expressed without HNF4 at early stages of liver differentiation (25).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	217	 Therefore the FTF promoter segment analyzed here would bypass HNF4 at prehepatic endodermal stages.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	218	Point mutations selecting the downstream GATA site or its adjacent E box element resulted in lower levels of basal FTF promoter activity, indicating that in hepatoma cells the proximal FTF regulatory domain 85/61 is subject to up-regulation by GATA and basic helix-loop-helix (bHLH) factors.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	219	 bHLH proteins play important differentiation functions in diverse cell lineages and are plausible activators of the FTF gene at an early stage of development.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	220	 The tandem GATA/E box motif is also intriguingly similar to a composite element of the hematopoietic lineage, with the same orientation and spacing, and coactivated by a protein complex made of GATA1, bHLH factor Tal1, and several bridging molecules that include the LIM domain protein Lmo2 (34).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	221	 GATA1, Tal1, and Lmo2 are each required for proper development of the erythropoietic lineage, and genes activated by the composite GATA/E box motif are predicted to play critical differentiation functions in the blood cell lineage.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	222	 FTF could thus plausibly qualify as a first target gene for such a GATA/E box multiprotein activatory complex in the endodermal lineage.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	223	 Furthermore, a second FTF promoter E box element is present two nucleotides downstream from the first one and appears to down-regulate FTF promoter activity (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	224	 3B, lane 8); this strikingly reproduces a variant hematopoietic GATA/E box motif in which the second E box serves to attenuate the adjacent GATA1-Tal1 multiprotein activatory complex (35).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	225	 Differential mFTF promoter activity between tissues or developmental stages might then finely respond to changing combinations of activatory or repressor components forming the GATA/E boxes complex.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	226	 We note here that the second E box is not conserved in the zebrafish promoter (see Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	227	 1B), the usage of which is much less restricted among adult tissues (abundant FTF transcripts ff1-I are detected in ovary, testis, and muscle) (17).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	228	The more distal GATA/Nkx mFTF promoter domain between 99 and 138 bp conveys clear inductive responses to exogenous GATA and Nkx2.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	229	5 in cotransfection assays, but mutations in these elements do not reduce but rather enhance basal FTF promoter activity in hepatoma cells.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	230	 This suggests that the distal GATA/Nkx segment may be less efficiently used in hepatocytes than in other cell types or liver differentiation states.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	231	 Like bHLH factors, Nk2-related homeoproteins such as Nkx2.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	232	5 broadly serve mammalian cells to execute differentiation programs; Nkx factors are also represented in hepatic cells (36).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	233	 Notably, the combination of GATA4/Nkx2.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	234	5 factors that enhanced the mFTF promoter are well known to induce pleiotropic differentiation program in the cardiogenic lineage, and they cooperatively activate heart-specific gene promoters via tandem motifs similar to that in the distal FTF promoter (37).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	235	 Interestingly, cardiogenic pathways use GATA4/Nkx2.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	236	5 as terminal transducers of differentiation cascades triggered by cell-surface TGF--related receptors (38); similar TGF- signals operate in endodermal specification (39), and TGF- or FGF relays (3) could plausibly reach the distal FTF promoter domain and activate its preferential use in specific cells and times.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	237	An Alternative mFTF Promoter?-- FTF translational analyses in vitro and in vivo (11) have clearly established that rodent FTF exon 1 is transcribed in prenatal liver, and therefore that the promoter characterized here is used at fetal stages of development (hFTF exon1 transcripts are also present in fetal human liver) (29).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	238	 But data in lower vertebrates point to a second FTF promoter downstream from exon 1 and used preferentially at early stages of development.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	239	 FTF cloning from embryonic cDNA libraries has yielded transcripts with a translation start site corresponding either to the Met62 codon of mouse exon 3 (amphibian xFF1rA and rrFTZ-F1) (14, 40) (zebrafish ff1 variant II (17) also initiates translation at Met62) or to the Met94 codon of mouse exon 4 (frog rrFTZ-F1, chicken OR2.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	240	 Furthermore, the N-terminal exon of xFF1rA, ff1-II, and rrFTZ-F1 contains a 3'-end sequence matching mouse exon 3 segment Met62-Val89 (see Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	241	 1A) (17, 40), but its 5'-side sequence becomes unrelated to mouse exon 3 (17, 33, 40), and it spans 500 nucleotides in xFF1rAs (14, 33).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	242	 This readily suggests that FTF gene transcription starts in an intronic domain in which the exon 2-3 structure has been evolutionarily rearranged.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	243	 In addition, fish/amphibian transcripts containing exon 1 are undetectable at embryonic stages, whereas transcripts excluding exon 1 increase abundantly in early embryos and then decline (14, 17).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	244	 Thus, all indicate that at least in lower vertebrates FTF gene transcription proceeds from both the upstream promoter characterized here and from an internal "early" promoter yet to be mapped and independently regulated.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	245	 The early promoter also seems broadly activated in fish, amphibian, or avian embryonic cells (especially brain and steroidogenic tissues), whereas the upstream promoter is less promiscuous and more active in gut derivatives (14, 15, 17, 40).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	246	 We note that no SF1 transcripts have been found in fish (41); an alternate or ancestral FTF gene promoter possibly evolved in early vertebrates to better fulfill both FTF and SF1 functions in time and space.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	247	 Whether a second mFTF gene promoter may actively operate between exons 1 and 3 remains conjectural.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	248	 But FTF isoforms referred to translational variants, and fluctuating between adult liver and fetal liver or embryonic stem cells (11) might also indicate modulations in both promoter and splicing products; for instance, the four rat FTF isoforms (10) (see Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	249	 2A) interpreted as translational variants Met1, Met62, Met83, and Met87 (11) could also be accounted for by exon variants 1:2, 1:3, 1:4, and 3:4.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	250	 An alternative mFTF promoter might take charge of FTF transcription detected as early as the 2-cell stage embryo and in all cells of the E3.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	251	5 blastocyst (our unpublished results with a lacZ-marked mFTF genomic locus).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	252	Novel FTF-activated Gene Targets-- The Hnf3, Hnf4, and Hnf1 genes encode transcription factors critically involved in early liver differentiation, and the promoters of all three genes were found here to be activated by FTF.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	253	 Combined with temporal patterns of expression of these four factors (19, 25, 42, 43) and the fact that the FTF promoter, but not the Hnf3, Hnf4, and Hnf1 promoters, contain bona fide GATA-inducible sites, these results clearly suggest that FTF lies between GATA and HNF3, HNF4, and HNF1 in transcriptional cascades of liver cell differentiation.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	254	 Thus, as FTF initiates hepatic functions at the AFP promoter, it would also enhance other transcription factors engaged into liver-induction networks.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	255	 We recall here that AFP gene activity is restricted to early proliferative stages of liver development and that the FTF regulation domain in the AFP promoter is deactivated by hormonal signals that interrupt liver cell growth (9, 11, 44); this implies that the FTF function may be dependent upon or enhanced by cell growth stimuli.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	256	 Although other potential FTF liver gene targets have recently been proposed (21, 29, 31, 45, 46), it is uncertain whether all FTF effects can actually proceed in nongrowing hepatocytes since most results were obtained by cotransfection in growing cultured cells.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	257	 For one, the hepatitis B viral core promoter, strongly activated by three FTF-binding elements (21, 29), could have evolved FTF activation sites to adapt sustained hepatitis B virus replication with proliferative stages of hepatitis.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	258	 FTF action on the Hnf3, Hnf4, and Hnf1 promoters may then be exerted only transiently at early developmental growth stages and be substituted by alternative factors in mature nondividing hepatocytes; the Hnf3, Hnf4, and Hnf1 promoters all contain substitute proximal elements expected to operate efficiently under adult stage conditions.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	259	 But FTF clearly plays a role in hepatocyte bile acid synthesis pathways; FTF activates the rate-limiting Cyp7A gene promoter in adult hepatocytes (47), and FTF is a direct target for CYP7A feedback repression by FTF heterodimeric partner SHP induced by bile acid receptor FXR (48-50).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	260	 FTF could thus use alternative regulatory means to modulate differentially early developmental and late metabolic liver program.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	261	 It is interesting that the Hnf1, Hnf3, Hnf4, hepatitis B virus, and AFP promoters, but not Cyp7A, all contain a close doublet of FTF-binding sites (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	262	2 This may point to novel regulatory means for DNA-bound FTF monomers operating during cell growth; transient FTF-FTF interactions via a cell cycle-dependent FTF modification, ligand, or coregulator is an intriguing possibility.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	263	The proximal FTF site in the HNF1 promoter is particularly interesting with regard to developmental growth signaling.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	264	 That site is stringently conserved in the Xenopus Hnf1 promoter (51), which undergoes developmental enhancement (52) closely parallel to that of the Xenopus FTF gene (xFF1rA) (14).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	265	 Furthermore, the FTF site in the xHnf1 promoter lies in a 30-bp domain essential to promoter activity (deletant 238/207 in Ref.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	266	 51), and it is contained in a short 69-bp promoter segment inducible by activin A (53), also a cell surface receptor ligand of the TGF- superfamily.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	267	 The 69-bp domain carries the conserved HNF4-binding site (5, 51) which, however, is dispensable for activation of the 69-bp domain in endodermal cells (54).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	268	 It is thus very tempting to infer that the endodermal activin A response element in the xHnf1 promoter is indeed FTF (xFF1rA).
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	269	 Given the fast kinetics of xHnf1 promoter induction by activin A ( < 6 h) (53), this may then imply that TGF- and/or FGF signaling could reach both the FTF gene promoter (as discussed previously) and the FTF protein itself.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	270	In conclusion, this combined analysis of FTF promoter regulatory elements and gene targets suggests that FTF is an early intermediary in the endodermal chain of events leading to hepatic differentiation.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	271	 Our results are consistent with a simplified scheme (Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	272	 6) where GATA cooperates with bHLH or homeodomain factors to activate the FTF gene in hepatocyte precursors, and the FTF gene product in turn activates early liver functions (AFP) and other transcription factors enhancing cross-regulatory networks to set the hepatic phenotype.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	273	 FTF gene disruption in the mouse is embryonic lethal at E7.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	274	5,2 and it will be important to see if FTF-mutant ES cells contribute to the hepatocyte lineage of chimeric mice.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	275	View larger version (12K):    Fig.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	276	   FTF relationships with other genes involved in liver differentiation.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	277	 Robert Costa for collaboration and the gift of plasmids; Dr.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	278	 Stephen Duncan for useful information and materials; Dr.
0.3133714.11145965.html.plaintext.txt	279	 Frances Sladek for the pH4-luc vector; Julie Vezina and Daniel Malenfant for experimental assistance; and Denise Rioux and Marie-France Voyer for excellent secretarial support.
