0.37514272.11981036.html.plaintext.txt	422	 Nucleic Acids Res 23:1536 to 1543[Abstract].
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	0	Ubc9 and Protein Inhibitor of Activated STAT 1 Activate Chicken Ovalbumin Upstream Promoter-Transcription Factor I-mediated Human CYP11B2 Gene Transcription* Isao Kurihara, Hirotaka Shibata , Sakiko Kobayashi, Noriko Suda, Yayoi Ikeda||, Kenichi Yokota, Ayano Murai, Ikuo Saito, William E.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	1	From the Department of Internal Medicine, School of Medicine, Keio University, Tokyo 160-8582, Japan, the Health Center, Keio University, 35 Shinanomachi, Shinjuku-ku, Tokyo 160-8582, Japan, the ||Department of Fine Morphology, Yokohama City University Graduate School of Medicine, Yokohama 236-0004, Japan, and the **Division of Reproductive Endocrinology, University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center, Dallas, Texas 75390-9032.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	2	Received for publication, October 18, 2004 , and in revised form, December 14, 2004.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	3	   ABSTRACT TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Aldosterone synthase (CYP11B2) is involved in the final steps of aldosterone biosynthesis and expressed exclusively in the adrenal zona glomerulosa cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	4	 Using an electrophoretic mobility shift assay, we demonstrate that COUP-TFI binds to the  to 129/ to 114 element (Ad5) of human CYP11B2 promoter.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	5	 Transient transfection in H295R adrenal cells demonstrated that COUP-TFI enhanced CYP11B2 reporter activity.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	6	 However, the reporter construct with mutated Ad5 sequences showed reduced basal and COUP-TFI-enhanced activity, suggesting that binding of COUP-TFI to Ad5 is important for CYP11B2 transactivation.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	7	 To elucidate molecular mechanisms of COUP-TFI-mediated activity, we subsequently screened for COUP-TFI-interacting proteins from a human adrenal cDNA library using a yeast two-hybrid system and identified Ubc9 and PIAS1, which have small ubiquitin-related modifier-1 (SUMO-1) conjugase and ligase activities, respectively.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	8	 The coimmunoprecipitation assays confirmed that COUP-TFI forms a complex with Ubc9 and PIAS1 in mammalian cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	9	 Immunohistochemistry showed that Ubc9 and PIAS1 are markedly expressed in rat adrenal glomerulosa cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	10	 Coexpression of Ubc9 and PIAS1 synergistically enhanced the COUP-TFI-mediated CYP11B2 reporter activity, indicating that both proteins function as coactivators of COUP-TFI.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	11	 However, sumoylation-defective mutants, Ubc9 (C93S) and PIAS1 (C351S), continued to function as coactivators of COUP-TFI, indicating that sumoylation activity are separable from coactivator ability.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	12	 In addition, chromatin immunoprecipitation assays demonstrated that ectopically expressed COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 were recruited to an endogenous CYP11B2 promoter.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	13	 Moreover, reduction of Ubc9 or PIAS1 protein levels by small interfering RNA inhibited the CYP11B2 transactivation by COUP-TFI.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	14	 Our data support a physiological role of Ubc9 and PIAS1 as transcriptional coactivators in COUP-TFI-mediated CYP11B2 transcription.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	15	   INTRODUCTION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Aldosterone is exclusively produced in adrenal zona glomerulosa cells due to its unique expression of aldosterone synthase cytochrome P450 (CYP11B2), the enzyme required for the final steps of aldosterone biosynthesis.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	16	 In aldosterone-producing adrenal cortical adenomas of patients with primary aldosteronism, overexpression of CYP11B2 is demonstrated at the transcriptional level (1, 2).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	17	 Although the reason for aberrant expression of CYP11B2 in these adenomas is not known, mutations in the CYP11B2 gene do not appear to be the cause (3, 4).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	18	 We therefore postulated that transcription factors and/or coregulators may play important roles in CYP11B2 overexpression in the tumors.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	19	The trans-acting factors that regulate CYP11B2 expression remain poorly defined.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	20	 The orphan nuclear receptor, steroidogenic factor-1 (SF-1),1 is shown to play a crucial regulator of most steroid hydroxylase genes, including CYP17 and CYP11B1 (5, 6).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	21	 However, SF-1 actually represses rather than activates expression of hCYP11B2 (7 to 9).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	22	 In addition, other transcription factors that are expressed in the adrenal cortex include the NGFI-B family of orphan nuclear receptors, such as Nurr1, NGFI-B, and NOR-1.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	23	 The NGFI-B family receptors are highly expressed in the adrenal zona glomerulosa cells as well as in aldosterone-producing adenomas (8, 10, 11).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	24	 These three nuclear receptors are rapidly induced early response genes that enhance transcription by binding to a consensus sequence, named NBRE-1, as well as an Ad5 element of the hCYP11B2 promoter.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	25	 In addition, CREB and ATF-1 enhance transcription of the hCYP11B2 gene by binding to a CRE (9, 12, 13).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	26	 Our previous data (12) showed that human adrenocortical H295R nuclear proteins containing chicken ovalbumin upstream promoter-transcription factors (COUP-TFs) were bound to the  to 129/ to 114 sequence, designated as the Ad5 element of the hCYP11B2 promoter by electrophoretic mobility shift assays.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	27	 The COUP-TFI was originally identified as an activator of the chicken ovalbumin gene (14, 15); however, COUP-TFs mostly function as transcriptional repressor of many target genes.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	28	 COUP-TFs inhibit the transcription of other nuclear receptor such as retinoic acid receptor and thyroid hormone receptor (14).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	29	 Furthermore, COUP-TFI represses basal transcriptional activity by active repression utilizing transcriptional corepressors, such as N-CoR and SMRT (16).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	30	 We and other investigators have previously demonstrated that COUP-TFI and SF-1 regulate the bovine CYP17 expression in a mutually exclusive manner (17, 18).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	31	 We have previously reported that COUP-TFI is expressed in the normal adrenal cortex and that expression levels of COUP-TFI is inversely correlated with those of CYP17, but correlated with those of N-CoR in adrenal cortical adenomas (18 to 23).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	32	We, therefore, have screened COUP-TFI-interacting proteins from a human adrenocortical adenoma cDNA library using a yeast two-hybrid system and identified Ubc9 (24) and PIAS1, which are small ubiquitin-related modifier-1 (SUMO-1)-conjugating enzyme and SUMO-1 ligase, respectively.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	33	 The SUMO post-translationally modifies many proteins with roles in diverse processes, including regulation of transcription, chromatin structure, and DNA repair (25 to 30).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	34	 The SUMO modification has not been generally associated with increased protein degradation.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	35	 Rather, similar to non-proteolytic roles of ubiquitin, SUMO modification regulates protein localization and activity.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	36	 The SUMO E1-activating, E2-conjugating enzymes, and E3-ligase are involved in the sumoylation machinery.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	37	 In contrast to the ubiquitin system where dozens of E2 enzymes have been identified, Ubc9 is the only known SUMO-E2-conjugating enzyme.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	38	 Several SUMO-E3 ligases have been identified that promote transfer of SUMO from E2 to specific substrates.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	39	 To date, three unrelated proteins have been suggested to have SUMO-E3 ligase activity; the protein inhibitors of activated STAT1 (PIAS1) proteins (31 to 33), RanBP2 (34, 35), and polycomb group protein Pc2 (36).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	40	 The present study described that both Ubc9 and PIAS1 can function as transcriptional coactivators of COUP-TFI for the hCYP11B2 gene transcription in a sumoylation-independent manner.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	41	 These proteins are shown to form a complex in the nucleus and exhibit a very unique localization in the adrenal zona glomerulosa cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	42	 We demonstrated here that COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 are recruited to an endogenous CYP11B2 promoter, thus contributing to aldosterone biosynthesis in adrenal zona glomerulosa cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	43	   EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Plasmid Constructs Several COUP-TF constructs, such as pG-BKT7-COUP-TFI, pGBKT7-COUP-TFI-(55 to 315), pGBKT7-COUP-TFI-(86 to 183), pGBKT7-COUP-TFI-(150 to 183), pGBKT7-COUP-TFI-(315 to 423), pGBKT7-COUP-TFI-(55 to 423), pRSV-COUP-TFI, pRSV-COUP-TFI35, pDsRed-COUP-TFI, and pGBKT7-COUP-TFII were described previously (16, 24) (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	44	 Several other constructs, including pG-BKT7-Ubc9, pGADT7-Ubc9, pcDNA3.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	45	1/His-Ubc9-(1 to 58), and pAS1cyh2-TR-(168 to 456) were described previously (16, 24).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	46	 pGBT9-Ad4BP/SF-1, pGBT9-DAX-1, and p3xFLAG-CMV10-PIAS1 were generous gifts by Professor Ken-ichirou Morohashi (National Institute for Basic Biology, Japan).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	47	 pGL3-Basic-human CYP11B2 ( to 1521/+2), pGL3-Basic-human CYP11B2 mutAd5, pGL2-wtAd5, pGL2-m5Ad5, and pGL2-m7Ad5 were described previously (7, 8).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	48	 pGADT7-PIAS1-(5 to 651) was first identified as a COUP-TFI-interacting protein from human adrenocortical adenoma cDNA library.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	49	 Several PIAS1 fragments, such as PIAS1-(1 to 651), -(1 to 150), -(1 to 300), -(1 to 405), -(301 to 651), -(406 to 651), and -(5 to 73/564 to 651), were subcloned into pGADT7 vector using a PCR amplification with primers containing oligonucleotide linkers of restriction enzyme sites (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	50	 Mutagenesis of PIAS1 was performed with the QuikChange site-directed mutagenesis kit (Stratagene) and the mutant PIAS1 (C351S) was generated.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	51	 pEGFP-PIAS1 and pEGFP-PIAS1 (C351S) were generated utilizing PCR amplifications from pGADT7-PIAS1 and pGADT7-PIAS1 (C351S), respectively.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	52	View larger version (19K):    FIG.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	53	 Diagram of various deletion mutants of COUP-TFI (A) and PIAS1 (B).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	54	 A, the COUP-TFI fragments shown were cloned into the pGBKT7 expression vector as described under "Experimental Procedures.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	55	" Based on other nuclear hormone receptors as a reference, the sequence from amino acids 1 to 85, 86 to 149, 150 to 183 and 184 to 423 have been designated domains A/B, C, D and E/F, respectively.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	56	 (B) The PIAS1 fragments shown were cloned into the pGADT7, pEGFP, and pcDNA3.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	57	1/His expression vectors as described under "Experimental Procedures.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	58	" The N terminus of PIAS1 contains NR box, a coactivator motif that interacts with nuclear receptors, whereas the C terminus of PIAS1 contains two CoRNR motifs, the corepressor of which interacts with nuclear receptors.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	59	 In the middle of the PIAS1 proteins, the RING finger domain, which is necessary for SUMO-1 ligase activity, is localized.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	60	  Cloning of Ubc9 and PIAS1 by a Yeast Two-hybrid System Yeast two-hybrid screening was conducted with a MATCHMAKER Two-Hybrid System 3 kit (Clontech) and COUP-TFI (amino acids 55 to 423) as bait.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	61	 A human adrenocortical adenoma cDNA library was prepared as shown previously (24).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	62	 Yeast strain AH109 containing pGBKT7-COUP-TFI-(55 to 423) was transformed with a human adrenocortical adenoma cDNA library in pGADT7 (Clontech) and plated on synthetic complete medium lacking tryptophan, adenine, leucine, and histidine.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	63	 His+ and Ade+ colonies exhibiting -galactosidase activity by filter lift assay were further characterized according to the manufacturer's protocol (Clontech).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	64	 -Galactosidase activity was determined with chlorophenol red -D-galactopyranoside as described previously (16, 24).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	65	 To recover the library plasmids, total DNA from the yeast was isolated with a ZymoprepTM yeast plasmid Miniprep kit (Zymo Research, Orange, CA) and used to transform Escherichia coli (HB101) in the presence of ampicillin.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	66	 To ensure that the correct cDNAs were identified, the library plasmids isolated were transformed into Y187 containing pGBKT7-COUP-TFI-(55 to 423), and -galactosidase activity was determined.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	67	 The specificity of the interaction of #2 to 3 (PIAS1-(5 to 651)) and #2 to 4 (Ubc9-(1 to 158)), both part of the 20 positive clones, with COUP-TFI was determined by mating with Y187, which contains pGBKT7-lamin (Clontech).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	68	 The -galactosidase activities of these diploids were examined by the filter lift and chlorophenol red -D-galactopyranoside methods.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	69	 The sequence of the #2 to 3 and #2 to 4 clones was identical to the GenBankTM-submitted sequence of PIAS1 and Ubc9, respectively.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	70	 The yeast two-hybrid system was also used to determine protein-protein interaction between COUP-TFI/COUP-TFII/Ad4BP/DAX-1/TR and these clones.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	71	Western Blot Analysis and Coimmunoprecipitation The cells were lysed with lysis buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl (pH 8.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	72	0), 150 mM NaCl, 1% Triton X-100, 5 mM EDTA, 2 mM phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride), and Western blots were performed before the immunoprecipitation (IP) steps to confirm protein expression by corresponding antibodies as described previously (24).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	73	 The same samples for the Western blots were diluted to 1 ml in IP buffer (20 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	74	5), 150 mM NaCl, 10 mM dithiothreitol, 5 ng/ microl aprotinin, 0.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	75	5 mM phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride, 0.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	76	1% Tween 20) and precleared with protein G plus-agarose beads (Santa Cruz Biotechnology, Santa Cruz, CA), and antibodies were added for 1 h.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	77	 Immune complexes were adsorbed to protein G plus-agarose beads and washed four times in IP buffer.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	78	 Proteins were then separated on 12.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	79	5% polyacrylamide gels and transferred onto Hybond ECL nitrocellulose membranes (Amersham Biosciences).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	80	 The primary antibodies used for immunoprecipitation were rabbit polyclonal anti-COUP-TFI antibody (generous gift by Dr.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	81	 Ming-Jer Tsai) (15), and the antibodies used for the Western blots were anti-COUP-TFI, anti-Xpress (Invitrogen), anti-FLAG (Sigma), anti-Ubc9 (BD Biosciences Pharmingen), anti-PIAS1 (Santa Cruz Biotechnology), and anti--tubulin (Oncogene Research Product) antibodies.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	82	Fluorescence Imaging The images of EGFP-tagged Ubc9 and DsRed-COUP-TFI were described previously (24).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	83	 COS-1 cells were transiently transfected with expression vectors of pEGFP-PIAS1, and pDsRed-COUP-TFI.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	84	 Live cell microscopy of GFP fusion and DsRed fusion proteins was performed on a confocal microscope (Axiovert 100M, Carl Zeiss Co.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	85	 Imaging for GFP and DsRed was performed by excitation with 488 and 543 nm, respectively, from an argon laser, and the emissions were viewed through band passes ranging from 500 to 550 nm, and 550 to 600 nm, respectively, by band pass regulation with LSM510 (Carl Zeiss Co.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	86	 All images were processed as TIFF (tagged image file format) files on Photoshop 7.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	87	0 using standard image-processing techniques.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	88	Northern Blot Analysis The human tissue Northern blots (Clontech) were hybridized at 42  degrees C overnight with 32P-labeled cDNA probes of the full-length 1.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	89	1-kb glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase (Clontech) cDNAs according to the manufacturer's protocol.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	90	 The membranes were washed at a final stringency of 0.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	91	1% SDS at 50  degrees C and analyzed with a BAS 3000 image scanner (Fuji Film Co.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	92	 The mRNA levels were determined by comparison with glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase mRNA levels.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	93	Immunohistochemistry Formalin-fixed tissues were embedded in paraffin, sectioned at 6  microm, and mounted on silane-coated slides.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	94	 For immunohistochemistry, sections were dewaxed, rehydrated, followed by blocking endogenous peroxidase using 3% (v/v) hydrogen peroxidase in phosphate-buffered saline, which were then subjected to microwave antigen retrieval in 0.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	95	 Thereafter, they were washed in phosphate-buffered saline and blocked with a blocking solution containing 5% bovine serum albumin in phosphate-buffered saline for 30 min.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	96	 They were subsequently incubated overnight at 4  degrees C with primary antibodies diluted appropriately with the blocking solution.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	97	 Primary antibodies for immunohistochemistry included rabbit anti-COUP-TFI, anti-Ubc9 (BD Biosciences, Pharmingen), anti-PIAS1 (Santa Cruz Biotechnology).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	98	 After two washes in phosphate-buffered saline, immunoreactivities were detected using a Vectastatin ABC Elite kit (Vector Laboratories, CA) and a Vecta DAB substrate kit (Vector Laboratories).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	99	 As negative controls, sections were incubated with the preimmune or control serum in place of the primary antibody.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	100	Electrophoretic Mobility Shift Analysis Nuclear extracts were prepared as described previously (8, 11, 12).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	101	 For in vitro transcription/translation, 0.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	102	5  microg of pGBT9-Ad4BP/SF-1 and pFL-COUP-TFI was used in conjunction with the TNT-coupled reticulocyte lysate system (Promega), as directed by the manufacturer.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	103	 EMSA conditions were as described previously (8, 11, 12) using 5  microg of H295R nuclear extract or 0.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	104	0  microl of reticulocyte extract.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	105	 Protein-DNA complexes were separated from free probe by electrophoresis (2 h) on a 4% polyacrylamide, 2.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	106	5% glycerol gel using 1x TGE as running buffer (50 mM Tris-Cl, 38 mM glycine, 2.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	107	 For detection of supershift complex, anti-SF-1 (a generous gift of Dr.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	108	 Ken-ichirou Morohashi) and anti-COUP-TFI (a generous gift of Dr.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	109	 Ming-Jer Tsai) antibodies were used.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	110	Mammalian Cell Culture, Transient Transfections, and Luciferase Assays H295R cells, derived from human adrenocortical carcinoma cells (8, 12, 37), were used for luciferase assays.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	111	 H295R cells were routinely maintained in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium/F-12 (Invitrogen) supplemented with 2.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	112	5% NuSerum (Collaborative Bio, Bedford, NA) and 1% ITS (insulin-transferrin-selenium) culture supplement (Invitrogen).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	113	 Twenty-four hours before transfection, 1 x 105 cells per well of a 24-well dish were plated in the medium.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	114	 All transfections into H295R cells were carried out using Lipofectamine 2000 (Invitrogen) with indicated amounts of expression plasmids, according to the manufacturer's protocol.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	115	 Cells were harvested 48 h after transfection, and cell extracts were assayed for both Firefly and Renilla luciferase activities with a Dual-Luciferase Reporter Assay System (Promega).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	116	 Relative luciferase activity was determined as ratio of Firefly/Renilla luciferase activities, and data are expressed as the mean ( plus or minus S.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	117	) of triplicate values obtained from a representative experiment that was independently repeated at least three times.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	118	RNA Interference H295R cells transfection with siRNAs, and luciferase assays were performed as described previously (8, 12, 37).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	119	 H295R cells were plated into 24-well plates, grown until reaching 70 to 80% confluence, and transfected with 30 pmol of negative control sequence, Ubc9-, or PIAS1-specific siRNA duplex using Lipofectamine 2000 (Invitrogen) following the manufacturer's instructions.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	120	 Whole cell extracts were prepared as described previously as follows: siRNA Ubc9a sense, 5'-GGC CAG CCA UCA CAA UCA ATT-3'; siRNA Ubc9a antisense, 5'-UUG AUU GUG AUG GCU GGC CTC-3'; siRNA Ubc9b sense, 5'-GGA ACU UCU AAA UGA ACC ATT-3'; siRNA Ubc9b antisense, 5'-UGG UUC AUU UAG AAG UUC CTG-3'; siRNA PIAS1a sense, 5'-GGU CCA GUU AAG GUU UUG UTT-3'; siRNA PIAS1a antisense, 5'-ACA AAA CCU UAA CUG GAC CTG-3'; siRNA PIAS1b sense, 5'-GGU UAC CUU CCA CCU ACA ATT-3'; siRNA PIAS1b antisense, 5'-UUG UAG GUG GAA GGU AAC CTG-3'; and Silencer Negative Control #1 siRNA (Ambion) were used.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	121	Chromatin Immunoprecipitation ChIP assay was performed as described previously (38).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	122	 The cross-linked, sheared chromatin solution was used for immunoprecipitation with 3  microg of anti-COUP-TFI, anti-Xpress antibody, anti-FLAG antibody, or normal IgG.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	123	 The immunoprecipitated DNAs were purified by phenol-chloroform extraction, precipitated by ethanol, and amplified by PCR using primers flanking the human CYP11B2 Ad5 region ( to 335 to  to 52 from the transcription initiation site) or 3'-untranslated region (1939 to 2198 from the transcription initiation site): CYP11B2 Ad5 sense primer: 5'-CCT CTC ATC TCA CGA-3' ( to 335/ to 321) and CYP11B2 Ad5 antisense primer: 5'-AAC CTG CTC TGG AAA-3' ( to 66/ to 52); CYP11B2 control sense primer: 5'-CAT TAA GCG GGA TCC-3' (1939/1953) and CYP11B2 control antisense primer: 5'-CAA GAC CTG GTC CAT-3' (2184/2198).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	124	 DNA samples with serial dilution were amplified by PCR to determine the linear range for the amplification (data not shown).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	125	Statistics All experiments were performed in triplicate several times.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	126	 The error bars in the graphs of individual experiments correspond to the S.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	127	   RESULTS TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Identification of Ubc9 and PIAS1 as COUP-TFI-interacting Proteins by Yeast Two-hybrid System To search for proteins that might regulate the activity of the COUP-TFI, we performed a yeast two-hybrid screen with COUP-TFI encoding amino acids 55 to 423 as bait and a cDNA library prepared from a human adrenocortical adenoma as described previously (24).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	128	 In this manner, we identified a full-length clone of Ubc9 and a partial clone of PIAS1, which are SUMO E2-conjugating enzyme and E3-ligase, respectively.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	129	 This report further describes function and expression of COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 in the transcriptional regulation of the human aldosterone synthase gene (CYP11B2).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	130	We have recently shown that Ubc9 specifically interacted with COUP-TFI and mapped interaction domains that C terminus of Ubc9 encoding amino acids 59 to 158 interacted with the C terminus of COUP-TFI encoding 383 to 403 (24).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	131	 In the present study we performed yeast two-hybrid assays to demonstrate that PIAS1 interacts specifically with COUP-TFI.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	132	 Both Ubc9 and PIAS1 interacted with COUP-TFI, and the interactions were specific, as no interaction between Gal4 DBD-COUP-TFI (amino acids 55 to 423) fusion and Gal4 activation domain (Gal4 AD; empty vector) was observed (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	133	 In contrast, as a positive control, we showed strong interaction between Gal4 DBD-COUP-TFI and Gal4 AD-COUP-TFI, because COUP-TFI readily forms homodimers (data not shown).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	134	 In addition, both Ubc9 and PIAS1 did not interact with unrelated bait corresponding to lamin (data not shown).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	135	 Besides interacting with COUP-TFI, both Ubc9 and PIAS1 also interacted with COUP-TFII and SF-1, but not with DAX-1 or unliganded TR 168 to 456 (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	136	View larger version (24K):    FIG.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	137	 Interaction of Ubc9 and PIAS1 with several nuclear receptors in yeast two-hybrid assays.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	138	 A, interaction of Ubc9 and PIAS1 with several nuclear receptors (COUP-TFI, COUP-TFII, SF-1, DAX-1, and TR) in yeast.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	139	 B, interaction of various COUP-TFI fragments with PIAS1 in yeast.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	140	 C, interaction of various PIAS1 fragments with COUP-TFI in yeast.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	141	 -Galactosidase activity was assayed in liquid cultures in three separate experiments, each with triplicate samples.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	142	 Values are expressed as the average Miller units ( plus or minus S.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	143	  To identify interaction domains more precisely, various fragments of COUP-TFI and PIAS1 were cotransformed in yeast, and -galactosidase liquid assays were performed to quantitate the protein-protein interaction (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	144	 Both Gal4 DBD-COUP-TFI encoding amino acids 86 to 183 and amino acids 150 to 183 strongly interacted with the full-length PIAS1, suggesting that the DNA-binding domain and hinge regions of COUP-TFI were necessary to interact with Ubc9.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	145	 In contrast, the C-terminal fragments of PIAS1 encoding amino acids 301 to 651 and amino acids 406 to 651 strongly interacted with COUP-TFI, whereas PIAS1 fragments encoding amino acids 1 to 150, 1 to 300, 1 to 405, and 5 to 73/564 to 651 showed minimal interaction with COUP-TFI.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	146	 Although the N and C termini of PIAS1 contain nuclear receptor-interacting domains, named nuclear receptor box (NR box), and CoRNR motifs, respectively, these domains are not involved in the interaction with COUP-TFI.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	147	 Taken together with the interaction data described above, the most C-terminal fragments of PIAS1 encoding amino acids 406 to 563 interacted with DNA binding and hinge regions of COUP-TFI in yeast.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	148	Interaction and Subcellular Localization of Ubc9, PIAS1, and COUP-TFI in Mammalian Cells We previously showed that Ubc9 interacts specifically and directly with COUP-TFI (24).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	149	 The association between COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 was further investigated by coimmunoprecipitation assays (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	150	 COS-1 cells were transfected with Xpress-tagged Ubc9 (pcDNA3.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	151	1/His-Ubc9), FLAG-tagged PIAS1 (p3xFLAG-CMV-10-PIAS1), and RSV-promoter-driven COUP-TFI expression vectors (pRSV-COUP-TFI).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	152	 Polyclonal anti-COUP-TFI antibody was first used to precipitate the protein complexes containing COUP-TFI, and the presence of PIAS1 protein was detected in lysates from cells transfected with both RSV-COUP-TFI and FLAG-tagged PIAS1, but not with RSV-COUP-TFI or FLAG-tagged PIAS1 alone (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	153	 Similarly, when RSV-COUP-TFI, FLAG-PIAS1, and Xpress-Ubc9 were expressed together, these exogenously overexpressed proteins were shown to form a complex (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	154	 To determine if Ubc9, PIAS1, and COUP-TFI could interact within a cellular environment, COS-1 cells were transfected with EGFP, EGFP-tagged PIAS1, EGFP-tagged PIAS1 (C351S), DsRed, DsRed-tagged COUP-TFI alone, or in various combinations and photographed using a fluorescence microscope (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	155	 COS-1 cells transfected with EGFP alone displayed a diffuse green fluorescence (data not shown).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	156	 EGFP-tagged PIAS1 and DsRed-tagged COUP-TFI showed predominantly nuclear localization with occasional dot formation.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	157	 When cells were then cotransfected with both EGFP-tagged PIAS1 and DsRed-tagged COUP-TFI, expression of both proteins was colocalized in the nucleus and was not altered compared with the expression obtained when either was transfected alone.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	158	 In addition, expression of both EGFP-tagged PIAS1 (C351S) and DsRed-COUP-TFI was colocalized in the nucleus (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	159	 3, E to G), indicating that presence of sumoylation activity did not affect nuclear localization of COUP-TFI.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	160	View larger version (32K):    FIG.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	161	 Ubc9 and PIAS1 are associated and colocalized in the nuclei of transfected COS-1 cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	162	 A, coimmunoprecipitation assays.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	163	 COS-1 cells were transfected with pRSV-COUP-TFI, pX-press-Ubc9 (pcDNA3.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	164	1/His-Ubc9), and/or pFLAG-PIAS1 expression constructs (p3xFLAG-PIAS1), and the amount of DNA was kept constant by the addition of empty expression vectors.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	165	 Whole cell extracts were subjected to immunoprecipitation (IP) with anti-COUP-TF antibody, and immunoprecipitates were subsequently analyzed by immunoblotting (blots) with anti-COUP-TF (upper), anti-FLAG (middle), and anti-Xpress antibodies (lower).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	166	 B to G, subcellular localization of COUP-TFI and PIAS1.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	167	 EGFP-PIAS1 (B to D) or EGFP-PIAS1(C351S) (E to G) was cotransfected with DsRed-COUP-TFI in COS-1 cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	168	 These proteins are colocalized in the nuclei of the transfected COS-1 cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	169	  Tissue Distribution of mRNA of COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 by Northern Blot Analysis We next examined the expression of COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 mRNA in human endocrine tissues (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	170	 Because Ubc9 and PIAS1 were cloned from a human adrenocortical adenoma cDNA library, we confirmed that these mRNAs were expressed in normal human adrenal cortex (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	171	 Ubc9 mRNA is widely distributed in many endocrine tissues, and the expression profile of Ubc9 is similar to that of COUP-TFI as shown previously (24).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	172	 PIAS1 mRNA is also relatively highly expressed in steroidogenic tissues, such as testis, ovary, and adrenal cortex (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	173	View larger version (74K):    FIG.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	174	 Tissue distribution of COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 mRNA demonstrated by Northern blot analyses.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	175	 A human tissue Northern blot (Clontech) was probed with the 1.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	176	1-kb glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase cDNA.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	177	 Each lane contained 2  microg of poly(A)+ RNA from pancreas (Pa), adrenal medulla (Am), thyroid (Tr), adrenal cortex (Ac), testis (Te), thymus (Tm), small intestine (Sm), stomach (St)(lanes 1 to 8), spleen (Sp), thymus (Tm), prostate (Pr), testis (Te), ovary (Ov), small intestine (Si), colon (Co), and peripheral leukocytes (Le) (lanes 9 to 16).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	178	 The positions of the RNA size are indicated by the arrows.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	179	 COUP-TFI, Ubc9, PIAS1, or glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase cDNA was used to probe the same blot.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	180	  Immunohistochemistry of COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 in Rat Adrenal Glands We next examined immunohistochemistry of COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 in rat adrenal glands (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	181	 Strikingly, both Ubc9 and PIAS1 are exclusively expressed in the nuclei of zona glomerulosa cells of adult rat adrenal cortex (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	182	 5, B and C), whereas COUP-TFI is expressed in the nuclei of all three zones of adrenocortical cells (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	183	 In addition, these expression profiles are shown to be developmentally regulated.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	184	 At 2 weeks after birth, Ubc9 is expressed in all three zones of the adrenal cortex, and expression of Ubc9 gradually becomes localized in the zona glomerulosa cells as development progresses at 3 weeks after birth (data not shown).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	185	 At 8 weeks after birth, Ubc9 is specifically expressed in zona glomerulosa cells and slightly expressed in the interstitial stromal cells of zona fasciculata and reticularis (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	186	 These expression profiles of Ubc9 were not altered between male and female rat adrenal glands (data not shown).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	187	 These results indicate that both Ubc9 and PIAS1 are mainly expressed in the nuclei of adrenal glomerulosa cells, where aldosterone is exclusively synthesized.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	188	View larger version (79K):    FIG.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	189	 Immunohistochemistry for COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 in adult rat adrenal glands.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	190	 A, COUP-TFI was localized in the nuclei of most adrenal cortical cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	191	 Both Ubc9 (B) and PIAS1 (C) were colocalized in the nuclei of the rat adrenal zona glomerulosa cells at 8 weeks after birth.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	192	  COUP-TFI Binds to Ad5 Element ( to 129/ to 114) of the Human CYP11B2 Gene Promoter and Competes with SF-1 for Binding in a Mutually Exclusive Manner We have previously mapped human CYP11B2 DNA sequences required both for basal transcription and for optimal transcriptional responses to angiotensin II, K+, and cAMP to position  to 129/ to 114 (12).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	193	 To define more precisely the DNA-protein interactions occurring within this region, electrophoretic mobility shift analysis (EMSA) was performed using a synthetic 32P-labeled oligonucleotide probe encompassing this sequence and nuclear extract derived from H295R cell line (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	194	 In the presence of H295R cell nuclear extract, 4 protein-DNA complexes were formed.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	195	 Formation of complexes 1, 2, and 3 was completely inhibited in the presence of a 200-fold molar excess of non-radiolabeled probe (lane 3 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	196	 We observed displacement at lower levels of the cold probe, which was 10-fold displaced in about one-half of the radiolabeled binding (data not shown).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	197	 These data indicate that these three complexes represent specific protein-DNA interactions.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	198	 Formation of the fourth complex, migrating immediately above complex 3, was unaffected by this maneuver, suggesting that this complex arises through nonspecific DNA binding (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	199	 Complex 3 was recognized by an antibody directed against SF-1 (lane 4 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	200	 6A), whereas complexes 1 and 2 were both recognized by antibodies directed against COUP-TF (lane 5 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	201	View larger version (60K):    FIG.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	202	 Binding of COUP-TF and SF-1 to the CYP11B2 to 129/ to 114 (Ad5) cis-element.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	203	 A, electrophoretic mobility shift analysis (EMSA) was performed using H295R nuclear extract (NE, 5.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	204	0  microg) and a 32P-labeled oligonucleotide probe corresponding to human CYP11B2 to 129/ to 114.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	205	 Protein-DNA complexes (shown by arrows) were separated from free probe (shown by arrowheads) by electrophoresis on a 4% native polyacrylamide gel.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	206	 Non-radiolabeled self competitor DNA was added to a 200-fold molar excess (lane 3) to identify nonspecific protein-DNA interactions (NS).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	207	 Lanes 4 to 6 show binding activity in the presence of antisera directed against either SF-1 (S) or COUP-TF (C).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	208	 The position of the resulting supershifted complexes is indicated by a bracket.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	209	 B, EMSA was performed as described above using in vitro translated SF-1, COUP-TFI, or COUP-TFII as the source of protein.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	210	  To confirm that SF-1 and COUP-TF bind to this element, the binding activity of in vitro translated proteins was assessed.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	211	 In vitro translated SF-1 bound to the Ad5 probe, producing a complex with mobility similar to that of complex 3 (lane 1 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	212	 In the presence of either in vitro translated COUP-TFI or COUP-TFII, a complex with mobility similar to that of complex 1 was formed (lanes 3 and 6 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	213	 All three in vitro synthesized proteins were recognized by their respective antibodies (lanes 2, 4, and 5 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	214	These data suggest that complexes 1 and 3 represent binding of COUP-TF and SF-1, respectively.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	215	 The nature of the protein(s) forming complexes 2 is unknown at present.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	216	 Because formation of this complex was abolished in the presence of anti-COUP-TF antibody, but not reproduced by recombinant COUP-TFI or II, complex 2 may represent binding either of a heterodimer between COUP-TF and another unidentified protein or binding of a protein related to, but distinct from COUP-TF.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	217	COUP-TFI-mediated Human CYP11B2 Gene Transactivation Is Potentiated by Ubc9 and PIAS1 Independently of the sumoylation Activities To explore how COUP-TF regulates human CYP11B2 gene transcription, we transiently transfected exogenous COUP-TFI in H295R cells and measured the luciferase activity of the CYP11B2 reporter gene.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	218	 Overexpression of COUP-TFI activated the CYP11B2 gene transcription in a dose-dependent manner (lanes 2 to 4 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	219	 The mutation of Ad5 sequences, to which COUP-TFI binding was disrupted, abrogated basal and COUP-TFI-mediated transactivation of the gene, thus suggesting that Ad5 sequences are crucial for COUP-TFI-mediated CYP11B2 transactivation (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	220	 In addition, overexpression of COUP-TFI35, in which 35 amino acids are deleted from the C terminus, effectively removing repressor domain, did not activate this reporter activity (lanes 5 to 7 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	221	 7A), indicating that the deleted region of the COUP-TFI C terminus is indispensable for this activation of CYP11B2 gene.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	222	View larger version (15K):    FIG.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	223	 COUP-TFI functions as a transcriptional activator for the human CYP11B2 gene transcription through Ad5 element in H295R cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	224	 A, H295R cells were transiently transfected with 0.

0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	226	3  microg of CYP11B2 ( to 1521/+2)-luciferase reporter DNA for each well of the 24-well dish as indicated.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	227	 Forty-eight hours post-transfection, cells were harvested, and the extracts were assayed for luciferase activity.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	228	 B, H295R cells were transiently transfected with 0.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	229	6  microg of total DNA, including COUP-TFI (lane 2, 30 ng; lane 3, 100 ng; lane 4, 300 ng) or COUP-TFI35 cDNA (lane 5, 30 ng; lane 6, 100 ng; lane 7, 300 ng), and 0.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	230	3  microgof CYP11B2 reporter with mutated Ad5 sequences was used (mutated Ad5 ( to 129/ to 114)-luciferase) instead of the wild-type CYP11B2 reporter.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	231	 Forty-eight hours post-transfection, cells were harvested and the extracts were assayed for luciferase activity.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	232	 Assays were performed in three separate experiments, each with triplicate samples.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	233	  Furthermore, cotransfection of Ubc9 or PIAS1 with COUP-TFI transactivated COUP-TFI-mediated activation of the CYP11B2 gene transcription (lanes 5 and 8 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	234	 8A), whereas Ubc9 or PIAS1 alone did not influence the reporter gene activity (lanes 2 and 3 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	235	 Cotransfection of both Ubc9 and PIAS1 with COUP-TFI showed that their transactivating effect on the COUP-TFI-mediated CYP11B2 transcription was synergistic (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	236	 In addition, coexpression of Ubc9-(1 to 58) or PIAS1-(1 to 150), which does not contain COUP-TFI-interacting domain, had no effects on the COUP-TFI-mediated transactivation (lanes 7 and 10 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	237	 8A), indicating that interaction between COUP-TFI and Ubc9 or PIAS1 is crucial for COUP-TFI-mediated transactivation of the CYP11B2 promoter.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	238	 These findings indicate that both Ubc9 and PIAS1 can function as transcriptional coactivators of COUP-TFI for the CYP11B2 gene transcription.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	239	 Although Ubc9 and PIAS1 are enzymes that are responsible for SUMO modification, the sumoylation-defective mutants Ubc9 (C93S) or PIAS1 (C351S) continued to function as activators of COUP-TFI (lanes 6 and 9 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	240	 These findings suggest that both Ubc9 and PIAS1 function as coactivators for the COUP-TFI-mediated CYP11B2 gene transcription in a sumoylation-independent manner.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	241	View larger version (19K):    FIG.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	242	 Both Ubc9 and PIAS1 cooperatively potentiate COUP-TFI-enhanced CYP11B2 gene transcription.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	243	 A, H295R cells were transfected with 0.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	244	43  microg of total DNA, including 30 ng of empty vector (pRSV) or COUP-TFI (pRSV-COUP-TFI), 100 ng of Ubc9 or PIAS1 construct, and 0.

0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	250	 Forty-eight hours post-transfection, cells were harvested, and the extracts were assayed for luciferase activity.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	251	 Assays were performed in three separate experiments, each with triplicate samples.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	252	  Binding of Ubc9 and PIAS1 to COUP-TFI, but Not to SF-1, Are Crucial for COUP-TFI-mediated CYP11B2 Gene Transactivation The Ad5 sequence contains a direct repeat of a consensus (AGGTCA) and variant (AGGCTG) nuclear receptor half-site (DR0) on the non-coding strand.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	253	 To define the precise nucleotides required for binding of SF-1 and COUP-TFI, a series of oligonucleotides containing progressive stepwise 2-bp mutations across these putative half-sites (m1 to m9) were radiolabeled and used in EMSA (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	254	 When H295R nuclear extracts were used as the source of protein (top panel of Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	255	 9A), m1 through m4 formed specific complexes similar to those formed using the wild-type probe.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	256	 The m5 through m8 failed to form complexes 1 or 2, although complex 3 was still observed using m7 and m8 as probe.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	257	 Similar results were observed using in vitro translated proteins (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	258	 SF-1 was bound to all mutant oligonucleotides except m5 and m6, whereas COUP-TFI and COUP-TFII failed to bind to m5 through m8.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	259	 These data further support the hypothesis that complexes 1 and 3 represent binding of COUP-TF and SF-1, respectively, because the abilities of in vitro synthesized proteins and H295R nuclear extracts to bind to the various mutant oligonucleotides were identical.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	260	 Further, because only mutations within the consensus nuclear receptor half-site (AGGTCA, m5-m8) disrupt binding of COUP-TF, it is likely that this sequence represents the key site for the COUP-TF binding site.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	261	 Utilizing Ad5 luciferase reporters containing the wild-type, m5 or m7 sequences, we investigated how Ubc9 and PIAS1 affect the COUP-TFI-regulated CYP11B2 promoter activities.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	262	 In compared with the finding that Ubc9 and PIAS1 potentiated the COUP-TFI-mediated transactivation of the wild-type Ad5 promoter (lanes 4 to 7 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	263	 9B), both proteins activated neither m5 nor m7 Ad5 reporter activities (lanes 8 to 21 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	264	 These findings indicate that both Ubc9 and PIAS1 enhance the Ad5 reporter activity mediated by COUP-TFI, but not SF-1.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	265	View larger version (32K):    FIG.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	266	 Mutational analysis of COUP-TFI and SF-1 binding to the CYP11B2 Ad5 element.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	267	 A, a series of oligonucleotides containing progressive 2-bp mutations across the Ad5 sequence (m1 to m9) was radiolabeled and used in EMSA.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	268	 The positions of the mutations relative to the wild-type sequence (wt) are indicated at the top of the figure.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	269	 EMSA was performed using H295R nuclear extract (top panel) or in vitro synthesized SF-1, COUP-TFI, or COUP-TFII (lower panels).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	270	 The positions of the specific DNA-protein complexes are indicated by arrows.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	271	 The boxed sequence at the top of the figure indicates the core recognition motif.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	272	 Neither COUP-TFI nor SF-1 can bind to the m5 Ad5 sequence, whereas SF-1, but not COUP-TFI, can bind to the m7 Ad5 sequence.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	273	 B, effects of introduction of two kinds of mutations of the CYP11B2 Ad5 element on the COUP-TFI-mediated transcription.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	274	 H295R cells were transiently transfected with 0.

0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	276	3  microg of each reporter DNA (wtAd5, mtAd5, or m7Ad5).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	277	 Forty-eight hours post-transfection, cells were harvested, and the extracts were assayed for luciferase activity.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	278	 Assays were performed in three separate experiments, each with triplicate samples.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	279	  Endogenous Ubc9 and PIAS1 Are Required for the CYP11B2 Transcriptional Activation by COUP-TFI If Ubc9 and PIAS1 are coactivators of COUP-TFI, reducing the endogenous level of Ubc9 or PIAS1 should decrease the transcriptional activity by COUP-TFI in transient transfection assays.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	280	 7 and 8), overexpression of COUP-TFI activated human CYP11B2 reporter activities by 6-fold (lane 3 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	281	 Cotransfection of siRNA of two sets of Ubc9 (Ubc9a (lane 5) and Ubc9b (lane 6) in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	282	 10A) or two sets of PIAS1 (PIAS1a (lane 7) and PIAS1b (lane 8) in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	283	 10A), but not negative control (lane 4 in Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	284	 10A), effectively reduced the endogenous levels of Ubc9 or PIAS1 proteins but had no effect on the -tubulin protein level seen in Western blot (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	285	 Reduction of endogenous Ubc9 or PIAS1 protein level decreased the COUP-TFI-mediated transactivation by 30 to 50%.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	286	 These findings indicate that endogenous Ubc9 and PIAS1 normally function as transcriptional coactivators for the COUP-TFI-mediated transactivation.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	287	View larger version (24K):    FIG.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	288	 Endogenous Ubc9 and PIAS1 are required for COUP-TFI-mediated CYP11B2 transactivation.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	289	 A, knockdown of the Ubc9 or PIAS1 protein reduces the COUP-TFI-mediated transcription of human CYP11B2 reporter.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	290	 H295R cells in 24-well dishes were transiently transfected using Lipofectamine 2000 with 0.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	291	33  microg of total DNA, including 30 ng of COUP-TFI and 0.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	292	3  microgof CYP11B2 reporter DNA, and 30 pmol of either Ubc9a, Ubc9b, PIAS1a, PIAS1b or negative control (N.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	293	 72 h after transfection, cells were harvested, and luciferase reporter assays were performed according to the manufacturer's instructions.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	294	 B, Western blot analysis of endogenous Ubc9 or PIAS1 protein level that was efficiently reduced by transfection of either Ubc9 (Ubc9a or Ubc9b)- or PIAS1 (PIAS1a or PIAS1b)-specific siRNA duplex.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	295	  COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 Are Specifically Recruited to the Ad5 Element of Human CYP11B2 Gene Promoter As mentioned above, COUP-TFI-Ubc9-PIAS1 complex activated the human CYP11B2 gene transcription.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	296	 Chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP) assays were used to test whether Ubc9 and PIAS1 are recruited to the endogenous CYP11B2 gene promoter in H295R cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	297	 The cross-linked, sheared chromatin preparations were subjected to immunoprecipitation with various antibodies, and the precipitated DNA was analyzed by PCR amplification of the Ad5 element of the CYP11B2 promoter.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	298	 We have confirmed the size of the sonicated DNA is 300 to 600 bp and these bands looked uniform (data not shown).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	299	 When COUP-TFI, Xpress-Ubc9, and FLAG-PIAS1 were aberrantly overexpressed in H295R cells, antibodies against COUP-TFI, Xpress, or FLAG efficiently immunoprecipitated the Ad5 element of the CYP11B2 promoter.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	300	 Normal IgG and no antibody failed to precipitate the CYP11B2 promoter (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	301	 In contrast to the Ad5 element of the CYP11B2 promoter, the 3'-untranslated control region of the CYP11B2 gene was not detected in association with COUP-TFI, Ubc9, or PIAS1 (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	302	 Thus Ubc9, PIAS1, and COUP-TFI were recruited to a native COUP-TFI-regulated CYP11B2 promoter, demonstrating a functional interaction between COUP-TFI and Ubc9-PIAS1 occurring in an in vivo setting.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	303	 The results from ChIP and RNA interference experiments strongly support a physiological role of Ubc9 and PIAS1 in COUP-TFI-dependent transcription of the human CYP11B2 gene.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	304	View larger version (63K):    FIG.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	305	 COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 are recruited to the native CYP11B2 promoter containing the Ad5 element in H295R cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	306	 For ChIP assays, when COUP-TFI, Xpress-Ubc9, and FLAG-PIAS1 were aberrantly overexpressed in H295R cells, sheared chromatin was immunoprecipitated with anti-COUP-TFI, anti-Xpress, anti-FLAG, or normal IgG.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	307	 The coprecipitated DNA was amplified by PCR, using primers to amplify the CYP11B2 promoter containing the Ad5 element or the 3'-untranslated control region.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	308	 COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 interact with the  to 335/ to 52 DNA segment containing Ad5 element, but not with the 1939/2198 region of the hCYP11B2 3'-untranslated region (Control) in H295R cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	309	 Both mock immunoprecipitation (lane 1, No Ab) and immunoprecipitation with normal IgG (lane 2) served as negative controls.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	310	     DISCUSSION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   In this report, we have identified and described Ubc9 and PIAS1, which interact with the COUP-TFI and can function as coactivators for the COUP-TFI-mediated transcription of the human CYP11B2 gene.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	311	 We detected that COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 form a complex in the nuclei of mammalian cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	312	 Expression of Ubc9 and PIAS1 was markedly detected in rat adrenal zona glomerulosa cells, in which CYP11B2 is exclusively expressed.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	313	 Transient transfection assays together with small interfering RNA and ChIP assays indicated a physiological role of Ubc9 and PIAS1 in COUP-TFI-dependent transactivation of the human CYP11B2 gene in normal adrenal glomerulosa cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	314	 Both Ubc9 and PIAS1 have SUMO-1-conjugating enzyme (E2) and SUMO-1 ligase (E3) activity, respectively (25 to 30).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	315	 The C93S substitution of Ubc9 and the C351S substitution of PIAS1, which abrogate sumoylation activity, continued to interact with COUP-TFI and to potentiate transcriptional activation mediated by COUP-TFI, indicating that their sumoylation enzyme activities are not required for function as coactivators of COUP-TFI.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	316	Ubc9 and PIAS1 Function as Transcriptional Coactivators of COUP-TFI in CYP11B2 Transcription Both Ubc9 and PIAS1 meet all the criteria for transcriptional coactivator proteins in the modulation of COUP-TFI transcriptional properties.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	317	 2 and 3, Ubc9 and PIAS1 specifically interacted with COUP-TFI in yeast and mammalian cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	318	 The Ubc9 was previously shown to interact with the C-terminal putative ligand-binding domain of COUP-TFI-(388 to 403) that is described as a transcriptional repressor domain (24).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	319	 The present study showed that PIAS1 interacted with the DNA-binding domain and hinge region of COUP-TFI-(86 to 183).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	320	 Coimmunoprecipitation and subcellular localization experiments showed that Ubc9 and PIAS1 are colocalized with COUP-TFI in transfected COS-1 cells (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	321	 These findings suggest that Ubc9 and PIAS1 specifically interact with COUP-TFI and form a complex in mammalian cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	322	 Second, overexpression of Ubc9 or PIAS1 had no effect on the reporter activities in the absence of transfected COU-TFI (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	323	 However, Ubc9 or PIAS1 potentiated the transactivation mediated by COUP-TFI.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	324	 Subsequently, coexpression of the Ubc9 or PIAS1 deletion mutant, Ubc9-(1 to 58) or PIAS1-(1 to 150), which impairs COUP-TFI binding, did not affect the transactivation mediated by COUP-TFI, indicating that interaction of COUP-TFI with Ubc9 or PIAS1 is required for COUP-TFI-mediated transactivation.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	325	 In addition, coexpression of Ubc9 and PIAS1 synergistically enhanced the COUP-TFI-mediated transactivation.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	326	 Third, reduction of endogenous Ubc9 or PIAS1 by small interfering RNA decreased COUP-TFI-mediated transactivation of the human CYP11B2 promoter activity, indicating that endogenous Ubc9 and PIAS1 normally contributes to COUP-TFI-mediated transactivation.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	327	 Fourth, ChIP assays clearly showed that COUP-TFI, Ubc9, and PIAS1 were recruited to a native COUP-TFI-regulated CYP11B2 promoter, demonstrating a functional coupling between COUP-TFI and Ubc9-PIAS1 in vivo.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	328	 Therefore, Ubc9 and PIAS1 possess all the characteristics expected for transcriptional coactivator proteins of COUP-TF in vivo.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	329	To confirm further that Ubc9 and PIAS1 are coactivators of COUP-TFI, we ruled out several other possible ways in which these proteins might enhance COUP-TFI-mediated transactivation.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	330	 First, as SUMO-1 conjugation plays an important role in protein modification, the effects of Ubc9 and PIAS1 on COUP-TFI transactivation might be the result of effects of Ubc9 and PIAS1 on COUP-TFI protein concentrations.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	331	 Our preliminary experiments showed that overexpression of Ubc9 or PIAS1 did not alter COUP-TFI protein concentration in H295R cells (data not shown).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	332	 Second, it was also possible that overexpression of Ubc9 or PIAS1 increases the concentrations of some coactivators or decreases the concentrations of some corepressors, which have been shown to interact with COUP-TFI, but the results showed that overexpression of these proteins did not alter the protein concentrations of SRC-1, GRIP-1, or SMRT in the cells (data not shown).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	333	 Because these experiments were performed by transient transfection, we are not able to conclude unequivocally that Ubc9 and PIAS1 have no effects on these coregulator concentrations, and further investigation is required.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	334	 Third, another possibility is that overexpression of Ubc9 or PIAS1 increased the DNA-binding affinity of COUP-TFI.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	335	 To exclude the possibility, we performed electrophoretic mobility shift assays to determine whether bacterially or in vitro transcription-translated Ubc9 or PIAS1 proteins affect the binding of COUP-TFI to its response element DNA (Ad5) of the human CYP11B2 promoter region.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	336	 The results showed that Ubc9 or PIAS1 have no effects on COUP-TFI binding to the Ad5 element (data not shown).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	337	 Fourth, it has been proposed that SUMO-1 conjugation targets proteins to different cellular localizations.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	338	 SF-1 can be directed into nuclear speckles and sequestered from the nucleolus in the presence of SUMO-1, thus resulting in transcriptional repression (39).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	339	 It is therefore possible that coexpression of Ubc9 and PIAS1 alters subcellular localization of COUP-TFI.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	340	 However, based on the subcellular localization data (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	341	 3), localization of COUP-TFI continues to be in the nucleus without re-localization.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	342	 Taken together with the above-mentioned findings, Ubc9 and PIAS1 clearly function as novel coactivators of COUP-TFI in vivo.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	343	 However, detailed molecular mechanisms are largely unknown and further investigation is required.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	344	Role of Ubc9 and PIAS1 in Sumoylation SUMO-1 conjugation (sumoylation) has been reported to play an important role in many cellular processes (25 to 30).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	345	 Sumoylation resembles ubiquitination, but the enzymes involved in these three processes are distinct.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	346	 SUMO-1 is conjugated to target proteins at the consensus sequence KXE ( is any hydrophobic amino acid, and X is any amino acid).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	347	 COUP-TFI has no such SUMO consensus sequence; however, several proteins, such as Mdm2 and CREB, are also modified at sites other than KXE (26).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	348	 Further investigation is required to elucidate whether COUP-TFI is sumoylated in vivo.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	349	Our data showed that both wild type and sumoylation-defective mutants Ubc9 (C93S) and PIAS1 (C351S) similarly enhanced COUP-TFI-regulated CYP11B2 promoter activities, indicating that these proteins possess dual distinct functions, SUMO-dependent and SUMO-independent pathways, such as coactivator function.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	350	 However, it is possible that ectopically produced Ubc9 and PIAS1 regulate COUP-TFI-mediated transactivation through not only sumoylation of COUP-TFI but also conjugation of SUMO-1 to one or more other cellular factors involved in transcriptional regulation.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	351	 Recent data have raised the intriguing possibility that SUMO modification may have a specific impact on the ability of some transcription factors to function synergistically (27, 40, 41).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	352	 Previous studies of the glucocorticoid receptor (GR) had identified a region referred to as a synergy control motif, mutation of which led to a selective increase in the activity of the GR from promoters bearing multiple, but not single sites.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	353	 The synergy control motif contains a consensus SUMO acceptor site, and recent data have shown that this is, in fact, the major site of addition of SUMO in the GR.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	354	 Considerable numbers of transcription factors, including GR (41 to 44), androgen receptor (32, 33, 45 to 51), progesterone receptor (47, 52), mineralocorticoid receptor (53, 54), peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor (55), and steroidogenic factor-1 (SF-1) (39, 56), are modulated by SUMO-1 attachment, and SUMO-modified transcription factors mostly resulted in attenuation of transcription.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	355	 Recent studies demonstrated that one of the molecular mechanisms of sumoylation-mediated repression is protein modified by SUMO-1 recruited histone deacetylases and transcriptional corepressors, thus repressing transcription (29, 38, 57 to 59).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	356	 However, there are also opposite examples of SUMO-modified proteins, which lead to transcriptional activation rather than repression.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	357	 Transcriptional coactivators, such as SRC-1 and GRIP1, are shown to be modified by SUMO-1, thus resulting in enhanced transcriptional coactivator capacities (60, 61).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	358	 Therefore, sumoylation does not necessarily induce transcriptional repression depending on the substrates.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	359	 The molecular mechanisms that could explain how SUMO modification affects transcriptional regulation are largely unknown.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	360	COUP-TFI-Ubc9-PIAS1 Complexes Are Crucial for Aldosterone Synthesis We have identified three important cis-elements in the hCYP11B2 promoter: a CRE at  to 71/ to 64, a cis-element termed Ad5 at  to 129/ to 114, and a third cis-element termed NBRE-1 ( to 766/ to 759) (8, 9, 12).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	361	 The CRE is common to both hCYP11B1 and hCYP11B2 and is regulated by both protein kinase A- and calmodulin-dependent kinase-dependent mechanisms.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	362	 Neither the Ad5 nor NBRE-1 cis-elements found in the 5'-flanking sequence of hCYP11B2 are present in hCYP11B1 (8, 9, 12).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	363	 The present results confirmed Ad5 element is crucial for CYP11B2 transactivation, because deletion of the element dramatically reduces basal and COUP-TFI-mediated transactivation (Fig.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	364	 Based on the present and previous reports (8, 9, 12), COUP-TFI and/or Nurr1/NGFI-B play important roles in transactivation of human CYP11B2 gene through binding to the Ad5 element.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	365	 The physiological importance of these particular transcription factors should be investigated in vivo.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	366	 Our preliminary data demonstrated that levels of expression of Ubc9 and PIAS1 are not altered in aldosterone-producing adenomas of patients with primary aldosteronism compared with those in normal adrenals.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	367	2 However, the significance of Ubc9 and PIAS1 in aldosterone-producing adenomas remains to be further investigated.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	368	We have recently shown that the effects of K+ and angiotensin II (Ang II) on hCYP11B2 transcription occur through two pathways; increased expression of Nurr1/NGFI-B and phosphorylation of ATF-1/CREB (13).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	369	 Ang II treatment rapidly induces levels of mRNA and protein of Nurr1/NGFI-B, thereby transactivating hCYP11B2 gene (8, 9).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	370	 Both Nurr1 and NGFI-B markedly increased transcription of hCYP11B2 through binding to the NBRE-1 and Ad5 sites, which are unique to hCYP11B2.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	371	 (62) have very recently reported that COUP-TF is a negative regulator of steroidogenesis in bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	372	 They also showed that Ang II treatment dramatically decreased levels of COUP-TF in the cells, thus activating StAR gene expression.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	373	 Based on these findings, it is tempting to speculate that levels of expression of COUP-TFI, Ubc9, or PIAS1 are regulated by Ang II treatment.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	374	 We therefore investigated these possibilities in H295R cells; however, Ang II treatment did not affect expression levels of COUP-TFI, Ubc9, or PIAS1 in real-time reverse transcription-PCR and Western blot analysis (data not shown).
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	375	 The reason why Ang II treatment showed different effects on COUP-TFI levels between other report and ours is not known; however, different cellular context, such as bovine adrenal zona glomerulosa cells and human H295R cells, may be one reason for that.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	376	 We do not know a physiological role of COUP-TFI and Ubc9-PIAS1 in Ang II and K+ regulation of hCYP11B2 expression in this study, and this should be investigated.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	377	In conclusion, we identified novel COUP-TFI-interacting proteins, Ubc9 and PIAS1, and these proteins function as coactivators of COUP-TFI for human CYP11B2 transactivation.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	378	 The unique localization profiles of these proteins in adrenal zona glomerulosa cells are consistent with a crucial physiological role in aldosterone biosynthesis.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	379	 Therefore, the COUP-TFI-Ubc9-PIAS1 complexes shed new light in controlling the long term capacity of the adrenal gland to produce aldosterone.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	380	 In addition, these studies provide new mechanisms through which COUP-TFI can act as a transcriptional activator through the novel interaction with Ubc9 and PIAS1.
0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	381	   FOOTNOTES   * This work was supported by a Grant-in-Aid for Scientific Research (C) from the Japan Society for the Promotion of Science (No.

0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	383	), and by Grant DK043140 from the National Institutes of Health (to W.

0.33547345.15611122.html.plaintext.txt	389	1 The abbreviations used are: SF-1, steroidogenic factor-1; STAT, signal transducers and activators of transcription; PIAS1, protein inhibitors of activated STAT 1; COUP-TFI, chicken ovalbumin upstream promoter-transcription factor I; SUMO, small ubiquitin-related modifier; NBRE, NGFIB response element; CREB, cAMP response element-binding protein; EMSA, electrophoretic mobility shift assay; siRNA, small interfering RNA; ChIP, chromatin immunoprecipitation; E1, ubiquitin-activating enzyme; E2, SUMO carrier protein; E3, SUMO-protein isopeptide ligase; CMV, cytomegalovirus; IP, immunoprecipitation; GFP, green fluorescent protein; EGFP, enhanced GFP; RSV, Rous sarcoma virus; GR, glucocorticoid receptor; Ang II, angiotensin II; DsRed, Discosoma sp.
