0.2717503.15890675.html.plaintext.txt	336	 Genes Dev 15:3059 to 3087[Free Full Text] Krishnan V, Pereira FA, Qiu Y, Chen CH, Beachy PA, Tsai SY, Tsai MJ 1997 Mediation of sonic hedgehog-induced expression of COUP-TFII by a protein phosphatase.
0.2717503.15890675.html.plaintext.txt	337	 Science 278:1947 to 1950[Abstract/Free Full Text] Byrd N, Becker S, Maye P, Narasimhaiah R, St-Jacques B, Zhang X, McMahon J, McMahon A, Grabel L 2002 Hedgehog is required for murine yolk sac angiogenesis.
0.2717503.15890675.html.plaintext.txt	338	 Development 129:361 to 372[Medline] Oksjoki S, Sallinen S, Vuorio E, Anttila L 1999 Cyclic expression of mRNA transcripts for connective tissue components in the mouse ovary.
0.2717503.15890675.html.plaintext.txt	339	 Mol Hum Reprod 5:803 to 808[Abstract/Free Full Text] Navab R, Wang Y, Chow YH, Wang A, Jankov RP, Takamoto N, Tsai SY, Tsai MJ, Tanswell AK, Hu J 2002 Regulation of human Clara cell 10 kD protein expression by chicken ovalbumin upstream promoter transcription factors (COUP-TFs).
0.2717503.15890675.html.plaintext.txt	340	 Am J Respir Cell Mol Biol 27:273 to 825[Abstract/Free Full Text].
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	0	Mechanism of rifampicin and pregnane X receptor inhibition of human cholesterol 7-hydroxylase gene transcription Tiangang Li and John Y.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	1	Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Pathology, Northeastern Ohio University College of Medicine, Rootstown, Ohio.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	2	Submitted 14 June 2004 ; accepted in final form 25 August 2004.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	3	   ABSTRACT TOP ABSTRACT MATERIALS AND METHODS RESULTS DISCUSSION GRANTS REFERENCES   Bile acids, steroids, and drugs activate steroid and xenobiotic receptor pregnane X receptor (PXR; NR1I2), which induces human cytochrome P4503A4 (CYP3A4) in drug metabolism and cholesterol 7-hydroxylase (CYP7A1) in bile acid synthesis in the liver.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	4	 Rifampicin, a human PXR agonist, inhibits bile acid synthesis and has been used to treat cholestatic diseases.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	5	 The objective of this study is to elucidate the mechanism by which PXR inhibits CYP7A1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	6	 The mRNA expression levels of CYP7A1 and several nuclear receptors known to regulate the CYP7A1 gene were assayed in human primary hepatocytes by quantitative real-time PCR (Q-PCR).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	7	 Rifampicin reduced CYP7A1 and small heterodimer partner (SHP; NR02B) mRNA expression suggesting that SHP was not involved in PXR inhibition of CYP7A1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	8	 Rifampicin inhibited CYP7A1 reporter activity and a PXR binding site was localized to the bile acid response element-I.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	9	 Mammalian two-hybrid assays revealed that PXR interacted with hepatic nuclear factor 4 (HNF4, NR2A1) and rifampicin was required.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	10	 Coimmunoprecipitation assay confirmed PXR interaction with HNF4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	11	 PXR also interacted with peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor coactivator (PGC-1), which interacted with HNF4 and induced CYP7A1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	12	 Rifampicin enhanced PXR interaction with HNF4 and reduced PGC-1 interaction with HNF4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	13	 Chromatin immunoprecipitation assay showed that PXR, HNF4, and PGC-1 bound to CYP7A1 chromatin, and rifampicin dissociated PGC-1 from chromatin.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	14	 These results suggest that activation of PXR by rifampicin promotes PXR interaction with HNF4 and blocks PGC-1 activation with HNF4 and results in inhibition of CYP7A1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	15	 Rifampicin inhibition of bile acid synthesis may be a protective mechanism against drug and bile acid-induced cholestasis.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	16	bile acid synthesis; gene regulation; nuclear receptors; peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor coactivator.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	17	BILE ACID FEEDBACK INHIBITS bile acid synthesis by inhibiting the transcription of cholesterol 7-hydroxylase (CYP3A4), the rate-limiting enzyme in the bile acid biosynthetic pathway.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	18	 This tightly regulated feedback mechanism is necessary because bile acids are highly toxic and cholesterol is needed for maintaining cellular structure and function.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	19	 Recent studies (4) have revealed that bile acid feedback has far-reaching impacts on liver metabolism; it not only regulates bile acid synthesis in the digestive system but also regulates cholesterol, lipoprotein, triglyceride, and glucose metabolisms.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	20	 The discovery that lithocholic acid (LCA) is an endogenous ligand for pregnane X receptor (PXR) suggests that bile acids may also regulate drug metabolism in the liver and intestine by induction of CYP450 enzymes (27, 34).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	21	 PXR and its human ortholog steroid and xenobiotic receptor (SXR) induce the CYP3A, CYP2B, and CYP2C families of steroid- and drug-metabolizing enzymes in the liver and intestine (17).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	22	 Despite the high-sequence identity in the ligand-binding domain between human and mouse PXR, they are very different in ligand selectivity.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	23	 Pregnenolone-16-carbonitrile (PCN) and dexamethasone are strong agonists for mouse PXR but weaker agonists for human PXR.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	24	 In contrast, rifampicin, an antibiotic that has been used to treat intrahepatic cholestasis, activates human PXR, but not mouse PXR (18).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	25	 Previous studies (6, 20) from this laboratory show that PCN and dexamethasone strongly reduced CYP7A1 activity, mRNA, and protein expression levels in rat livers.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	26	 This finding was recently confirmed by reports that PCN inhibited Cyp7a1 mRNA levels in mouse liver but had no effect on Cyp7a1 mRNA expression in Pxr knockout mice (27).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	27	 These results suggest that PXR may mediate LCA and PCN inhibition of mouse Cyp7a1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	28	 It was proposed that activation of PXR by drugs and bile acids might protect the liver against drug and bile acid-induced cholestasis (27, 34).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	29	Our previous studies identified two bile acid response elements (BAREs): BARE-I and BARE-II.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	30	 These two BAREs are essential for basal transcriptional activity and also for conferring bile acid feedback inhibition (reviewed in Ref.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	31	 They contain several AGGTCA-like repeating sequences, which are potential binding sites for nuclear receptors.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	32	 A direct repeat spaced by four bases (DR4) in the rat BARE-I is a binding site for an orphan receptor, chicken ovalbumin upstream transcription factor-II (COUP-TFII; NR2F2) and also for liver orphan receptor (LXR; NR1H3).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	33	 However, COUP-TFII and LXR do not bind to the human BARE-I due to the lack of a DR4 motif (5).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	34	 The factor that binds to the human BARE-I has not been identified.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	35	 The BARE-II contains an 18-bp sequence that is completely conserved in rats and humans.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	36	 Hepatic nuclear factor (HNF)4 binds to a DR1, and human -fetoprotein transcription factor (FTF; NR5A2) or mouse liver-related homolog (LRH) binds to an overlapping half-site sequence in the BARE-II.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	37	 HNF4 is the only nuclear receptor that is able to stimulate the human CYP7A1 gene; all other factors tested (FTF, COUP-TFII, LXR) inhibited the human CYP7A1 gene (2, 5, 29).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	38	Bile acids are known to activate nuclear receptor farnesoid X receptor (FXR; NR1H4), which binds to the inverted repeat (IR1) sequences and induces several genes involved in lipid metabolism (reviewed in Ref.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	39	 However, FXR inhibits the CYP7A1 gene by inducing a negative receptor, small heterodimer partnet (SHP), which interacts with FTF and inhibits its transactivation of the CYP7A1 gene (3).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	40	 The FXR/SHP/FTF mechanism is consistent with lacking inhibition of Cyp7a1 and induction of Shp mRNA expression in Fxr null mice fed with bile acids (26).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	41	 However, bile acid feeding still inhibits Cyp7a1 expression in Shp null mice (15, 33), suggesting that mechanisms alternative to the FXR/SHP/FTF pathway must exist for bile acids to inhibit Cyp7a1 mRNA expression in Shp null mice (33).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	42	 The alternative mechanisms include the cytokine/MAPK/JNK pathway, protein kinase C/cJun pathway, FXR/FGF19/FGFR4 pathway, and the PXR-mediated pathway (4).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	43	Rifampicin has been used to treat pruritus of intrahepatic cholestasis and primary biliary cirrhosis (1, 12).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	44	 Rifampicin induces 6-hydroxylation of bile acids by CYP3A4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	45	 The objective of this research is to study how PXR inhibit CYP7A1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	46	 First, we applied quantitative real-time PCR (Q-PCR) to assay the mRNA expression of CYP7A1 and several nuclear receptors that are known to regulate CYP7A1 expression in human primary hepatocytes and established a model for studying the human CYP7A1 gene regulation.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	47	 We used reporter assays, mutagenesis, Q-PCR, and EMSAs to identify a PXR response element in the human CYP7A1 gene.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	48	 Mammalian two-hybrid assay and coimmunoprecipitation (co-IP) assay were used to study PXR interaction with HNF4 or peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor coactivator (PGC-1).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	49	 Chromatin immunoprecipitation assay (ChIP) was used to verify HNF4 and PXR binding to the native CYP7A1 chromatin.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	50	 Results revealed a novel mechanism for PXR, HNF4, and PGC-1 regulation of CYP7A1 gene transcription in bile acid- and drug-induced cholestasis.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	51	   MATERIALS AND METHODS TOP ABSTRACT MATERIALS AND METHODS RESULTS DISCUSSION GRANTS REFERENCES   Cell culture.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	52	 The human hepatoblastoma cells (HepG2, HB8065) were obtained from the American Type Culture Collection (Manassas, VA).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	53	 The cells were grown in a 1:1 mixture of Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium and F-12 (50:50; Life Technologies) supplemented with 100 U/ml penicillin G/streptomycin sulfate (Celox, Hopkins, MN) and 10% (vol/vol) heat-inactivated fetal calf serum (Irvine Scientific, Santa Ana, CA).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	54	 Primary human hepatocytes were isolated from human donors (HH1088, 2 yr female; HH1089, 52 yr male; HH1115, 22 yr male; HH1117, 68 yr female; HH1118, 73 yr female; HH1119, 29 yr female; HH1122, 46-yr-old female; HH1148, 60-yr-old male) and were obtained through the Liver Tissue Procurement and Distribution System of National Institutes of Health (S.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	55	 Strom, University of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, PA).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	56	 Cells were maintained in Hank s modified medium (HMM) modified Williams E medium (Clonetics) supplemented with 10 to 7 M of insulin and dexamethasone and used within 24 h after receiving.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	57	Reporter and receptor expression plasmids.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	58	 Human CYP7A1/luciferase (Luc) reporter constructs ph-1887/Luc, ph-298/Luc, and ph-150/Luc were constructed as described previously (32).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	59	 Expression plasmid for steroid receptor coactivator (SRC)-1 (PCR3.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	60	 Tsai (Baylor College of Medicine, Houston, TX).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	61	 Expression plasmid for human PGC-1 (pcDNA3/HA-PGC-1) was obtained from A.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	62	 Kralli (The Scripp Research Institute, La Jolla, CA).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	63	 Expression plasmid for human FTF (pCDM8-hFTF) was obtained from D.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	64	 Moore (Baylor College), expression plasmids for retinoid X receptor (RXR; pcDNA3-hRXR), HNF4 (pCMX-rHNF4), and human PXR (pSG5-hPXR) (19) were provided by R.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	65	 Evans (Scripps Research Institute), W.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	66	 Chin (Eli Lily Research Laboratories, Indianapolis, ID), and S.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	67	 Kliewer (University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center, Dallas, TX), respectively.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	68	For mammalian two-hybrid assays, the reporter used was 5xUAS-TK-Luc, which contains five copies of the upstream activating sequence (UAS) fused upstream of a thymidine kinase minimum promoter (TK) and the luciferase reporter gene (30).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	69	 Two-hybrid constructs contained ligand-binding domain (LBD) of nuclear receptors or nuclear receptor-interacting domain (RID) of coactivators fused to Gal4-DNA binding domain (DBD) or VP16-activation domain (AD) vector.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	70	 Mammalian two-hybrid fusion plasmids used were as follows: pCMX-VP16-rHNF4 [D + E regions, amino acids (AA) 125 to 364] from D.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	71	 Moore (Baylor College of Medicine); pCMX-VP16-hCPF (D + E regions) from B.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	72	 Shen (Tularik, South San Francisco, CA); Gal4-PXR-LBD (AA 107 to 434), Gal4-SRC-1-RID (AA 595 to 780), and VP16-PXR-LBD (AA 107 to 437) from A.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	73	 Takeshita (Toranomon Hospital, Tokyo, Japan) (30), and Gal4-PGC-1 [full length (FL)] from A.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	74	 Kralli (The Scripp Research Institute).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	75	 Gal4-HNF4 fusion plasmids pBx-HNF4-FL (AA 1 to 455) and pBx-HNF4-130 to 455 (D + E + F regions) were obtained from I.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	76	 Talianidis (Institute of Molecular Biology and Biotechnology Foundation for Resarch and Technology, Hellas, Herakleion Crete, Greece), and pcDNA3X-Gal4-HNF4-1 to 129 (A/B and DBD-C) was obtained from M.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	77	 Crestani (University of Milan, Italy).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	78	 Primary hepatocytes were plated in six-well plates.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	79	 Cells were treated with rifampicin (10  microM; Sigma, St.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	80	 Louis, MO) and chenodeoxycholic acid (CDCA) (30  microM) (Sigma) in serum-free media and grown for 24 h.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	81	 Total RNA was isolated from the cells using Tri-Reagent (Sigma) according to the manufacturer's protocol.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	82	 Reverse-transcription reactions were performed using RETROscript kit according to manufacturer's instructions (Ambion, Austin, TX).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	83	 For Q-PCR, samples were prepared according to the PCR SYBRgreen Master Mix 2X protocol (Applied Biosystems, Foster City, CA).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	84	 Amplification of human highly basic protein (21) or ubiquitin C (16) was used in the same reactions of as an internal reference gene.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	85	 Primers were designed using Primer Express 1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	86	 Quantitative PCR analysis was conducted on the ABI Prism 7700 sequence-detection system.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	87	 Relative mRNA expression was quantified using the comparative threshold cycle (Ct; Ct) method according to the ABI manual.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	88	 HepG2 cells were grown to 80% confluence in 24-well tissue culture plates.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	89	 Unless otherwise indicated, in transient transfection assay, human CYP7A1/Luciferase reporter plasmid (1  microg) was transfected with expression plasmid (0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	90	5  microg) using the calcium phosphate-DNA coprecipitation method.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	91	 The pCMV-galactosidase plasmid (0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	92	1  microg) was transfected as an internal standard for normalizing the transfection efficiency in each assay.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	93	 In some samples, empty expression vectors were added to equalize the total amounts of plasmid DNA transfected in each assay.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	94	 Four hours after transfection, cells were incubated in serum-free media and treated with LCA (Steraloids, Newport, RI) or rifampicin in the concentrations indicated in each experiment for 40 h.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	95	 Cells were harvested for assay of luciferase reporter activity using Luciferase Assay System (Promega).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	96	 Luciferase activity was determined using a Lumat LB 9501 luminometer (Berthold Systems, Pittsburgh, PA) and normalized by dividing the relative light units by -galactosidase activity.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	97	 Each assay was done in triplicate, and individual experiments were repeated at least three times.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	98	 Data are plotted as means  plus or minus  SD.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	99	 Statistical analyses of treated vs.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	100	 untreated controls (vehicle or empty plasmids) were performed using Student's t-test.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	101	05 is considered statistically significant.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	102	 Cell viability assays were performed using TOX1 kit (Sigma).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	103	 HepG2 cells or human primary hepatocytes (HH1165) were cultured in 48-well plates and treated with increasing amounts of LCA (1 to 15  microM), CDCA (10 to 50  microM) or rifampicin (5 to 20  microM) for 48 h.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	104	 3-(4,5-dimethylthiazol-2-yl)-2,5-diphenyltetrazolium bromide (MTT) was added to the media and incubated for an additional 2 h.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	105	 The resulting purple crystals from MTT were dissolved in MTT dissolving solution, and absorbance was measured at 570 nm using a spectrophotometer.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	106	 Mutations were introduced into ph-298/Luc plasmid using PCR-based QuikChange Site-directed Mutagenesis Kit (Stratagene, La Jolla, CA).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	107	 Two complementary oligonucleotides containing the mutations (see Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	108	 PCR reactions were set up according to the manufacturer's instruction using 50 ng of template DNA and 125 ng of primers.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	109	 PCR cycling parameters were set as follows: denaturing at 95 degrees C for 2 min, followed by 18 cycles at 95 degrees C for 30 s, 55 degrees C for 1 min, and 68 degrees C for 18 min.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	110	 The reaction mixture was digested by Dpn I for 2 h to remove the template DNA and transformed into XL1-Blue super competent cells (Stratagene) for selection of mutant clones.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	111	 Mutations in each clone were confirmed by DNA sequencing.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	112	View larger version (24K):    Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	113	 Effects of hepatocyte nuclear factor (HNF)4, PXR/RXR, and peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor coactivator (PGC-1) on human CYP7A1 promoter activities.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	114	 HepG2 cells were cultured to 80% confluence.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	115	 Human CYP7A1/luciferase reporter (ph-298/Luc; 1  microg) was transiently transfected into HepG2 cells.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	116	5  microg) was cotransfected as indicated.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	117	 Cells were incubated in serum-free media for 40 h and harvested for luciferase activity assays as described in MATERIALS AND METHODS.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	118	 The error bars represent the SD from the mean of triplicate assays of an individual experiment; n = 3, *P  <  0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	119	 Reporter plasmid 5x UAS-TK-LUC (1  microg) was transfected with various two-hybrid plasmids (0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	120	5  microg each) and CMV--gal plasmid (0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	121	 Cells were treated with rifampicin (10  microM), LCA (10  microM), or vehicle (DMSO).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	122	 Luciferase activity was assayed as described in Transient transfection assay.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	123	 Nuclear receptors were synthesized in vitro using Quick-coupled Transcription/Translation Systems (Promega) programmed with receptor expression plasmids according to the manufacturer's instruction.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	124	 Double-stranded synthetic probes for the PXR binding site of CYP3A4, BARE-I and BARE-II of the human CYP7A1 gene were prepared by heating equal molar amounts of complementary oligonucleotides to 95 degrees C in 2x SSC (0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	125	5 M NaCl, 15 mM sodium citrate, pH 7.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	126	0) and then slowly cooled to room temperature.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	127	 The resulting double-stranded fragments were labeled with [32P]dCTP by filling in reaction using the Klenow fragment of DNA polymerase I.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	128	 Labeled double-stranded probes were purified through G-50 spin columns.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	129	 For each binding reaction, 50,000 counts/min (cpm) of labeled probe and 5 l of in vitro translated protein were incubated at room temperature for 20 min in 20  microl of binding buffer containing 12 mM HEPES, pH 7.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	130	9, 50 mM KCl, 1 mM EDTA, 1 mM dithiothreitol, 15% glycerol, and 2  microg of poly (dI-dC).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	131	 Samples were loaded on a 5% polyacrylamine gel, and electrophoresis was performed at room temperature at constant 200 V for 1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	132	 The gel was dried and autoradiographed using Phosphor Imager 445Si (Molecular Dynamics, Sunnyvale, CA).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	133	 Primary human hepatocytes were obtained in T75 culture flasks, and ChIP assays were performed on the same day the cells were received.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	134	 HepG2 cells were grown in 100-mm culture dishes to 80% confluence.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	135	 Ten micrograms of PXR, RXR, FTF, HNF4, and HA tagged-PGC-1 expression plasmids were transfected using the calcium phosphate-DNA coprecipitation method as described in Transient transfection assay.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	136	 Four hours after transfection, cells were incubated in serum-free media containing vehicle (DMSO) or 10  microM rifampicin for 40 h.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	137	 ChIP assays were performed using ChIP assay kit (Upstate Biotec, NY) according to manufacturer's protocol.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	138	 Briefly, cells were cross-linked in 1% formaldehyde for 10 min and washed with ice-cold PBS containing protease inhibitors (1 mM PMSF, 1  microg/ml aprotinin, and 1  microg/ml pepstanin A, Sigma) twice.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	139	 Cells were scraped and incubated in 1% SDS lysis buffer (1% SDS, 10 mM EDTA, 50 mM Tris HCl, pH 8.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	140	1) for 30 min on ice and sonicated using a Branson sonifier 250 with a microtip setting 6 for 15-s pulses at 40% output for a total of 1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	141	 Cell lysates were collected by centrifugation and diluted 10-fold in ChIP dilution buffer (0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	142	 Ten percent of the cell lysates were saved and used as the "input" for immunoprecipitation.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	143	 After the diluted cell lysate was precleared with protein A-agarose, DNA-protein complexes were precipitated by incubating the cell lysates with 10  microg of antibodies (goat HNF4, #6556; goat PXR, #7737; goat PGC-1, #5815; goat CPF, #5995, from Santa Cruz Biotechnology, Santa Cruz, CA) against target proteins overnight followed by a 3-h incubation with protein A or G-agarose beads for each treatment.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	144	 Protein A or G was added as a nonimmunoprecipitation control.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	145	 The beads were washed with low-salt wash buffer (0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	146	1% SDS, 1% Triton X-100, 2 mM EDTA, 20 mM Tris HCl, pH 8.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	147	1, 150 mM NaCl) once, high-salt wash buffer (0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	148	1% SDS, 1% Triton X-100, 2 mM EDTA, 20 mM Tris HCl, pH 8.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	149	1, 500 mM NaCl) once, LiCl wash buffer [0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	150	25 M LiCl, 1% Nonidet P-40 (NP-40), 1% deoxycholate, 1 mM EDTA, and 10 mM Tris HCl, pH 8.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	151	1] once, and buffer with 10 mM Tris HCl and 1 mM EDTA, pH 8.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	152	 Samples were eluted twice with 250  microl of ChIP elution buffer (1% SDS, 0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	153	1 M NaHCO3), and the eluates were combined.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	154	 The cross-links were reversed by adjusting NaCl concentration to 200 mM and incubating the eluates at 65 degrees C for 4 h followed by a 1-h incubation in 0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	155	04  microg/ microl proteinase K.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	156	 DNA was extracted using phenol/chloroform and precipitated using isopropanol.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	157	 A 391-bp DNA fragment containing BARE-I and BARE-II was PCR amplified for 45 cycles and analyzed on a 2% agarose gel.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	158	 The PCR primers used were as follows: forward primer: 5'- ATCACCGTCTCTCTGGCAAAGCAC; reverse primer: 5'-CCATTAACTTGAGCTTGGTTGACAAAG.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	159	 The amplified fragment of 391 bp is from  to 432 to  to 41 containing the BARE-I and BARE-II.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	160	 HepG2 cells were cultured in T150 flasks and transfected with 10 g of PXR expression plasmid using Ca+2-phosphate coimmunoprecipitation method.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	161	 Human primary hepatocytes (#HH1148) in T75 flasks were treated with either vehicle (DMSO) or rifampicin (10  microM) for 24 h, collected, and incubated in modified RIPA buffer (50 mM Tris-HCl, 1% NP-40, 0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	162	25%-deoxycholate, 150 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA) containing protease inhibitors (1 mM PMSF, 1  microg/ml aprotinin, 1  microg/ml pepstanin, Sigma) for 30 min.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	163	 Clear cell lyates were collected by centrifugation at 10,000 g at 4 degrees C for 15 min.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	164	 Clear lysates were precleared with protein G beads and incubated with 15  microg of rabbit anti-HNF4 antibody (Santa Cruz Biotechnology) at 4 degrees C with rotation overnight, followed by an additional incubation for 2 h with protein G beads.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	165	 The beads were then washed three times with RIPA buffer and were boiled in 2x protein loading buffer for 5 min.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	166	 Samples were divided into equal amounts and_loaded on SDS PAGE gels for Western immunoblot analysis using goat antibodies against HNF4 (#6556, Santa Cruz Biotechnology), PGC-1 (#5815), and PXR (#7737).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	167	   RESULTS TOP ABSTRACT MATERIALS AND METHODS RESULTS DISCUSSION GRANTS REFERENCES   CYP7A1, nuclear receptors, and PGC-1 mRNAs are expressed in human primary hepatocytes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	168	 We first used Q-PCR assays to detect mRNA expression levels of CYP7A1 and several transcription factors known to regulate CYP7A1 transcription in human primary hepatocytes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	169	 The averaging Ct ( plus or minus SD) determined from seven hepatocyte preparations (HH1088, HH1089, HH1115, HH1117, HH1118, HH1119, and HH1122) wereas follows: CYP7A1 (16.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	170	 The Ct is the fractional cycle number at which the amount of amplified target reaches a fixed threshold.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	171	 The Ct value is exponentially related to copy number.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	172	 High Ct value indicates low copy number.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	173	 The Ct value is the Ct of the target gene minus the Ct of the reference gene (ubiquitin C).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	174	 These data indicated that CYP7A1 mRNA levels were very low but detectable by this assay.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	175	 SHP mRNA levels were 100-fold higher than CYP7A1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	176	 PXR mRNA levels were lower than FXR, HNF4, and PGC-1, which were abundant in human primary hepatocytes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	177	 These experiments revealed that human primary hepatocytes expressed very low levels of CYP7A1 but abundant nuclear receptors and a coactivator known to regulate CYP7A1 gene expression.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	178	 Therefore, the human primary hepatocyte is suitable for studying CYP7A1 gene regulation by nuclear receptors.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	179	Rifampicin and CDCA reduce CYP7A1 mRNA expression in human primary hepatocytes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	180	 Q-PCR was then used to assay the effect of CDCA, an FXR ligand, and rifampicin, a human PXR ligand, on CYP7A1 mRNA expression levels in human primary hepatocytes (HH1106).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	181	 Comparative Ct ( to Ct) method was used to quantify the change of mRNA expression levels by CDCA and rifampicin (Table 1).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	182	 CDCA (30  microM) markedly reduced CYP7A1 mRNA expression by 95%, and rifampicin (10  microM) reduced CYP7A1 mRNA expression by 80%.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	183	 As a positive control for CDCA induction, SHP mRNA levels were determined.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	184	 As expected, CDCA induced SHP mRNA by sixfold.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	185	 The observed inverse relationship of CYP7A1 and SHP mRNA expression levels by bile acid is consistent with the hypothesis that SHP mechanism mediates bile acid inhibition of CYP7A1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	186	 Interestingly, rifampicin completely abolished SHP mRNA expression.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	187	 As a positive control of PXR induction, CYP3A4 mRNA expression levels were measured in human primary hepatocytes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	188	 The CYP3A4 mRNA levels were too low to be detected in vehicle and CDCA-treated human hepatocytes (Ct = 40).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	189	 Rifampicin remarkably induced CYP3A4 mRNA levels by more than 50-fold, consistent with a previous report (9).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	190	 The strong induction of SHP by CDCA and CYP3A4 by rifampicin indicates that these compounds at the concentrations tested did not cause toxic effect on human primary hepatocytes as demonstrated by MTT assays.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	191	 The lack of an inverse relationship between CYP7A1 and SHP mRNA expression by rifampicin provides strong evidence that SHP is not involved in PXR inhibition of CYP7A1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	192	 These results may suggest that ligand-activated PXR reduced SHP gene transcription in human livers.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	193	 Quantitative PCR analysis of CYP7A1 mRNA expression in human primary hepatocytes (HH1106).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	194	  Human PXR and rifampicin inhibit CYP7A1 reporter activity in HepG2 cells.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	195	 We then studied the effect of human PXR and rifampicin on human CYP7A1 gene transcription by transient transfection assay in HepG2 cells using a human CYP7A1/luciferase reporter construct (ph-298/Luc).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	196	 MTT assays revealed that LCA (1 to 15  microM), CDCA (10 to 50  microM), and rifampicin (5 to 20  microM) did not reduce HepG2 cell viability in the concentration range tested.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	197	 Rifampicin (10  microM) slightly inhibited CYP7A1 reporter activity assayed in HepG2 cells (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	198	 Because HepG2 cells express very low levels of PXR that are barely detectable by Western blot analysis and Q-PCR (data not shown), we overexpressed human PXR and RXR in HepG2 cells for reporter assays.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	199	 1B, rifampicin strongly reduced the reporter activity by 80% in PXR-expressing HepG2 cells.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	200	 These results suggest that PXR is involved in rifampicin inhibition of the CYP7A1 gene.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	201	View larger version (19K):    Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	202	 Rifampicin-activated pregnane X receptor (PXR) suppresses the cholesterol 7-hydroxylase (CYP7A1) reporter activity in transient transfection assays in HepG2 cells.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	203	 HepG2 cells were cultured to 80% confluence.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	204	 Human CYP7A1/luciferase reporter (ph-298/Luc; 1  microg) was transiently transfected into HepG2 cells.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	205	 Cells were treated with vehicle (DMSO) or rifampicin for 40 h and harvested for luciferase activity assays as described under MATERIALS AND METHODS.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	206	 A: effect of rifampicin (10  microM) on human CYP7A1/Luc reporter activity in HepG2 cells.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	207	 Data are plotted as means  plus or minus  SD, n = 3.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	208	 B: effects of PXR ligands (10  microM) on human CYP7A1/Luc reporter activity in HepG2 cells transfected with PXR/retinoid X receptor (RXR) expression plasmids (0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	209	5  microg) or empty vector, pcDNA3, and PXR ligands were added as indicated.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	210	 The error bars represent the SD from the mean of triplicate assays of an individual experiment, n = 3.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	211	  Identification of a negative PXR response element.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	212	 To localize the promoter region that confers negative rifampicin and PXR effect in the human CYP7A1 gene, 5'-deletion constructs of human CYP7A1/Luc reporter containing sequences from  to 1887/+24,  to 298/+24, and  to 150/+24 were assayed in HepG2 cells transfected with PXR and RXR.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	213	 Reporter activities of all three constructs were inhibited 80% by rifampicin (data not shown).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	214	 It is concluded that the PXR response element is located in the region downstream of  to 150, which contains both BARE-I and BARE-II.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	215	 We thus performed EMSA using oligonucleotide probes designed based on the nucleotide sequences in the BARE-I and BARE-II.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	216	 When the human BARE-I probe was used for EMSA (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	217	 2A), a mixture of in vitro synthesized PXR and RXR shifted a single band (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	218	 Neither PXR nor RXR alone bound the BARE-I probe (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	219	 A probe that contains a strong PXR binding site in the human CYP3A4 gene (ER6; Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	220	 2A) was used as a positive control for PXR binding (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	221	 Excess unlabeled BARE-I or unlabeled CYP3A4 oligonucleotide completely abolished the shifted band.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	222	 A mutant BARE-I probe, which has mutations introduced to alter the AGCTCA half-site sequence, did not bind PXR/RXR.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	223	 Figure 2C shows that unlabeled CYP3A4 oligonucleotide could completely compete out PXR binding to the labeled BARE-I probe at 100-fold excess.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	224	 On the other hand, 200-fold excess of unlabeled BARE-I was required to completely complete out PXR binding to the labeled 3A4 probe.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	225	 PXR is known to bind various motifs including DR3, DR4, and ER6 (11).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	226	 Analysis of the nucleotide sequences of human BARE-I revealed a putative DR3 motif (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	227	 2A) that is known to bind human PXR (17).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	228	View larger version (46K):    Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	229	 EMSA of PXR/RXR binding to human and rat bile acid response element (BARE)-I probes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	230	 A: nucleotide sequences of the probes used in the EMSA.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	231	 Rat BARE-I sequence is shown for comparison.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	232	 Arrows above sequences indicate hormone response element half-site.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	233	 Lower case letters indicate mutations.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	234	 DR, direct repeat; ER, everted repeat.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	235	 B: PXR/RXR binding to human BARE-I probes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	236	 -P32-labeled probes [5 x 104 cycles/min (cpm)] and 5  microl of in vitro synthesized proteins (TNT lysate) were mixed and applied to each lane as indicated.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	237	 Excess (100-fold) of unlabeled probes was used as cold competitor.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	238	 Probe CYP3A4 contains a PXR/RXR binding site (ER6) of human CYP3A4 gene.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	239	 Probe Mut contains a mutant human BARE-I as shown in A.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	240	 C: cold competition of PXR/RXR binding to human BARE-I probe and CYP3A4 probe.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	241	 Increasing amount of excess unlabeled probes and 1  microl -P32-labeled probes (5 x 104 cpm) were incubated with 5  microl of in vitro synthesized proteins (TNT lysate) for 20 min and applied to each lane as indicated.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	242	  We then introduced the same mutations into a human CYP7A1/Luc reporter to test whether the PXR binding site is functional.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	243	 Mutation of the AGCTCA sequence in the_BARE-I markedly reduced reporter activity by 90% (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	244	 This hormone-response element half-site apparently is essential for basal human CYP7A1 gene transcriptional activity.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	245	 When transfection assays were performed in HepG2 cells cotransfected with PXR/RXR, rifampicin did not significantly inhibit the mutant reporter activity (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	246	 These results confirmed that the BARE-I was a functional negative PXR response element.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	247	 It was also concluded that the BARE-II was not a PXR response element, because PXR did not bind to the BARE-II (data not shown) and rifampicin did not inhibit the mutant reporter that had an intact BARE-II (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	248	View larger version (15K):    Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	249	 Mutation in the BARE-I of human CYP7A1 gene abolished PXR inhibition.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	250	 A: wild-type human CYP7A1/Luc reporter (ph-298)/Luc or mutant reporter with mutations in the BARE-I region introduced by site-directed mutagenesis (shown in Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	251	 2) was transfected into HepG2 cells.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	252	 Basal reporter activity was assayed; n = 3, mutant vs.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	253	 B: mutant reporter plasmid was transfected into HepG2 cells cotransfected with PXR/RXR expression plasmids.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	254	 **Not significant for rifampicin vs.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	255	 Cells were treated with vehicle (DMSO) or 10  microM rifampicin as indicated.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	256	  Rifampicin inhibits HNF4 and PGC-1 stimulation of human CYP7A1 gene.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	257	 We then studied the effect of rifampicin on CYP7A1 reporter activity affected by HNF4, PXR, and PGC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	258	 4, HNF4 stimulated human CYP7A1 reporter activity by fivefold (lane 2).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	259	 PGC-1 alone stimulated human CYP7A1 reporter activity by threefold (lane 3).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	260	 Combination of HNF4 and PGC-1 stimulated activity by eightfold (lane 5).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	261	 It is remarkable that addition of rifampicin almost completely abolished reporter activity in PXR expression HepG2 cells (lanes 4 and 6 to 8).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	262	 These data revealed that PXR was a strong repressor of the CYP7A1 gene when activated by a ligand, whereas HNF4 and PGC-1 are positive regulators of the human CYP7A1 gene.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	263	PXR interacts with HNF4 and PGC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	264	 We reported previously that HNF4 bound to the BARE-II and COUP-TFII bound to the BARE-I synergistically stimulated rat CYP7A1 gene transcription (29).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	265	 We proposed a model that factors bound to the BARE-I and BARE-II interact and regulate CYP7A1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	266	 We therefore wanted to test the hypothesis that PXR, which binds to the BARE-I, might also interact with HNF4 to regulate the human CYP7A1 gene.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	267	 We used mammalian two-hybrid assay to study the interaction between Gal4-PXR-LBD fusion and VP16-HNF4 fusion in HepG2 cells.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	268	 In this assay, Gal4-PXR-LBD fusion protein binds to the Gal4-DBD (DNA binding site or UAS) in a luciferase reporter (Gal4 to 5XUAS-TK-Luc), which has a TK minimal promoter, and expresses low basal activity in mammalian cells.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	269	 If Gal4-PXR fusion protein interacts with VP16-HNF4 fusion protein, then the Gal4 reporter activity should be stimulated.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	270	 The effect of a PXR ligand on the interaction also can be tested in this assay.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	271	 5A show that Gal4-PXR-LBD (AA 107 to 434) interacts strongly with VP16-HNF4 (D + BD, AA 125 to 364) only in the presence of rifampicin.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	272	 As a control for specificity of interaction, Gal4-PXR interacts very weakly with VP16-FTF.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	273	 It should be noted that the FTF binding site overlaps with the HNF4 binding site in the BARE-II.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	274	 We then used Gal4-HNF4 and VP16-PXR hybrids in two-hybrid assays.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	275	 Figure 5B shows that Gal4-HNF4 full-length and VP16-PXR-LBD interact without addition of a HNF4 ligand (4-fold of the background).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	276	 It should be noted that HNF4 has intrinsic activity, and the endogenous HNF4 ligand is not known for certain.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	277	 Addition of rifampicin somewhat enhanced the interaction.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	278	 The interactions between Gal4-HNF4 and VP16-PXR fusion proteins were much weaker than between Gal4-PXR/VP16-HNF4 hybrids (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	279	 5A), as indicated by much lower reporter activities.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	280	 The NH2-terminal region (A/B + DBD; AA 1 to 129) of HNF4 did not_interact with PXR, whereas the COOH-terminal region (LBD; AA 130 to 455) of HNF4 did.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	281	 These data revealed that the LBD of HNF4 interacts with LBD of PXR.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	282	View larger version (24K):    Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	283	 Mammalian 2-hybrid assays of PXR interaction with HNF4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	284	 A: mammalian 2-hybrid assay of ligand-dependent interaction between PXR and HNF4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	285	5  microg) Gal4-PXR-ligand binding domain (LBD), VP16-empty vector, VP16--fetoprotein transcription factor (FTF)-LBD, or VP16-HNF4 (0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	286	5  microg) were cotransfected with 5x upstream activating sequence (UAS)-thymidine kinase (TK)-LUC reporter plasmid (1  microg) into HepG2 cells.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	287	 Cells were treated with vehicle (DMSO) or 10  microM rifampicin for 40 h and harvested for luciferase activity assays as described under MATERIALS AND METHODS.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	288	 The error bars represent the SD from the mean of triplicate assays of an individual experiment; n = 3, *P  <  0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	289	 B: mammalian 2-hybrid assay of ligand-dependent interaction between PXR and HNF4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	290	5  microg) containing a full-length, NH2-terminal A/B + C [1 to 129 amino acid (AA)], and COOH-terminal D + E + F (130 to 455 AA) of HNF4, and VP16-PXR-LBD (0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	291	5  microg) were cotransfected with 5x UAS-TK-LUC reporter plasmid (1  microg) into HepG2 cells as indicated.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	292	 Empty vector VP16 was used as a negative control.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	293	 Cells were treated with vehicle (DMSA) or 10  microM rifampicin for 40 h and harvested for luciferase activity assays as described in MATERIALS AND METHODS.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	294	 The error bars represent the SE of the mean of triplicate assays of an individual experiment; n = 3, *P  <  0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	295	  PXR interacts with PGC-1 and rifampicin attenuates the PGC-1 interaction with HNF4 and PXR.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	296	 PGC-1 was originally identified as a coactivator of PPAR.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	297	 Since then, several other nuclear receptors including HNF4, LXR, RXR, and Estrogen receptor (ER), and ER-related receptor were found to interact with PGC-1 and regulate gluconeogenesis and energy metabolism (23, 25).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	298	 It is not known whether PGC-1 interacts with PXR.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	299	 We therefore performed mammalian two-hybrid assays to study PXR interaction with PGC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	300	 Figure 6A shows that Gal4-PGC-1 strongly interacts with VP16-PXR as indicated by a 400-fold stimulation of Gal4 reporter activity over Gal4 basal activity.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	301	 A ubiquitous steroid receptor coactivator, SRC-1, interacts much weaker (20-fold) with VP16-PXR.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	302	 Because coactivator is known to interact with nuclear receptor by binding to the LBD and ligand enhances the interaction, we then studied the effect of rifampicin on PXR interaction with HNF4 and PGC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	303	 Figure 6B shows that rifampicin induced a fourfold stimulation of PXR and PGC-1 interaction.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	304	 Interestingly, overexpression of HNF4 strongly inhibited PXR and PGC-1 interaction only when a PXR ligand was added.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	305	 This indicates that rifampicin promotes PXR and HNF4 interaction and excludes PGC-1 from interaction with PXR.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	306	 Figure 6C shows that Gal4-PGC-1 interacts strongly with VP-16-HNF4 (500-fold), and rifampicin did not have any effect on the interaction.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	307	 This is expected because rifampicin is not a ligand of HNF4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	308	 When PXR expression plasmid was cotransfected, addition of rifampicin strongly inhibited HNF4 and PGC-1 interaction.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	309	 These results also suggest that rifampicin promotes PXR interaction with HNF4 and prevents PGC-1 interaction with HNF4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	310	 These results reveal for the first time that PGC-1 is a strong coactivator of PXR and rifampicin promotes PXR interaction with HNF4 and blocks PGC-1 from interaction with HNF4 or PXR.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	311	View larger version (17K):    Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	312	 Mammalian 2-hybrid assay of PXR and HNF4 interaction with PGC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	313	 A: mammalian 2-hybrid assay of PXR interaction with PGC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	314	5  microg) VP16-PXR-LBD, Gal4-empty vector, Gal4-SRC-1-RID, and Gal4-PGC-1 were cotransfected with 5x UAS-TK-LUC reporter plasmid (1  microg) into HepG2 cells as indicated.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	315	 Cells were incubated for 40 h and harvested for luciferase activity assay as described in MATERIALS AND METHODS.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	316	 The error bars represent the SD from the mean of triplicate assays of an individual experiment; n = 3, *P  <  0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	317	 B: HNF4 disrupts PGC-1 and PXR interaction.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	318	 VP16-PXR-LBD, Gal4-empty vector, or Gal4-PGC-1 and expression plasmid pCMX-HNF4 were cotransfected with 5x UAS-TK-LUC reporter plasmid (1  microg) into HepG2 cells as indicated.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	319	 Cells were treated with vehicle (DMSO) or 10  microM rifampicin as indicated for 40 h and harvested for luciferase activity assay; n = 3, *P  <  0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	320	 C: PGC-1 interacts with HNF4, and rifampicin-activated PXR disrupts HNF4 interaction with PGC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	321	5  microg) VP16-PXR-LBD, Gal4-empty vector, or Gal4-PGC-1 and expression plasimd pSG5-hPXR were cotransfected with 5x UAS-TK-Luc reporter plasmid into HepG2 cells.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	322	 The error bars represent the SD from the mean of triplicate assays of an individual experiment; n = 3, *P  <  0.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	323	  HNF4 and PXR bind to the CYP7A1 gene and interact with PGC-1 in the native CYP7A1 chromatin.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	324	 To further test the binding and interaction of HNF4, PXR, and PGC-1 to the CYP7A1 gene in vivo, we performed ChIP assays using human primary hepatocytes and HepG2 cells.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	325	 PCR primers were designed to amplify a 391-bp fragment that contains both BARE-I and BARE-II sequences.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	326	 Figure 7A shows that an antibody against PXR or HNF4 precipitated the CYP7A1 chromatins in primary human hepatocytes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	327	 For ChIP assay using HepG2 cells, PGC-1, HNF4, and PXR/RXR were overexpressed to increase receptor expression levels.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	328	 Figure 7B shows that anti-PXR or HNF4 antibody precipitates CYP7A1 chromatin.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	329	 These results confirmed that PXR and HNF4 bound to the native CYP7A1 chromatin.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	330	 PGC-1 antibody also precipitated the CYP7A1 chromatin (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	331	 Because PGC-1 is a coactivator that lacks a DBD, PGC-1 must interact with either HNF4 and/or PXR in the CYP7A1 chromatin.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	332	 We also did ChIP assay using an antibody against FTF and confirmed that FTF bound to the BARE-II.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	333	 We then studied the effect of rifampicin on the binding of these transcription factors to the CYP7A1 chromatin.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	334	 Rifampicin treatments did not affect the binding of HNF4 and PXR to the CYP7A1 chromatin, but PGC-1 was absent from the chromatin (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	335	 As a control, ChIP assays showed that rifampicin did not alter FTF binding to the chromatin.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	336	 These data are consistent with our mammalian two-hybrid assay data, which suggest that rifampicin disrupts PGC-1 interaction with HNF4 or PXR.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	337	View larger version (25K):    Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	338	 rifampicin impairs the recruitment of PGC-1 to CYP7A1 chromatin.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	339	 A: chromatin immunoprecipitation assay (ChIP) of PXR and HNF4 binding to human CYP7A1 gene in primary human hepatocytes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	340	 Anti-PXR or anti-HNF4 antibody (Ab) was used to precipitate the DNA-protein complex in primary human hepatocytes (HH1119).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	341	 A 391-bp fragment containing BARE-I and BARE-II was PCR amplified and analyzed on a 2% agarose gel.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	342	 Protein G was used alone as nonimmunoprecipitation control.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	343	 Ten percent of the total cell lysate was used as the "input.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	344	" B: ChIP assay of HNF4, PXR, FTF, and PGC-1 binding to human CYP7A1 chromatin using HepG2 cells.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	345	 HepG2 cells were transfected with 10  microg of PXR, RXR, HNF4, HA-PGC-1, or FTF expression plasmids and treated with vehicle (DMSO) or 10  microM rifampicin for 40 h.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	346	 ChIP assays were performed as described in MATERIALS AND METHODS.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	347	 Anti-PXR, anti-HNF4, anti-HA, or anti-FTF antibodies were used to precipitate the DNA-protein complexes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	348	 A 391-bp fragment containing BARE-I and BARE-II was PCR amplified and analyzed on a 2% agarose gel.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	349	 Protein G was used alone as nonimmunocontrol (not shown).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	350	  Co-IP assay of HNF interaction with PXR and PGC-12.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	351	 To further confirm the physical interaction between HNF4 and PXR in cells, anti-HNF4 antibody was used to immunoprecipitate HNF4 from cell extracts isolated from HepG2 and human primary hepatocytes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	352	 If PXR interacts with HNF4 in these cells, PXR should be co-IP by anti-HNF4 antibody and detected by Western immunoblot analysis using antibody against PXR.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	353	 Because PXR protein levels are very low in HepG2 cells, HepG2 cells were transfected with PXR expression plasmid.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	354	 8A shows that antibody against PXR detected small amounts of PXR in HepG2 cell extracts precipitated by anti-HNF4 antibody.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	355	 Rifampicin treatment markedly increased PXR protein in the IP.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	356	 Anti-HNF4 antibody detected similar amounts of HNF4 in vehicle and rifampicin-treated cell extracts.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	357	 We also did co-IP assay using human primary hepatocytes (no overexpression of PXR).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	358	 Figure 8B shows co-IP assay using anti-HNF4 antibody to precipitate cell extracts from human primary hepatocytes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	359	 Anti-PXR antibody detected a small amount of PXR protein in the IP.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	360	 Rifampicin pretreatment of hepatocytes markedly increased the amounts of PXR co-IP with the HNF4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	361	 Anti-PGC-1 antibody detected PGC-1 protein in the IP, and rifampicin pretreatment markedly reduced the amounts of PGC-1 protein in the IP.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	362	 These data confirmed that rifampicin enhanced PXR interaction with HNF4 as revealed by mammalian two-hybrid assays shown in Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	363	 Rifampicin reduced PGC-1 co-IP with HNF4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	364	 These results are consistent with the finding from two-hybrid assays (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	365	 6, B and C) and ChIP assays (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	366	 7B) that rifampicin promoted PXR interaction with HNF4 and excluded PGC-1 from interaction with HNF4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	367	View larger version (27K):    Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	368	 Coimmunoprecipitation assay of HNF4 interaction with PXR and PGC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	369	 A: coimmunoprecipitation assay using HepG2 cell extracts.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	370	 HepG2 cells were transfected with PXR expression plasmid and treated with either vehicle (DMSO) or 10  microM rifampicin for 40 h.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	371	 Rabbit anti-HNF4 antibody (ab) was added to immunoprecipitate the cell lysates as described in MATERIALS AND METHODS.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	372	 Western immunoblot analyses were performed using goat anti-PXR or anti-HNF4 antibody to detect PXR and HNF4 in the precipitates.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	373	 B: coimmunoprecipitation assay using human primary hepatocytes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	374	 Human primary hepatoctyes (HH1148) were treated with DMSO or 10  microM rifampicin for 40 h.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	375	 Rabbit anti-HNF4 antibody was added to cells lysates as described in MATERIALS AND METHODS.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	376	 Western immunoblot analyses were performed using goat anti-HNF4, PXR or PGC-1 antibody to detect these proteins in the immunoprecipitates.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	377	 Protein G was added as a negative control.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	378	     DISCUSSION TOP ABSTRACT MATERIALS AND METHODS RESULTS DISCUSSION GRANTS REFERENCES   In this report, we studied the mechanism of rifampicin and PXR inhibition of human CYP7A1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	379	 We established the human primary hepatocyte as a suitable model for studying CYP7A1 gene regulation by nuclear receptors and PGC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	380	 Q-PCR analysis reveals that CYP7A1 mRNA expression levels are repressed in human primary hepatocytes, likely because the negative effects of several negative regulators of the human CYP7A1 gene, FTF, COUP-TFII, PXR, Prox1 (see below), and SHP, may dominant over the positive effect of activators HNF4 and PGC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	381	 Q-PCR analysis showed that CDCA strongly reduced CYP7A1 but induced SHP mRNA expression in human primary hepatocytes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	382	 This inverse relationship of CDCA effect on CYP7A1 and SHP expression is consistent with the FXR/SHP mechanism of bile acid inhibition of CYP7A1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	383	 In contrast, rifampicin strongly reduced both CYP7A1 and SHP mRNA expression in human primary hepatocytes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	384	 This result provides strong evidence that SHP is not involved in PXR inhibition of CYP7A1 because reduction of a negative factor should result in induction of CYP7A1 expression.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	385	 Our preliminary results show that rifampicin-activated PXR inhibits human SHP reporter activity (data not shown).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	386	In bile acid or drug-induced cholestasis, PXR may be activated to induce CYP3A4, which catalyzes 6-hydroxylation of bile acids for renal excretion.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	387	 PXR also induces dehydroepiandrosterone sulfotransferase that excretes sulfate-conjugated bile acids.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	388	 Our findings suggest that PXR inhibition of CYP7A1 gene transcription may be an additional mechanism for reducing intrahepatic bile acid concentrations and further protect the liver from toxic effects of bile acids and xenobiotics.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	389	 PXR inhibition of SHP may also be a part of the PXR protection mechanism, because SHP could interact with PXR to inhibit CYP3A4 induction (22).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	390	Our cell-based mammalian two-hybrid assay, co-IP, and ChIP assays all confirm the interactions of PXR with HNF4 and PGC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	391	 The interaction between PXR and HNF4 is novel and is consistent with our model that factors bound to the BARE-I and BARE-II interact and coordinately regulate basal transcription of the CYP7A1 gene (8).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	392	 HNF4 is known to play a central role in regulation of bile acid synthesis (3).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	393	 There are reports that HNF4 is required for PXR-mediated xenobiotic induction of CYP3A4 in mice (31) and that HNF4 regulates PXR expression and xenobiotic response during fetal liver development (14).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	394	 Therefore, the PXR and HNF4 interaction may be physiologically important in the coordinated regulation of xenobiotic and bile acid metabolisms.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	395	 Both two-hybrid assay and co-IP assay using HepG2 and primary hepatocyte extracts show that rifampicin markedly enhances PXR interaction with HNF4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	396	 The interaction between PXR and PGC-1 is as strong as between HNF4 and PGC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	397	 This is the first report that PXR is a target of PGC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	398	 Rifampicin is not required for PXR to interact with PGC-1 and does not affect HNF4 and PXR binding to CYP7A1 chromatin.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	399	 On the other hand, rifampicin dissociates PGC-1 from CYP7A1 chromatin likely due to enhancing PXR interaction with HNF4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	400	Our results suggest a model for PXR, HNF4, and PGC-1 regulation of the CYP7A1 gene (Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	401	 HNF4 and PGC-1 are the most important transactivators of the human CYP7A1 gene.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	402	 PGC-1 interacts with HNF4, which binds to the BARE-II and activates human CYP7A1 gene.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	403	 According to this study, PXR binds to the BARE-I and interacts with PGC-1 but may not be important in basal transcription of the CYP7A1 gene.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	404	 It should be noted that our model does not suggest a ternary complex formation among PXR, HNF4, and PGC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	405	 PGC-1 is a coactivator that binds to the LBD of both PXR and HNF4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	406	 Therefore, it is not likely that PGC-1 interacts simultaneously with both nuclear receptors.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	407	 Ubiquitous coactivators, SRC-1 and CBP, are known to interact with PXR and HNF4; however, our data show a much stronger interaction of PXR with PGC-1 than SRC-1.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	408	 Nuclear receptor/coactivator complexes may facilitate the recruitment of histone acetytransferase to remodel the chromatin to allow recruitment of other coactivator/mediator complexes and assemble the general transcriptional machinery that regulates RNA polymerase II activity (10).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	409	 On the basis of our results, we propose a model that activation of PXR by rifampicin would allow PXR to interact directly with HNF4 and exclude PGC-1 from interacting with HNF4, resulting in suppression of the CYP7A1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	410	 Corepressors, such as SMRT and NCoR1, have been shown to inhibit nuclear receptor activity (7).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	411	 Our preliminary results show that the interaction of SMRT and NCoR1 with HNF4 and PXR is very weak.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	412	 It is also possible that rifampicin-activated PXR may compete with HNF4 for PGC-1, thus inhibiting CYP7A1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	413	 This mechanism of PXR inhibition of gene transcription is not likely because PGC-1 interaction with PXR or HNF4 does not require a ligand and rifampicin-activated PXR and HNF4 is known to strongly induce, not inhibit, CYP3A4 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	414	View larger version (35K):    Fig.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	415	 A model for rifampicin and PXR regulation of CYP7A1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	416	 Top: HNF4 and PGC-1 are the most important activators of human CYP7A1 gene.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	417	 PGC-1 interacts with HNF4, which binds to the BARE-II and transactivates the human CYP7A1 gene.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	418	 According to this study, PXR is able to bind to the BARE-I.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	419	 Coactivators SRC-1 and cAMP response element binding protein binding protein (CBP) and histone acetytransferase (HAT) may be also recruited to remodel chromatin and recruit other coactivator complexes to induce the basal transcription of the CYP7A1 gene by RNA polymerase II.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	420	 Bottom: rifampicin activates PXR to promote its interaction with HNF4.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	421	 This interaction may disrupt the interaction between PGC-1 and HNF4 (and may be also PXR) and result in suppression of CYP7A1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	422	 Corepressors and histone deacetylase (HDAC) may be also recruited to inhibit CYP7A1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	423	  Very recently, a homeobox transcription factor, Prox1, has been shown to interact specifically with FTF and inhibits the CYP7A1 gene (24).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	424	 Prox1 is expressed in the liver and intestine and may play an important role not only in liver development, but also in regulation of bile acid synthesis.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	425	 Our Q-PCR analysis detects very high levels of Prox1 mRNA in human primary hepatocytes, indicating that Prox1 might be the dominant repressor of CYP7A1 gene expression in human livers.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	426	 However, it is not known whether bile acids or drugs affect Prox1 interaction with FTF, HNF4, or PXR.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	427	 Another recent report (28) shows that Prox1 interacts with FTF and inhibits SHP gene expression and that Prox1 specifically interacts with histone deacetylase (HDAC)3.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	428	 HDACs are known to form complexes with nuclear receptors and corepressors and inhibit gene transcription (13).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	429	 The roles of these transcriptional repressors in mediating bile acid inhibition of CYP7A1 gene transcription remain to be elucidated.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	430	In summary, this study provides the first evidence that PXR is able to interact with HNF4 and PGC-1 and plays a role in mediating rifampicin and bile acid inhibition of CYP7A1 gene transcription.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	431	 On ligand binding, PXR interacts with HNF4, blocks PGC-1 interaction with HNF4, and results in inhibition of the CYP7A1 gene.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	432	 The PXR pathway may be important for preventing bile acid and drug-induced cholestasis by inhibiting bile acid synthesis as well as stimulating bile acid transport, excretion, and detoxification.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	433	 Thus PXR plays a central role in coordinated regulation of bile acid homeostasis and drug metabolism.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	434	 This may be the mechanism for using rifampicin and steroids to treat pruritus of intrahepatic cholestasis and primary biliary cirrhosis (1, 12).
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	435	 Efficacious PXR agonists may be developed for treating these chronic liver diseases.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	436	   GRANTS TOP ABSTRACT MATERIALS AND METHODS RESULTS DISCUSSION GRANTS REFERENCES   This study is supported by National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases Grants DK-44442 and DK-58379.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	437	   ACKNOWLEDGMENTS   We thank Dr.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	438	 Strom for providing human primary hepatocytes.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	439	 Spalding-Yoder is gratefully acknowledged.

0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	445	 The article must therefore be hereby marked "advertisement" in accordance with 18 U.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	446	 Section 1734 solely to indicate this fact.

0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	533	 Redundant pathways for negative feedback regulation of bile Acid production.
