0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	535	 An essential role for nuclear receptors SXR/PXR in detoxification of cholestatic bile acids.
0.40663978.15331348.html.plaintext.txt	536	 Proc Natl Acad Sci USA 98: 3375 to 3380, 2001.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	0	The Synergistic Effect of Dexamethasone and All-trans-retinoic Acid on Hepatic Phosphoenolpyruvate Carboxykinase Gene Expression Involves the Coactivator p300* Xiaohui L.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	1	 Wang, Birger Herzog, Mary Waltner-Law, Robert K.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	2	 Hall, Masakazu Shiota, and Daryl K.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	3	From the Department of Molecular Physiology and Biophysics, Vanderbilt University School of Medicine, Nashville, Tennessee 37232-0615 and Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center, Nashville, Tennessee 37212.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	4	Received for publication, March 29, 2004 , and in revised form, May 25, 2004.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	5	   ABSTRACT TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION MATERIALS AND METHODS RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Activation of phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase (PEPCK) gene transcription in response to all-trans-retinoic acid (RA) or a glucocorticoid such as dexamethasone (Dex) requires a distinct arrangement of DNA-response elements and their cognate transcription activators on the gene promoter.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	6	 Two of the accessory factor-binding elements involved in the Dex response (gAF1 and gAF3) coincide with the DNA-response elements involved in the RA response.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	7	 We demonstrate here that the combination of Dex/RA has a synergistic effect on endogenous PEPCK gene expression in rat hepatocytes and H4IIE hepatoma cells.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	8	 Reporter gene studies show that the gAF3 element and one of the two glucocorticoid receptor-binding elements (GR1) are most important for this effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	9	 Chromatin immunoprecipitation assays revealed that when H4IIE cells were treated with Dex/RA, ligand-activated retinoic acid receptors (retinoic acid receptor/retinoid X receptor) and glucocorticoid receptors are recruited to this gene promoter, as are the transcription coregulators p300, CREB-binding protein, p/CIP, and SRC-1.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	10	 Notably, the recruitment of p300 and RNA polymerase II to the PEPCK promoter is increased by the combined Dex/RA treatment compared with Dex or RA treatment alone.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	11	 The functional importance of p300 in the Dex/RA response is illustrated by the observation that selective reduction of this coactivator, but not that of CREB-binding protein, abolishes the synergistic effect in H4IIE cells.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	12	   INTRODUCTION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION MATERIALS AND METHODS RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Extracellular signals received by eucaryotic cells are transferred to the nucleus where the transcription of specific sets of genes is modulated (1).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	13	 The final targets of these signaling pathways are different combinations of transcription factors that bind to DNA-response elements and form various protein-protein interactions on gene promoters and thereby either activate or repress gene transcription.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	14	 DNA-response elements in gene promoters often overlap or are adjacent to one another (2).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	15	 This provides various possibilities for the recruitment of transcription factors and their cognate coregulators in response to distinct signals and creates the potential for considerable flexibility in gene regulation.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	16	 Regulation of the phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase (PEPCK)1 gene provides an excellent model system for exploring the mechanisms of signal integration in the context of gluconeogenesis, an important physiologic process (2).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	17	 The expression of hepatic PEPCK is primarily accomplished at the transcriptional level (3).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	18	 Glucagon (acting through cAMP), glucocorticoids, all-trans-retinoic acid (RA), and thyroid hormone activate PEPCK gene expression, whereas insulin and glucose are inhibitory (3 to 6).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	19	Activation of PEPCK gene transcription by RA occurs through a multicomponent retinoic acid-response unit (RARU) that consists of two separate retinoic acid-response elements, RARE1 and RARE2, each of which binds an RAR/RXR heterodimer (4, 7).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	20	 Activation of PEPCK gene transcription by Dex also requires a multicomponent glucocorticoid-response unit (GRU), which consists of two nonconsensus glucocorticoid receptor-binding sites (GR1 and GR2) (8), and four accessory factor-binding sites (gAF1, gAF2, gAF3, and the cAMP-response element (CRE)), which bind COUP-TF/HNF4, HNF3, COUP-TF, and C/EBP, respectively (9 to 12).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	21	 A mutation of any one of the accessory elements results in a 50 to 60% reduction of Dex-induced PEPCK gene transcription in H4IIE hepatoma cells (11).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	22	 Any combination of the mutation of two elements nearly abolishes this response (11).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	23	Most interesting, RARE1 and RARE2 in the RARU are coincident with gAF1 and gAF3 in the GRU (4, 7, 9, 13).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	24	 The respective transcription factors are present in about the same abundance in the H4IIE cell nucleus, and each binds with approximately the same affinity to these elements.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	25	 Thus, it is of interest to understand how a cell responds to either of these inducers, whether different constellations of accessory factors and coregulators are used for each response and whether there is any functional interaction between the two units in the presence of both ligands.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	26	In this study, we demonstrate that the Dex/RA combination has a synergistic effect on endogenous PEPCK gene expression in both primary hepatocytes and H4IIE hepatoma cells.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	27	 This response is most dependent on the gAF3 and GR1 elements.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	28	 Upon treatment with Dex/RA, ligand-activated RAR/RXR heterodimers, GR, HNF3, HNF4, p/CIP, SRC-1, CBP, p300, and RNA polymerase II (pol II) are present on the PEPCK gene promoter.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	29	 Notably, the recruitment of p300 and pol II on the PEPCK promoter is increased upon Dex/RA treatment.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	30	 The important role of p300 is illustrated by the fact that its reduction results in a selective loss of the synergistic effect of Dex/RA, whereas a similar reduction of CBP has no effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	31	   MATERIALS AND METHODS TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION MATERIALS AND METHODS RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Plasmids The PEPCK luciferase (PEPCK-LUC) reporter gene construct was made by cloning the PEPCK gene promoter ( to 467 to +69) into pGL3 basic (Promega), as described previously (14).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	32	 The gAF1-Gal4 PEPCK-LUC, gAF2-Gal4 PEPCK-LUC, or gAF3-Gal4 PEPCK-LUC reporter constructs were constructed by replacing gAF1, gAF2, or gAF3 with a Gal4 DNA-binding element, as described previously (15).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	33	 gAF1 gAF3-Gal4 PEPCK-LUC was constructed by further mutating the gAF1 element of gAF3-Gal4 PEPCK-LUC plasmid to a Gal4 DNA-binding element using the QuikChange site-directed mutagenesis kit (Stratagene).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	34	 The sequence of the Gal4 DNA-binding element is 5'-CGGAGGACTGTCCTCCGACCA-3'.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	35	 gAF3m PEPCK-LUC, gAF3m PEPCK-LUC, gAF3Em PEPCK-LUC, gAF1-COUP-TF PEPCK-LUC, and gAF1-HNF4 PEPCK-LUC were made as described previously (15).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	36	 mGR1 PEPCK-LUC and palGR1 PEPCK-LUC were made by converting the GR1 element to a block mutation or palindromic GRbinding element, respectively.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	37	 mGR2 PEPCK-LUC was constructed by replacing the GR2 site with a block mutation.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	38	 mGR1/2 PEPCK-LUC was made by replacing the GR1 site in mGR2 PEPCK-LUC with a block mutation.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	39	 The oligonucleotides used to construct mGR1, mGR2, and palGR1 were described previously (8).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	40	 gAF1-cRARE PEPCK-LUC or gAF3-cRARE PEPCK-LUC was made by replacing gAF1 or gAF3 element individually with a consensus retinoic acid receptor-binding element (cRARE) (16).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	41	 The oligonucleotides used to generate gAF1-cRARE PEPCK-LUC and gAF3-cRARE PEPCK-LUC are as follows: gAF1-cRARE, 5'-ATTCCCTTCTGGTTCACCGAAAGTTCAGGAGTGACACC-3', and gAF3-cRARE, 5'-CGTCCCGGCCGGTTCACCGAAAGTTCACCACCTGACAA-3'.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	42	 The sequence of all of the constructs was verified by DNA sequence analysis.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	43	Cell Culture and Transfection H4IIE hepatoma cells were grown in stationary culture in Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium (DMEM) supplemented with 10% fetal calf serum at 37  degrees C in 5% CO2.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	44	 Transfection was performed using the calcium phosphate precipitation method as described previously (17) using 10  microg of a reporter plasmid (wild type or mutations of PEPCK-LUC).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	45	 The cells were subsequently washed and incubated for 18 h in DMEM containing 500 nM dexamethasone (Dex) and/or 5  microM all-trans-retinoic acid (RA) (Sigma).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	46	 Cells were harvested by trypsin digestion and resuspended in 200  microl of lysis buffer (Promega).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	47	 Firefly luciferase activity was measured and corrected for transfection efficiency with Renilla luciferase activity using the dual-luciferase reporter assay system (Promega).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	48	H4IIE cells are transfected with  < 1% efficiency; therefore, a rat kidney fibroblast cell line, KNRK cells, was employed.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	49	 These cells express abundant amounts of p300 and CBP and are transfected with 80% efficiency, as measured by the expression of enhanced green fluorescent proteins.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	50	 They are therefore very useful in establishing the efficacy and selectivity of candidate siRNA molecules.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	51	 KNRK cells were grown at 37  degrees C in DMEM supplemented with 5% calf serum, nonessential amino acids, and 4.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	52	 These cells were cultured in 6-well plates for 24 h and transfected with LipofectAMINE 2000 (Invitrogen).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	53	 2  microg of the siRNA vectors were transfected into 0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	54	5  microg of enhanced green fluorescent proteins were cotransfected as a control for transfection efficiency.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	55	 Control cells were transfected with empty pSUPER vector.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	56	 Cells were assayed for p300 or CBP expression 72 h after transfection by using Western blot assays of cell lysates.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	57	 -Actin was used to control for any differences in cell numbers or protein loading.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	58	Real Time PCR Primary hepatocytes were deprived of serum overnight and then were either left untreated or were treated with 500 nM Dex and/or 5  microM RA for 4 h.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	59	 Total RNA was extracted from these cells, and 0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	60	5  microg of this was transcribed using 50 units of Taqman reverse transcriptase (Applied Biosystems) and 125  microM random hexamer primers.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	61	 Real time PCR reactions were performed on one-tenth of the reverse-transcribed RNA using primers specific for the PEPCK and cyclophilin genes.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	62	 A 50- microl master mix of the following reaction components was prepared for each real time PCR: 18  microl of water, 100 nM forward primer, 100 nM reverse primer, 25  microl of 2x SYBR Green PCR master mix (Applied Biosystems), and 5  microl (one-tenth) of the reverse-transcribed RNA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	63	 The sequence of the forward PEPCK primer was 5'-GAATCAGCCAGATGTAATCCCG-3', and the sequence of the reverse PEPCK primer was 5'-CATTGTGCTTGCTGGTTTGC-3'.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	64	 The sequence of the forward cyclophilin primer was 5'-AAGGTGAAAGAAGGCATGAGCA-3', and the sequence of the reverse cyclophilin primer was 5'-AGTTGTCCACAGTCGGAGATGG-3'.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	65	 The following real time PCR protocol was used: denaturation and enzyme activation at 95  degrees C for 10 min followed by a two-step amplification and quantification program consisting of 40 cycles of denaturation for 15 s at 95  degrees C and annealing/extension for 1 min at 60  degrees C.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	66	 Data were analyzed using the SDS version 1.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	67	Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Assays (ChIP) H4IIE cells (1 x 108 cells per treatment) were kept in serum-free DMEM at 37  degrees C in 5% CO2 for about 48 h.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	68	 After a 2-h hormone treatment, protein-DNA cross-linking was performed with 1% formaldehyde in serum-free DMEM at room temperature for 10 min.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	69	 The cells were then harvested into PBS buffer (ice-cold 1x PBS with protease inhibitors: 1 mM phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride, 1  microg/ml aprotinin, 1  microg/ml leupeptin, 1  microg/ml pepstatin).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	70	 The cells were then pelleted and resuspended in SDS lysis buffer (1% SDS, 10 mM EDTA, 50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8, with protease inhibitors).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	71	 After incubation on ice for 20 min, the lysates were mixed with 25- microm-diameter glass beads (MO-SCI Corp.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	72	5-mm tip) at 4  degrees C 10 times with 15-s pulses at a setting of 6 (output of 6 watts) to shear chromatin to 500-bp fragments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	73	 The supernatant from each sample was divided into aliquots for a subsequent 10-fold dilution in ChIP dilution buffer (0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	74	7 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8, with protease inhibitors).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	75	 Each sample was pre-cleared to reduce nonspecific background using 40  microl of a 1:1 protein A/G-agarose slurry (Santa Cruz Biotechnology) supplemented with 100  microg/ml salmon sperm DNA (Stratagene) for 3 h at 4  degrees C on a rotating wheel.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	76	 The beads were then pelleted, and the supernatant was transferred to a new tube.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	77	 The precleared extracts were incubated overnight with 4  microg of the antibody or without antibody (as a negative control) at 4  degrees C on a rotating wheel.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	78	 Immune complexes were collected using 40  microl of a 1:1 protein-A/G-agarose slurry plus 100  microg/ml salmon sperm DNA, with constant rotation for 3 h at 4  degrees C.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	79	 The agarose beads were pelleted at 1000 x g for 2 min and washed for 10 min at room temperature with 1 ml of each of the following buffers in succession: low salt wash buffer (0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	80	1% SDS, 1% Triton X-100, 2 mM EDTA, 20 mM Tris-HCl, 150 mM NaCl, pH 8), high salt wash buffer (0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	81	1% SDS, 1% Triton X-100, 2 mM EDTA, pH 8, 20 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8, 500 mM NaCl, pH 8), LiCl wash buffer (0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	82	25 M LiCl, 1% Nonidet P-40, 1% sodium deoxycholate, 1 mM EDTA, 10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8), and 2x with TE buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl, 1 mM EDTA, pH 8).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	83	 Chromatin complexes were eluted from the beads by two 1-h incubations with 160  microl of elution buffer (1% SDS, 0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	84	1 M NaHCO3) at room temperature.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	85	 The DNA-protein cross-links were reversed by incubating the samples at 65  degrees C for 12 h.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	86	 The RNA and protein in the samples were digested using an RNase mixture (Ambion) and 50  microg/ml proteinase K, respectively.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	87	 The DNA was purified using the QIAquick PCR purification kit (Qiagen) and resuspended in 50  microl of nuclease-free water.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	88	 Five microliter aliquots were used for each PCR or real time PCR utilizing primers specific for PEPCK or -actin promoters.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	89	 The forward primer used for the PEPCK gene promoter was 5'-GTTTCACGTCTCAGAGCTGA-3'; the reverse primer was 5'-ACCGTGACTGTTGCTGATGC-3'.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	90	 The forward and reverse primers used for the -actin gene promoter were described previously (18).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	91	 PCR products were run on a 2% agarose gel and visualized by ethidium bromide staining.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	92	 Real time PCR was performed as described above.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	93	 The antibodies used for GR, RAR, RXR, HNF3, HNF4, PCAF, p300, CBP, SRC-1, and p/CIP were obtained from Santa Cruz Biotechnology (Santa Cruz, CA); anti-RNA polymerase II was from Berkeley Antibody Co.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	94	Small Interfering RNA The mammalian vector pSUPER was used for the expression of siRNAs specifically targeted against rat p300 and CBP mRNAs.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	95	 The pSUPER vector consists of an H1-RNA promoter, which directs the synthesis of siRNA transcripts (19).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	96	 The target sequence of the p300 mRNA is a 21-nucleotide sequence corresponding to nucleotide positions 88 to 108 downstream from the transcription start site of this gene, which is separated by a 9-nucleotide noncomplementary spacer sequence followed by the reverse complement of the same 21-nucleotide sequence.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	97	 The cloning of the sequence was facilitated by BamHI and HindIII flanking sites.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	98	 This vector is referred to as p300 siRNA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	99	 The siRNA specific for CBP was made in a similar way by using a 21-nucleotide sequence corresponding to nucleotide positions 122 to 142 downstream of the transcription start site of this gene; the resulting vector is referred to as CBP siRNA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	100	Western Blot Analysis siRNA-treated KNRK cells were washed twice with ice-cold PBS.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	101	 These cells were disrupted in a detergent lysis buffer (20 mM Tris-HCl, pH 7.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	102	6, 1 mM EDTA, 1 mM EGTA, 1 mM Na3VO4, 20 mM Na4P2O7, 0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	103	2% Triton X-100, 10 nM microcystin, 0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	104	1 M phenylmethylsulfonyl fluoride, 1  microg/ml aprotinin, 1  microg/ml pepstatin, and 1  microg/ml leupeptin).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	105	 A 40- microg aliquot of protein from each treatment was loaded on a 6% Tris-glycine gel (Invitrogen).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	106	 After electrophoresis, the separated proteins were transferred to a nitrocellulose membrane (Invitrogen).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	107	 The membrane was incubated for 2 h with the appropriate antibody, followed by incubation with an anti-rabbit or anti-mouse IgG conjugated to horseradish peroxidase.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	108	 Immunoreactive proteins were detected using the ECL immunodetection system (Amersham Biosciences).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	109	 To assess the specificity of siRNA, the membrane probed with p300 antibody was re-probed with CBP antibody and vice versa.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	110	Statistical Analysis Statistical analyses were performed using Student's t test, with the significance level set at p  <  0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	111	   RESULTS TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION MATERIALS AND METHODS RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   Dexamethasone and Retinoic Acid Have a Synergistic Effect on PEPCK Gene Expression Dexamethasone (Dex) and retinoic acid (RA) each induce transcription of the PEPCK gene in H4IIE hepatoma cells through some shared DNA elements (2, 4, 7, 9, 13).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	112	 This is not a clonal cell line (20), so it is possible that different populations of cells in a culture respond to each inducer.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	113	 If so, the summed responses to the two ligands should be additive.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	114	 To determine the effect of the Dex/RA combination on PEPCK gene expression, real time RT-PCR assays were performed to quantify PEPCK mRNA upon Dex and/or RA treatment.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	115	 Cyclophilin mRNA was also measured as a normalization control.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	116	7-fold induction, respectively, and the combination resulted in a synergistic 13.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	117	3-fold effect in H4IIE cells (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	118	 In rat primary hepatocytes, PEPCK mRNA is induced 15- and 7.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	119	4-fold upon treatment with RA or Dex, respectively.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	120	 When both ligands are present, a much greater than additive 39-fold induction was observed (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	121	 This indication of an effect on mRNA induction within a single population of cells was confirmed at the protein level in an immunofluorescent experiment performed on primary hepatocytes.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	122	 PEPCK expression is induced in 71, 67, or 70% of hepatocytes upon treatment with RA, Dex, or Dex/RA, respectively (data not shown).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	123	 Because more than 50% of the cells respond to treatment with either or both ligands, we conclude that there are no discrete populations of hepatocytes that respond to either Dex or RA or to the combination.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	124	 Also, in keeping with the observations noted in Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	125	 1B, the intensity of staining was greater in the cells treated with the Dex/RA combination (data not shown).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	126	View larger version (20K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	127	 Regulation of PEPCK gene expression by Dex/RA in rat primary hepatocytes and H4IIE hepatoma cells.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	128	 A, H4IIE cells were serum-deprived overnight, and then were either left untreated or were treated with 500 nM Dex and/or 5  microM RA for 4 h.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	129	 Total RNA was extracted from these cells, and 0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	130	5  microg of RNA was subjected to reverse-transcription.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	131	 Real time PCRs were performed on the reverse-transcribed RNA using primers encoding cDNA sequences for PEPCK and cyclophilin, as described under "Materials and Methods.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	132	" B, the experiment described in A was performed using isolated rat hepatocytes.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	133	 Data were analyzed using the SDS version 1.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	134	 Results represent the means  plus or minus  S.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	135	 of four to six independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	136	 The horizontal bar in the Dex/RA column in this and other figures indicates the value that would have been achieved if the result was additive.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	137	  RAR/RXR Heterodimers at the gAF3 Element Are Primarily Involved in the Synergistic Effect The involvement of specific cis-elements and their cognate transcription factors in this synergistic effect was defined by using a number of variations of the PEPCK-LUC reporter plasmid, which contains the wild type PEPCK promoter from  to 467 to +69 ligated to the luciferase reporter gene.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	138	 Upon treatment of H4IIE cells with 5  microM RA, 500 nM Dex, or a combination of the two, PEPCK promoter-driven luciferase reporter gene expression is induced 3.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	139	 This greater than additive response is qualitatively similar to that noted in expression of the endogenous gene (see Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	140	 1A); hence, this transient transcription approach can be used to define the DNA elements and associated transcription factors involved in this response.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	141	View larger version (35K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	142	 The gAF3 element is primarily involved in the synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	143	 Mutations of PEPCK-LUC that replace gAF1, gAF2, or gAF3 with a Gal4 DNA-binding element(s) individually, or gAF1 and gAF3 in combination, were made.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	144	 H4IIE cells were transfected with 10  microg of a reporter plasmid (wild type or mutated forms of PEPCK-LUC) and 100 ng of PRL-SV40 Renilla luciferase vector as a control for transfection efficiency.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	145	 Cells were left untreated or were treated with 500 nM Dex and/or 5  microM RA for 18 h, and cell lysates were prepared for dual luciferase assays as described under "Materials and Methods.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	146	" Data represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	147	 of five to eight independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	148	 Results illustrated are normalized to the basal activity of each PEPCK-LUC reporter gene construct.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	149	  Mutations of PEPCK-LUC that replace gAF1, gAF2, or gAF3 with a Gal4 DNA-binding element(s) individually, or gAF1 and gAF3 in combination, were made to identify the involvement of these accessory elements in the synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	150	 Results consistent with previously published data from our laboratory show that any single mutation of these three gAFs reduces the Dex-induced response by about 50%, and the mutation of both gAF1 and gAF3 abolishes the response (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	151	 By contrast, the major effect of RA is facilitated through gAF3, although a small effect is mediated through gAF1.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	152	 gAF2 is not involved in the RA effect, as noted earlier (13).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	153	 Correspondingly, gAF2 has no qualitative effect on the synergistic response (the total effect is reduced because of the decreased response to Dex), whereas both gAF1, and especially gAF3, have major effects (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	154	The gAF1 element was converted to a consensus binding element for either HNF4 or COUP-TF which do not bind RXR (9).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	155	 In accordance with a previous observation, the presence of consensus HNF4- or COUP-TF-binding elements at gAF1 decreases the RA-induced response by about 50% (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	156	 A significant synergistic effect of Dex/RA was not achieved from these constructs.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	157	 However, the presence of a consensus RAR/RXR-binding element (cRARE) at gAF1, which excludes HNF4 or COUP-TF binding, promotes a significant increase of the RA response but reduces the Dex response by about 50% (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	158	 Nonetheless, the synergistic effect is fully supported when gAF1 is replaced by a cRARE (gAF1-cRARE PEPCK-LUC).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	159	View larger version (34K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	160	 cRARE at gAF1 restores the synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	161	 H4IIE cells were transiently transfected with 10  microg of wild type PEPCK-LUC or mutated forms of PEPCK-LUC in which the gAF1 element was replaced with a consensus binding element for either an HNF4, COUP-TF homodimer, or RAR/RXR heterodimers.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	162	 Cells were left untreated or were treated with 500 nM Dex and/or 5  microM RA for 18 h.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	163	 Dual luciferase assays were performed as described under "Materials and Methods.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	164	" The results illustrated are normalized to the basal activity of each PEPCK-LUC reporter gene construct.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	165	 Data represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	166	 of five to eight independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	167	  The gAF3 element includes two RAR/RXR sites, and , separated by a 5-bp linker sequence (see Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	168	 An E box, which binds the transcription factor USF, is located immediately downstream (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	169	 The and elements, and the E box, were mutated in the context of PEPCK-LUC to determine which component of gAF3 is involved in the synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	170	 As expected from previous studies (11), the E box mutation does not affect either of the Dex or RA responses nor does it have an effect on the Dex/RA response.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	171	 A mutation of the site slightly reduces the RA-induced response but has no significant effect on the Dex-induced response or on the Dex/RA-induced synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	172	 By contrast, a mutation of the site of gAF3 significantly reduces both the RA and Dex effects and abolishes the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	173	 These data indicate that transcription factors binding to the site of gAF3 mediate the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	174	View larger version (33K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	175	 The element in gAF3 is important for the synergistic effect of Dex/RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	176	 The components of gAF3 are illustrated in the top panel.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	177	 Transfection experiments were performed, as described in Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	178	 2, in H4IIE cells by using variations of PEPCK-LUC in which the , elements of gAF3, and the E box, were individually mutated.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	179	 The results illustrated are normalized to the basal activity of each PEPCK-LUC reporter gene construct.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	180	 Data represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	181	 of five to eight independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	182	  The approach employed in the experiment described in Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	183	 3 was used to infer the binding of transcription factors to the gAF3 element upon Dex/RA treatment (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	184	 The full synergistic effect was supported only when gAF3 was converted to a cRARE (gAF3-cRARE PEPCK-LUC).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	185	 The cRARE binds RAR/RXR heterodimers with a higher affinity than either HNF4 or COUP-TF (16), thus the RA response in a construct in which gAF3 was changed to a consensus RAR/RXR-binding element is greater than that obtained from the wild type PEPCK-LUC (12-fold versus 3.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	186	 The response of constructs in which both gAF1 and gAF3 were converted to cRAREs (gAF1/gAF3-cRARE PEPCK-LUC) was similar to that of gAF3-cRARE PEPCK-LUC (data not shown).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	187	 This implies that gAF3 is more important than gAF1 in promoting the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression and that ligand-bound RAR/RXR heterodimers play a critical role.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	188	View larger version (31K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	189	 cRARE at gAF3 restores the synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	190	 H4IIE cells were transiently transfected with 10  microg of PEPCK-LUC or mutated forms of PEPCK-LUC in which the gAF3 element was replaced with a consensus binding element for RAR/RXR heterodimers or a Gal4 DNA-binding element.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	191	 Cells were left untreated or were treated with 500 nM Dex and/or 5  microM RA for 18 h.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	192	 Dual luciferase assays were performed as described under "Materials and Methods.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	193	" The results illustrated are normalized to the basal activity of each PEPCK-LUC reporter construct.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	194	 Data are presented as the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	195	 of five to eight independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	196	  The GR1 Glucocorticoid Receptor-binding Site Is Involved in the Synergistic Effect Block mutations of GR1 and/or GR2, which prevent the binding of GR, were made in the context of the PEPCK-LUC construct.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	197	 6) reduces Dex-induced PEPCK gene expression by 60%, whereas mGR2 has little effect, as expected (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	198	 The synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression is totally abolished in mGR1 but is not affected by mGR2 (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	199	 These results indicate that GR1, but not GR2, is involved in the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression, which is consistent with our previous report (8) that GR1 is more important for Dex-induced PEPCK gene expression.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	200	View larger version (37K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	201	 GR1 is involved in the synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	202	 PEPCK-LUC constructs were made that contain a mutated GR1 (mGR1), a mutated GR2 (mGR2), a combined mutation of GR1 and GR2 (mGR1/2), or a palindromic GR-binding element (pal GR1).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	203	 H4IIE cells were transiently transfected with 10  microg of PEPCK-LUC or mutant forms of PEPCK-LUC.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	204	 The results illustrated are normalized to the basal activity of each PEPCK-LUC reporter gene construct.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	205	 Data represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	206	 of five to eight independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	207	  GR1 is a weak, nonconsensus GR-binding site which, by itself, cannot induce a Dex response on PEPCK gene expression (8).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	208	 The accessory factor elements gAF1 to gAF3, with associated transcription factors, increase the affinity of binding of liganded GR to GR1/GR2 and stabilize this binding (21).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	209	 The gAF1 and gAF3 accessory elements are not necessary when GR1/GR2 are replaced with high affinity, palindromic GR-binding elements (21).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	210	 To test whether ligand-activated RAR/RXR heterodimers are necessary in the presence of a high affinity GR-binding element, GR1 was converted to a palindromic glucocorticoid-response element (palGRE) in the context of PEPCK-LUC.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	211	 PEPCK luciferase activity is induced 80-fold by Dex in the context of palGR1 PEPCK-LUC, but when both Dex and RA are present, PEPCK gene expression is not further augmented (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	212	 Most interesting, the synergistic effect of Dex/RA is not seen when GR1 is converted to a palindromic high affinity GR-binding site, which is independent of gAF1 and gAF3 (8).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	213	 By contrast, when either gAF1 or gAF3 is converted to a consensus RAR/RXR-binding element, in the context of the wild type GR1/GR2 elements, the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression is actually augmented (see Figs.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	214	 Taken together, we conclude that the synergistic effect of Dex/RA involves enhanced GR binding to the nonconsensus GR1 element and that this may be facilitated by the binding of RAR/RXR heterodimers.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	215	Dex/RA Treatment Affects the Binding of Transcription Factors to the PEPCK Gene Promoter in Vivo ChIPs were performed in untreated and hormone-treated H4IIE cells to identify the in vivo binding profile of accessory factors, nuclear receptors, and coregulators to the PEPCK gene promoter.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	216	 GR is only recruited to the PEPCK gene promoter when Dex is present (1- versus 13.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	217	0-fold), as shown previously (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	218	 This association is increased by the combined Dex/RA treatment (13.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	219	 7, Table I), which is consistent with the functional data illustrated above.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	220	 This leads us to hypothesize that RAR/RXR heterodimers enhance GR binding/function.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	221	View larger version (28K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	222	 GR, RAR/RXR, HNF3, and HNF4 are present on the PEPCK gene promoter upon treatment with Dex/RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	223	 A, the association of GR, RAR, RXR, HNF3, and HNF4 with the endogenous PEPCK gene promoter was measured by ChIP in H4IIE cells treated for 2 h under the following conditions: no hormone, 5  microM RA, 500 nM Dex, or 500 nM Dex/5  microM RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	224	 No Ab lanes show the results of immunoprecipitations performed in parallel without the application of primary antibodies.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	225	 Input lanes show the results from samples not subjected to immunoprecipitation.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	226	 B, the association of GR, RAR, RXR, HNF3, and HNF4 with the endogenous -actin gene promoter was measured by ChIP, as a negative control.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	227	 Results are representative of four to six independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	228	View this table:    TABLE I The occupancy of the PEPCK gene promoter by transcription factors and coregulators changes upon treatment with Dex and/or RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	229	The numbers shown are derived from quantitative real time PCR analysis of PEPCK promoter fragments co-immunoprecipitated with the indicated antibody after ChIP.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	230	 The data are expressed as the fold difference relative to the control (untreated) samples from four to six independent assays.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	231	  In some genes RA is thought to bind to DNA-bound RAR/RXR heterodimers, and the RA-RAR interaction results in the release of a corepressor complex and the subsequent association of a coactivator complex (22, 23).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	232	 There is a significant association of RAR and RXR to the PEPCK gene promoter in the absence of ligand, but there is a substantial increase of binding of both (2-fold increase) when RA is added to the cells (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	233	 This association is not increased by the concomitant administration of Dex.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	234	HNF3 binds to the PEPCK gene promoter constitutively, presumably to gAF2 (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	235	 7) (10, 18), which is consistent with functional data in which we have shown that this element is not involved in either the RA or Dex/RA-induced synergistic responses on PEPCK gene expression (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	236	 HNF4 is also bound to the PEPCK gene promoter in untreated cells and in cells treated with Dex and/or RA (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	237	SRC-1 and p/CIP, members of the p160 nuclear receptor family, are recruited to the PEPCK gene promoter upon treatment with Dex and/or RA (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	238	 Although Dex causes a somewhat greater recruitment of SRC-1 and p/CIP to the PEPCK gene promoter than RA (3.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	239	8- versus 2-fold, respectively, Table I), the recruitment of these proteins is not further increased when both ligands are present.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	240	 PCAF, a HAT family protein, is present in H4IIE cells but is not located on the PEPCK gene promoter under any of these treatment conditions.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	241	 This is probably not due to epitope masking, as antibodies specific for different epitopes of PCAF were used.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	242	 CBP and p300 are both recruited to the PEPCK gene promoter upon Dex and/or RA treatment but, despite their structural homology, the binding of CBP and p300 differs.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	243	 The recruitment of CBP is induced 3.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	244	9-fold upon treatment with Dex or RA, respectively (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	245	 The recruitment of CBP is not further increased (6.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	246	5-fold) by combined treatment with Dex/RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	247	 By contrast, recruitment of p300 is increased 4.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	248	7-fold upon treatment with Dex/RA combination as compared with an 2.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	249	0-fold increase upon treatment with either RA or Dex alone, respectively.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	250	 Antibodies specific for different epitopes of CBP and p300 were also used in this experiment, and similar recruitment profiles of CBP and p300 were observed in each case (data not shown).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	251	 The increased recruitment of RNA pol II (2-, 2-, and 5-fold upon treatment with RA, Dex, and RA/Dex, respectively) parallels the change in p300 binding (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	252	 Similar changes in the binding patterns of these nuclear proteins were noted in primary hepatocytes (data not shown).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	253	View larger version (32K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	254	 Recruitment of p300 to the PEPCK gene promoter is increased upon treatment with Dex/RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	255	 A, the association of PCAF, SRC-1, p/CIP, CBP, p300, and pol II with the endogenous PEPCK gene promoter was measured by ChIP in H4IIE cells treated for 2 h under the following conditions: no hormone, 5  microM RA, 500 nM Dex, or 500 nM Dex/5  microM RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	256	 No Ab lanes show the results of immunoprecipitations performed in parallel without the application of primary antibodies.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	257	 Input lanes show the results from samples not subjected to immunoprecipitation.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	258	 B, the association of the above proteins with the endogenous -actin gene promoter was measured by ChIP, as a negative control.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	259	 Results are representative of four to six independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	260	  p300 Is Specifically Involved in the Synergistic Effect The difference in association of p300 and CBP when H4IIE cells are exposed to Dex/RA is interesting in view of the observation that these proteins interact with many transcription factors and nuclear receptors in the regulation of gene transcription and are often considered to be interchangeable.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	261	 Selective reduction of p300 or CBP was used to establish the role of these proteins in the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	262	 siRNAs directed against p300 or CBP mRNA were cloned into the pSUPER mammalian expression vector (designated as p300 siRNA and CBP siRNA, respectively).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	263	 A Western blot analysis, performed using cell lysates prepared 72 h after transfection of these siRNAs into KNRK cells, shows that the siRNA directed against either p300 or CBP mRNA inhibited the endogenous expression of each of these proteins (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	264	 To validate the specificity of the siRNAs, the nitrocellulose membrane used in the p300 analysis was re-blotted with the CBP antibody and vice versa.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	265	 The p300 siRNA does not affect CBP gene expression, nor does the CBP siRNA affect p300 gene expression.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	266	 -Actin expression is not affected by either treatment.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	267	 Thus, the siRNAs cause a major and selective reduction of the cognate proteins.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	268	View larger version (26K):    FIG.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	269	 Selective reduction of p300, but not CBP, results in a loss of the synergistic effect.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	270	 A, 2  microg of either the siRNA vector targeted against p300 or the empty pSUPER vector (control) was transiently transfected into rat KNRK cells (see "Materials and Methods").
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	271	 Cells were assayed for p300 expression 72 h after transfection using Western blot analysis of cell lysates.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	272	 The nitrocellulose membrane used in the p300 analysis was re-blotted with the CBP antibody to assess the specificity of the siRNA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	273	 -Actin was used to control for protein loading.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	274	 The data shown are representative of four separate experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	275	 B, a transfection experiment was performed as described in A using an siRNA vector targeted against CBP.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	276	 The nitrocellulose membrane used in the CBP analysis was re-blotted with the p300 antibody to assess the specificity of the siRNA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	277	 C, H4IIE cells were transiently transfected with 10  microg of PEPCK-LUC, 100 ng of PRL-SV40, 0.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	278	5  microg of RSV-GR, CMX-RAR, and CMX-RXR expression vectors with 15  microg of either pSUPER alone (control), p300 siRNA, or CBP siRNA for 72 h.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	279	 Cells were then left untreated or were treated with 500 nM Dex and/or 5  microM RA for 18 h before they were harvested.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	280	 Dual luciferase assays were performed as described under "Materials and Methods.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	281	" Results illustrated are normalized to the basal activity of PEPCK-LUC.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	282	 Data represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	283	 of four independent experiments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	284	  H4IIE cells were transfected with PEPCK-LUC, RSV-GR, CMX-RAR, and CMX-RXR expression vectors with either pSUPER alone (control), p300 siRNA, or CBP siRNA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	285	 5  microM RA, 500 nM Dex, or a combination of the two, was added to the cells 18 h before harvest.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	286	 By using PEPCK-LUC reporter gene expression with Dex/RA treatment as 100%, the induction by RA or Dex is 10 and 65%, respectively (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	287	 This is quantitatively similar to the pattern of endogenous PEPCK gene expression.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	288	 The Dex-induced response was reduced to 35% of the maximal response in p300 siRNA-transfected H4IIE cells.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	289	 By contrast, the RA-induced response was not changed.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	290	 The Dex/RA-induced response is, however, reduced to 37%, which is similar to the reduction of the Dex-induced response.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	291	 This result indicates that the synergy achieved with Dex/RA is abolished when p300 expression is reduced.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	292	 The Dex-induced response was also reduced to 29% in CBP siRNA-transfected H4IIE cells, and the RA-induced response was not affected.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	293	 The Dex/RA-induced response was only reduced to 53%, which is mainly because of the decreased response to Dex; however, the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression still remained (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	294	 These results indicate that p300, but not CBP, is involved in the synergistic effect of Dex/RA on PEPCK gene expression.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	295	   DISCUSSION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION MATERIALS AND METHODS RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES   The GRU and RARU in the PEPCK gene promoter consist of several overlapping DNA elements, as described in the Introduction.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	296	 Although any of these DNA elements and associated factors could be involved in the synergistic action of Dex/RA, it appears that gAF3, and to a lesser extent gAF1, are of most importance, and gAF2 is not involved (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	297	 In particular, the site of gAF3, which binds a RAR/RXR heterodimer, is critical (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	298	 The role of RAR/RXR binding is supported by the observation that substitution of an element at gAF1, which selectively binds RAR/RXR, promotes synergism, but elements that selectively bind either HNF4 or COUP-TF, which bind to the wild type gAF1, do not (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	299	 Finally, the substitution of a consensus RARE at gAF1 (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	300	 3), and especially at gAF3 (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	301	 5), markedly enhances the synergistic effect; the cRARE at gAF3 results in a 4-fold greater synergistic response than that obtained from the wild type promoter (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	302	The Dex response was reduced by 50 to 60% in the experiment in which a cRARE was substituted for gAF3, which normally binds COUP-TF as an accessory factor in the Dex response (11, 13).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	303	 Thus, unliganded RAR/RXR, if bound to the cRARE, cannot serve as an accessory factor for the Dex response.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	304	 However, when RA is added, a robust synergistic effect is obtained, as noted above (and Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	305	 Although indirect, this suggests that ligand-bound RAR/RXR can serve as an accessory factor in the Dex response.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	306	The role of the accessory factors at gAF1, gAF2, and gAF3 (HNF4/COUP-TF, HNF3, and COUP-TF, respectively) is to increase the affinity of binding of GR to the GR1 element (21).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	307	 Thus, when GR1 is converted to a high affinity site, gAF1 and gAF3 have no additional effect on GR binding (21).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	308	 Likewise, when GR1 is converted to a palindromic GRE, PEPCK gene expression is at the maximal rate, and there is no additional or synergistic effect of RA (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	309	It is reasonable to presume that Dex and RA each induce the formation of unique transcription complexes and that the combination of Dex/RA results in yet another complex.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	310	 We began an exploration of this topic by using the ChIP assay.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	311	 As noted previously (18), GR is absent from the PEPCK gene promoter in the absence of ligand.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	312	 The addition of Dex results in a 13-fold increase in GR occupancy on the promoter (Table I).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	313	 Small amounts of RAR and RXR appear on the promoter in the absence of ligand; a 2 to 2.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	314	5-fold increase in the binding of both occurs after the addition of RA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	315	 Interestingly, the Dex/RA combination has no effect on RAR and RXR occupancy, but GR binding increases from 13- to 21-fold.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	316	 This is in concert with the observation that RAR/RXR acts as an accessory factor to increase the affinity of GR binding and to enhance transcription (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	317	 The occupancy of the accessory factors HNF4 and HNF3 is not affected by any treatment, as noted previously (18).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	318	The promoter occupancy of PCAF, SRC-1, p/CIP, p300, and CBP was analyzed under the various hormone treatments.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	319	 There was no binding of PCAF under any of the treatment conditions (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	320	 This was somewhat surprising in view of the observations that RA-activated RAR/RXR heterodimers recruit PCAF to DNA segments that contain the typical DR5 RARE in vitro (26).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	321	 RA and Dex each recruit p/CIP and SRC-1; however, there is no additional binding when the Dex/RA combination is employed.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	322	 Indeed, the binding of these p160 family members is the same in Dex/RA as in Dex-only treated cells (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	323	 A different pattern was noted with CBP.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	324	 RA treatment resulted in more recruitment of CBP than did Dex treatment, and the Dex/RA level was equivalent to that of RA alone.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	325	 The most interesting observation concerns the binding of p300 to the PEPCK gene promoter.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	326	 RA and Dex each increase the binding of p300 by 2-fold; however, the combination results in about a 5-fold increase (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	327	 A similar quantitative change occurs with the binding of pol II to the promoter (Table I).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	328	 In concert with this observation, McGrane and co-workers (27) recently showed that pol II association with the PEPCK gene promoter is reduced in vitamin A-deficient mice.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	329	A key role for p300 in the synergistic action of Dex/RA was established by selectively reducing the cellular levels of p300 and CBP by siRNA.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	330	 Elimination of either had no effect on the RA response, whereas both reduced the Dex effect by about 50%.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	331	 The absence of CBP had no effect on the synergistic effect of the Dex/RA combination, but removal of p300 abolished the response (Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	332	 CBP and p300 are closely related proteins.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	333	 Although encoded by different genes, they have several functional domains in common.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	334	 The designation CBP/p300 implies a common overall function; however, recent reports (28) suggest each may govern unique cellular events.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	335	 Mice with inactivation of a single allele of CBP develop a variety of hematological abnormalities that were not seen in mice that had a similar inactivating mutation in one of the p300 alleles.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	336	 By contrast, the selective reduction of p300 makes F9 cells resistant to RA-induced differentiation, whereas a similar reduction of CBP has no effect (29).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	337	The linear increase of the recruitment of p300 and pol II in conjunction with a nonlinear increase of the transcription response is not unexpected.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	338	 Veitia (30) has explained this in the context of a series of cooperative interactions between promoter elements/enhancers and transcription factors with a succession of coregulator proteins and ultimately the basal transcription apparatus.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	339	 The activation of the interferon- gene in response to viral infection is a case in point.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	340	 The synergistic transcription response of this gene is thought to be the result of the formation of a unique activating surface composed of a domain in the p65 subunit of NFB and the activation domains of IRF1 and ATF-2/c-Jun with the architectural protein HMGI(Y).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	341	 This enhanceosome recruits CBP/p300 to the basal transcription complex (31).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	342	 The likely participation of other components unique to the complex assembled on the PEPCK gene promoter in response to Dex/RA awaits further investigation.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	343	In addition to the PEPCK gene, a number of other genes that encode enzymes involved in metabolic processes have promoters that allow for a range of gene expression.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	344	 Examples include the tyrosine aminotransferase, fatty-acid synthase, L-type pyruvate kinase, insulin-like growth factor-binding proteins, and the glucose 6-phosphate catalytic subunit genes (32 to 37).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	345	 We have used the phrase "metabolic control domain" (MCD) to describe an array of DNA elements and associated transcription factors that provide an integrated response to a variety of signals (2, 15).
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	346	 As the PEPCK gene MCD is elucidated, the central importance of one element, gAF3, has become apparent.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	347	 4) is involved as an accessory factor in the glucocorticoid response (8), as an important element in the retinoic acid response (7), the thyroid hormone response (5), as a component of the cyclic AMP response unit (15), in the amplifying effect of PGC-1 (38), and now in the synergistic effect of Dex/RA (Figs.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	348	 The proteins known to bind to gAF3 include COUP-TF and RAR/RXR.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	349	 It remains to be seen whether these proteins account for all of the roles played by this interesting element in the MCD.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	350	Insulin and glucose, by inhibiting basal and hormone-induced transcription (3, 6, 25), set the lower end of expression of the PEPCK gene.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	351	 The synergistic effect of Dex/RA sets the upper end and expands the repertoire of responses available from this MCD.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	352	 In this regard, it is interesting that RA affords no additional response in the presence of a high affinity GR-binding element (cGRE, Fig.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	353	 6), which elicits an exaggerated response from this otherwise wild type promoter.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	354	 When considered in the context of the MCD, the PEPCK gene promoter may have evolved to have a weak GRE (GR1) which, when combined with the variety of other elements and cognate transcription factors described above, allows for a graduated response between off and fully on and therefore a very flexible means of adjusting the rate of gluconeogenesis.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	355	   FOOTNOTES   * This work was supported by National Institutes of Health Grants DK35107 and DK20593 from the Vanderbilt Diabetes Research and Training Center and by a Mentor-based fellowship award from the American Diabetes Association (to B.

0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	357	 This article must therefore be hereby marked "advertisement" in accordance with 18 U.
0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	358	 Section 1734 solely to indicate this fact.

0.21842672.15166231.html.plaintext.txt	360	 of Molecular Physiology and Biophysics, Vanderbilt University School of Medicine, Nashville, TN 37232-0615.
