0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	0	Chicken Ovalbumin Upstream Promoter-Transcription Factor Is a Negative Regulator of Steroidogenesis in Bovine Adrenal Glomerulosa Cells Carine F.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	1	 Buholzer, Jean-Francois Arrighi, Shahnaz Abraham, Vincent Piguet, Alessandro M.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	2	Division of Endocrinology, Diabetology and Nutrition (C.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	3	) and Department of Dermatology and Venereology (J.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	4	), University Hospital, CH-1211 Geneva 14, Switzerland.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	5	Address all correspondence and requests for reprints to: Professor Alessandro M.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	6	 Capponi, Division of Endocrinology, Diabetology, and Nutrition, University Hospital, 24 rue Micheli-du-Crest, CH-1211 Geneva 14, Switzerland.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	7	   ABSTRACT TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION RESULTS DISCUSSION MATERIALS AND METHODS REFERENCES   The octapeptide hormone, angiotensin II (AngII) and ACTH stimulate mineralocorticoid biosynthesis in the zona glomerulosa of the adrenal cortex in part by promoting the transcription of the gene coding for the steroidogenic acute regulatory (StAR) protein.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	8	 We have examined whether chicken ovalbumin upstream promoter-transcription factor (COUP-TF), a member of the orphan nuclear receptor family of transcription factors, is involved in this transcriptional regulation.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	9	 We analyzed COUP-TF and StAR mRNA and protein levels in bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells in primary culture.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	10	 COUP-TF protein was readily detectable in nonstimulated cells, and AngII markedly reduced its expression in a time- and concentration-dependent manner (IC50 = 1 nM), to 46  plus or minus  4.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	11	4% of control levels after 6 h, (n = 3; P  <  0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	12	 This repression was paralleled by a marked decrease in COUP-TF mRNA levels, reaching 18  plus or minus  8.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	13	01) after 6 h and by a 20-fold increase in aldosterone output.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	14	 In bovine glomerulosa cells overexpressing COUP-TFI and -II, the induction of StAR mRNA and protein elicited by AngII was completely suppressed to control levels, and the aldosterone response was significantly reduced (from 4.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	15	1-fold the basal value in mock-infected cells to 1.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	16	7-fold in COUP-TFI- and COUP-TFII-expressing cells, respectively; n = 3; P  <  0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	17	 Finally, by using electrophoretic mobility shift assays and chromatin immunoprecipitation, we have shown a direct interaction between COUP-TF and the proximal StAR promoter.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	18	 These results suggest that COUP-TF exerts a tonic inhibition on steroidogenesis by repressing StAR protein expression and that activators of aldosterone biosynthesis lift this inhibition in part by repressing COUP-TF levels.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	19	   INTRODUCTION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION RESULTS DISCUSSION MATERIALS AND METHODS REFERENCES   THE MAIN MINERALOCORTICOID, aldosterone, is synthesized primarily in the zona glomerulosa of the adrenal cortex, under the control of three major physiological stimuli, the octapeptide hormone angiotensin II (AngII), ACTH, and extracellular potassium (K+) (1).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	20	 Aldosterone is synthesized from cholesterol, the common precursor of all steroid hormones, which is stored within intracellular lipid droplets as cholesterol esters and mobilized to the mitochondrion by cholesterol ester hydrolase upon stimulation (2).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	21	 The rate-limiting step in the activation of steroidogenesis is the delivery of cholesterol from the mitochondrial outer membrane to the inner membrane, where the cytochrome P450 side-chain cleavage enzyme is located (3).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	22	 Within the mitochondria, cholesterol undergoes an enzymatic cascade leading eventually to the formation of aldosterone.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	23	This crucial step of intramitochondrial cholesterol transfer is performed by the steroidogenic acute regulatory (StAR) protein (4, 5).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	24	 The ultimate demonstration of the indispensable role of the StAR protein came from congenital lipoid adrenal hyperplasia, an inherited disease that leads to a dramatic deficiency in all steroid hormones and in which loss of function mutations have been discovered in the StAR gene (6).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	25	Because the StAR protein mediates the rate-limiting step in steroidogenesis, its expression must be finely regulated.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	26	 Indeed, in human NCI-H295R adrenocortical carcinoma cells, hormone-stimulated StAR protein synthesis and steroid production are prevented by inhibition of RNA synthesis (7).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	27	 In bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells in primary culture, mimicking the calcium signal gener ated by AngII leads to increased expression of StAR mRNA and protein (8).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	28	 Similarly, treatment of human NCI-H295R cells with AngII results in an increase in StAR mRNA levels within 30 min, with maximal levels being reached within 6 h (7, 9).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	29	 These results clearly indicate a transcriptional regulation of AngII on StAR gene expression.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	30	 Various consensus response elements have been identified in the StAR gene promoter (10).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	31	 Although promoter mapping studies have provided extensive information on activators of the StAR gene, the role of transcription factors that repress StAR protein expression has received less attention.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	32	 The best characterized repressor of the StAR gene is DAX-1 (dosage-sensitive sex reversal, adrenal hypoplasia congenita critical region on the X chromosome, gene 1), a member of the orphan nuclear receptor family (11, 12, 13).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	33	 Our laboratory has recently demonstrated that AngII powerfully represses DAX-1 expression in bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells, thus leading to increased StAR expression and aldosterone production (14).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	34	Another potential candidate for a negative regulation of the StAR gene is chicken ovalbumin upstream promoter-transcription factor (COUP-TF), which is usually present as two isoforms, COUP-TFI and COUP-TFII (15, 16).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	35	 These orphan members of the steroid receptor superfamily play distinct and crucial roles in fetal development of the nervous (17) and cardiovascular (18) systems.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	36	 In addition to these well-established developmental effects in fetal life, the following pieces of evidence suggest a direct or indirect interaction between COUP-TF and the promoter of the StAR gene and thus an involvement of COUP-TF in adult steroidogenic cell function.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	37	 First, COUP-TF colocalizes in the nuclei of the adrenal cells with DAX-1 and steroidogenic factor-1 (SF-1), two transcription factors involved in steroidogenesis and in StAR regulation, and its expression is modulated in adrenocortical adenomas, COUP-TFI being lower in aldosterone-producing tumors than in normal tissue (19, 20) and COUP-TFII appearing to be increased in aldosteronoma cells (21).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	38	 In normal adrenocortical tissue, COUP-TFI and -II expression levels appear to be qualitatively equivalent (20).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	39	 Second, it has been recently shown that SF-1 and COUP-TF can activate and repress, respectively, bovine CYP17 gene transcription in Y-1 mouse adrenocortical cells (22, 23).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	40	 Third, a similar competition between SF-1 and COUP-TF for a composite binding site has been demonstrated for other genes involved in steroidogenesis, including human aldosterone synthase, aromatase, and murine DAX-1 genes (23, 24, 25).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	41	 Taken together, these data raise the question of a possible negative role of COUP-TF in the regulation of StAR gene expression.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	42	In the present work, we have therefore examined whether COUP-TFs are involved in the regulation of basal and AngII- or ACTH-induced aldosterone biosynthesis in bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells in primary culture.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	43	 Our results show clearly that COUP-TF is a negative regulator of mineralocorticoid biosynthesis.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	44	   RESULTS TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION RESULTS DISCUSSION MATERIALS AND METHODS REFERENCES   COUP-TF Protein Levels in Bovine Glomerulosa Cells and Modulation by AngII and Forskolin We first examined whether bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells in primary culture express COUP-TF protein.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	45	 1A, a robust COUP-TF signal was detected upon Western blot analysis of nuclear proteins from nonstimulated cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	46	 When glomerulosa cells were challenged for 6 h with AngII, a concentration-dependent decrease in COUP-TF protein levels was observed, an inhibition to 46  plus or minus  4.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	47	4% of control levels being reached with 10 nM AngII (n = 3; P  <  0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	48	 Cultured bovine glomerulosa cells produced significant amounts of aldosterone into the medium (2.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	49	2 fmol/ microg protein/6 h), and AngII stimulation for 6 h increased aldosterone production 20-fold to 44.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	50	2 fmol/ microg/6 h (n = 3; P  <  0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	51	 A similar activation of aldosterone production was obtained with forskolin, used as a mimicker of ACTH, to 42.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	52	5 fmol/ microg/6 h (n = 3; P  <  0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	53	 To determine the kinetics of the effect of AngII on COUP-TF protein expression, we incubated glomerulosa cells with 10 nM AngII for various periods of time ranging from 0 to 15 h.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	54	 2, the inhibitory effect of AngII was time dependent: COUP-TF protein levels started to decrease after 30 min, and a complete abolition was reached within 15 h of treatment.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	55	View larger version (21K):    Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	56	 AngII Represses COUP-TF Protein Levels in a Concentration-Dependent Manner.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	57	Bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells were stimulated for 6 h with AngII at various concentrations.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	58	 COUP-TF was determined in nuclear extracts and aldosterone was measured in the incubation medium as described in Materials and Methods.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	59	 A, Representative Western blot of COUP-TF.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	60	 B, Densitometric analysis of COUP-TF levels in AngII-stimulated glomerulosa cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	61	 C, Aldosterone production in response to AngII (10 nM) or forskolin (Fk, 25  microM).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	62	 Each value is the mean  plus or minus  SEM of three experiments performed with separate cell preparations.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	63	  View larger version (26K):    Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	64	 Time-Dependent Repression of COUP-TF Protein by AngII.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	65	Bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells were treated with AngII (10 nM) for the indicated periods of time, after which COUP-TF protein was determined in nuclear extracts as described in Materials and Methods.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	66	 A, Representative Western blot of COUP-TF.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	67	 B, Densitometric analysis of COUP-TF levels in AngII-stimulated cells as a function of time, expressed as percentage of control values (Ctrl) at time zero.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	68	 Each point is the mean value from two separate experiments.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	69	  AngII-Induced Repression of COUP-TF Is Independent of Protein Synthesis AngII-induced inhibition of COUP-TF protein expression was paralleled by a decrease in COUP-TF mRNA levels, an inhibition to 18  plus or minus  8.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	70	01) being reached with 10 nM AngII after 6 h, as shown in Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	71	 To determine whether de novo protein synthesis is required for AngII-mediated COUP-TF repression, we treated bovine glomerulosa cells for 6 h with 10 nM AngII in the presence of 10  microg/ml cycloheximide, a protein synthesis inhibitor.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	72	 Blockade of protein synthesis affected neither the inhibitory effect of AngII on COUP-TF mRNA expression (Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	73	 3, A and B) nor its repression of COUP-TF protein levels in glomerulosa cells (Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	74	 These observations suggest that de novo protein synthesis is not required for AngII-induced repression of COUP-TF.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	75	 In this same series of experiments, forskolin was as potent as AngII in repressing COUP-TF mRNA (data not shown) and protein levels (Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	76	View larger version (29K):    Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	77	 Effect of AngII and Cycloheximide (CHX) Treatment on COUP-TF mRNA and Protein Levels.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	78	Bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells were treated for 6 h with AngII (10 nM) in the absence or in the presence of 10  microg/ml cycloheximide.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	79	 COUP-TF mRNA and protein levels were determined by Northern blot and Western blot analysis, respectively, as described in Materials and Methods.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	80	 A, Representative Northern blot of COUP-TF mRNA.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	81	 B, Densitometric analysis of COUP-TF mRNA levels in glomerulosa cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	82	 C, Representative Western blot of COUP-TF.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	83	 D, Densitometric analysis of COUP-TF protein levels in glomerulosa cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	84	 Values are means  plus or minus  SEM from three separate experiments.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	85	  AngII Does Not Affect COUP-TF mRNA Stability To determine whether AngII affects COUP-TF mRNA stability, we incubated control and AngII-stimulated adrenal glomerulosa cells in the presence of 1  microg/ml actinomycin D, a transcription inhibitor, for various periods of time and determined COUP-TF mRNA levels by Northern blot analysis.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	86	 4, in the presence of actinomycin, COUP-TFI mRNA decayed with a half-life of approximately 8 h, and AngII did not alter COUP-TFI mRNA stability over a 24-h period.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	87	View larger version (31K):    Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	88	 Effect of Actinomycin D on COUP-TFI mRNA Levels in AngII-Treated Bovine Adrenal Glomerulosa Cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	89	Bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells were treated with 2.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	90	5  microg/ml actinomycin D in the absence or in the presence of AngII (10 nM) for the indicated periods of time.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	91	 COUP-TFI mRNA levels were determined by Northern blot analysis as described in Materials and Methods.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	92	 A, Representative Northern blot of COUP-TFI.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	93	 B, Densitometric analysis of COUP-TFI mRNA levels.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	94	 Values are means  plus or minus  SEM from three separate experiments.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	95	  Effect of COUP-TF Overexpression on StAR Expression and on Mineralocorticoid Production Lentiviral vectors have proven to be highly useful infection tools.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	96	 Indeed, HIV-derived lentiviral vectors efficiently integrate into nondividing cells (31, 32).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	97	 Because bovine glomerulosa cells in primary culture are practically quiescent and in view of the relatively low transfection efficacy obtained in these cells with the usual transfection reagents, we used HIV-derived vectors to overexpress COUP-TFI and -II in glomerulosa cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	98	 We first infected bovine glomerulosa cells with lentiviral vectors encoding green fluorescent protein (GFP) under control of the human phospholgycerate kinase (hPGK) promoter.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	99	 The infected cells were analyzed for GFP fluorescence by flow-cytometric analysis 5 d after infection.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	100	 Ninety-one percent of the cells infected with 500 ng p24 expressed GFP (data not shown).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	101	 Bovine glomerulosa cells in primary culture were then infected with lentiviral vectors encoding for murine COUP-TFI or COUP-TFII under control of the hPGK promoter.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	102	 Five days after infection, cells were incubated in the presence of 10 nM AngII for 6 h, and StAR, COUP-TFI, and COUP-TFII mRNA levels were determined by RT-PCR with bovine- and mouse-specific primers.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	103	 As expected, no endogenous signal was detected in noninfected and mock-infected cells because we used murine probes (Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	104	 In contrast, the infected cells displayed robust expression of mouse COUP-TFI and -II mRNA, as determined by RT-PCR with mouse-specific primers.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	105	 5B, AngII treatment for 6 h induced an increase of StAR mRNA levels in noninfected and mock-infected cells [to 172  plus or minus  14% and 165  plus or minus  10% of controls, respectively (n = 3; P  <  0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	106	 This increase was entirely blocked in cells overexpressing either COUP-TFI [104  plus or minus  12% of controls; n = 3; not significantly different (NS; P  >  0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	107	05)] or COUP-TFII (82  plus or minus  24% of controls; n = 3; NS) (Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	108	View larger version (32K):    Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	109	 Effect of COUP-TFI and II Overexpression on StAR mRNA Levels and Aldosterone Production in Bovine Adrenal Glomerulosa Cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	110	The COUP-TFI and -II isoforms were overexpressed in bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells using lentiviral vectors.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	111	 StAR mRNA levels and aldosterone production were determined in control (Ctrl) and AngII-stimulated (10 nM, 6 h), noninfected (NI), mock-infected (Mock), and COUP-TFI- or COUP-TFII-infected cells as described in Materials and Methods.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	112	 A, Representative ethidium bromide staining of murine COUP-TFI and -II mRNA amplified by RT-PCR in control glomerulosa cells and in cells infected with the pRRL-sin-ppt-hPGK viral vector, either mock or encoding for COUP-TFI or -II.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	113	 B, Densitometric analysis of StAR mRNA in control cells and in cells challenged with AngII.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	114	 C, Basal and AngII-stimulated aldosterone production in the medium of control and infected bovine glomerulosa cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	115	 Values are means  plus or minus  SEM, from three separate experiments.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	116	  Paralleling the effect on StAR mRNA under conditions of COUP-TF overexpression, we observed that the AngII-induced increase of StAR protein levels in nontransfected and mock-transfected cells (to 161  plus or minus  5.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	117	5% of controls, respectively; n = 3; P  <  0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	118	01 for both values) was entirely blocked in cells overexpressing COUP-TFI (87  plus or minus  3.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	119	2% of controls; n = 3; NS) (Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	120	View larger version (29K):    Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	121	 Effect of COUP-TFI Overexpression on StAR Protein Levels in Bovine Adrenal Glomerulosa Cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	122	COUP-TFI was overexpressed in bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells using a classical transient transfection technique as described in Materials and Methods.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	123	 StAR protein levels were determined by Western blot after 10 nM AngII treatment of the cells for 6 h.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	124	 A, Representative Western blot.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	125	 B, Densitometric analysis of StAR protein levels.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	126	 Values are means  plus or minus  SEM from three separate experiments.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	127	, Staining of the gel with Coomassie blue to ensure that equal amounts of protein have been loaded.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	128	  Basal aldosterone production rate amounted to 3.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	129	4 fmol/ microg protein/6 h in both untreated noninfected and mock-infected cells and rose to 17.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	130	6 fmol/ microg protein/6 h in noninfected cells and to 16.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	131	4 fmol/ microg protein/6 h in mock-infected cells under AngII challenge (n = 3; P  <  0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	132	 In contrast, AngII only increased aldosterone production from 5.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	133	0 fmol/ microg protein/6 h in cells overexpressing COUP-TFI and from 4.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	134	7 fmol/ microg protein/6 h in cells overexpressing COUP-TFII (n = 3; P  <  0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	135	 AngII response in noninfected cells) (Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	136	Effect of COUP-TFI on StAR Promoter Activity To gain further insight into the regulation of StAR gene expression by COUP-TFs, we performed a dual luciferase reporter assay in bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells in primary culture.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	137	3-kb human StAR promoter region directing the expression of the luciferase reporter gene (Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	138	 7A) was transfected into bovine glomerulosa cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	139	 Treatment of the cells with AngII 10 to 8 M for 6 h significantly increased StAR promoter activity 2.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	140	 7B, this AngII-induced effect was completely abolished in cells that had been cotransfected with either COUP-TFI (0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	141	 mock-transfected cells for both treatments).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	142	View larger version (34K):    Fig.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	143	 COUP-TFI and -II Prevent StAR Promoter Activity by Directly Interacting with the StAR Promoter in Bovine Adrenal Glomerulosa Cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	144	A, COUP-TFI and -II were cotransfected with the StAR-luc reporter construct in bovine glomerulosa cells in primary culture as described in Materials and Methods.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	145	 B, Densitometric analysis of the relative StAR promoter activity in mock-transfected and COUP-TFI- and COUP-TFII-overexpressing cells, in the presence and absence of 10 nM AngII.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	146	 C, EMSA: nuclear extracts derived from control bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells or cells stimulated with 10 nM AngII were incubated with the labeled StAR promoter fragment probe (see Materials and Methods) in the absence or in the presence of a purified COUP-TFI antibody and submitted to PAGE followed by autoradiography.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	147	 The EMSA is representative of three separate experiments yielding similar results.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	148	 D, ChIP assay was performed on bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells using a purified COUP-TFI antibody for immunoprecipitation and specific primers corresponding to the StAR promoter for real-time PCR, as described in detail in Materials and Methods.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	149	 Representative agarose gel of the amplification product.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	150	 E, Densitometric analysis of the ChIP assay.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	151	 Values are means  plus or minus  SEM from three separate experiments.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	152	  Interaction of COUP-TFI with the StAR Promoter To examine whether the transcription factor COUP-TFI interacts directly with the StAR promoter for its action, we performed EMSAs.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	153	 Because direct competition between SF-1 and COUP-TF is known for binding to other gene promoters, we used a 23-bp DNA fragment containing the proximal SF-1 response element of the bovine StAR promoter as a probe.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	154	 7C, lanes 2 and 3, nuclear extracts of bovine glomerulosa cells shifted the labeled probe, generating at least two bands.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	155	 When the nuclear extracts were preincubated with a purified antibody directed against COUP-TFI, the intensity of the shifted bands was dramatically reduced, thus suggesting that COUP-TFI binds to the proximal StAR promoter in vitro (lanes 4 and 5).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	156	 No significant differences in the intensity of the shifted bands were observed with nuclear extracts from AngII-treated cells (lanes 3 and 5) in this qualitative assay.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	157	Finally, this interaction was confirmed by in vivo analysis of the physical interaction between COUP-TFI and the StAR promoter, using the chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP) assay.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	158	 7, D and E, immunoprecipitation with a COUP-TFI antibody of nuclear extracts of glomerulosa cells, followed by real-time PCR of the StAR promoter, yielded a band of the expected size on agarose gel, indicating that the StAR promoter was immunoprecipitated with COUP-TFI and thus strongly suggesting an interaction between COUP-TFI and the proximal StAR promoter.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	159	 Furthermore, when ChIP was performed on chromatin extracted from AngII-treated cells, a marked and significant decrease in the intensity of the StAR promoter band was observed (61.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	160	   DISCUSSION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION RESULTS DISCUSSION MATERIALS AND METHODS REFERENCES   The StAR protein plays a rate-limiting, pivotal role in the activation of steroidogenesis (5).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	161	 The present study was undertaken in an attempt to investigate the mechanism(s) of the known induction of StAR protein expression in adrenal glomerulosa cells in response to two physiological activators of aldosterone biosynthesis, the octapeptide hormone AngII and ACTH (9, 33).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	162	 Specifically, we have examined a possible role of COUP-TF proteins in this process.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	163	Four main conclusions can be drawn from the present work: 1) COUP-TF proteins are abundantly present in bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells in primary culture and are repressed by AngII and forskolin; 2) COUP-TFI and -II repress AngII-induced StAR mRNA and protein expression; 3) COUP-TFI and -II overexpression prevents AngII-induced mineralocorticoid biosynthesis; 4) COUP-TFI interacts directly with the proximal StAR promoter.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	164	First, in agreement with previous immunohistochemical studies performed in mice (18), we detected high basal COUP-TF protein levels in resting bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	165	 In man, recent studies have shown that COUP-TF expression is inversely correlated with steroid production in adrenocortical tumors (20).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	166	 These data suggested that this transcription factor could function as a repressor of steroidogenesis and that the mechanism of action of physiological activators of steroid production, such as AngII or ACTH (mimicked by forskolin), could operate, in part, through a reduction of COUP-TF protein levels.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	167	 Indeed, as shown in the present study, both AngII and forskolin strongly diminished COUP-TF mRNA and protein expression, over a range of concentrations similar to those used to induce aldosterone production.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	168	Second, we observed that COUP-TFI and -II repressed StAR mRNA and protein expression.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	169	 Because the StAR protein controls the rate-limiting step of steroidogenesis, we hypothesized that COUP-TF might act at this level.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	170	 COUP-TF is known to negatively regulate the transcriptional activity of SF-1 and to repress various actors in the steroidogenic cascade (23, 34), such as the gene encoding cytochrome P450 steroid 17-hydroxylase, by competing with SF-1 for the binding to repeated cAMP-responsive sequences spaced by six nucleotides (repCRS2) (35).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	171	 Furthermore, COUP-TF and SF-1 have also been shown to bind to overlapping binding sites involved in the regulation of the oxytocin gene in the bovine ovary (36).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	172	 Although multiple SF-1 binding elements required for hormonal induction have been identified in the StAR protein gene 5'-flanking promoter region (10, 37, 38), COUP-TF has not been reported, so far, to bind to the StAR promoter or to affect its activity.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	173	 Interestingly, our laboratory has demonstrated recently that the levels of another orphan nuclear receptor, DAX-1, which is known to repress StAR protein expression also by interacting negatively with SF-1 either directly or indirectly (12), are down-regulated by AngII and forskolin in bovine adrenal glomerulosa cells and that this effect is correlated inversely with StAR protein expression and aldosterone biosynthesis (14).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	174	We therefore examined whether COUP-TF could repress StAR expression levels by overexpressing the transcription factor in bovine glomerulosa cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	175	 To overcome the usually low rates of efficiency observed in these cells when utilizing classical transfection reagents, we have used an HIV-derived lentiviral system yielding high levels of gene delivery in primary cells (27, 28).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	176	 Indeed, infected bovine glomerulosa cells expressed high amounts of exogenous, murine COUP-TFI and -II mRNA that could be distinguished from endogenous COUP-TF mRNAs by using species-specific primers for the RT-PCR amplification.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	177	 Moreover, we show here that overexpression of either isoform of COUP-TF resulted in a complete suppression of AngII-induced StAR mRNA and protein induction, a finding strongly suggesting a direct or indirect repressor role for COUP-TF on StAR promoter activity.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	178	 These results were indeed confirmed by luciferase reporter gene assay of the StAR promoter in cells overexpressing COUP-TF, which showed a dramatic reduction in AngII-induced StAR promoter activity.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	179	 COUP-TFI and COUP-TFII were equally effective in repressing StAR mRNA expression, although only the latter has been shown to be expressed in the cortex of the adrenal gland during organogenesis in mice (18).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	180	 However, both COUP-TFI and COUP-TFII have been shown to be present in normal and tumoral human adrenocortical tissue in immunohistological studies (19, 21), and we observed a similar expression pattern of the mRNA of both isoforms in bovine glomerulosa cells (data not shown).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	181	Third, at the functional level, we observed an inverse relationship between mRNA COUP-TF levels and AngII-induced aldosterone output, a finding that corroborates our hypothesis that the hormone acts by lifting the repression exerted by COUP-TF on StAR gene expression.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	182	 Interestingly, overexpression of COUP-TFs did not affect either basal StAR expression or basal aldosterone production.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	183	 This result was actually expected, in view of the robust expression of endogenous COUP-TFs in bovine glomerulosa cells, which presumably already exert a maximal repressor effect on these parameters in the resting state.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	184	 Only under conditions of stimulation with AngII, when endogenous COUP-TFs are repressed, is the effect of overexpressing exogenous COUP-TF visible, preventing the normal StAR induction and steroid production elicited by the hormone.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	185	 In addition, COUP-TF is certainly not the sole regulator of StAR expression, and other factors, such as DAX-1 and SF-1 (14), most probably also contribute to basal StAR gene expression.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	186	 This finding is also in agreement with clinical observations showing that COUP-TFI and -II protein levels are markedly reduced in steroid-producing human adrenal tumors, as assessed by Western blot analysis (19), but contrasts with immunohistological observations indicating that COUP-TFII is highly expressed in nuclei of aldosteronoma cells (21).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	187	 One possible explanation for this discrepancy could be found in the different methodologies used in these studies, as immunoblotting yields more quantitative measures than immunocytochemistry.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	188	Fourth, we have shown a direct physical interaction of COUP-TF with the proximal StAR promoter both in vitro and in vivo.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	189	 In EMSAs performed with a probe corresponding to a region of the proximal StAR promoter known to be critical in the control by SF-1 of StAR gene expression, the intensity of two bands was dramatically reduced by preincubation of the nuclear extracts with the anti-COUP-TF antibody.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	190	 This finding indicated that COUP-TF can interact either directly or indirectly with the StAR promoter.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	191	 Whether the two shifted bands represent complexes of COUP-TF with other proteins remains to be elucidated.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	192	Finally, ChIP assays allowed us to clearly demonstrate and quantify a direct binding of COUP-TF with the proximal StAR promoter.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	193	 The decrease in StAR promoter yield in the ChIP assay observed after AngII treatment matches exactly the repression of COUP-TF that we have observed, thus confirming that AngII lifts a direct repression exerted by COUP-TF on the StAR promoter.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	194	In summary, the data we have presented in this work indicates that the transcription factor COUP-TF, which is essentially known to play a developmental role in the adrenal cortex, is also implicated in modulating the differentiated function of adrenal glomerulosa cells, namely aldosterone biosynthesis.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	195	 Under basal conditions, COUP-TF exerts a tonic inhibition on steroidogenesis by repressing StAR protein expression, thus preventing cholesterol substrate supply to the mitochondria.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	196	 Challenge of glomerulosa cells with physiological activators of mineralocorticoid production lifts this inhibition by reducing COUP-TF protein levels and COUP-TF binding to the StAR promoter, thus allowing the StAR protein to be expressed in higher amounts, intramitochondrial cholesterol transfer to occur and, eventually, aldosterone synthesis to proceed.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	197	   MATERIALS AND METHODS TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION RESULTS DISCUSSION MATERIALS AND METHODS REFERENCES   Bovine Adrenal Zona Glomerulosa Cell Culture and Treatments Bovine adrenal glands were obtained from a local slaughterhouse.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	198	 Zona glomerulosa cells were prepared by enzymatic dispersion with dispase and purified on Percoll density gradient as reported previously (26).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	199	 Primary cultures of purified glomerulosa cells were maintained in DMEM as described in detail elsewhere (26).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	200	 The cells were grown in 10-cm petri dishes (1 x 107 cells per dish) and kept in serum-free medium for 24 h before experiments, which were performed on the third day of culture.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	201	 Cells were then washed and incubated at 37 C in serum-free medium containing various agents, for varying periods of time as appropriate.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	202	 At the end of the incubation period, the media were collected and cells were processed for protein or total RNA extraction as described below.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	203	Generation of Lentiviral Vectors and Infection of Bovine Adrenal Glomerulosa Cells Lentiviral vectors were generated as described previously (27, 28).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	204	5-kb fragments were excised out of the original mouse plasmids pCDNA3-COUP-TFI and pCDNA3-COUP-TFII with BamHI and XhoI restriction enzymes.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	205	 The digested fragments were separated on agarose and subsequently purified (JetQuick extraction kit, Genomed GmbH, Basel, Switzerland).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	206	 COUP-TF cDNAs were then inserted into the pRRL-sin-ppt-hPGK vector digested with BamHI and SalI.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	207	Lentiviral vectors were obtained by transient transfection of 293T human embryonic kidney cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	208	 A total of 2 x 106 293T cells were seeded in 10-cm petri dishes 24 h before transfection, in DMEM containing 10% fetal calf serum and glutamine, in the presence of chloroquine (final concentration, 25  microM) and in a 5% CO2 atmosphere.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	209	 Plasmid DNA (20  microg) was used for the transfection of one 10-cm dish using the calcium-phosphate precipitation method: 2.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	210	5  microg envelope-coding plasmid pMDG, 7.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	211	5  microg packaging plasmid pCMVR8.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	212	91 (which expresses Gag, Pol, Tat, and Rev), and 10  microg of either COUP-TFI- or COUP-TFII-expressing pRRL-sin-ppt-hPGK plasmid.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	213	 The cells were washed with PBS after 14 to 16 h and were incubated in serum-free DMEM in a 10% CO2 atmosphere.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	214	 The conditioned medium was collected after another 24 h and filtered through 0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	215	45- microm pore polyvinylidene difluoride filters.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	216	 The vectors were concentrated 100-fold by one round of centrifugation at 50 000 x g for 90 min and resuspended for 20 min at room temperature in PBS.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	217	 Titers of HIV vectors were determined by p24 antigen ELISA.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	218	 Titers were found to range from 5 x 106 to 107 infectious units/ml.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	219	 Stock of vectors was stored at  to 80 C until used for infection of the bovine glomerulosa cells.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	220	 All infections were performed in 12-well plates, with 200,000 glomerulosa cells per well and 500 ng of p24 were used for each COUP-TF.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	221	Determination of Aldosterone Production Aldosterone content in incubation media was measured by direct RIA using a commercially available kit (Diagnostic Systems Laboratories, Webster, TX).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	222	 Aldosterone production was normalized and expressed per microgram cellular protein.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	223	Western Blot Analysis For the determination of protein expression levels, bovine glomerulosa cells were washed twice in ice-cold PBS, and nuclear extracts were prepared according to the procedure of Schreiber et al.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	224	 Mitochondrial extracts were prepared as described elsewhere (30).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	225	 Proteins were quantified using a protein microassay (Bio-Rad, Munich, Germany).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	226	 Equal amounts of protein (15  microg) were resolved by 10% SDS-PAGE and transferred onto polyvinylidene difluoride membranes.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	227	 Western blot analysis was carried out with rabbit antisera directed either against COUP-TF (kindly provided by Professor Ming-Jer Tsai, Houston, TX) or against StAR (kindly provided by Professor Douglas Stocco, Lubbock, TX).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	228	 Immunoreactive proteins were visualized by the enhanced chemiluminescence method (Amersham Biosciences, Otelfingen, Switzerland).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	229	Northern Blot Analysis Glomerulosa cell total RNA was extracted using the RNAgents kit (Promega Corp.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	230	, Zurich, Switzerland) according to the instructions of the manufacturer.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	231	 For Northern blot analysis, 30  microg RNA were size fractionated on a 1% formaldehyde agarose gel, vacuum transferred onto Nytran membranes (Schleicher  and  Schuell, Dassel, Germany), and fixed by UV cross-linking.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	232	 The integrity of the 18 S and 28 S RNA was checked by ethidium bromide staining of the gel.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	233	 Hybridization was performed using the previously cloned 1.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	234	 The cDNA was labeled with [32P]dCTP using the Rediprime II random primer labeling kit from Amersham Biosciences.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	235	 Northern blots were prehybridized in Rapid Hybridization Buffer (Amersham Biosciences) at 65 C for 30 min.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	236	 The 32P-labeled probe (specific activity: 2 x 106 cpm/ng DNA) was then added, and the incubation was continued for 2.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	237	 Blots were washed for 5 min and 15 min successively at room temperature in 2x saline sodium citrate (SSC)-0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	238	1% SDS, and then for 15 min in 1x SSC-0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	239	 The final wash was performed at 65 C for 15 min in 1x SSC-0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	240	 RNA-cDNA hybrids were visualized on Hyperfilms (Amersham Biosciences) after a 12- to 14-h exposure period.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	241	 Blots were stripped and reprobed with mouse glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GAPDH) cDNA (Ambion, Lugano, Switzerland) to assess RNA loading.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	242	Semiquantitative RT-PCR RT-PCR was used to evaluate StAR and COUP-TF mRNA abundance in response to various treatments.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	243	 Total RNA (100 ng) was amplified by one-step RT-PCR Access system (Promega Corp.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	244	, Madison, WI) according to the instructions of the manufacturer.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	245	 The primers were: bovine StAR 5'-TGA AGA GCT TGT GGA GCG CA-3'(forward) and 5'-TGC GAG AGG ACC TGG TTG AT-3'(reverse), corresponding to positions +538 to 557 and +902 to 921, respectively (GenBank accession no.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	246	 Y17259); mouse COUP-TFI 5'-ATG CAC TCA CAA ACG GGG AT-3' (forward) and 5'-ACT GTG CGA AGA GAG GGC AAT-3' (reverse), corresponding to positions +514 to 533 and +1121 to 1141, respectively (GenBank accession no.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	247	 U07625); mouse COUP-TFII 5'-AAG CTG TAC AGA GAG GCA GGA-3' (forward) and 5'-AGA GCT TTC CGA ACC GTG TT-3' (reverse), corresponding to positions +475 to 495 and +1106 to 1125, respectively (GenBank accession no.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	248	 X76653); GAPDH 5'-ATG GTG AAG GTC GGA GTG-3' (forward) and 5'-TGC AGA GAT GAT GAC CCT C-3' (reverse), corresponding to positions +82 to 99 and +426 to 444 (GenBank accession no.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	249	 Primers yielded products of the expected size corresponding to 362 bp for GAPDH, 383 bp for StAR, 627 bp for COUP-TFI, and 650 bp for COUP-TFII.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	250	 PCR products (10  microl) were analyzed on 1.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	251	2% agarose gel and quantified by densitometry using a Computing Densitometer (Molecular Dynamics, Inc.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	252	 All mRNA levels were normalized to GAPDH mRNA.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	253	Dual Luciferase Reporter Assay System The StAR-luc reporter construct was kindly provided by Dr.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	254	3-kb StAR promoter region was cloned into the plasmid vector pGL2 (Promega Corp.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	255	), which contains firefly luciferase as a reporter gene.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	256	 Other plasmids used in these experiments included the pGL2 basic vector as a negative control, which contains no promoter sequence; pGL2 control used as a positive control, which places the luciferase gene under the control of the simian virus 40 (SV40) promoter; pRL-SV40 vector, which places the Renilla luciferase under the control of the SV40 promoter was used as an internal control; and pCR3.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	257	1 vector in which murine COUP-TFI or COUP-TFII cDNA were subcloned under the control of the cytomegalovirus promoter (kindly provided by Professor Ming-Jer Tsai, Houston, TX).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	258	 Bovine glomerulosa cells were cotransfected with the various vectors according to the manufacturer s protocol (Effectene Transfection Reagent kit, QIAGEN GmbH, Hilden, Germany).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	259	 Cells were harvested 48 h after transfection, and extracts were made in Passive lysis buffer (Promega Corp.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	260	 Luciferase and Renilla activities were quantified using a Luminoskan Ascent (Labsystems, Catalys AG, Wallisellen, Switzerland).
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	261	 The luciferase assay results were normalized to Renilla activity to compensate for variations in transfection efficiency.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	262	 Each treatment group contained at least triplicate cultures.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	263	EMSA Double-stranded DNA (5'-gatCACAGCCTTCAGCTGGAGGTATTT annealed with 5'-gatcAAATACCTCCAGCTGAAGGCTGTG) corresponding to nucleotides  to 49 to  to 26 of the bovine StAR promoter according to the sequence published by Rust et al.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	264	 (39) was [-32P]dATP labeled by Klenow (Promega Corp.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	265	 Nuclear protein extracts (15  microg) were incubated for 20 min at room temperature with 30, 000 cpm/min of labeled probe and 2  microg of poly[d(IC)] in EMSA binding buffer.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	266	 The reaction mixture was loaded onto on a nondenaturing 5% polyacrylamide gel for 2 h at 200 V in a cold room.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	267	 Gels were dried and exposed to autoradiography films (Kodak Biomax MR, Sigma-Aldrich GmbH, Steinheim, Germany) for 72 h.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	268	 In supershift experiments, 1  microg purified rabbit polyclonal anti-COUP-TFI (kindly provided by Dr.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	269	 Dufau, Bethesda, MD) or anti-SF-1 (kindly provided by Professor K.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	270	 Morohashi, Okasaki, Japan) antibody was added to the mixture 30 min before the labeled probe.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	271	ChIP Assay Chromatin cross-linking was performed by adding 1% formaldehyde to bovine glomerulosa cells at room temperature for 8 min.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	272	 The reaction was stopped by adding glycine to a final concentration of 0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	273	 Cells were then washed twice with ice-cold PBS, collected in 5 ml PBS, and harvested by brief centrifugation.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	274	 Cells were resuspended in ice-cold cell lysis buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	275	5% Nonidet P-40; protease inhibitors), incubated on ice for 5 min, and briefly centrifuged.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	276	 Cells were then resuspended in nuclear lysis buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	277	0; 1 mM EDTA; 1% Triton X-100; 0.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	278	5 M NaCl; protease inhibitors), incubated at room temperature for 5 min while vortexing vigorously several times, and washed in PBS.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	279	 Sonication of the cells was performed 30 times for 30 sec in TEN buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	280	0; 1 mM EDTA; 100 mM NaCl) with a Branson 250 sonifier, followed by centrifugation for 15 min at 14,000 rpm in an Eppendorf table centrifuge.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	281	 Supernatant was collected and diluted 5-fold in dilution/incubation buffer (20 mM HEPES, pH 8.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	282	1% NaDOC; 1% Triton X-100; 100  microg/ml salmon sperm DNA; 1 mg/ml BSA; protease inhibitors) followed by immunoclearing with 20  microl protein A Sepharose CL-4B (Pharmacia Biotech AB, Uppsala, Sweden) for 30 min at room temperature, to which 5  microl of specific anti-COUP-TFI antibody were added for overnight incubation at 4 C.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	283	 The mixture was then cleared from precipitated material by centrifugation at 10,000 rpm for 10 min.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	284	 Supernatant was incubated with 12  microl Protein A Sepharose (Amersham Biosciences) for 1 h at room temperature.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	285	 Precipitate was recovered by centrifugation at 3000 rpm for 1 min and washed seven times in RIPA buffer (50 mM HEPES, pH 7.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	286	7% NaDOC; 1% Nonidet P-40) and once in TE buffer (10 mM Tris-HCl; pH 8.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	287	0; 1 mM EDTA) and extracted twice with 100  microl elution buffer (100 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	288	 Eluates were pooled, treated with proteinase K (100  microg/ml) for 2 h at 42 C, heated at 65 C overnight to reverse the formaldehyde cross-linking, and treated by phenol extraction and ethanol precipitation.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	289	 The DNA pellet was dissolved in 15  microl of TE buffer.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	290	 DNA (5  microl) was used for real-time PCR.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	291	 The primers were located on the proximal part of the bovine StAR promoter: forward, 5'-AGA CTC CTG GTG AGG CAA TC-3'; and reverse, 5'-CTG CGG CCA GAT GAT GTG TT-3', according to the GenBank sequence (accession no.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	292	 Y17260), and yielding an amplification product of 137 bp.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	293	Analysis of Data Results are expressed as means  plus or minus  SEM.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	294	 The mean values were compared by ANOVA using Fisher s test.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	295	05 was considered as statistically significant.
0.22347338.15375188.html.plaintext.txt	296	 Quantification of immunoblots and autoradiograms was performed using a Molecular Dynamics Computing Densitometer.
