0.22037566.14583614.html.plaintext.txt	291	 278, 27703 to 27711[Abstract/Free Full Text].
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	0	  Rockefeller University Press, 0022-1007/2003/3/763 $5.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	1	00 The Journal of Experimental Medicine, Volume 197, Number 6, 763-775 Detection of a Functional Hybrid Receptor c/GM-CSFRss in Human Hematopoietic CD34+ Cells J.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	2	1 U 506 Institut National de la Sante et de la Recherche Medicale (INSERM), Hopital Paul Brousse, 94807 Villejuif, France 2 Istituto Gaslini, Largo Gerolamo Gaslini 516147 Genoa, Italy 3 Istituto Nazionale per la Ricerca sul Cancro, IST, Largo Rosanna Benzi 16132 Genoa, Italy 4 U 487 INSERM, IGR, 94800 Villejuif, France 5 U 268 INSERM, Hopital Paul Brousse, 94807 Villejuif, France 6 GenMab B.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	3	 University Medical Center Immunotherapy Laboratory, KC02.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	4	2 Lundlaan 6 3584 EA Utrecht, Netherlands 7 Forshungzentrum Borstel, Parkallee 22, D-23845 Borstel, Germany 8 INSERM E-0109, Bicetre, France 9 U 542 INSERM, Hopital Paul Brousse, 94807 Villejuif, France.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	5	 Bruno Azzarone, INSERM U542, Batiment Lavoisier, Hopital Paul Brousse, 94807 Villejuif, France.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	6	 Phone: 00-33-145595344; Fax: 00-33-145595343; E-mail: bazzarone{at}hotmail.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	7	   Abstract Top Abstract Introduction Materials and Methods Results Discussion References   A functional hybrid receptor associating the common chain (c) with the granulocyte/macrophage colony-stimulating factor receptor ss (GM-CSFRss) chain is found in mobilized human peripheral blood (MPB) CD34+ hematopoietic progenitors, SCF/Flt3-L primed cord blood (CB) precursors (CBPr CD34+/CD56-), and CD34+ myeloid cell lines, but not in normal natural killer (NK) cells, the cytolytic NK-L cell line or nonhematopoietic cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	8	 We demonstrated, using CD34+ TF1ss cells, which express an interleukin (IL)-15R/ss/c receptor, that within the hybrid receptor, the GM-CSFRss chain inhibits the IL-15 to triggered c/JAK3-specific signaling controlling TF1ss cell proliferation.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	9	 However, the c chain is part of a functional GM-CSFR, activating GM-CSF to dependent STAT5 nuclear translocation and the proliferation of TF1ss cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	10	 The hybrid receptor is functional in normal hematopoietic progenitors in which both subunits control STAT5 activation.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	11	 Finally, the parental TF1 cell line, which lacks the IL-15Rss chain, nevertheless expresses both a functional hybrid receptor that controls JAK3 phosphorylation and a novel IL-15/c/TRAF2 complex that triggers nuclear factor B activation.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	12	 The lineage-dependent distribution and function of these receptors suggest that they are involved in hematopoiesis because they modify transduction pathways that play a major role in the differentiation of hematopoietic progenitors.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	13	Key Words: IL-15   GM-CSF   IL-15R   signal transduction   CD34+ cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	14	   Introduction Top Abstract Introduction Materials and Methods Results Discussion References   The development of hematopoietic cells is controlled by hematopoietic growth factors, cytokines and chemokines produced in the bone marrow (BM)* by accessory cells and T lymphocytes (1, 2), and by several other mechanisms (3).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	15	 Hematopoietic factors constitute a complex network, in which each cytokine may act at various stages: for example, myeloid growth factors such as G-CSF and GM-CSF may also affect the lymphoid compartment (4, 5).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	16	 GM-CSF inhibits the expansion of the NK cell progenitor population from unprimed BM CD34+ cells, and the generation and functioning of NK cells both in vivo and in vitro (5, 6).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	17	 IL-15, the most powerful factor inducing the differentiation of CD34+ hematopoietic progenitor cells into CD56+/CD3- NK cells in vivo (7), may also cause a large increase in the number of long-term culture-initiating cells (LTC-IC) when added to the IL-3/SCF/Flt3-L combination (8).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	18	 Transgenic mice carrying a mutation in the cytoplasmic domain of the common gamma chain (c), or lacking the signaling kinase JAK3, both of which are necessary for IL-15 to mediated signaling, have very low lymphocyte counts and display dysregulated myelopoiesis (9, 10).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	19	 Moreover, the erythroid burst-forming cells of these mice have a larger than normal fraction of hematopoietic precursors with the CD34+/c- phenotype (11).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	20	 These data suggest that there is cross talk between myeloid growth factors and IL-15, which may regulate the balance between the myeloid and lymphoid lineages during hematopoietic differentiation.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	21	 This regulation may operate at the level of signal transduction because IL-15 and GM-CSF share signaling pathways (JAK2/STAT5 and NF-B) heavily involved in the control of hematopoiesis (12 to 16).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	22	 Alternatively, the cross talk between these two cytokines may involve direct interactions between their receptor subunits, as suggested by the fact that GM-CSF almost totally inhibits IL-2 binding to IL-2/IL-15Rss/c in the M07sb CD34+ hematopoietic cell line (17).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	23	 We investigated whether this cross talk resulted from a physical interaction between the two receptors, possibly involving the c chain and the GM-CSFRss chain.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	24	 Indeed, these two subunits identify two families of cytokines, one with the c chain (IL-2, IL-4, IL-7, IL-9, IL-13, IL-15, and IL-21; references 7 and 18) and the other, with the GM-CSFRss chain (IL-3, IL-5, and GM-CSF; reference 19).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	25	In this study, we demonstrate that normal CD34+ cells, but not nonhematopoietic cells, express a novel functional hybrid receptor composed of the c and GM-CSFRss chains, in which the GM-CSFRss chain may inhibit c/JAK3 signaling.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	26	 This complex is maintained in CD34+ myeloid and cord blood (CB)Pr CD34+/CD56- cells, but not in mature NK cells, suggesting that it is involved in controlling hematopoietic differentiation.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	27	   Materials and Methods Top Abstract Introduction Materials and Methods Results Discussion References   Purification of CD34+ Cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	28	 Mononuclear cells from CB or adult G-CSF mobilized peripheral blood (MPB) were isolated by centrifugation on a Ficoll gradient (Lymphoprep Nicomed Pharma SA).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	29	 Adherent cells were isolated by adhesion to plastic Petri dishes for 2 h at 37 degrees C.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	30	 CD34+ cells were selected by an immunomagnetic method (Miltenyi Biotec), on nonadherent mononuclear cells labeled with a mAb specific for the QBEND10 epitope of the CD34 antigen, achieving a purity >97%, as previously described (20).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	31	 CB CD34+ cells were used unprimed or after treatment with SCF/Flt3-L to expand the population of CD34+/CD56- primed progenitors (CBPr) in which the frequency of NK cell precursors may be 65 to 235 times higher than that in freshly prepared CD34+ HPCs (7).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	32	Isolation and Culture of Normal Polyclonal NK Cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	33	 Non-adherent PBMCs from healthy volunteers were isolated by centrifugation on a Ficoll gradient.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	34	 CD3-/CD4-/CD8- cells were purified by negative depletion and cultured with 100 U/ml rIL-2 (Proleukin; Chiron Corp.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	35	) in the presence of 105 irradiated allogenic PBMCs/well and 104 221 lymphoblastoid cells/well.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	36	 By day 15, almost all the proliferating cells expressed CD16 and CD56 antigens.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	37	 Human TF1ss (IL-15R/ss/c) and M07sb (IL-15Rss/c) are two IL-15 to dependent leukemic cell lines, whereas TF1 (IL-15R/c) is a GM-CSF to dependent cell line.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	38	 TF1 and TF1ss cells have the potential to display proerythroid differentiation whereas M07Sb cells display promegakaryocytic differentiation.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	39	 NK-L is a functional human cytolytic NK cell line that is dependent on rIL-2.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	40	 Raji is a B cell line (IL-15R/c) that does not depend on growth factors for its proliferation.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	41	 The growth characteristics and phenotypes of these cells have been reported elsewhere (21 to 25).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	42	 Cells were maintained in RPMI medium (Eurobio) supplemented with 10% FCS (ATGC Biotechnologie), 2 mM glutamine, 1% antibiotics (GIBCO BRL), 10 ng/ml rIL-15, or rGM-CSF (R and D Systems) at 37 degrees C, under an atmosphere of 5% CO2/95% air.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	43	 Cells were subcultured twice per week by seeding fresh culture medium with 105 cells/ml.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	44	 The human stromal fibroblast MS9 strain, isolated in culture from the spleen of a patient with a myeloproliferative syndrome, was used as a feeder layer for hematopoietic cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	45	 MS9 fibroblasts express a bioactive membrane-bound IL-15 that induces the NK cell differentiation of CD34+ cells; they also secrete GM-CSF (26, 27).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	46	 MS9 cells between passages 5 and 10 were cultured for 72 h at a density of 2 x 105 cells/ml in RPMI medium supplemented with 10% FCS in 6-well plates before being brought into contact with hematopoietic cells (5 x 105 cells/well).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	47	 TF1ss and NK-L cells were kindly provided by Drs.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	48	 of Human Oncology, University of Wisconsin, Madison, WI) and Alessandro Moretta (Department of Experimental Medicine, University of Genoa, Genoa, Italy), respectively.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	49	 TF1ss cells and Raji cells (3 x 105 cells/ml) were cultured for 4 d in complete growth medium supplemented with rIL-15 or rGM-CSF (10 ng/ml).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	50	 Sister cultures were treated with neutralizing anti to IL-15R M162 (developed by Immunex Corp.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	51	, provided by Genmab A/S, Copenhagen, Denmark), rat anti-c (TUGh4), and anti-GM-CSFRss (BD Biosciences/Becton Dickinson) mAbs.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	52	TF1ss cells (3 x 105 cells/ml) were also cultured for 4 d with MS9 stromal cells as the feeder layer.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	53	 Sister cultures were treated with anti to IL-15 (R and D Systems), anti to IL-15R M162, anti to IL-15Rss (CF-1; a gift from Dr.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	54	 Jacques, U463 INSERM, Nantes, France), anti-c (TUGh4), anti-GM-CSFRss, or anti-GM-CSFR (S-20; Santa Cruz Biotechnology, Inc.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	55	 In some inhibition experiments, we used low concentrations of anti to IL-15Rss and anti-c mAbs, because a combination of 1  microg/ml of each mAb is more efficient than a single dose of 10  microg/ml of each mAb at inhibiting IL-15 effects (23).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	56	 Cells were counted in triplicate.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	57	 The statistical significance of differences was determined using Student's t test, with P 0.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	58	Analysis of IL-15 Signal Transduction in the Human Hematopoietic TF1ss Cell Line and in CBPr CD34+/CD56- Precursors.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	59	 For signal transduction analysis, cells were incubated overnight with a low concentration of rIL-15 (0.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	60	5 ng/ml) and were then deprived of growth factors for 3 h at 37 degrees C.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	61	 Cells were then stimulated by incubation with 10 ng/ml rIL-15 for 5 to 15 min.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	62	 In some experiments, cells were initially treated for 1 h with either 10  microg/ml neutralizing antibody against IL-15, IL-15Rss, c, or GM-CSFRss chains or with the JAK3-specific inhibitor, WHI-P131 (Calbiochem), which has no effect on JAK1 and JAK2.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	63	Immunoblotting: Western Blotting.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	64	 Experiments were performed as described previously (12, 14, 28, 29).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	65	 Briefly, cultures were serum-starved to reduce basal phosphorylation levels.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	66	 Cells were then washed twice and suspended in lysis buffer supplemented with 0.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	67	 For immunoprecipitation, lysates were incubated with anti-c (TUGh4), anti-JAK3 (Upstate Biotechnology) or polyclonal anti-TRAF2 (Santa Cruz Biotechnology, Inc.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	68	) antibody and immune complexes were captured by incubation with protein G-Sepharose beads (Amersham Biosciences) overnight at 4 degrees C.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	69	 The captured immune complexes were washed twice with lysis buffer.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	70	 Complexes or lysates (for Western blotting) were then dissolved in Laemmli buffer, boiled, and separated by SDS-PAGE (7.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	71	 The protein bands were transferred to PVDF membranes (NEN Life Science Products).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	72	 Membranes were blocked by incubation with 5% BSA and probed with the following antibodies: anti-JAK1, anti-JAK2, and 4G10 anti-phosphotyrosine (Upstate Biotechnology/USA Euromodex), anti-pJAK1 (Tyr 1022/1023), anti-pJAK2 (Tyr 1007/Tyr 1008), anti-STAT3, anti-pSTAT3 (Tyr705), and anti-STAT6 (Santa Cruz Biotechnology, Inc.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	73	), anti-STAT5 (Transduction Laboratories/Becton Dickinson), anti-pSTAT5 (Tyr694), anti-pSTAT6 (Tyr641; Cell Signaling/New England Biolabs, Inc.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	74	Primary antibody binding to the membrane was detected by incubation with peroxidase-conjugated secondary antibodies, followed by the enhanced chemiluminescence (ECL) system (Amersham Biosciences).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	75	 The membrane was then subjected to densitometry, including correction for background, with analysis using NIH Image software.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	76	 To correct for possible variations in the amount of protein loaded, values are expressed as pSTAT/STAT ratios.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	77	 Results are expressed as increases (e.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	78	, three times) with respect to the results obtained for untreated cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	79	 For the double staining of c and GM-CSFRss chains, human MPB and CB CD34+ cells, the leukemic cell lines (TF1, TF1ss, and M07sb), and MS9 cells were washed and permeabilized by incubation with ORTHOpermeafix (Ortho Diagnostic Systems Inc.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	80	) for 45 min at room temperature.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	81	 Cells were then stained with anti-c (TUGh4) mAb and with the biotinylated anti to GM-CSFRss secondary mAb, and were then incubated at room temperature with Alexa Fluor594-GAR and streptavidin-Alexa Fluor594 (Molecular Probes).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	82	 The extent of association between the two chains was assessed using the colocalization option of Methamorphe Software (Universal Imagine).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	83	 We also used confocal microscopy to evaluate production of the activated transcription factor, pSTAT5, in TF1ss and M07sb cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	84	 Cells were starved of growth factors overnight and were then stimulated with rGM-CSF, as described above.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	85	 Some samples were pretreated with anti to IL-15ss/c or anti to GM-CSFRss mAbs.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	86	 Cells were then permeabilized and indirect immunofluorescence assessed by means of antibodies recognizing the phosphorylated form of the transcription factor STAT5 (pSTAT5).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	87	 Samples were washed and incubated with Alexa Fluor488-GARa antibody.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	88	 Nuclei were stained with 2  microg/ml propidium iodide (PI, red staining).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	89	 All antibodies were dissolved in PBS supplemented with 10 mg/ml BSA to block nonspecific binding.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	90	 The stained cells were washed with PBS, centrifuged in a Cytospin 3 (Shandon) onto glass slides, and mounted under a coverslip in Prolong Antifade (Molecular Probes) mounting medium.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	91	 The slides were analyzed by laser scanning confocal microscopy, using a Leica TCS Confocal System.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	92	   Results Top Abstract Introduction Materials and Methods Results Discussion References   Human Hematopoietic CD34+ Cells Express a Hybrid c/GM-CSFRss Receptor.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	93	 We investigated the possible interactions between IL-15R and GM-CSFR complexes in human hematopoietic and nonhematopoietic cells by Western blotting (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	94	 1 A), coimmunoprecipitation (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	95	 1 B), and confocal microscopy (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	96	 The Western blotting of total lysates (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	97	 1 A) showed that the cells analyzed (TF1ss, M07Sb, and MPB CD34+) expressed both the c chain (a single band of 64 kD) and the GM-CSFRss chain (a major band of 130 kD, corresponding to the mature protein, and a second band of 95 kD, corresponding to the nonglycosylated precursor protein; reference 30).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	98	View larger version (60K):    Figure 1.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	99	 c/GM-CSFRss interaction in human hematopoietic and nonhematopoietic cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	100	 (A) Western blots of total lysates.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	101	 MPB CD34+ cells, TF1, and M07Sb promyeloid CD34+ cell lines were analyzed for the expression for c and GM-CSFRss chains.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	102	 Briefly, cell lysates were subjected to electrophoresis and the protein bands were transferred to PVDF membranes.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	103	 The total lysate membranes (Tot.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	104	lys) were then probed with anti-c or anti to GM-CSFRss mAbs.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	105	 The data shown are representative of three independent experiments.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	106	 (B) Coimmunoprecipitation MPB CD34+ cells, CBPr CD34+/CD56- and normal polyclonal NK cells (panel a), TF1, TF1ss, MO7sb promyeloid CD34+and NK-L cell lines (panel b) and human skin myofibroblasts (panel c) were analyzed for c/GM-CSFRss interactions.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	107	 Briefly, total lysates were subjected to immunoprecipitation (IP) with an anti-c antibody.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	108	 Immunoprecipitates were subjected to electrophoresis and the protein bands were transferred to PVDF membranes.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	109	 Membranes corresponding to the c immunoprecipitate and to total lysates (Tot.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	110	lys) were probed with anti-c or anti-GM-CSFRss mAb.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	111	 The data presented are representative of three independent experiments.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	112	 Analysis by confocal microscopy of the interactions between the c chain (green staining) and GM-CSFRss (red staining) in MPB CD34+ cells (panel a1), CBPr CD34+ cells (panel a2), TF1 cells (panel b1), TF1ss cells (panel b2), M07Sb (panel b3), and MS9 spleen myofibroblasts (panel c).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	113	 As specificity controls, we analyzed the interactions between the c chain (green staining) and IL-6R gp130 (red staining, panel d) or between the c chain (green staining) and ss1 integrin (red staining, panel e) in CB CD34+ cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	114	 The images presented are compacted overlay pictures from serial optical sections, 1  microm thick, from the outside to the inner compartments of the cell.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	115	 The yellow staining indicates colocalization of the various molecules.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	116	 The data presented are representative of three independent experiments.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	117	  Human MPB CD34+ cells, CBPr CD34+/CD56- progenitors and normal polyclonal NK cells were immunoprecipitated with anti-c mAb, and the c membranes were reprobed with mAbs recognizing the c and GM-CSFRss chains.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	118	 Reprobing with the anti-c mAb confirmed the presence of a specific 64 kD band, whereas reprobing with anti to GM-CSFRss mAb resulted in detection of the specific 130 kD band in MPB CD34+ and CBPr CD34+/CD56- cells, but not in polyclonal NK cells from normal donors (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	119	 Thus, normal human CD34+ cells express a c/GM-CSFRss complex, which is not detectable in mature NK cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	120	The c/GM-CSFRss association was also detected both in the proerythroid TF1 and TF1ss cell lines, which expressed IL-15R/c and IL-15R/ss/c, respectively, and in the promegakaryocytic (M07sb) cells expressing IL-15Rss/c, whereas it was not detected in the cytolytic NK-L cell line (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	121	 In addition, the c/GM-CSFRss complex was not found in human skin myofibroblasts despite the presence of the c and GM-CSFRss chains in these cells (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	122	 Reprobing the c membrane with anti-GM-CSFR or anti-gp130 mAbs did not give a specific signal (unpublished data).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	123	We demonstrated, by confocal microscopy, the colocalization of the c (green staining) and GM-CSFRss (red staining) chains in MPB and CB CD34+ progenitors, as well as in the TF1, TF1ss and M07sb cell lines (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	124	 The images presented are overlay-compacted images from confocal analysis of 1  microm serial optical sections from the cell surface to the inner compartment.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	125	In MPB CD34+ and unprimed CB CD34+ cells (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	126	 1 C, panels a1 and a2), all cells displayed strong colocalization of the two molecules (yellow staining), restricted to the membrane/submembrane compartment.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	127	 1 C, panels b1 and b2), we observed similar yellow staining of the membrane/submembrane compartment and spotted yellow staining in the cytoplasm, suggesting that the hybrid receptor was taken up by some of the cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	128	 This punctate distribution of the c/GM-CSFRss complex in the cytoplasms was the predominant staining pattern in M07sb cells (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	129	 No colocalization was observed in human MS9 myofibroblasts (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	130	 The specificity of c and GM-CSFRss chain colocalization was further confirmed by the lack of colocalization of the c chain and the IL-6R subunit gp130 (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	131	 1 C, panel d) or the ss1 integrin (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	132	 1 C, panel e) in normal CB CD34+ cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	133	 Computerized quantification of the extent to which the c chain and the GM-CSFRss chain were colocalized in normal and leukemic CD34+ cells showed that 74.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	134	3% (M07sb) of the GM-CSFRss chain colocalized with the c chain, whereas 94.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	135	6% (M07sb) of the c chain colocalized with the GM-CSFRss chain.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	136	 Our results indicate that the c chain is almost completely associated with the GM-CSFRss chain, with 30 to 40% of the GM-CSFRss chain left free.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	137	The expression of this hybrid receptor is constitutive and does not seem to be influenced by cytokine stimulation, as it is observed in CB hematopoietic progenitors, whether unprimed or treated with SCF/Flt3-L, in MPB CD34+ cells, and in CD34+ myeloid cell lines, which are dependent on GM-CSF (TF1) or IL-15 (TF1ss, M07sb) for growth.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	138	IL-15 to  and GM-CSF to dependent Proliferation in TF1ss Cells Is Modified by Anti to GM-CSFRss and Anti-c mAbs, Respectively.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	139	 The presence of the hybrid receptor on CD34+ cells dependent on IL-15 or GM-CSF led us to investigate the role of this receptor in cell proliferation.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	140	 2 A, TF1ss cells proliferated in the presence of rIL-15 (+200%) or rGM-CSF (+300%).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	141	 IL-15 to dependent proliferation was inhibited by anti to IL-15R, but not by anti-c mAbs.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	142	 Anti-GM-CSFRss mAb slightly, but significantly increased (+20 to 25%, P  <  0.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	143	001) the rate of cell proliferation.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	144	View larger version (26K):    Figure 2.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	145	 Proliferation induced by rIL-15 and rGM-CSF: IL-15R/GM-CSFR cross talk in TF1ss cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	146	 (A) Proliferative response of TF1ss cells to recombinant IL-15 and GM-CSF.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	147	 TF1ss (IL-15R/ss/c) CD34+ cells were cultured for 4 d with rIL-15 or rGM-CSF (10 ng/ml) and their proliferation potential was then analyzed.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	148	 Sister cultures were continuously incubated with neutralizing mAbs recognizing the IL-15R, c, and GM-CSFRss chains.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	149	 In TF1ss cells cultured with rIL-15, the proliferation rates of samples treated with an anti to GM-CSFRss mAb were significantly higher (+25%; P  <  0.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	150	001) than those of samples incubated with rIL-15 alone or with rIL-15 plus an anti-c mAb.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	151	 (B) Proliferative response of Raji cells to rIL-15.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	152	 Raji cells (IL-15R/c) were cultured for 4 d with rIL-15 (10 ng/ml) and analyzed for proliferation.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	153	 Sister cultures were continuously incubated with neutralizing mAbs recognizing the IL-15R, c, and GM-CSFRss chains.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	154	 (C) Proliferative response of TF1ss cells to MS9 cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	155	 TF1ss cells were cocultured for 4 d with MS9 cells and analyzed for proliferation.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	156	 Sister cultures were continuously incubated with neutralizing mAbs recognizing the GM-CSFR, GM-CSFRss, IL-15Rss/c, IL-15R chains, and IL-15.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	157	 Cells were counted in an electronic Coulter counter and the data are expressed as % difference in proliferative potential with respect to control untreated samples.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	158	 The data presented are representative of three independent experiments.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	159	  In contrast, GM-CSF to dependent proliferation was totally inhibited not only by anti to GM-CSFRss mAb, but also by anti-c mAb, further suggesting that there is cross talk between these two cytokine receptors in these cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	160	 As a control, we used the Raji cell line, the growth of which is not dependent on IL-15, and which expresses IL-15R and c, but not IL-15Rss chains (reference 30; Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	161	 After 4 d in culture, Raji cells fed with DMEM supplemented with 10% FCS proliferated, resulting in a 200% increase in cell density.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	162	 The addition of 10 ng/ml of rIL-15 increased the proliferation of these cells (+30%).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	163	 This effect was inhibited by anti-IL-15R mAb, but not by anti-c or anti-GM-CSFRss mAbs.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	164	 Anti to IL-15 and anti to IL-15R mAbs have been shown to have similar effects on Raji cells (25).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	165	We investigated whether the growth of TF1ss cells could be stimulated by contact with human stromal MS9 cells, which have been shown to secrete several hematopoietic growth factors (26), and whether the hybrid receptor was involved in these interactions.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	166	 TF1ss cells proliferated when cultured in contact with MS9 cells, doubling in number after 4 d (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	167	 The proliferation induced by MS9 cells was totally inhibited by neutralizing mAbs against the GM-CSFR and GM-CSFRss chains.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	168	 Neutralizing mAbs directed against IL-15 or the IL-15R chain had no effect whereas anti to IL-15Rss/c mAbs inhibited the proliferation of TF1ss cells by 60%.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	169	 Thus, TF1ss cell proliferation is completely dependent on GM-CSF produced by MS9 cells (26) and can be efficiently inhibited by anti to IL-15Rss/c mAbs, consistent with the existence of cross talk between the two cytokine receptors.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	170	IL-15 to induced JAK/STAT Signaling Is Inhibited by Anti to GM-CSFRss mAb.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	171	 The inability of the anti-c mAb to block IL-15 to dependent proliferation in TF1ss cells suggests that the c chain cannot mediate the effects of IL-15 in these cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	172	 We investigated the signal transduction triggered by IL-15 and the involvement of the various subunits of the IL-15R, in TF1ss cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	173	Densitometric analysis revealed that rIL-15 (10 ng/ml) caused the levels of phosphorylation of JAK1 and STAT3 to increase by a factor of seven within 15 min (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	174	 Neutralizing anti to IL-15Rss mAb totally inhibited the phosphorylation of JAK1 and inhibited that of STAT3 by 50%.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	175	 In contrast, anti-c mAb had no effect on either pathway.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	176	 These data confirm the results of the proliferation assays, demonstrating the incapacity of the c chain to mediate IL-15 to dependent functions in TF1ss cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	177	View larger version (43K):    Figure 3.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	178	 IL-15 signal transduction: IL-15R/GM-CSFR cross talk in TF1ss cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	179	 Analysis of JAK/STAT signal transduction by Western blotting.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	180	 TF1ss cells were incubated with 10 ng/ml rIL-15 for 15 min at 37 degrees C.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	181	 Sister cultures were pretreated for 1 h with neutralizing anti to IL-15Rss/c, anti-GM-CSFRss, or anti-IL-6R gp130 mAbs.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	182	 Cell extracts were analyzed by Western blotting using anti-phospho-JAK1 (pJAK1), anti-phospho-JAK2 (pJAK2), anti-phospho-TYK2 (pTYK2), anti-phospho-STAT5 (pSTAT5), and anti-phospho-STAT6 (pSTAT6) antibodies.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	183	 Membranes were then reprobed with antibodies recognizing the native proteins.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	184	 To correct for possible variations in the amount of protein loaded, values are expressed as pJAK/JAK or pSTAT/STAT ratios.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	185	 pJAK/JAK and pSTAT/STAT levels were determined by densitometry including correction for background (NIH Image software).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	186	 Results are expressed as increases (e.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	187	, two times) with respect to untreated cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	188	 The data presented are representative of three independent experiments.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	189	  We then investigated whether the GM-CSFRss chain interfered with c chain activity, as suggested by the results of the proliferation assays.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	190	 Constitutive levels of JAK1, JAK2, STAT5, and STAT6 phosphorylation were low in TF1ss cells (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	191	 Densitometric analysis showed that rIL-15 (10 ng/ml) induced an increase by a factor of at least two in the level of phosphorylation of all of these molecules, within 15 min.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	192	 The phosphorylation of JAK1, STAT5, and STAT6 was totally inhibited not only by the synergistic combination of anti to IL-15Rss and anti-c mAbs, but also by neutralizing anti to GM-CSFRss mAb.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	193	In contrast, JAK2 phosphorylation was totally inhibited by anti to IL-15Rss/c mAb but was only inhibited by 30% with the anti-GM-CSFRss mAb.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	194	 The use of an isotype-matched anti-gp130 mAb had no significant effect on the level of phosphorylation of the various molecules.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	195	 In contrast to what was observed in TF1ss cells, anti to GM-CSFRss mAb did not affect IL-15 signaling in CD34+ promegakaryocytic M07sb cells expressing a low-affinity IL-15Rss/c receptor (unpublished data).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	196	GM-CSF to induced pSTAT5 Nuclear Translocation Is Inhibited by Anti to IL-15Rss/c mAbs in TF1ss Cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	197	 We analyzed the effects of anti to IL-15Rss/c mAbs on the signal transduction activated by rGM-CSF (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	198	 Densitometric analysis revealed that rGM-CSF (at a concentration of 10 ng/ml) doubled the phosphorylation of JAK2 and quadrupled that of STAT5 in TF1ss cells in a 15-min period.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	199	 In experiments with anti to IL-15Rss/c mAbs, the specific JAK3 inhibitor WHI-P31 or the irrelevant anti-gp130 mAb, we observed no significant inhibition of either pathway, which demonstrated that neither of the two chains of the IL-15R affected these steps of GM-CSF signaling.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	200	 The effects of rGM-CSF and IL-15Rss/c mAbs on the localization of pSTAT5 were analyzed by confocal microscopy (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	201	 Cells were stained for pSTAT5 (green staining) and with propidium iodide (specific for nuclei; red staining); superimposition of the two stains gave a yellow coloration.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	202	 In basal culture conditions, all cells displayed green staining of the cytoplasm, indicating the presence of pSTAT5 protein in this compartment.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	203	 The intensity of the green staining increased after GM-CSF stimulation suggesting that the level of STAT5 phosphorylation increased.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	204	 No inhibition was observed in the presence of neutralizing anti-IL-15Rss/c mAbs, or of the specific JAK3 inhibitor WHI-P31 (unpublished data), confirming the results obtained by Western blotting.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	205	View larger version (50K):    Figure 4.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	206	 GM-CSF signal transduction: IL-15R/GM-CSFR cross talk in TF1ss cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	207	 (A) Analysis of JAK2/STAT5 signal transduction by Western blotting.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	208	 TF1ss cells were incubated with 10 ng/ml rGM-CSF for 15 min at 37 degrees C.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	209	 Sister cultures were pretreated for 1 h with neutralizing anti to IL-15Rss/c mAbs or specific JAK3 inhibitors.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	210	 Cell extracts were analyzed by Western blotting with anti-phospho-JAK2 (pJAK2) and anti-phospho-STAT5 (pSTAT5) antibodies.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	211	 Membranes were then reprobed with antibodies recognizing the native proteins.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	212	 To correct for possible variations in the amount of protein loaded, values are expressed as pJAK/JAK or pSTAT/STAT ratios.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	213	 pJAK/JAK and pSTAT/STAT levels were determined by densitometry, including correction for background (NIH Image software).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	214	 Results are expressed as an increase (e.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	215	, two times) with respect to untreated cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	216	 The data presented are representative of three independent experiments.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	217	 (B) Analysis of pSTAT5 nuclear localization by confocal microscopy.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	218	 TF1ss cells were incubated with 10 ng/ml rGM-CSF for 15 min at 37 degrees C.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	219	 Sister cultures were pretreated for 1 h with neutralizing anti-IL-15Rss/c mAbs.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	220	 Control (basal) and treated cultures were analyzed by confocal microscopy for pSTAT5 distribution in the cell, focusing particularly on whether this protein was present in the nucleus.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	221	 Propidium iodide stains nuclei red whereas pSTAT5 is stained green.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	222	 Yellow staining indicates the presence of pSTAT5 in the nucleus.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	223	  In basal culture conditions, only a few cells displayed yellow staining indicating the presence of pSTAT5 in the nucleus.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	224	 Control cultures displayed only red nuclear staining when treated with PI and the second reagent.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	225	 Short-term stimulation with rGM-CSF (15 min) induced the massive nuclear translocation of pSTAT5 in 30% of the cells, as demonstrated by intense yellow staining of the nucleus.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	226	 Finally, anti to IL-15Rss/c mAbs efficiently inhibited the effects of rGM-CSF on pSTAT5 nuclear translocation, as shown by a loss of the yellow staining, whereas the isotype-matched anti-gp130 mAb had no effect (unpublished data).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	227	 The effects on STAT5 of anti-IL-15Rss/c mAbs and of the specific JAK3 inhibitor WHI-P31 were also observed in M07Sb cells (unpublished data).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	228	TF1 Cells Express Functional IL-15R/c Complex, the Formation of which Is Controlled by the Hybrid c/GM-CSFRss Receptor.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	229	 The absence of proliferation in IL-15R/c-positive TF1 cells in response to IL-15 has been attributed to the lack of the IL-15Rss subunit (23), which is indispensable for IL-15 binding and c chain signaling (7).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	230	 However, it has recently been reported that the IL-15R chain may transduce a signal in the absence of links with any other receptor subunit (12), leading to NF-B activation via the cytoplasmic interaction of this molecule with the signaling molecule TRAF2.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	231	 We therefore investigated the possible presence of a functional IL-15R/c receptor in TF1 cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	232	 Analysis of total lysates showed that the TF1 and TF1ss cell lines expressed the c chain (64 kD) and at least two IL-15R isoforms, 58 and 38 kD in size (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	233	 The two cell lines were then incubated with an anti-c mAb for immunoprecipitation.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	234	 The c membrane was reprobed with the anti-c mAb.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	235	 A strong specific signal was identified at 64 kD.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	236	 In contrast, two major bands, 58 and 38 kD in size, were identified if the membrane was reprobed with anti to IL-15R mAb.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	237	 Thus, in both TF1 and TF1ss cells, the c chain is physically associated with the two IL-15R isoforms.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	238	View larger version (42K):    Figure 5.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	239	 IL-15R/c interaction in TF1 and TF1ss cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	240	 TF1 and TF1ss cells were analyzed for IL-15R/c interactions.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	241	 Briefly, lysates were subjected to immunoprecipitation (IP) with an anti-c antibody.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	242	 Immunoprecipitates were subjected to electrophoresis and the protein bands were transferred to PVDF membranes.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	243	 Membranes corresponding to immunoprecipitated c and total lysates (Tot.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	244	) were probed with anti-c or anti to IL-15R mAbs.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	245	 The data presented are representative of three independent experiments.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	246	 (B) Analysis of JAK3 phosphorylation by Western blotting.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	247	 TF1 and TF1ss cells were incubated with 10 ng/ml rIL-15 for 15 min at 37 degrees C.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	248	 Sister cultures were pretreated for 1 h with neutralizing anti to IL-15R, anti to GM-CSFRss, and anti-gp130 mAbs.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	249	 Cell extracts were subjected to immunoprecipitation with an anti-JAK3 mAb.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	250	 JAK3 membranes were then re-probed with anti-phosphotyrosine 4G10 or anti-JAK3 mAbs.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	251	 To correct for possible variations in the amount of protein loaded, values are expressed as pJAK3/JAK3 ratios.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	252	 pJAK3/JAK3 levels were determined by densitometry, including correction for background (NIH Image software).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	253	 Results are expressed as increases (e.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	254	, two times) with respect to untreated cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	255	 The data presented are representative of three independent experiments.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	256	 TF1 cells were analyzed for interactions between TRAF2, IL-15R, and c.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	257	 Briefly, lysates were subjected to immunoprecipitation (IP) with an anti-TRAF2 antibody.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	258	 Immunoprecipitates were subjected to electrophoresis and the protein bands were transferred to PVDF membranes.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	259	 Membranes corresponding to immunoprecipitated TRAF2 and total lysates (Tot.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	260	) were probed with anti-TRAF2, anti-c, or anti-IL-15R mAbs.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	261	 The data presented are representative of three independent experiments.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	262	 (D) Analysis of IB phosphorylation by Western blotting.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	263	 TF1 and TF1ss cells were incubated with 10 ng/ml rIL-15 or rIL-7 for 15 min at 37 degrees C.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	264	 Cell extracts were analyzed by Western blotting with anti-phospho-IB (pIB) antibody.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	265	 Membranes were then reprobed with an antibody recognizing ss-actin.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	266	 To correct for possible variations in the amount of protein loaded, values are expressed as pIB/ss actin ratios.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	267	 pIB/ss actin levels were determined by densitometry, including correction for background (NIH Image software).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	268	 Results are expressed as increases with respect to untreated cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	269	 The data presented are representative of three independent experiments.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	270	  Stimulation with rIL-15 induced JAK3 phosphorylation (increase by a factor of 15) only in the presence of anti to GM-CSFRss mAb, indicating that the IL-15R/c receptor is potentially functional in TF1 cells (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	271	 A similar result was also obtained with TF1ss cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	272	Total lysates of the TF1 and TF1ss cell lines were subjected to immunoprecipitation with an anti-JAK3 mAb, and the JAK3 membranes were probed with the anti-phosphotyrosine mAb 4G10.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	273	 A single phosphorylated band was detected for the samples treated with an anti-GM-CSFRss mAb.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	274	 Reprobing of the membrane with an anti-JAK3 mAb resulted in the detection of a single protein with migration characteristics identical to those of the phosphorylated band detected on the 4G10 Western blot, indicating that the phosphorylated protein is, indeed, JAK3.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	275	 These data indicate that the c subunit of the IL-15R/c receptor is functional in TF1 cells, even in the absence of the IL-15Rss chain, but that signaling is controlled by GM-CSFRss.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	276	 The hybrid receptor is, therefore, functional in these cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	277	We analyzed whether the IL-15R/c complex was associated with the signaling molecule TRAF2 (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	278	 Analysis of total lysates with anti-TRAF2, anti-c, or anti to IL-15R mAbs showed that TF1 cells expressed TRAF2 (55 kD), the 58 kD IL-15R isoform and the c chain (64 kD).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	279	 After immunoprecipitation with an anti-TRAF2 antibody, reprobing of the TRAF2 membranes with mAbs recognizing the IL-15R and c chains resulted in the detection of specific 58 and 64 kD bands, respectively, indicating that TRAF2 is physically associated with the IL-15R 58 kD standard isoform and the c chain.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	280	We also showed that rIL-15, but not rIL-7, triggered phosphorylation of the p65 NF-B subunit inhibitor IB (42 kD) within 15 min in TF1 and TF1ss cells (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	281	 Reprobing the membranes with an anti to ss-actin mAb identified a band of similar intensity at 42 kD in each sample, indicating that the gel had been evenly loaded in terms of amount of protein.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	282	 We also showed by confocal microscopy that rIL-15, but not rIL-7, induced the translocation to the nucleus of the p65 NF-B subunit (unpublished data).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	283	 These data indicate that, in TF1 cells, the IL-15R chain is functional and able to activate the NF-B factor.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	284	 Moreover, not only does its association with the c chain not interfere with NF-B activation, it also probably renders the c chain functional even in the absence of the IL-15Rss chain, as shown by the induction of JAK3 phosphorylation by rIL-15.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	285	IL-15 to induced STAT5 Signaling Is Inhibited by Anti to GM-CSFRss mAb in Normal CBPr CD34+/CD56- Cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	286	 Finally, we investigated the functional significance of the hybrid receptor in normal CB hematopoietic progenitors and the properties of this receptor in these cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	287	 We used populations of CB progenitors that had been expanded for 5 d in the presence of SCF and Flt3-L (CBPr CD34+/CD56-).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	288	 This facilitates proliferation of the hematopoietic progenitors, which maintain a CD34+/CD56- phenotype with no expression of lineage-specific markers (7).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	289	 We found that rIL-15 quadrupled levels of STAT3 phosphorylation, which was not significantly affected by anti to GM-CSFRss or isotype-matched control anti-gp130 mAbs (Fig.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	290	 As expected, rGM-CSF did not induce STAT3 phosphorylation.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	291	 In contrast, anti-c, but not anti-gp130 mAbs inhibited constitutive STAT3 phosphorylation, suggesting interference with an autocrine IL-15 to dependent loop.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	292	 Indeed, unprimed hematopoietic precursors secrete several hematopoietic cytokines that regulate normal hematopoiesis (3) by autocrine/paracrine loops, and IL-15 belongs to this group (20).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	293	View larger version (51K):    Figure 6.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	294	 IL-15 signal transduction: IL-15R/GM-CSFR cross talk in CBPr CD34+/CD56- cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	295	 Analysis of STAT signal transduction by Western blotting.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	296	 CB CD34+ cell populations were expanded by incubation for 5 d in the presence of SCF and Flt3-L.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	297	 These cells displayed a CD34+/CD56- phenotype with no expression of lineage-specific markers.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	298	 These CBPr CD34+/CD56- progenitors were incubated with 10 ng/ml rIL-15 or rGM-CSF for 15 min at 37 degrees C.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	299	 Sister cultures were pretreated for 1 h with neutralizing anti-IL-15Rss/c, anti-GM-CSFRss, or anti-IL-6R gp130 mAbs.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	300	 Cell extracts were analyzed by Western blotting with anti-phospho-STAT3 (pSTAT3), anti-phospho-STAT5 (pSTAT5), and anti-phospho-STAT6 (pSTAT6) antibodies.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	301	 Membranes were then reprobed with antibodies recognizing the native proteins.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	302	 To correct for possible variations in the amount of protein loaded, values are expressed as pSTAT/STAT ratios.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	303	 pSTAT/STAT levels were determined by densitometry, including correction for background (NIH Image software).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	304	 Results are expressed as increases with respect to untreated cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	305	 The data presented are representative of two independent experiments.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	306	  Both rIL-15 and rGM-CSF induced STAT5 phosphorylation (increases by factors of 10 and 7, respectively).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	307	 Anti to GM-CSFRss mAb totally abolished the effect of rIL-15 whereas the action of rGM-CSF action was inhibited by only 35% with an anti-c mAb.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	308	 No significant inhibition was observed if an anti-gp130 mAb was used.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	309	 Finally, CBPr CD34+/CD56- progenitors displayed discrete constitutive STAT6 phosphorylation, with an 80% increase in phosphorylation in response to rIL-15, but no effect of rGM-CSF.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	310	 The various neutralizing mAbs had no significant effect on STAT6 phosphorylation.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	311	   Discussion Top Abstract Introduction Materials and Methods Results Discussion References   We found that human CD34+ hematopoietic progenitors express a novel hybrid receptor composed of the c chain of IL-2R and the GM-CSFRss chain.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	312	 This receptor was also found in CD34+ hematopoietic cell lines with proerythroid (TF1, TF1ss) or promegakaryocytic (M07sb) differentiation potentials and in CBPr CD34+/CD56- precursors, but not in the cytolytic NK-L cell line, normal NK cells or nonhematopoietic human cells, even though all these cells produce both chains.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	313	 The hybrid receptor is functional and mediates signal transduction by both the IL-15 and GM-CSF pathways.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	314	 Indeed, the results obtained with an anti-GM-CSFRss mAb suggested that, in TF1ss cells, the GM-CSFRss chain replaces the c chain, inhibiting its specific signaling (phosphorylation of JAK3), but that this chain cooperates with the IL-15Rss chain, facilitating the IL-15 to dependent activation of other JAK/STAT pathways (JAK1, JAK2, STAT5, and STAT6) and controlling the proliferation of these cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	315	 In contrast, an anti-c mAb inhibited the GM-CSF to dependent proliferation of TF1ss cells treated with the recombinant cytokine or cocultured with human stromal hematopoietic cells secreting GM-CSF.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	316	 This suggests that the hybrid receptor may have important effects in vivo, interfering in the interactions between CD34+ cells and stromal cells that play a major role in the control of both normal and pathological hematopoiesis (1, 2).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	317	 In addition, anti to IL-15Rss/c mAbs, and the specific JAK3 inhibitor WHI-P31, inhibited the nuclear translocation of STAT5 induced by rGM-CSF but did not inhibit the phosphorylation of STAT5.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	318	 These effects on STAT5 were also observed in M07Sb cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	319	 Our observation that the c subunit of the hybrid receptor controls the GM-CSF to dependent nuclear translocation of pSTAT5 rather than STAT5 phosphorylation is consistent with recent results showing that the tyrosine phosphorylation and nuclear translocation of STAT proteins are regulated independently (31, 32).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	320	 Indeed, in human keratinocytes, which express a type II IL-4R, IL-4 induces the phosphorylation of STAT3, but not its nuclear translocation (31), whereas the prolactin receptor (PRLR) regulates STAT5 tyrosine phosphorylation and nuclear translocation by means of two independent pathways (32).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	321	 With PRLR, the number of phosphorylated tyrosines on the receptor itself seems to play a critical role in the activation of a cellular component that controls the number of STAT5 complexes in the cytoplasm, by controlling the entry of these complexes into the nucleus (32).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	322	 Moreover, STAT5 tyrosine phosphorylation and DNA binding via the IL-2Rss chain requires receptor phosphotyrosines (33), whereas similar events mediated by the G-CSFR are independent of receptor phosphotyrosines (34).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	323	 Thus, the structural organization of some receptors and the subsequent activation of particular signaling pathways may affect the translocation of STAT protein to the nucleus.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	324	On the basis of these results, we propose a model for the activation of STAT5 by rGM-CSF via the hybrid receptor c/GM-CSFRss.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	325	 We suggest that STAT5 tyrosine phosphorylation and nuclear translocation are regulated independently and that the translocation pathway is controlled by the c/JAK3 complex, which, in cells with type I IL-4R, is necessary for the translocation of STAT5 to the nucleus (35).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	326	The hybrid receptor is functional not only in leukemic cell precursors, but also in normal progenitors, although its functions appear more limited in normal cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	327	 Indeed, in normal CBPr CD34+/CD56- progenitors, the hybrid receptor controls the IL-15 to dependent phosphorylation of STAT5 but not of STAT3 and STAT6.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	328	 Moreover, levels of GM-CSF to dependent STAT5 phosphorylation are decreased by anti-c mAb in CBPr CD34+/CD56- progenitors, but not in TF1ss cells.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	329	 These differences may be due to differences in origin (normal versus pathological) and/or degree of primitiveness of the two types of CD34+ cell.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	330	 In any case, our results emphasize the involvement of the hybrid receptor in the control of normal and pathological hematopoiesis, with this receptor probably displaying various functions during hematopoietic development.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	331	The absence of the hybrid receptor on nonhematopoietic cells strengthens the evidence for its "specific" involvement in hematopoiesis.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	332	 The distribution of this receptor in cells of various lineages and functions suggests that it is involved in the development of hematopoiesis, probably affecting engagement in myeloid, rather than lymphoid, lineages.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	333	 Indeed, the inhibition of c/JAK3 signaling by the GM-CSFRss chain should be interpreted in light of the inhibition of lymphocyte maturation and myelopoiesis dysregulation observed in mice and humans bearing c or JAK3 deletions or mutations (9 to 11).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	334	In erythrocytic TF1 cells, we describe, for the first time, a novel IL-15R/c/TRAF2 complex that triggers specific IL-15 signaling, even though these cells do not express the IL-15Rss chain23, a subunit indispensable for the c chain functions (7).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	335	 Both subunits of the IL-15R/c heterodimer are functional, although they behave differently from what would be expected based on the results obtained for other cell types.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	336	 It has been reported that IL-15R, associating with the signaling molecule TRAF2, activates the transcription factor NF-B, in the absence of a link with the c chain (12, 24).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	337	 In contrast, in TF1 cells, IL-15R and c are associated but we nevertheless observed the phosphorylation, not only of IB, but also of JAK3 factors.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	338	 However, the phosphorylation of JAK3 factor was only observed in samples treated with rIL-15 and anti to GM-CSFRss mAb, indicating that the c/JAK3 pathway is functional in the absence of the IL-15Rss chain but is controlled by the hybrid receptor.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	339	The association of IL-15R/c/TRAF2 may play a regulatory role at certain stages of hematopoiesis, associating NF-B activation, which is involved in the control of erythropoiesis (15), with the conditional activation of JAK3-dependent pathways.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	340	Finally, we showed that rIL-15 induced the phosphorylation of STAT6 both in leukemic TF1ss proerythroid precursors, and in normal CBPr CD34+/CD56- progenitors.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	341	 Our data suggest that this unusual IL-15 to dependent pathway, the activation of which in mast cells was attributed to the high-affinity p65 IL-15RX receptor (28, 29), is also triggered in other types of CD34+ precursor.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	342	 However, in TF1ss cells, this pathway is controlled by the classical IL-15R/ss/c receptor and/or by the c/GM-CSFRss hybrid receptor, whereas in normal CBPr, CD34+/CD56- IL-15 to dependent STAT6 phosphorylation is not controlled by the hybrid receptor.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	343	 Overall, these results suggest the possible and complex involvement of STAT6 in the control of hematopoiesis (36) and provide further evidence that IL-15/GM-CSF are involved in cross talk.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	344	Recent data have shown that unprimed hematopoietic progenitors secrete several mediators activating autocrine/paracrine regulatory loops (3).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	345	 For instance, CD34+ cells may express GM-CSF transcripts (3) and a biologically active IL-15 that controls expression of the c chain, but is not competent for inducing the spontaneous differentiation of these cells into NK cells (20).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	346	 Thus, IL-15 and GM-CSF may contribute, by means of the hybrid receptor, to the autocrine/paracrine cross talk that controls the development of hematopoietic cells (3), perhaps by inhibiting the spontaneous engagement of these cells in the lymphoid lineage.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	347	 In contrast, in leukemic hematopoiesis, the action of the hybrid receptor is probably irreversible and may be involved in the molecular mechanisms responsible for the inhibition of differentiation in certain leukemic clones.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	348	   Acknowledgments   This work was supported by grants from the Association pour la Recherche sur le Cancer (ARC, N degrees  5801), NRB-Vaincre le Cancer, FE.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	349	FLUC, Fondation de France (N degrees  99-003929), Italian Association for Cancer Research (AIRC), and the Italian National Council for Research (CNR).
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	350	Submitted: January 29, 2002 Revised: January 27, 2003 Accepted: January 28, 2003.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	351	   Footnotes   * Abbreviations used in this paper: BM, bone marrow; CB, cord blood; MPB, mobilized peripheral blood.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	352	   References Top Abstract Introduction Materials and Methods Results Discussion References   Ratajczak, M.

0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	355	 Numerous growth factors, cytokines, and chemokines are secreted by human CD34(+) cells, myeloblasts, erythroblasts, and megakaryoblasts and regulate normal hematopoiesis in an autocrine/paracrine manner.
0.26340848.12642604.html.plaintext.txt	356	[Abstract/Free Full Text] Shibuya, A.
