0.25489283.16188891.html.plaintext.txt	464	HOME HELP FEEDBACK SUBSCRIPTIONS ARCHIVE SEARCH TABLE OF CONTENTS  All ASBMB Journals   Molecular and Cellular Proteomics   Journal of Lipid Research   Biochemistry and Molecular Biology Education  Copyright   2005 by the American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	0	Role of Accessory Factors and Steroid Receptor Coactivator 1 in the Regulation of Phosphoenolpyruvate Carboxykinase Gene Transcription by Glucocorticoids* John M.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	1	 Stafford, Mary Waltner-Law, and Daryl K.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	2	From the Department of Molecular Physiology and Biophysics, Vanderbilt University School of Medicine and the Nashville Veterans Administration Hospital, Nashville, Tennessee 37232.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	3	Received for publication, October 13, 2000, and in revised form, November 6, 2000.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	4	    ABSTRACT TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	5	In the liver, glucocorticoids induce a 10-15-fold increase in the rate of transcription of the phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase (PEPCK) gene, which encodes a key gluconeogenic enzyme.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	6	 This induction requires a multicomponent glucocorticoid response unit (GRU) comprised of four glucocorticoid accessory factor (AF) elements and two glucocorticoid receptor binding sites.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	7	 We show that the AFs that bind the gAF1, gAF2, and gAF3 elements (hepatocyte nuclear factor [HNF]4/chicken ovalbumin upstream promoter transcription factor 1 and HNF3) all interact with steroid receptor coactivator 1 (SRC1).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	8	 This suggests that the AFs function in part by recruiting coactivators to the GRU.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	9	 The binding of a GAL4-SRC1 chimeric protein completely restores the glucocorticoid induction that is lost when any one of these elements is replaced with a GAL4 binding site.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	10	 Thus, when SRC1 is recruited directly to gAF1, gAF2, or gAF3, the requirement for the corresponding AF is bypassed.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	11	 Surprisingly, glucocorticoid receptor is still required when SRC1 is recruited directly to the GAL4 site, suggesting a role for the receptor in activating SRC1 in the context of the GRU.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	12	 Structural variants of GAL4-SRC1 were used to identify requirements for the basic-helix-loop-helix and histone acetyltransferase domains of SRC1, and these are specific to the region of the promoter to which the coactivator is recruited.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	13	     INTRODUCTION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	14	Mammals must have a readily adaptable mechanism for maintaining glucose homeostasis in the face of fluctuations in nutrient supply.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	15	 Hormones such as glucocorticoids control transcription of genes that encode enzymes that help provide the adaptive response to these environmental changes (3-5).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	16	 These hormone responses were originally thought to be mediated through a direct interaction of the hormone receptor and a simple DNA element, the hormone response element (HRE)1 (6-8).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	17	 In recent years it has become apparent that more complex structures are involved.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	18	 Hormone response units, comprised of HREs and accessory factor (AF) elements have been found in many genes involved in metabolic regulation (9-14).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	19	 AFs are DNA binding transcription factors that act in concert with the hormone receptor to provide the flexible regulation of gene transcription required for metabolic homeostasis (5, 6, 15, 16).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	20	In addition to their function in hormone-mediated gene transcription, AFs also play a central role in determining how metabolites regulate transcription.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	21	 For instance, glucose-stimulated transcription of the L-PK gene requires a glucose response element that binds transcription factors of the upstream stimulating factor family.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	22	 This glucose response, however, is regulated positively or negatively by the binding of HNF4 or COUP-TF, respectively, at an adjacent accessory element (17-20).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	23	 In addition, Osborne and co-workers show that, in the absence of cholesterol, SREBP activates transcription of the low density lipoprotein receptor and hydroxymethylglutaryl-CoA reductase gene promoters (21-23).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	24	 An SREBP response element (SRE) alone, however, is not sufficient for activation of either gene.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	25	 The activation of the low density liproprotein receptor gene promoter by SREBP requires not only a sterol response element but also an SP1 binding element (21, 24).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	26	 SP1 binding to this promoter correlates with transcription of the gene in the absence of cholesterol (9).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	27	 Similarly, the activation of hydroxymethylglutaryl-CoA reductase gene expression by SREBP requires both a sterol response element and an element that binds nuclear factor Y (9, 22, 23).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	28	The role of AFs is well characterized in the regulation of PEPCK gene transcription by glucocorticoids.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	29	 In adipose tissue, where PEPCK is involved in glycerogenesis, glucocorticoids repress basal and cAMP-induced PEPCK gene transcription (25, 26).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	30	 By contrast, the PEPCK gene is stimulated by glucocorticoids in the liver, where PEPCK is an important control point for gluconeogenesis (16, 27).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	31	 In the liver, glucocorticoids induce an 10-fold increase in the rate of transcription of the PEPCK gene through a multicomponent glucocorticoid response unit (GRU) located in the promoter region (28).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	32	 The GRU consists of a tandem array of four AF elements (gAF1-3 and the cAMP response element) that bind HNF4/COUP-TF, HNF3, COUP-TF, and C/EBP, respectively, and two nonconsensus glucocorticoid receptor binding sites (GR1, GR2) (13, 28-32).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	33	 Interestingly, neither HNF3 nor HNF4 is expressed in adipose tissue, whereas both are expressed at high levels in the liver (33-35).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	34	 Thus, the accessory factors HNF3 and HNF4 appear to play an additional important role in facilitating tissue-specific induction of PEPCK gene transcription.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	35	A mutation of any one of the accessory elements results in a 50-60% reduction of glucocorticoid-stimulated PEPCK gene transcription in H4IIE hepatoma cells (28, 32, 36, 37).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	36	 Any combination of two mutations of gAF1/gAF3 or gAF2 nearly abolishes the response (28, 37).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	37	 The physiologic importance of these gAFs is evident in their role in glucose production.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	38	 Overexpression of an HNF3 variant that reduces the response of the PEPCK gene to glucocorticoids by ~50% nearly abolishes glucocorticoid-induced glucose production in hepatoma cells (14).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	39	These gAF elements are not all functionally equivalent in the context of the PEPCK gene promoter (28, 31, 38).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	40	 gAF1 and gAF3 can be exchanged, a finding consistent with the observation that COUP-TF binds to both elements.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	41	 However, gAF1/gAF3 cannot be replaced with gAF2 and vice versa (37).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	42	 Furthermore, the spacing between gAF2 and GR1 must be maintained, whereas this is not as important for gAF1 and gAF3 (37).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	43	 HNF3, the AF that binds gAF2, interacts with GR in vitro (37).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	44	 Thus, direct contact between HNF3 and GR may be important for stabilizing GR binding to the GR1 and GR2 elements of the PEPCK gene promoter, which bind GR with low affinity relative to a consensus GRE (36).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	45	 In fact, these nonconsensus elements (GR1 and GR2), either alone or in combination, cannot by themselves mediate a glucocorticoid response when placed in the context of a heterologous promoter (36).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	46	 Thus, the glucocorticoid response of the PEPCK gene is completely dependent on the gAF elements and the factors that bind to these sites.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	47	 However, the mechanism by which AFs control the direction and magnitude of PEPCK gene transcription in response to glucocorticoids remains largely unknown.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	48	The recruitment of coactivator molecules provides a crucial step in the integration of the functions of steroid hormone receptors and AFs with the basal transcription machinery (2, 39, 40).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	49	 Coactivators generally do not bind DNA, but instead associate with DNA-bound activator proteins.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	50	 Some coactivators such as CREB (cAMP-response element-binding protein)-binding protein (CBP) mediate the functions of a diverse group of transcription factors.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	51	 Others, such as steroid receptor coactivator 1 (SRC1) and glucocorticoid receptor interacting protein (GRIP1), are functionally more specific in that they interact with activator proteins involved in steroid hormone-mediated gene transcription (41, 42).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	52	In this study, we show that the AFs bound to the gAF1 and gAF2 elements of the PEPCK gene promoter recruit the coactivator molecule SRC1.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	53	 HNF4 and COUP-TF interact with SRC1 through the domains required for their AF activity (1, 2).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	54	 We show here that HNF3 also interacts with SRC1 through the same domain required for its AF activity in the PEPCK gene promoter.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	55	 Mutations of either gAF1 or gAF2 that prevent HNF4/COUP-TF or HNF3 from binding, including replacement of the gAF element with a GAL4 binding site (gAFGAL4), result in a 50-60% reduction of the response of the PEPCK gene to glucocorticoids (43).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	56	 The binding of a GAL4-SRC1 chimeric protein to a gAF1GAL4 or a gAF2GAL4 element in a PEPCK luciferase reporter gene construct completely restores the glucocorticoid induction.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	57	 Thus, when SRC1 is recruited directly to gAF1 or gAF2, the requirement for the corresponding AF is functionally bypassed.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	58	 Surprisingly, even when SRC1 is recruited to the PEPCK gene promoter in this manner, active involvement of ligand-bound GR is still required, suggesting a role of the receptor in activating SRC1 in the context of this enhanceosome.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	59	 Finally, we show that the bHLH and HAT domains of SRC1 function differently according to the component of the PEPCK gene GRU to which the coactivator is recruited.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	60	     EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	61	Plasmid Construction-- The reporter construct PEPCK-LUC was made by excising the PEPCK gene promoter (from 467 to +65) from pPL32-CAT (44) with AflIII/BglII and inserting it into the MluI/BglII sites of pGL3 basic (Promega).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	62	 The same procedure was used to generate the gAF1GAL4 PEPCK-LUC, gAF2GAL4 PEPCK-LUC, and gAF3GAL4 PEPCK-LUC reporter constructs from their respective chloramphenicol acetyltransferase reporters, as described previously (43).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	63	 The gAF1GAL4 PEPCK-LUC constructs with block mutations in the GR1 and GR2 elements were constructed using the Quick Change site-directed mutagenesis kit (Stratagene).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	64	 The GAL4-SRC1 deletion constructs were also made by the Quick Change site-directed mutagenesis kit using a GAL4-SRC1 construct as the template.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	65	 Oligonucleotides used to generate these constructs were made by an Expedite 8909 oligonucleotide synthesizer (Perspective Biosystems, Framingham, MA).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	66	 The sequences of all oligonucleotides used in this study are shown in Table I.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	67	 All constructs were verified by sequencing.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	68	 The reporter plasmid (GAL4)5-E1b-LUC has been described previously (1, 2).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	69	 The GAL4-HNF3 constructs were also described previously and are expressed at approximately equal levels in transient transfection experiments (43).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	70	                              View this table:    Table I Oligonucleotides used; sense strand 5' to 3'.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	71	Transient Transfection-- The maintenance and transfection of H4IIE cells and the measurements of luciferase activity were performed as described previously (44, 45), except that H4IIE cells were maintained in alpha-modified Eagle's medium 10% fetal bovine serum growth medium during incubation with calcium phosphate-precipitated DNA for 3 h before the Me2SO shock.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	72	 Subsequently, the cells were washed and incubated overnight in serum-free medium with or without 500 nM dexamethasone, as described in the figure legends.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	73	 In experiments performed with H4IIE cells, the glucocorticoid response varied from 7- to 20-fold (with dexamethasone/without dexamethasone).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	74	 The variation is passage- and batch-dependent.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	75	 For this reason, we expressed the data in each experiment as a percentage of the wild-type glucocorticoid response, which allowed for comparison of experiments done in cells grown at different times.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	76	 For experiments that involved mapping the domains of GAL4-SRC1 required for accessory factor activity, 5  microg of the reporter construct (gAF1GAL4 PEPCK-LUC or gAF2GAL4 PEPCK-LUC) were cotransfected with 2.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	77	5  microg of GR expression vector and 0.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	78	0  microg of expression plasmid encoding the various GAL4-SRC1 structural variants.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	79	 The total amount of DNA transfected in each experiment was kept constant by using varying amounts of the empty vector.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	80	 These experiments were repeated 3-5 times, and the optimal hormonal responses from each titration experiment were pooled for the results shown in Figs.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	81	 The optimal concentration of GAL4-SRC was consistently 0.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	82	25  microg, but the optimal concentration of the structural variants varied from 0.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	83	 Luciferase activity was determined using the Promega luciferase assay system and normalized to the protein concentration of whole cell extracts.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	84	 Transient transfections of HeLa and COS cells were performed as described previously (2, 43).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	85	 The expression vector for GAL4-SRC1 was provided by Dr.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	86	 Peter Kushner, University of California, San Francisco.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	87	 Statistical analysis was performed using Student's t test, assuming two-tailed variance.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	88	Gel Mobility Shift Assay-- The gel mobility shift assays were performed as described previously, except that 7.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	89	5  microg of nuclear extracts were used for incubations rather than whole-cell extracts (43).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	90	 Nuclear extracts were prepared as described (30, 46).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	91	 Briefly, extracts were incubated in the presence or absence of GAL4-DNA binding domain (GAL4-DBD) antibody or Lex A antibody as a control (Santa Cruz Biotechnology, Santa Cruz, CA) for 15 min at room temperature in a 10- microl reaction and then mixed with 10  microl of a reaction buffer containing 30,000 cpm of a 32P-labeled DNA probe (5'-CACACGGAGGACTGTCCTCCGACCA-3'), 20 mM HEPES, pH 7.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	92	6, 100 mM NaCl, 5 mM MgCl2, 10  microM ZnS04, 6% glycerol, 0.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	93	6  microg poly(dI-dC) (Amersham Pharmacia Biotech), and 2  microg of salmon sperm DNA for another 15 min at room temperature.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	94	 The reaction mixtures were loaded onto a 6% polyacrylamide gel in 0.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	95	5 x  Tris-buffered EDTA and electrophoresed at 20 mA for 150 min at room temperature.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	96	 The gels were dried and exposed to x-ray film (Eastman Kodak Co.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	97	     RESULTS TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	98	Direct Recruitment of a Coactivator, GAL4-SRC1, Can Replace the AF Function of HNF4 or COUP-TF at gAF1-- Previous studies of the PEPCK gene GRU show that each gAF element is specifically required and that a precise organization of these elements in the GRU is necessary for a full glucocorticoid response (28, 37).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	99	 Glucocorticoids cause a 15-fold induction of reporter enzyme activity when a PEPCK gene promoter-luciferase reporter construct that contains all of the gAF elements is expressed transiently in H4IIE hepatoma cells (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	100	 H4IIE cells have significant amounts of endogenous accessory factors and potential coregulators such as SRC1 to provide for this response.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	101	2 The presence of large amounts of these wild-type proteins, however, makes it difficult to analyze the effects of their transiently expressed variants on PEPCK gene transcription.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	102	 Mutations of the gAF1 element that prevent HNF4/COUP-TF from binding, including replacement of gAF1 with a GAL4 binding site (gAF1GAL4), result in a 50-60% reduction of the response of the PEPCK gene to glucocorticoids, as noted previously (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	103	 The GAL4 binding site can bind chimeric proteins that contain domains of interest and, thus, can serve as a surrogate gAF element.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	104	 This is useful because the endogenous PEPCK AFs cannot function through this surrogate gAF element; thus, they are effectively removed from the analytical system.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	105	View larger version (16K):    Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	106	   GAL4-SRC1 mediates accessory factor activity through the gAF1 element.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	107	 H4IIE cells were transfected with 5  microg of the PEPCK-LUC reporter construct (wild-type PEPCK gene promoter, from position 467 to +65 relative to the transcription start site, fused to LUC) and 2.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	108	5  microg of an expression plasmid for GR.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	109	 Alternatively, cells were transfected with 5  microg of a reporter construct based on PEPCK-LUC in which the gAF2 element has been mutated to a GAL4 DNA binding element (gAF1GAL4).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	110	 These cells were cotransfected with 0.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	111	5  microg of an expression plasmid encoding either the GAL4-DBD or GAL4-SRC1.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	112	 Transfected cells were incubated in serum-free medium with or without hormone overnight.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	113	 Cells were harvested, and luciferase assays were performed as described under "Experimental Procedures.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	114	" These results represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	115	The reduction of the glucocorticoid response caused by replacement of the gAF1 element with a GAL4 element cannot be restored by expression of the GAL4-DBD, indicating that the GAL4-DBD cannot act as an AF through this surrogate gAF1 element (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	116	 By contrast, the binding of chimeric proteins consisting of the GAL4-DBD and either HNF4 or COUP-TF restores the glucocorticoid response (1, 43).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	117	 It is possible that HNF4 and COUP-TF recruit coactivator molecules to form a glucocorticoid-specific enhanceosome, whereas the GAL4-DBD does not.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	118	 These coactivators, in turn, could stabilize the enhanceosome complex and/or provide necessary activation to the promoter region (47).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	119	 In support of this model, we have shown that HNF4 and COUP-TF (AFs which bind gAF1 and gAF3) interact with SRC1 through the domains demonstrated to be required for their accessory factor activity (1, 2).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	120	We hypothesized that, if the role of HNF4/COUP-TF at gAF1 is to recruit coactivators such as SRC1, then direct recruitment of the latter to the gAF1 element by making a chimeric protein with the GAL4-DBD and full-length SRC1 (GAL4-SRC1) should also mediate the glucocorticoid response.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	121	 Indeed, the binding of GAL4-SRC1 completely restores the glucocorticoid induction through a gAF1GAL4 PEPCK-LUC construct (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	122	 Thus, the requirement for the AF is bypassed when SRC1 is recruited directly to gAF1.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	123	 Surprisingly, there is little increase in basal promoter-reporter activity with GAL4-SRC1 expression in the absence of glucocorticoids (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	124	 This implies that, even when SRC1 is constitutively recruited by a GAL4 binding element, active involvement of ligand-bound GR is still required, suggesting a role of the receptor in activating SRC1 in the context of the enhanceosome.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	125	 We and others also show that the coactivator cAMP-response element-binding protein (CREB)-binding protein (CBP) interacts with HNF4 (2, 48).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	126	 A fusion construct expressing a GAL4-CBP chimeric protein also restores the lost glucocorticoid response through the gAF1GAL4 PEPCK-LUC construct (data not shown).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	127	 Thus, one role of the AF bound at the gAF1 element appears to be recruitment of its cognate coactivators.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	128	In a set of experiments similar to those shown in Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	129	 1, we found that GAL4-SRC1 can also replace COUP-TF at gAF3 in a construct where the gAF3 element was changed to a GAL4 binding element, gAF3GAL4 PEPCK-LUC (data not shown).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	130	 This result is not surprising since the gAF1 and gAF3 elements are interchangeable, and both bind COUP-TF.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	131	 The amino acid region from 408-423 of COUP-TFI is necessary for this protein to function as an AF in the PEPCK gene GRU (1).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	132	 This same region of COUP-TFI is also essential for the interaction with SRC1 (1).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	133	 These observations suggest that GAL4-SRC1 replaces some essential function of the AFs that bind to these elements in the native promoter.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	134	Coactivator Recruitment Does Not Relieve the Requirement for Active Involvement of Ligand-bound GR in the Glucocorticoid Response-- The ligand-bound GR could serve primarily as a signal transducer for recruitment of coactivators and assembly of a glucocorticoid-specific enhanceosome.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	135	 If so, ligand-bound GR would no longer be required after this enhanceosome is assembled.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	136	 The low basal reporter gene activity in cells expressing GAL4-SRC1 was surprising, as the coactivator is constitutively bound to the promoter, yet the reporter gene is inactive in the absence of glucocorticoid treatment (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	137	 We therefore reasoned that there must be active involvement of ligand-bound GR for GAL4-SRC1 to function as a surrogate AF.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	138	 In a set of experiments performed concomitantly with those described in Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	139	 1, PEPCK promoter reporter gene constructs were made in which block mutations were created in either GR2 or both of the GREs (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	140	 Since GR1 is more important than GR2 in the glucocorticoid response (36), we were able to create a graded system in which only ~40% (GR2 mutated) or all of the function of GR is eliminated (GR1 and GR2 mutated), respectively.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	141	 Mutation of GR2 or both GREs severely blunts or eliminates the glucocorticoid response, respectively, even when GAL4-SRC1 is tethered to the promoter through the surrogate gAF1 element (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	142	View larger version (25K):    Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	143	   The PEPCK gene glucocorticoid response requires GR binding even after coactivator recruitment.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	144	 These experiments were performed as described in Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	145	 1, except that the reporter constructs illustrated in the inset were used.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	146	 In the inset, crosses through the GR1 or GR2 elements represent block mutations in these elements that prevent GR form binding.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	147	 For simplicity, results are represented relative to the fold induction of wild-type PEPCK-LUC by glucocorticoids, taken as 100%.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	148	 These results represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	149	GAL4-SRC1 Can Also Replace the AF Function of the gAF3-bound Factor-- The gAF1/3 and gAF2 elements are not interchangeable in the PEPCK gene GRU (36, 37).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	150	 As expected, about 60% of the glucocorticoid response is lost when gAF2 is changed to a GAL4 binding element (gAF2GAL4 PEPCK-LUC) (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	151	 This AF activity cannot be restored by coexpression of the GAL4-DBD but is completely restored by GAL4-HNF3 (43).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	152	 Despite the functional distinction between gAF1/3 and gAF2, GAL4-SRC1 recruitment to gAF2GAL4 PEPCK-LUC completely restores the glucocorticoid response lost by mutation of this element (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	153	 Thus, GAL4-SRC1 can act as a surrogate AF through gAF2 as well, and in so doing, it provides a functional bypass of the requirement for HNF3.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	154	View larger version (14K):    Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	155	   GAL4-SRC1 mediates accessory factor activity through the gAF2 element.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	156	 Experiments were performed as described in Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	157	 1, except that a reporter plasmid in which the gAF2 element of PEPCK was been mutated to a GAL4 DNA binding element (gAF2GAL4 PEPCK-LUC) was used.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	158	 These results represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	159	HNF3 Interacts with SRC1 in Vivo-- As mentioned previously, HNF4 and COUP-TF, the AFs that bind gAF1 and gAF3, both interact with SRC1.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	160	 We proposed that GAL4-SRC1 could serve as a surrogate AF through gAF1 and gAF3 when these elements are changed to a GAL4 binding element, respectively, because SRC1 is recruited to the promoter at an appropriate position (this paper and Refs.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	161	 If SRC1 replaces a distinct function of HNF3 in the GRU, it is possible that HNF3 also interacts with SRC1.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	162	 To test this, an expression vector for SRC1 was cotransfected into HeLa cells with GAL4-HNF3 or variants thereof and a luciferase reporter plasmid that contained a minimal E1b promoter positioned downstream of five GAL4 binding elements [(GAL4)5-E1b-LUC].
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	163	 All GAL4 constructs were expressed at low levels (0.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	164	5  microg of vector) to allow for maximal coactivation by SRC1.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	165	 Cotransfection of SRC1 potentiates transactivation mediated by GAL4-HNF3 an additional 7-fold relative to expression of an empty control vector (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	166	 Coexpression of SRC1 does not coactivate through the GAL4-DBD, as seen in previous work (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	167	View larger version (17K):    Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	168	   SRC1 potentiates the activity of GAL4-HNF3 fusion proteins.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	169	 Expression plasmids that encode SRC1 (5  microg) and GAL4-HNF3 fusion proteins (0.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	170	5  microg) were cotransfected into HeLa cells along with the reporter construct (GAL4)5-E1b-LUC (2.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	171	 The additional increase of activity provided by SRC1 is presented relative to the activity of the GAL4-DBD and is expressed as fold coactivation when equal amounts of DNA from the control vectors were transfected.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	172	 These results represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	173	The region of HNF3 encompassing amino acids 361-458 is required for the AF activity of this protein (43).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	174	 The interaction of SRC1 with GAL4-HNF3361-458 results in a 12-fold coactivation, whereas GAL4-HNF3 361-442, which cannot act as an AF (43), is ineffective (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	175	 Thus, the region of HNF3 required for AF activity in the GRU may act by recruiting SRC1, a finding consonant with the ability of GAL4-SRC1 to replace the function of HNF3 on the gAF2GAL4 PEPCK-LUC reporter construct.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	176	Promoter- and Element-specific Requirements for the bHLH/PAS and HAT Domains of GAL4-SRC1-- It is difficult to analyze the effect of transiently expressed SRC1 variants in the presence of significant amounts of the endogenous, wild-type protein.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	177	 However, the system described in the previous figures, in which GAL4-SRC1 is recruited to the GAL4 element of the gAFGAL4 PEPCK and (GAL4)5-E1b promoters, respectively, is useful because variants of GAL4-SRC1 can be specifically targeted to these promoters, effectively removing endogenous SRC1 from the analytical system.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	178	 This system can be used to identify the minimal functional domains of SRC1 required for the PEPCK glucocorticoid response.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	179	SRC1 was originally identified from a cDNA that lacked the region encoding the 41-most N-terminal amino acids (40).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	180	 The protein encoded by this cDNA does not function as a coactivator for HNF4,2 although it still presumably binds HNF4 through the nuclear receptor binding motifs, NRBI-IV, which are present in the truncated protein.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	181	 By contrast, full-length SRC1 does serve as a coactivator for HNF4, and as a GAL4-chimeric protein, it can replace HNF4 as an AF on a gAF1GAL4 PEPCK-LUC construct (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	182	 Expression of a variant of GAL4-SRC1 that lacks the N-terminal 45 amino acids (GAL4-SRC1-bHLH) does not replace HNF4 as an AF (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	183	 This GAL4-SRC1-bHLH protein provides no more AF activity than does the GAL4-DBD alone or a deletion of the gAF1 element (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	184	 Thus, the ability of GAL4-SRC1 to serve as a surrogate AF through the gAF1 element correlates with its ability to coactivate HNF4, the AF that binds this element in the wild-type promoter (30, 43).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	185	View larger version (24K):    Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	186	   The bHLH and HAT domains of SRC1 are required at gAF1 for the glucocorticoid response.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	187	 Panel A, experiments were performed as described in Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	188	 1, except that equal amounts of GAL4-DBD, GAL4-SRC1, or the structural variants indicated were used.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	189	 The results are represented relative to the fold induction of wild-type PEPCK-LUC by glucocorticoids, which is taken as 100%.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	190	 These results represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	191	 The asterisks represent statistically significant differences (p  <  0.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	192	 Panel B, the expression and DNA binding of various GAL4-SRC1 fusion proteins was determined in COS cells transfected with 20  microg of expression plasmids that encode various GAL4-SRC1 fusion constructs.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	193	 Nuclear extracts were prepared, and the gel mobility shift assay was used to analyze expression levels (as described under "Experimental Procedures").
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	194	 The arrows indicate the various GAL4-SRC1 fusion proteins.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	195	 Each protein complex was eliminated by preincubation of the extracts with a polyclonal antibody directed against the GAL4-DBD but not an unrelated antibody raised against Lex A.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	196	SRC1, with its resident acetyltransferase activity and protein-protein interaction surfaces, could serve both as a structural adapter molecule in the GRU enhanceosome and also to promote transcription by the acetylation of chromatin components and transcription factors (49-51).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	197	 A deletion construct of GAL4-SRC1, in which the acetyltransferase domain was deleted (GAL4-SRCHAT), does not restore the glucocorticoid responsiveness of the reporter gene (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	198	 A chimeric construct in which the five C-terminal amino acids encompassing NRBIV were deleted (GAL4-SRC1IV) provides a glucocorticoid response comparable with that of GAL4-SRC1 (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	199	 This region is important for the interaction of SRC1 with GR, although NRBI-III also contributes to this physical interaction (52).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	200	The expression of the GAL4-SRC1 variants was confirmed in a gel mobility shift experiment in which nuclear extracts prepared from GAL4-SRC1 fusion protein-expressing cells were tested.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	201	 The empty vector was used as a control to ensure that no endogenous mammalian proteins bind to the GAL4 binding element.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	202	 COS cells were used for this experiment because of the very low transfection efficiency of H4IIE hepatoma cells.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	203	 All of the structural variants of GAL4-SRC1 are expressed efficiently and at approximately equal levels (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	204	 The identity of these protein-DNA complexes as the GAL4-SRC1 variants was determined by preincubation of the nuclear extract with a polyclonal antibody raised against the GAL4-DBD.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	205	 This preincubation with the anti-GAL4-DBD antibody prevents each complex from forming, but an unrelated antibody (anti-Lex A) is without effect (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	206	 No protein-DNA complexes are seen with nuclear extracts prepared from COS cells transfected with pRC-RSV, the vector control for GAL4-SRC1 (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	207	 It is not known why GAL4-SRC1-bHLH migrates slightly more slowly.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	208	 All of these proteins migrate as expected, as determined by Western blot analysis, when the gel is run under denaturing conditions (data not shown).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	209	The gAF1 and gAF2 elements are functionally distinct in the PEPCK gene GRU (36, 37); thus, we speculated that there might be different requirements for SRC1 when it is recruited through these respective sites.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	210	 As seen at gAF1, the acetyltransferase activity of SRC1 is also required at gAF2, since GAL4-SRC1HAT does not mediate AF activity (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	211	 As at the gAF1 element, the NRBIV region of GAL4-SRC1 is also dispensable at gAF2 (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	212	 However, by contrast to the functional requirements of GAL4-SRC1 at gAF1, where the bHLH/PAS domain is critical to the surrogate-AF activity provided by this protein, the bHLH/PAS region is completely dispensable at gAF2 (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	213	 The distinct requirements of various regions of GAL4-SRC1 at gAF1, as compared with gAF2, supports the contention that the gAF1 and gAF2 elements have distinct roles in the glucocorticoid response (36).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	214	 This result also suggests that GAL4-SRC1 replaces some essential, but distinct function of both HNF4/COUP-TF and HNF3 at gAF1 and gAF2, respectively.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	215	View larger version (21K):    Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	216	   The HAT domain of SRC1 is required for the glucocorticoid response at gAF2, but the bHLH domain is not.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	217	 Experiments were performed as described in Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	218	 3, except that equal amounts of GAL4-DBD (+G4-DBD), GAL4-SRC1 (+G4-SRC1), or the structural variants indicated were used.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	219	 This result demonstrates element-specific requirements of SRC1 in the PEPCK gene GRU, and it further confirms that GAL4-SRC-bHLH is not transcriptionally inactive.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	220	 Results are represented relative to the fold induction of wild-type PEPCK-LUC by glucocorticoids, which is taken as 100%.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	221	 These results represent the mean  plus or minus  S.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	222	 The asterisk represents a statistically significant difference (p  <  0.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	223	The element-specific requirements for GAL4-SRC1 at gAF1 and gAF2 demonstrate that multiple functions of coactivators are required for the PEPCK glucocorticoid response.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	224	 These requirements may be determined by the local promoter environment to which the coactivator is recruited.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	225	 This high degree of specificity may also reflect promoter-specific requirements of the bHLH/PAS and HAT domains of SRC1 between different promoters.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	226	 None of the GAL4-SRC1 variants significantly activate basal PEPCK gene promoter-reporter activity (Figs.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	227	 1 and 3); however, GAL4-SRC1 has low basal transactivation potential through a simple promoter that contains multimerized GAL4 binding elements (53).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	228	 We used this system to test the inherent capacity of the GAL4-SRC1 variants to activate basal transcription.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	229	 The coexpression of GAL4-SRC1 and the (GAL4)5-E1b-LUC reporter in HeLa cells results in about a 10-fold activation of expression from the reporter as compared with that achieved when the GAL4-DBD alone is cotransfected (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	230	 GAL4-SRC1-bHLH activates this reporter only 4-fold (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	231	 This region appears to be a general activation domain of SRC1, since it is important both for AF activity at PEPCK gAF1 and in the context of a simple promoter (Figs.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	232	View larger version (15K):    Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	233	   Basal transcriptional activity of structural variants of GAL4-SRC1.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	234	 HeLa cells were transfected with 2.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	235	5  microg of (GAL4)5-E1b-LUC along with 5  microg of the indicated GAL4-SRC1 construct or the GAL4-DBD.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	236	 This result identifies promoter-specific requirements of SRC1 acetyltransferase activity in PEPCK gene transcription, and it further demonstrates that GAL4-SRC1HAT is not transcriptionally inactive.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	237	 Results are presented relative to the activity of the GAL4-DBD and represent the average  plus or minus  S.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	238	 The gAF1 activity of each GAL4-SRC fusion protein is also shown.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	239	By contrast to the PEPCK gene GRU, where GAL4-SRCHAT does not act as an AF at either gAF1 or gAF2, this protein increases expression through the simple promoter about 100 x  more effectively than does the DBD (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	240	 The heightened activation produced by deletion of the HAT domain may reflect different protein targets of this enzyme activity in the two promoters.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	241	 Deletion of NRBIV has no effect on basal transcription mediated by GAL4-SRC1 (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	242	     DISCUSSION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	243	The accessory factors HNF4, COUP-TF, and HNF3 are required for maximal induction of PEPCK gene transcription by glucocorticoids (13, 28-32), and each interacts with the coactivator SRC1 through exactly the same regions required for their AF function (this paper and Refs.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	244	 This series of observations strongly suggests that recruitment of SRC1 is important for the glucocorticoid response.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	245	 Recruitment of SRC1, however, does not exclude recruitment of other coactivators such as CBP to, or by, the same AFs.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	246	 We envision that, together, the AFs provide a surface for recruitment of a coactivator complex that includes SRC1, CBP, and probably other proteins.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	247	 The PEPCK gene GRU shares DNA elements with the hormone response units that provide a response to retinoic acid, cAMP, and insulin (38), but different transcription factors are recruited to the AF elements in response to these hormones (37, 54, 55).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	248	 It is probable that the constellation of coregulators recruited by each of these effectors is also different, yet somehow this array of hormone response units provides a coordinated response to the metabolic challenges imposed by hypoglycemia, when the PEPCK gene is activated, and hyperglycemia, when the gene is repressed.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	249	The ability of GAL4-SRC1 to replace the function of the AFs bound to gAF1, gAF2, or gAF3 in the GRU shows that the precise factor that binds these elements is less critical than is the ability of these proteins to assemble a functional enhanceosome.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	250	 There is, however, specificity associated with these AFs in the GRU.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	251	 The observation that the PEPCK gene GRU uses liver-enriched factors such as HNF4 and HNF3 to recruit coregulatory molecules rather than ubiquitously expressed factors provides insight into how tissue specificity of gene transcription in response to glucocorticoids may arise.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	252	 In this regard, it is noteworthy that in adipose tissue, which does not express HNF4 or HNF3 but does express GR, glucocorticoids repress basal and cAMP-induced PEPCK gene transcription (25, 26).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	253	 Thus, tissue-specific expression of the AFs may provide directionality to gene transcription in response to glucocorticoids, as well as contributing to the magnitude of the response.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	254	The precise role of ligand-bound GR in mediating this response is less clear.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	255	 A previous in vivo footprint analysis showed that all of the gAF elements in the GRU are occupied in the absence of glucocorticoids (56).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	256	 Here we show that GAL4-SRC1 is only able to function as a surrogate AF when GR is present (Figs.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	257	 Upon exposure to the ligand, the GR may help promote the formation of a functional enhanceosome by interacting with SRC1 to recruit components of the basal transcription machinery.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	258	 GR may also activate SRC1 once the latter has been recruited to the GRU by AFs such as HNF4, COUP-TF, and HNF3.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	259	 The activation of coactivators by nuclear receptors is not unprecedented.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	260	 The function of the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor- coactivator, PGC1, is stimulated by its association with peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor- (57).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	261	 This protein-protein interaction promotes a conformational change in PGC1 that permits recruitment of additional coactivators SRC1 and CBP/p300 (57).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	262	 We propose that the binding of GR to the PEPCK gene GRU promotes activation of SRC1 and assembly of a functional enhanceosome in a similar fashion.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	263	 The interaction between GR and SRC1 appears to be facilitated by localization of GR to its DNA binding elements.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	264	 When both the GR1 and GR2 elements are intact, GAL4-SRC1 is able to serve as a surrogate AF at gAF1.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	265	 As the ability of GR to be recruited to the promoter is reduced or lost by introducing mutations in the GR2 or GR1 and GR2 elements, respectively, the ability of GAL4-SRC1 to serve as a surrogate AF is reduced or lost in a coordinate manner (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	266	All of the p160 family of coactivators contain three central LXXLL motifs (NRBI-III) that are important for interaction with nuclear receptors (58, 59).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	267	 SRC1a, used in these experiments, has an additional C-terminal LXXLL motif (NRBIV) that exhibits strong in vitro binding to class I nuclear receptors such as estrogen receptor and GR (39, 52, 59, 60).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	268	 One might imagine that the NRBIV domain could help stabilize GR binding to the low affinity GR1 and GR2 elements.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	269	 If so, deletion of the NRBIV region of SRC1 (GAL4-SRC1IV) should reduce the effectiveness of GAL4-SRC1 as a surrogate AF.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	270	 Deletion of this region is without effect, however, as GAL4-SRC1IV functions comparably with the full-length chimeric protein (Figs.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	271	 show that, although NRBIV is the nuclear receptor interaction motif that interacts most strongly with estrogen receptor in vitro, deletion of this region has little functional consequence in estrogen receptor activation, providing the NRBI-III region is intact (60).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	272	 This suggests that multiple LXXLL motifs facilitate the in vivo effects of SRC1 on nuclear receptors.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	273	 Rather than stabilizing GR binding, the SRC1-GR interaction may be more important for the activation of SRC1.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	274	 By this model, AFs such as HNF4, COUP-TF1, and HNF3 would serve to recruit SRC1, which in turn is only activated by the additional presence of ligand bound GR.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	275	The recruitment of GAL4-SRC1 or variants of this protein to promoter constructs with GAL4 binding elements (gAFGAL4 PEPCK and (GAL4)5-E1b promoters, respectively) allowed us to look for promoter- and DNA element-specific requirements of SRC coactivation.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	276	 The bHLH region of GAL4-SRC1 is required for AF activity at the gAF1 element (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	277	 GAL4-SRC1-bHLH also provides a low rate of basal transcriptional activation through the simple E1b promoter (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	278	 The bHLH/PAS domain of SRC1 is highly conserved among the p160 family of coactivators, and the PAS motif serves as a protein-protein interaction surface for the transcription factors, Per, ARNT, and SIM (61, 62).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	279	 The importance of the bHLH/PAS domain of SRC1 in the context of the PEPCK gene GRU may indicate the requirement for interaction with an additional PAS-containing factor that is necessary for SRC1 function.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	280	 Interestingly, this region is not required when GAL4-SRC1 is recruited to gAF2 (Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	281	 This result supports the idea that these gAF elements and associated factors have distinct roles in the response of the PEPCK gene to glucocorticoids.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	282	The acetyltransferase domain of GAL4-SRC1 is required at both gAF1 and gAF2 (Figs.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	283	 5a and 6); however, the target of this acetyltransferase activity in the PEPCK gene GRU is unknown.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	284	 Acetylation of chromatin components and transcription factors correlates with activation of gene transcription (49, 50, 63-65).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	285	 The chromatin structure of the PEPCK gene promoter is already free of nucleosomes before exposure to hormone in H4IIE cells (66); thus, it is unlikely that this is the target of the acetyltransferase activity required of SRC1.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	286	 There are several other potential targets for the acetyltransferase activity of SRC1 in the GRU.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	287	 HNF4 can be acetylated by CBP, a reaction that promotes DNA binding and nuclear retention of HNF4 (64).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	288	 The androgen receptor can also be acetylated by CBP (67); thus, it is possible that other nuclear receptors, such as GR, may also be acetylated.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	289	 Different targets of the acetyltransferase activity of SRC1 (chromatin components versus transcription factors) may also explain why GAL4-SRC1HAT strongly activates a simple promoter but is not functional at any of the PEPCK gAF elements tested (Figs.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	290	The use of the GAL4-SRC1 chimeric protein to recruit this coactivator to specific DNA elements allowed us to demonstrate both promoter-specific requirements of SRC1 (between the simple and PEPCK gene promoters) and also element-specific requirements for domains of SRC1 at gAF1 and gAF2 in the PEPCK gene GRU.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	291	 A summary of these differences is illustrated in Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	292	 HNF4/COUP-TF and HNF3 mediate distinct functions as AFs, yet they are both capable of interacting with the same coactivator, SRC1.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	293	 SRC1 may serve both as a scaffolding molecule and an activator through its acetyltransferase activity.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	294	 Which of these functions is required seems to be determined by the local promoter environment to which SRC1 is recruited.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	295	 Furthermore, the function of SRC1 as a coactivator is not simply determined by the site of its recruitment to the GRU but also depends upon activation by GR.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	296	 This role of recruitment and activation of coactivators may have implications for other genes that employ AFs to mediate responses to metabolic signals.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	297	 Indeed, the AFs required for the glucocorticoid response of the PEPCK gene are involved in regulating the hormone responses of many genes that encode enzymes required for metabolic homeostasis (10-14, 68, 69).
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	298	 Thus, the functional interactions between HNF3 and HNF4 with SRC1, as described in the PEPCK gene GRU, may have a broad role in metabolic adaptation.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	299	View larger version (15K):    Fig.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	300	   A comparison of accessory factor activity and basal transactivation as mediated by GAL4-SRC structural variants.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	301	 Peter Kushner (University of California, San Francisco) for providing the expression vector for GAL4-SRC1, Dr.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	302	 Jen-Chywan Wang for helpful advice, Cathy Caldwell for technical assistance, and Deborah Caplenor Brown for helping prepare this manuscript.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	303	* This work was supported by National Institutes of Health Grants DK20593 (Vanderbilt Diabetes Research and Training Center), DK35107, and GM07347 (Vanderbilt Medical Scientist Training Program) and the Veterans Administration Research Service.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	304	The costs of publication of this article were defrayed in part by the payment of page charges.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	305	 The article must therefore be hereby marked "advertisement" in accordance with 18 U.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	306	 Section 1734 solely to indicate this fact.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	307	To whom correspondence should be addressed: Dept.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	308	 of Molecular Physiology and Biophysics, 707 Light Hall, Vanderbilt University School of Medicine, Nashville, TN 37232.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	309	: 615-322-7004; Fax: 615-322-7236; E-mail: daryl.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	310	Published, JBC Papers in Press, November 7, 2000, DOI 10.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	311	 Granner, unpublished observation.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	312	The abbreviations used are: HRE, hormone response element; AF, accessory factor; PEPCK, phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase; GRU, glucocorticoid response unit; CBP, cAMP-response element-binding protein (CREB)-binding protein; SRC1, steroid receptor coactivator 1; DBD, DNA binding domain; GR, glucocorticoid receptor; HNF, hepatocyte nuclear factor; COUP-TF, chicken ovalbumin upstream promoter transcription factor; bHLH, basic-helix-loop-helix; HAT, histone acetyltransferase; SREBP, sterol-response element binding protein.
0.32730934.11069927.html.plaintext.txt	313	    REFERENCES TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES RESULTS DISCUSSION REFERENCES 1.
