0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	141	001) compared with wild-type HNF4 value.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	142	 C, Pull-down assays were carried out as in Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	143	 1D using [35S]methionine-labeled HNF42 or its E276Q mutant to analyze their interactions with GST-p300(1 to 595) and GST-p300(340 to 528).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	144	 Shown are a PhosphorImage and a graph representing means  plus or minus  SD of the E276Q binding relative to that of wild-type HNF4 from two independent experiments performed in duplicate.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	145	 Inputs (10% of the in vitro synthesized proteins used in each incubation) were taken into account for binding quantification.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	146	  The E276Q Mutation Affects the Cooperation between p300 and the D to E Domains Required for Full Activity of the HNF4 AF-2 Activation Function The HNF4 AF-2 activation function does not exhibit an autonomous transcriptional activity and requires the sequence spanning residues 128 to 366 for its full activity (15).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	147	 The E276Q mutation is located within this sequence, which encompasses the HNF4 D to E domains.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	148	 We therefore investigated the effect of the E276Q mutation on the activity of the D to E domains.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	149	 To this end, wild-type or mutated HNF4 fragments spanning the sequence 128 to 369 fused to the GAL4 DBD were expressed.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	150	 These chimeras correspond to GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369) and GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369)-E276Q and were denoted WT and E276Q, respectively, in Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	151	 In HEK 293T cells, p300 alone elicited a 3-fold activation of the (UAS)2xtk promoter containing two GAL4 response elements (UAS) (Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	152	 GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369) and GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369)-E276Q exhibited indistinguishable activities on this promoter when p300 was not cotransfected (Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	153	 On the other hand, cotransfection of p300 resulted in a greater enhancement of activity for GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369) than for GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369)-E276Q (Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	154	 These experiments were also carried out in Hela cells in which the p300-mediated enhancement of HNF4 activity was previously documented (21).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	155	 Again in these cells, the transactivation activities of GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369) and GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369)-E276Q were similar when p300 was not cotransfected (Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	156	 5B, lanes c and e), and cotransfection of p300 resulted in a higher enhancement of activity for GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369) than for GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369)-E276Q (Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	157	 Therefore, in both cell lines, the E276Q mutation markedly impaired the cooperation between p300 and the HNF4 D to E domains.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	158	 This impairment was correlated with a decrease in physical interaction between p300 and HNF4 D to E domains, as evidenced by pull-down assays (Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	159	View larger version (16K):    Figure 5.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	160	 E276Q Mutation Affects the Functional Cooperation and Physical Interaction between HNF4 D-E Domains and p300.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	161	HEK 293T cells (A) and HeLa cells (B) were transfected with 500 ng of (UAS)2x tk Luc, 100 ng of pCMVss p300 (+), or its empty expression vector (-).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	162	 In columns a and b, cells were cotransfected with 50 ng of empty pGAP vector, whereas in columns c to f, cells were cotransfected with 50 ng of pGAP HNF4(128 to 369) or its E276Q mutant, denoted WT and E276Q, respectively.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	163	 Numbers above bars indicate activities of the promoter relative to that with no added p300 and HNF4 derivatives (lane a).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	164	 Results are means  plus or minus  SD of three independent experiments performed in triplicate.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	165	 ** Denotes a significant difference (P  <  0.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	166	01) compared with value obtained with wild-type HNF4 derivative in the presence of p300.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	167	 C, Pull-down assays were carried out as in Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	168	 1D using [35S]methionine-labeled GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369) or its E276Q mutant, which were incubated with GST-p300(1 to 595) or GST-p300(340 to 528).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	169	 Shown are a PhosphorImage and a graph representing means  plus or minus  SD of the GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369)-E276Q binding relative to that of GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369) from two independent experiments performed in duplicate.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	170	 Inputs (10% of the in vitro synthesized proteins used in each incubation) were taken into account for binding quantification.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	171	  Mapping of the Sequences of p300 Required for Interaction with HNF4 In the course of this work, we observed that HNF4 bound efficiently to GST-p300(1 to 595) and GST-p300(340 to 528) but not to GST-p300(1 to 340) (Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	172	 To determine more precisely the sequence of p300 required for interaction with HNF4, we compared the abilities of GST-p300(340 to 528) and GST-p300(355 to 528) to interact with wild-type HNF4.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	173	 In this experiment, we also analyzed binding of R154X and GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369), which contain only one of the activation function modules: AF-1 and AF-2, respectively.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	174	 Removal of 15 amino acid residues at the N terminus of the p300(340 to 528) fragment resulted in a dramatic decrease in its interaction with full-length HNF4 and GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369) (Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	175	 6A, lanes 3 and 9 compared with lanes 2 and 8, respectively) but did not affect binding of R154X (lanes 5 and 6 in Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	176	 The faint bands of full-length HNF4 and GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369) retained on GST-p300(355 to 528) were not due to a low expression of this latter protein (Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	177	 These results indicate that the p300 sequence 340 to 354 is required for efficient binding of full-length HNF4 and HNF4(128 to 369) but is dispensable for binding of R154X.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	178	 To confirm the role of this sequence in p300 recruitment by HNF4, in a functional context ex vivo, we tested whether the p300(302 to 443) fragment (Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	179	 6B), containing this sequence 340 to 354 but lacking the domain involved in histone acetyltransferase (HAT) activity, has a dominant negative effect on the cooperation between p300 and HNF4.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	180	 In this assay, the fragment p300(355 to 443) (Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	181	 When cotransfected with HNF4 and full-length p300, the fragment p300(302 to 443) exhibited a dominant negative effect that was not observed with the fragment p300(355 to 443) (Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	182	 Taken together, results of in vitro protein-protein interaction and ex vivo transactivation experiments obviously demonstrated the involvement of the sequence 340 to 354 of p300 in the potentiation of HNF4 activity.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	183	View larger version (20K):    Figure 6.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	184	 The Sequence 340 to 354 of p300 Is Involved in Recruitment of This Coactivator by HNF4.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	185	A, Pull-down assays were carried out as in Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	186	 1D using [35S]methionine- labeled HNF42 (left), R154X (middle), or GAL4-HNF4(128 to 369) (right) and either GST-p300(340 to 528) or GST-p300(355 to 528).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	187	 Due to the weak binding of R154X to GST-p300 fragments (see Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	188	 1D), a larger amount (8  microl vs.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	189	 5  microl) of labeled R154X was used to better visualize the bands.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	190	 The GST proteins used in these experiments were visualized on a Coomassie blue-stained SDS-polyacrylamide gel (inset).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	191	 B, Schematic representation of the p300 fragments used in panel C.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	192	 The LXXLL motif at position 342 to 346 is depicted by a circle.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	193	 C, HEK 293T cells were transfected by wild-type HNF42 and the HNF1 promoter as in Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	194	 1A along with the indicated p300 expression vectors.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	195	 Results are means  plus or minus  SD of three independent experiments performed in triplicate.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	196	 * Denotes a significant difference (P  <  0.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	197	05) compared with value obtained with full-length p300 alone.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	198	  It has been previously documented that interaction between the CBP (1 to 771) fragment and HNF4 is AF-2 independent (21).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	199	 6A indicated that p300 (340 to 354) efficiently interacted with HNF4 constructs containing the AF-2 module [full-length HNF4 and HNF4(128 to 369)] but did not interact with R154X lacking the AF-2.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	200	 The presence of a LXXLL motif within the p300 sequence 340 to 354 (at position 342 to 346) and involvement of LXXLL motifs in the interaction between coactivators and AF-2 modules of nuclear receptors (27) led us to reevaluate the role of the HNF4 AF-2 module in binding to p300(340 to 528).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	201	 To this aim, we compared binding to GST-p300(340 to 528) of HNF4-F and HNF4-AF-2, which only differ by the lack of AF-2 in the latter (Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	202	 Deletion of the AF-2 resulted in a significant decrease in binding to p300(340 to 528) (Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	203	 7B), thus demonstrating the crucial role of the HNF4 AF-2 in binding to this p300 fragment.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	204	View larger version (29K):    Figure 7.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	205	 Involvement of HNF4 AF-2 in Interaction with p300(340 to 528) Fragment.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	206	A, Schematic representation of HNF4-F and HNF4-AF-2 constructs.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	207	 B, Pull-down assays were carried out as in Fig.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	208	 1D using [35S]methionine-labeled HNF4-F and HNF4-AF-2 depicted in panel A and GST-p300(340 to 528).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	209	 Shown are a PhosphorImage and a graph representing means  plus or minus  SD of the HNF4-AF-2 binding relative to that of HNF4-F from three independent experiments performed in duplicate.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	210	 Inputs (10% of the in vitro synthesized proteins used in each incubation) were taken into account for binding quantification.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	211	     DISCUSSION TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION RESULTS DISCUSSION MATERIALS AND METHODS REFERENCES   Our results showed that MODY1-associated mutations R154X and E276Q in the HNF4 gene impair the functional cooperation and physical interaction between HNF4 and p300.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	212	 In the case of the R154X mutant, this impairment can be ascribed to the lack of AF-2, which plays a crucial role in the recruitment of p300 as discussed below.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	213	 In the case of the E276Q mutant, this impairment is ascribed to an alteration of the interaction and cooperation between p300 and the D to E domains, which are required for full activity of the HNF4 AF-2 activation function.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	214	 Impairment of the p300-mediated potentiation of HNF4 transcriptional activity is of particular importance for the E276Q mutant of which the intrinsic transcriptional activity (without exogenously supplied coactivators) is moderately affected (33, 35) by comparison with that of the R154X mutant (35, 36).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	215	 Another MODY1-associated HNF4 mutant, R127W, was shown recently to have no effect on the p300-mediated enhancement of HNF4 activity (37).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	216	 The localization of this mutation in the HNF4 DBD (aa 50 to 142), which does not interact with CBP/p300 (21), may account for the lack of change in CBP/p300 recruitment.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	217	Many authors who study the interaction and cooperation between nuclear receptors and their coactivators assume that they act synergistically when their combined effects on enhancement of transcription of the target promoter are higher than the sum of their individual effects.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	218	 Nevertheless, we cannot rule out that other models of interaction may be involved in p300 recruitment by HNF4.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	219	 Whatever the mechanism involved in this interaction, our results clearly showed that recruitment of p300, which has been shown to be essential for transcription by HNF4, was impaired by the studied HNF4 mutations.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	220	The ability of CBP/p300 to interact with the HNF4 AF-1 in the context of the chimera GAL4 (AF-1)2x has been shown previously (14).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	221	 CBP/p300 interacts with the HNF4 fragments 1 to 128 (21) and 1 to 153 (present work), which contain the AF-1.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	222	 Our results showing significant decreases in interaction and cooperation between R154X and p300 by the mutation F19D indicate unambiguously that the AF-1 is actually involved in p300 recruitment to this truncated HNF4.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	223	 In addition, our results extend these findings by demonstrating for the first time that the HNF4 AF-1 activity can be enhanced by p300.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	224	Mutation F19D resulted in a 50% decrease of full-length HNF42 activity despite the presence of the AF-2, a result consistent with that of Green et al.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	225	 (14) and which confirms the crucial role of the AF-1 in the transcriptional activity of full-length HNF4.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	226	 The AF-1 role in full-length HNF4 activity does not depend on p300 recruitment since the F19D mutation did not alter the p300-mediated enhancement of full-length HNF4 transcriptional activity.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	227	 This result fits with those obtained by Dell and Hadzopoulou-Cladaras (21) using a complete deletion of the AF-1.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	228	 It appears therefore that, even if p300-mediated potentiation of truncated HNF4 lacking the AF-2, i.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	229	 R154X, is exerted through the AF-1, p300-mediated potentiation of HNF4 proteins containing the AF-2 is exerted mainly through this latter activation function.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	230	 This suggests that, in the context of full-length HNF4, the p300-mediated enhancement of AF-2 activity is strong enough to compensate for the decrease in cooperation between p300 and the AF-1 by the F19D mutation.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	231	 This hypothesis is supported by the drop of 60% in cooperation between p300 and full-length HNF4 due to the E276Q mutation located in the D to E domains required for full activity of the AF-2.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	232	 The role of the AF-1 in the CBP/p300 action is much more crucial for other nuclear receptors than for HNF4.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	233	 Indeed, CBP/p300-mediated potentiation of AF-1 plays a major role in the transcriptional activities of androgen receptor, estrogen receptor-, and estrogen receptor-ss since mutations in AF-1 cause reductions in ligand-induced functional synergism between their AF-1 and AF-2 mediated by CBP/p300 (38, 39).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	234	Previous mapping of CBP sequences interacting with full-length or truncated HNF4 used either a CBP fragment spanning the sequence 271 to 451 (20) and corresponding to sequence 251 to 436 of p300 (23) or a CBP fragment spanning the sequence 1 to 771 (14, 21).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	235	 We have shown that the p300 sequence 340 to 528 is sufficient for binding full-length HNF4 as well as HNF4 fragments encompassing sequences 1 to 153 and 128 to 369 containing the AF-1 and AF-2, respectively.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	236	 Interestingly, we have observed that within the p300 fragment spanning residues 340 to 528, the sequence 340 to 354, which contains a LXXLL motif, is required for efficient interaction with the full-length HNF4 and the HNF4(128 to 369) fragment containing the AF-2.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	237	 Our results thus allow a more precise mapping of sequences of p300 involved in its interaction with HNF4.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	238	We have observed that the HNF4 AF-2 plays a crucial role in interaction with the p300(340 to 528) fragment, whereas Dell and Hadzopoulou-Cladaras have shown that interaction of the CBP(1 to 771) fragment with HNF4 is AF-2 independent (21) (referred to as AF-2 AD in this reference).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	239	 This discrepancy is not due to the presence of the RID in the CBP(1 to 771) fragment since both our results and those of Yoshida et al.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	240	 (20) showed that the RID is dispensable for interaction of CBP/p300 with HNF4.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	241	 Nevertheless, we cannot exclude a slight difference of behavior between CBP and p300 despite their very close structures (23).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	242	Cooperation between HNF4 and other transcription factors or coactivators is crucial in HNF4-mediated transcriptional activation (16, 17, 18, 40, 41, 42, 43, 44).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	243	 Some of these transcriptional partners interact directly with HNF4 (16, 17, 18, 44).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	244	 In addition to alteration in p300 recruitment by R154X and E276Q mutations, we have previously shown that alteration in synergy with the transcription factor COUP-TFII by the E276Q mutation strongly impairs HNF4 function (33).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	245	 Alteration in recruitments probably occurs with other HNF4 partners since the R154X and E276Q mutations also impair the in vitro interaction with the GRIP-1 (glucocorticoid receptor interacting protein-1) coactivator (J.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	246	 Eeckhoute, unpublished results).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	247	 Therefore, our results emphasize that impairment of recruitment of transcriptional partners by MODY1-associated HNF4 mutations most likely represents a key mechanism leading to HNF4 loss of function.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	248	The impairment of p300-mediated enhancement of HNF4 activity by MODY1 mutations has been observed on the HNF1 promoter.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	249	 HNF1 is essential for insulin gene transcription and also regulates expression of genes involved in glucose transport and metabolism and in insulin secretion (11).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	250	 In addition, loss of HNF1 function results in defective insulin secretion responses to glucose (10, 11), and mutations in the HNF1 gene are associated with another form of MODY, MODY3 (45).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	251	 Interestingly, patients with MODY1 and MODY3 exhibit similar clinical profiles (46).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	252	 Also, recent results showed that the phenotype and gene expression patterns of INS-1 ss-cells expressing a dominant negative HNF4 are strikingly similar to those of INS-1 ss-cells expressing a dominant negative HNF1 (6), which led the authors to suggest that loss of HNF4 function may cause abnormal ss-cell function secondary to defective HNF1 function.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	253	 Therefore, impairment by R154X and E276Q mutations in the p300 recruitment leading to a reduced activity of the HNF1 promoter is of major interest.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	254	 Nevertheless, as for other MODY1-associated HNF4 mutations, further studies are needed to link our mechanistic information to comprehension of ss-cell dysfunction and MODY1 physiopathology.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	255	 Indeed, whatever the mechanisms underlying HNF4 loss of function (either deletion of the AF-2 activation function for the Q268X and R154X mutations or impaired recruitment of HNF4 partners such as COUP-TF and p300 for the E276Q mutation), the scientific community is still unable to explain clearly how these HNF4 mutations lead to ss-cell abnormal function and to development of diabetes.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	256	 These mutations, as well as mutations in the HNF1 gene, are supposed to cause haploinsufficiency or reduced gene dosage (35, 47) since they do not result in proteins exhibiting dominant negative activities on the wild-type protein expressed from the unaffected allele [except for a slight dominant negative behavior of R154X in HIT-T15 cells (36)].
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	257	 Strikingly, although the Q268X exhibits a complete lack of transcriptional activity, its expression in ss-cells did not result in deficient insulin secretion (6).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	258	 Furthermore, the huge variability in the clinical characteristics of patients with MODY1 diabetes suggests the existence of other factors (environmental, genetic) influencing the phenotype of MODY1 patients (46).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	259	 Advances in clinical studies and cell biology of Langerhans islets, together with functional studies of HNF4 mutants, are clearly required for a better understanding of the physiopathology of MODY1 diabetes.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	260	 The present work, exploring the mechanisms by which the mutations E276Q and R154X could affect the function of HNF4, represents one contribution to achieve this goal.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	261	 This work also sheds new light on the crucial roles played by the glutamic acid residue at position 276 and by the AF-2 activation function module in recruitment of the p300 coactivator and therefore in the structure-function relationship of this nuclear receptor.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	262	   MATERIALS AND METHODS TOP ABSTRACT INTRODUCTION RESULTS DISCUSSION MATERIALS AND METHODS REFERENCES   DNA Constructs Wild-type human HNF42 and its mutants E276Q, -F, and -AF-2 cloned in the expression vector pcDNA3 were described previously (33, 36, 48).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	263	 The wild-type and R154X human HNF42 cloned in the vector pcDNA3.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	264	 Plasmids pcDNA3 HNF42-F19D and pcDNA3.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	265	1HisB HNF4-R154X-F19D were cloned using the QuikChange site-directed mutagenesis kit from Stratagene (La Jolla, CA) and primers spanning nucleotides 42 to 78 (taking A of ATG of initiation methionine at position 1) with mutations TG and TA at positions 55 and 56, respectively.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	266	 The plasmids pCMVss-NHA p300 and its pCMVss control vector, pCMVmycNLS p300(302 to 443), pCMVmycNLS p300(355 to 443), and pGEX2TK-p300(1 to 595), -p300(1 to 340), -p300(340 to 528), and -p300(355 to 528) were generous gifts from Dr.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	267	 The pGAP HNF4(128 to 369) vector expressing wild-type HNF4(128 to 369) fused to the GAL4 DBD (aa 1 to 147) corresponds to plasmid GAL AF-2 described in Ref.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	268	 48 ; its name has been modified to comply with the AF-2 terminology now restricted to the highly conserved module in helix 12 of nuclear receptors.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	269	 The plasmid pGAP HNF4(128 to 369)-E276Q was prepared by a similar method using pcDNA3 HNF42-E276Q as template.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	270	 The mouse HNF1 promoter-luciferase reporter construct was described in Ref.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	271	 The (UAS)2xtkLUC containing two copies of the GAL4-binding element upstream of the thymidine kinase (TK) promoter was a gift from V.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	272	 All constructs were verified by DNA sequencing.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	273	Cell Culture and Transient Transfection Assays HEK 293T and Hela cells (2 x 105 cells and 1.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	274	5 x 105 cells per 12-well dishes, respectively) were grown and transfected as in Ref.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	275	 33 except that 1  microg of reporter plasmid, 50 ng of HNF4 expression plasmid, and 500 ng of p300 expression vector were used unless otherwise specified in the figure legends.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	276	 Luciferase activities were measured using the SteadyGlo buffer (Promega Corp.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	277	, Madison, WI) and the Lumicount apparatus (Packard Instruments, Meriden, CT).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	278	Western Blot Assays Western blot assays were carried out as described previously (33).
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	279	In Vitro Protein-Protein Interaction Pull-down assays were performed as described previously (33) using immobilized GST-p300 proteins and [35S] labeled wild-type or mutated HNF42 which were synthesized in vitro using reticulocyte lysates (Promega Corp.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	280	 Binding of proteins was quantified by the PhosphorImager apparatus using ImageQuant software (Molecular Dynamics, Inc.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	281	Data Analysis Statistical analysis was performed by Student s t test for unpaired data using the Prism software.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	282	 The significance has been considered at *** P  <  0.
0.53388375.11435618.html.plaintext.txt	283	   ACKNOWLEDGMENTS   Acknowledgements.
